Reviews.Title: “beware of the rock hard beds!”
Reviews.Author: shadey_10
Reviews.Content: My self and my husband stayed there at the end of our honeymoon, we paid for the upgrade to the top florrs and even thoughtt eh view and facitlites were lovely, they beds were impossible to sleep on. We even ordered extra pillows to line the bed but we didnt sleep at all. I would recommend it fora plce to drop into but if you want to sleep dont stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: TotallyTingTong
Reviews.Content: Date of stay: 27th-28th January 2012. Our second visit but not our last. Next time we hope to book for a couple of weeks. Room: Very comfortable. Upgraded to Marina View with balcony this time. Nice surprise. Service: Quite simply the best customer service I have EVER experienced at any hotel. Faultless. Food: Excellent breakfast. Well worth getting included in the rate. Found the Chinese Restaurant Ha Tien Lo fully booked during the evenings of our stay (just after Chinese New Year). Very fortunate because, although Ha Tien Lo is good, the weekend Seafood Buffet (Global Kitchen?) is even better. Varied, delicious and plentiful. I wanted to try everything but it beat me! THOROUGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: JWGT1957
Reviews.Content: I had heard about how good this hotel was from friends and the reviews on TA are usually very positive overall, but like all hotels it comes down to the individuals own experience. I have to agree with the positive reviews and recommendations of friends, the Pan Pacific is an excellent hotel. My room was very clean and well appointed with a very comfortable bed and large TV. The bathroom was also clean and well designed with everything a 5 star hotel should have. The staff I encountered we all very friendly and willing to assist whenever required and room service was good and prompt. I can't fault it for service and comfort and it is a very impressive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kirstyskennelmate
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here on a stopover to Australia. It is a wonderful hotel in a lovely city. The rooms are excellent, the food is excellent and also the location. The pool is fabulous. It is truly a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: vegas005
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights right before h hotel closed for remodelling. Hotel was clean, beautiful and well run. I have no idea why they feel the need to spend 80 million on a refurbishment to a hotel that is so nice, but I am sure it will be even more spectacular when completed in 3 months. The rooms are nice with all the goodies needed for a great stay including free wifi and rain shower system. The bed is glorious, the views from floor 19 are excellent, and the work area is well appointed. Great pool, spa and gym....but what sets this place apart from the competition is the people who work here. Customer service is job one at the Pan Pacific and they go out of their way to please their customers. This is a 6 star hotel in my book. Well one Pan Pacific!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing, but great!”
Reviews.Author: Travelicious_K
Reviews.Content: Although I only stayed here for one night, the experience I had will leave a lasting impression on me. The room was very big and spacious, with a huge bed in the center that was super comfortable. I loved the fact that the room was airy and there was lots of space to walk around. The work desk added a nice touch too. The room had a very nice “aura” to it and I had a view of the Marina Sands Bay which was lovely! The bathroom was a walk-in, with a separate bath area and there was a huge vanity mirror. The array of toiletry provided was also pretty good. Breakfast was very, very nice – I liked the spread and the service was excellent. I was there for a half day training and the assorted finger food and pastries served were very good too. The swimming pool looked very inviting, but since I was only there for 1 night, I didn't get the chance to use it. This was a lovely hotel and I will definitely be going back again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation for the last 2 nights of our trip”
Reviews.Author: pem243
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights mid March 2012 and had a lovely room overlooking the pool. It was comfortable, clean and in an ideal location for the malls and the MRT. The first morning there, it was pouring with rain and my husband was able to borrow an umbrella from the concierge. We had breakfast in the Global Kitchen on the first morning and wished that we'd gone back there the next day. And we ate at Rang Mahal which was the best meal we had for the whole of our month long trip to Australia and New Zealand. Interesting to see that the hotel is undergoing a refurbishment and I hope to get there again to see it.

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific Singapore – luxury you have earned”
Reviews.Author: ikke5473
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific Hotel in Singapore, located at Raffles Boulevard close to the Singapore Marina is amongst my favorites in Singapore. Having stayed there on a number of occasions on both, business and private trips to Singapore, I always enjoyed the amenities the Pacific Club Rooms and the additional privileges this entails. Check-in is effortlessly taken care of by the dedicated staff at the Pacific Club Lounge, eliminating having to cue at the reception desk downstairs. Once check-in formalities have been completed, you are escorted to your room, where a brief overview of the functioning of the room’s amenities is explained. The Pacific Club Rooms are all located on the high floors of the hotel and you reach them by travelling 30 plus floors up in a glass elevator, fitted to the outside of the hotel building. The elevator ride alone is spectacular, offering a bird’s eye view over the Marina and the City. The Pacific Club Rooms are very spacious and furnished in a modern, but exclusive design. All amenities one expects to find in high class establishments like the Pan Pacific are, of course, at hand. Starting from a well stocked Mini bar, big Flat Screen Multi-channel TV, DVD Player, connectivity of your MP Players and I-Phones to the entertainment system, High-speed Internet to designer Bathrooms – it’s all there. Choosing a Pacific Club Room gives you also access to the Butler Service and the Pacific Club Lounge, where you may enjoy complimentary breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails and drinks. Not to forget, the swimming pool of the hotel is a great place to relax and take a refreshing dip, in an exceptionally clean surrounding. All in all, I always feel at home in the Pan Pacific and, whilst it is of course a large hotel with many guests, the friendly staff always seems to succeed in making you feel special. It should be noted, that the Hotel is undergoing a major refurbishment at this moment (April 2012) and I look forward being able to report of the enhancements made after my next trip to Singapore later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “One of Singapore's best: romantic, efficient, beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights at the Pan Pacific Singapore. We chose it because of the great number of good restaurants in the area, particularly those in the hotel. We ate dinner at Morton’s Steak house and at Keyaki. We didn’t go to Hai Tien Lo on the top floor because it was overcast while we were there. The hotel website said there were no rooms available on the date we wanted, but we had no trouble booking a room for that date through booking.com. We had a similar experience last year booking a room at Sari Pan Pacific Jakarta. Pros Good location. Probably because of my old Tanglin-Orchard Road orientation, I used to think of the Marina as rather remote, but The Pan Pacific is well connected not only by taxi (there are plenty) but by MRT. If it's raining, there’s a covered elevated walkway to Marina Square, and you can walk past shops in a rabbit warren of connecting tubes taking you to the City Hall or Promenade MRT stations. Good first impression. Doormen unloaded our suitcases and we had a quick and pleasant check-in on the ground floor. All of the lifts are glass lifts that face into the atrium. Large deluxe balcony rooms. Our room 1215 was large with all of the amenities that would be expected, with plasma TV with a good selection of channels including HBO and numerous electrical outlets with universal plugs (if all hotels had them, we wouldn’t need travel adaptors). The toilet even had its own door that could be locked. Double-headed shower. Wi-fi (available to everyone) for any number of devices was strong throughout the hotel, but we could not use it at Keyaki Restaurant, perhaps because they use a different protocol. Good view. The shade between the room and the porch worked by electric motor, and the view from the porch was beautiful, extending from the Singapore Flyer on our left to the Marina Bay Sands, Mandarin Oriental Hotel, and Clifford Pier on our right. Although there is no furniture on the balcony, it affords more than enough space for enjoying the view, particularly during the somewhat romantic Marina Bay Sands light show at 8 pm. Great breakfast in the room. We ordered between 7:30 and 8; it arrived at 7:45. The food was warm and well prepared, and the croissants were particularly delicious. Efficient service. We left early in the morning, so I was able to pay the bill the night before. They froze our ice pack, and I picked it up the next morning. Taxis were available from the road, and our departure was as smooth and fast as our arrival. Cons There is one strange aspect of the location of the balcony rooms: the sounds of accelerating cars for some reason reverberate between the concrete walls of Marina Square and the hotel, making us wonder if we heard race cars practicing for the grand prix. The sound was not bothersome to us, but perhaps that is because we were so pleased with the experience that we were not in a mood to be bothered. We didn’t mind the early morning racecar sounds, and we feel Pan Pacific Singapore provided an excellent value in a location that needs more exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what an amazing place - perfect”
Reviews.Author: Lovinglife170986
Reviews.Content: This was a truly amazing experience. From first check in to the breakfast greeter to the pool attendant every person we met at the hotel was friendly and helpful. The room was magnificent and big with a balcony and view of the harbour. We just didn't want to leave. Shops are close and the MRT nearby. Don't bother looking elsewhere this is great value for what you get

Reviews.Title: “Impossible to find a fault”
Reviews.Author: kai s
Reviews.Content: I think this is as good as it can get. The rates are very reasonable for the great great treatment you get from this hotel. Rooms are elegant and spacious. In the higher floors you have superb views of the town or of the marina. The restaurants are all excellent. the breakfast buffet is amazing. But the best of all is the out-of-ordinary kindness of the staff. They really do their utmost best to let you have a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - would go back!”
Reviews.Author: Jayne1967_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific for 6 nights, booked with Agoda, we had a double and a twin room next door for our grown up kids, our keycard opened their room so great for me to get them up in the morning! Staff are very friendly, rooms are a good size, breakfast was'nt included, so we upgraded to the executive package which included breakfast, afternoon tea 2-4pm, 4pm-8pm canopes and free drinks & free wi-fi for an extra $33 each, it sounded alot at first, but worth it when the drinks are expensive approx - $18 dollars each and most hotels charge for wi-fi. Our room had a balcony with a view of the Marina and Marina Bay Sands Hotel, which has a light show everynight! The pool area is nice and clean, changing rooms with showers, towels & hairdryers, free chilled water when you arrive, poolside bar! Access to Marina Mall via the hotel to shops and MRT. We did the tourist trips, Zoo & night safari, we went to Sentosa Island & did Universal whilst we were there. Taxis are cheap and quick to get around. The tourist bus is good to hop on and off, with a time-table you just get back on the stop where you got off, great with it being so hot at times, saved our legs a little, it did rain most days, its very humid too! We would definatelygo back to this hotel, we stayed at the Marina Bay Sands for 2 nights, it was huge, not as personnal as the Pan Pacific the pool was great and the views are fab from the infinity pool but very busy! We then moved to the Marina mandarin for the rest of our stay it looked nice from the lobby but the room/pool were not as nice at the Pan Pacific. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I missed it this time!”
Reviews.Author: Frisco2010
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent customer of Pan Pacifc Singapore hotel. Through the years I have appreciated the high quality of the hotel and its excellent service. The staff has costantly been very attentive and polite. I did a reservation for 7 nights in March 2012 but unfortunately before departing I broke my uncle and was obliged to cancel my reservation. Anyway, I saw that the hotel is going under a big transformation soon, so I'll go back for sure when they reopen in September 2012. I have been to Singapore 13 times already and Pan Pacific has always been my favourite hotel. Thank you very much to the whole staff and special thanks to the Duty Manager Tan Ai Leng, who gave me assistance for the reservation and always did her best to let me stay very comfortable. I no longer can wait to see their new design! Best wishes Francesco Agozzino

Reviews.Title: “A+ Location”
Reviews.Author: brngckn
Reviews.Content: Pan Pacific is very well located. MRT is close by. Not a long ride from the airport by taxi. Easy to walk to many attractions, restaurants and shopping. My room had a nice view (18th floor). Good-sized room showing some signs of wear. Comfortable bed and pillows. Bathroom had separate shower and tub with plenty of thick towels, hot water & water pressure. Free wifi. The Sat & Sun rate I had was ok. Monday rate was 1/3 higher and a bit more than I felt the room was worth. Walls are a little thin - street traffic can be heard and beware noisy neighbors. Time constraints meant that I did not try out the pool or hotel restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing short of amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: brjr
Reviews.Content: You cannot fault this hotel. We had a club room and it was worth every cent. The service is above and beyond what anyone could expect. The room was great with an unreal view. The food - Devine! The 24hr pantry is also fantastic, i was going here to eat even when I wasn't hungry! Location is also perfect. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: amaroo_9
Reviews.Content: Love love love Singapore and this hotel did not disappoint, had an early flight into Singapore from Athens and the front desk were accommodating in having a room available 6 hours prior to check in, concierge were helpful at all times, shopping and casino close, the furnished balcony was a bonus with views over the marina area. Lovely pool and cafe. Beds and room fantastic. Changi Airport definitely one of the best in the world. Would go back anyday.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to end our holiday”
Reviews.Author: frangipani69
Reviews.Content: Decided to catch the MRT from the airport to the Pan Pacific (an experience in itself!) By the time we finally made it after lugging heavy suitcases around (and getting off at a stop too early! we were hot and sweaty). Stepped into the coolness of the Pan Pacific and felt so much better. Easy check in - had booked a deal through Agoda which included access to the Business Lounge. 27th floor with a view over the Marina complex. Room was huge, with free internet access, lovely bathroom, huge bed with the most divine pillows, slippers, robes, balcony with a lounger, desk and mini bar. We were so thirsty when we arrived, grabbed a bottle of water from the mini bar (very expensive!!). Anything in the mini bar is immediately charged to your account if you take it our for me than 30 seconds - so if you don't want to pay the ridiculous prices - dont touch it!) Headed out to the Marina Bay Shopping District which is amazing - within walking distance (so many designer shops - you want it, they got it!) Breakfast was included which you could eat in the business lounge or the restaurant - wow! what a spread with everything you could possibly imagine. Excellent service and you can eat till you explode. Didn't need lunch the whole time we were there! Business Lounge was exceptional, house pours (eg scotch, vodka, wines, soft drinks available for 3 hours) as well as delicious canapes (loved the mini cheeseburgers) - a balcony overlooked the Marina - they could have had more than 2 chairs outside though for those that smoke). Needless to say, we went there every night - the staff were always friendly and happy to have a chat and we'd have our preferred drink a couple of minutes after we arrived, they seemed to remember what we were drinking) Alcohol is extremely expensive in Singapore (about $12AU) for a bottle of beer, and about $15(AU) for a spirit. We did have drinks in the lounge one night - which was a very expensive exercise! Free shuttle bus took us to Sentosa Island so we headed over there one day (Sun Tec Mall I think it is called, lots of options for cheap eats). The hotel is attached to several shopping malls, and we unfortunately discovered the best one on our last day. Our check out was noon, but they will store your bags for you if you want to wander around for some last minute shopping before leaving for the airport. You can use the pool showers to freshen up prior to your departure. The lifts on the outside of the building are probably not for the faint hearted! We didn't have time to use the pool, and also didn't realise there was another bar near the pool. The hotel is being refurbished this year, so if I am ever back in Singapore I will check it out - although it looked fine to me.. Great value for money and just remember, if you don't want your room cleaned early make sure you put the do not disturb sign on and then change it when you head out. Excellent service and staff - well worth checking out

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful -Amazing - Classy”
Reviews.Author: Princesslily89
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travelled to Singapore for our one year anniversary and stayed at Pan Pacific for 6 nights. What an amazing experience! We arrived at 3am in the morning and check in was so fast and easy. Such friendly, helpful and welcoming staff were very mindful of how tired and grumpy we were and did everything they could to assist. After a sleep in, we enjoyed a late breakfast outside in the undercover cafe where the light rain fell around us. Just beautiful. Once again the staff were amazing, service was fast and everything was very clean. The downstairs bar was a definite favourite (we enjoyed evening cocktails here almost every night) but the amazing proximity to the shopping centres is the real winner! The hotel literally links to the centre, meaning some days we would pop into Starbucks instead of eating breakfast at the hotel, or I broke my sunglasses one morning so stopped my the shops on my way out. So simple! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, just about to have a major refurb...”
Reviews.Author: lee_bear
Reviews.Content: I was in Singapore for four days whilst on an extended business stay around Asia for a couple of months but it felt ike a holiday with the time I spent at the Pan Pacific, the whole hotel feels top notch and luxurious. My room on the 27th floor was spacious with great views across the city, with a comfortable bed and huge bathroom with a separate toilet room, shower room and bath room. The pool is a lovely location in which to relax and have a swim or a lounge by the water, I was so relaxed I fell asleep there one night after work. I ate in several of the restauraunts with a particularly amazing buffet in one place on the third floor one of the evenings of multi cutural food, all of it sunning quality from Indian, Chinese, Dim Sum, fresh sea food and even a British roast beef with yorkshire pudding. I had a little bit of many dishes but there was so much I just couldn't try. I ate in the bar restauraunt that is outside by the pool and the Fish and Chips were excellent. I had brekfast one morning and didn't have the buffest which I thought expensive, I had Eggs Benedict which was dry and overcooked and the only disappointment whilst eating at the hotel. I heard staff saying they are having a major refurbishment from early April for three months with closures happening so check out details if you are staying there in the immeadiate future. I stay in a lot of hotels but not often I am so taken with one, well worth trying if you get the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with some flaws.”
Reviews.Author: Kennethtravelling
Reviews.Content: This is a high end hotel with excellent location. Service level is of course very good. Location is Suntec City and 5 min. walk to Mandarin Bay convention center/shopping mall/casino. The breakfast is one of the best I have ever tried. The rooms is very spacious with windows from wall to wall, floor to ceiling. Some flaws like very slow internet connection in the room (going off and on), and believe it or not even slower elevators and you need to settle down for a queue at peak hours at breakfast. My next upcoming stay in Singapore I´ll try the Marina Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: deenajan4
Reviews.Content: Singapore is very expensive. This hotel is not a 5 star... but all the hotels here are just average unless you spend $400-$500/night. The bathrooms need updated. They told us our room would have a panoramic view of the city & it wasn't. The location is close to shopping & restaurants. It's about a 10 minute cab ride to Marina Bay Sands.

Reviews.Title: “Look forward to refurbishment April 2012”
Reviews.Author: seafarers62
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure in staying at Pan Pacific for four days at the beginng of March. The stay was enjoyed and hope one day to return .My review is taking into consideration the refurbishment that will take place over three months commencing April. Hotel is nicely situated within walking distance to many places of interest or if the legs have no desire for exercise the highly efficient MTR is never too far away . There is a walkway from the hotel to Sun Tec City and Marina Square if you are in need of some retail therapy. Also about a ten minute walk there is an open air hawkers market in Glutons Bay, where various Singaporian dishes can be purchased at a very reasonable price.Parasols if raining or just to shelter from the sun . Now Pan Pacific itself , The welcome we recieved was very professional and like a breath of fresh air after our long flight from the UK. Must admit we were quiet disappointed with the room which i might add was spotless, and was provided with all the necessary additions you would expect from a top end establishment .The room in my eyes was souless, just another hotel room with no wow factor. I mentioned this to a member of front of house team and this was escalated to a senior member who's name I'm afraid has been forgotten .We were very generously offered a bigger room which due to the fact we had unpacked declined. Complimentary drinks were delivered to our room which we thought was a nice touch when you think of how many other guests were staying at the hotel . I'm sure after the needed refurbishment that the rooms will be brought back to past glory . All staff without exception were a credit to the company. Breakfast although some mornings very busy was well organized and the food on offer was first class with all palates provided for . All in all a great stay and look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Business trips”
Reviews.Author: Ajmba06
Reviews.Content: an ideal place to stay if you are on business. The location is quite central, I was there for a conference and I just had to walk down the hotel as it was connected to the venue. The restaurant has a huge buffet breakfast spread with both local and international fares. Nothing outstanding and nothing to complain! I stayed March 2011!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: rob3066
Reviews.Content: This place was fabulous, close to Sun Tec City & Marina Square malls, a short metro ride or 20 to 30 mins easy walk to Orchard Road, Clarkes Quay & Marina Sands. We used the exec lounge which was split into two, Sunrise & Sunset lounges on the 33rd & 34th floors, providing 24hr very light snack, soft drinks & even ice lollies plus fantastic views plus evening canapés & alcohol in the evenings plus a very acceptable breakfast in the mornings. On arrival our original room had an electrical failure so they upgraded us to a two storey 'loft room', 172sq metre of space with equally good views spread over 34th & 35th floors including a kitchen, lounge, huge bathroom with spa bath & a balcony. The hotel uses outside lift pods which go up the exterior of the building for the higher floors which take some getting used to, so beware. Lower floors use inside lifts. We avoided the hotel bars & restaurants due the usual high cost in such places except once, glass of wine was $18. Hotel Absolutely recommended without question. Staff very attentive. We could not fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best & Closing for a Remodel”
Reviews.Author: DonR_09
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific continues to be on of the best hotels in Singapore. Their service is excellent and it is over-the-top on the Club Floor. The Club Floor breakfast is perfect and the evening cocktail period is well done. The hotel will be closing next month for an extensive 3 month remodel. I am looking forward to seeing the new presentation.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: vijy
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the 13 th floor .cute little rooms.very comfy beds.well trained staff,they take care of our needs immdtly.check in and check out was really quick.food also was pretty good.only thing there was no hot water in the evenings.but we enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointingly average - stayed in several better hotels in Singapore previously”
Reviews.Author: fishytale
Reviews.Content: Annoyances included very slow lifts (great if you want a view, but a five minute wait then stops on what feels like every floor every time you want to go up or down from the 30th floor is tedious). Breakfast was chaotically busy and difficult to get at - both tea and coffee always seemed only warm, not hot. Aircon difficult to control and very cold at most settings. Shower good and room decor and facilities good except I could not get wireless items to connect at any time. Positives also included good communication prior to arriving and following my feedback to the hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay at Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: Scott T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose to stay in a Pacific Club room and we couldn't speak highly enough of the experience. The staff provided really personal service, from the early check-in to late check-out. There was a great selection for breakfast and the cocktails and snacks were a great way to relax in the early evening. The room was spacious and well appointed and has to of had one of the best showers I have ever used in a hotel. There is also a really nice pool and well equipped gym. The hotel location is close to shopping (connected by walkway to Suntec and Marina Square) and only a 5 minute walk through the mall to the City Hall MRT, so it is very easy to get to anywhere you want from the hotel. There are plenty of eating options close by to suit. Do yourself a favour when you are in Singapore and stay at the Pan Pacific, it truly is a treat.

Reviews.Title: “recommended place to stay in singapore”
Reviews.Author: Chocostreet99
Reviews.Content: this hotel is located in marina area, its around 10 mins walk to marina bay sands. real nice area to stay. nice room and excellent service. just bathroom is quiet small, but still manageable. so far we are satisfy with this hotel. and willing to get back again to this hotel. its also 5 mins walk only to promenade MRT station there :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: theorchidlady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights prior to beginning a South East Asian Cruise. It was definitely the right choice! The hotel and its grounds were truly beautiful. The Christmas decorations were still up and they were also lovely. The service was outstanding and all the staff had a positive and helpful attitude. The room was a cool oasis with great views, comfortable beds and classy decorations. While we found the restaurants in the hotel to be a bit pricey, you simply had to walk across the street to a large food court in the mall which could be accessed either directly from the hotel or by entering from the footbridge across the street to get a wide choice of meals. The hotel also had a great location, with quick and easy access to all the main Singapore locations. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Thin room's wall”
Reviews.Author: Liling
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom are spacious and clean. But the room's wall is very thin. You can easily heard your next door neighbour conversation. Is very disturbing if you are a light sleeper. Is within walking distance to Marina's bay Sands casino. Shopping malls are nearby the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A warm, welcoming and refreshing stay at Pan Pacific Singapore”
Reviews.Author: hotelanatomist
Reviews.Content: The correspondence and communication with Pan Pacific Singapore, leading up to our arrival in Singapore, was outstanding. Ms. Joohee Lee from Reservations was very prompt in responding to our email query about an early check in (almost 8 hours ahead of check in time!) and replied positively about accommodating our request. Since our flight arrived early morning, with a 5-year old in tow, an early check in was a priority for us. Pan Pacific’s accommodating gesture was very reassuring to say the least! On arrival, check in was a breeze. We received a personalised service indeed, including a welcome gift for our little girl which made her day after a poor night on a long flight. Maribel from the Front Office who checked us in and escorted us to our room deserves special mention for making us feel very welcome. The location of the hotel is good, with ready access to public transport (MRT) as well as taxis. Then again, you can’t go wrong there anywhere in Singapore! Our room was crisp, clean, comfortable and tastefully refurbished. The king bed was very comfortable and the bathroom artfully modern. The coffee station / TV console was uniquely designed and the availability of every conceivable audio visual cable for use by guests highlights the details that have gone into planning a comfortable stay for visitors. The complimentary internet was a very welcome feature. I can assure the hotel management that this is perhaps one of the extras that tip the balance when travellers look around for a hotel in a very competitive market in Singapore. Visitors to Singapore, where free and excellent public internet access is now the norm rather than the exception, would expect no less from the City's hotels. The room rate offered was value for money andthe buffet breakfast, included in the rate, would satisfy even the harshest crtics in the hospitality business. We would consider the Pan Pacific Singapore as a first option during future travel to Singapore and have no hesitation in strongly recommending it to any traveller to Singapore. What came across most from our stay at Pan Pacific was true warmth and friendliness from their staff and a welcoming and refreshing stay, on a level that we had not experienced in a long while during our travels.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sarajoef
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as the first part of our honeymoon. This hotel had great service. Staff were very helpful and staff at global kitchen were always willing to help with my gluten free allergy. Rooms: are very nice, only comment balcony could be nicer. Location: nice area close to marina but a bit away from shopping and places to eat / night life. Overal we had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with super friendly service with only a couple of blemishes.”
Reviews.Author: Mchumphries72
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights here for a work conference. It is an amazing place. The staff is second to none. If you needed it done, it was their mission to accomplish it. Room was great. Global kitchen was amazing. Pool was awesome. The only small inconvenience for us was a recurring sound of a mechanical room apparently next to ours. Also, the carpet is due for a refresh in the rooms and hallways. Overall a great stay in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Very good 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: MandNGarbett
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a single night in March. The checking was painless - they mail you in advance for details to simplify check in and all of the staff were friendly, efficient and prepared to do anything they could to help. Singapore airlines managed to check our baggage through to Phuket and the hotel were helpful in liaising with the airline and bringing the luggage to our room when the airline eventually located it and delivered it to the hotel several hours later. We booked a room with a panoramic view and although the room was exemplary I was a little disappointed by the view as it was angled away from the harbour and didn't show much of interest in the city - I suspect one of the cheaper harbour view rooms may have been a better option. We didn't eat an evening meal at the hotel but had breakfast which was generally very good (apart from one inedable overdone waffle from the buffet which we replaced) - pulling off the neat trick of appearing smaller and more intimate than it really was - sadly it seems that it was being redeveloped in near future. Overall it provides everything a 5 star hotel should with excellent service- definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Kushals
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in October 2011 with Family during short holiday in Singapore. I simply love Hotel location,view from the room & elevators ( specially if you are staying on higher floors). Hotel has nice walk through connectivity to many malls and other hotels so you can go to all this places even when its raining ! I have stayed in this hotel multiple times ever since my first stay during first trip of Singapore in June 2005. On one such occasion in may 2010 on day on my Birthday they actually sent me Birthday Cake with Birthday Card. since i didn't Eat Cake with Eggs they even sent me Chocolates. This was quite wonderful surprise i have ever received on my birthday ever ! Breakfast at Global Kitchen is too good .

Reviews.Title: “Farewell... see you in Fall 2012. Closing for renovation”
Reviews.Author: StephenLock
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific Singapore, Marina is shorty to close for a major restoration. The hotel will, staff tell me, close completely from mid-April until around end July, then have a 'soft opening' until the formal reopening at the end of the year. So there could be some excellent deals to be had for August & September! I have stayed here around 7 nights over the last 9 months. It's a huge hotel - a member of the Global Hotel Alliance - and service levels are good (overnight pressing & laundry, double-thumbs up). Staff are being retained, during the closure (well done!) for training. \ The lunchtime Indian buffet was also very good but I never really liked the breakfast spaces (rather crowded on both main breakfast & executive breakfast rooms; uninspired breakfasts). This is a massive hotel - around 700 rooms - and it is very well run; but don't expect intimate charm. It'll be interesting to see how they handle the re-design as its 'aircraft hanger'-style voids are hard to make into welcoming or destination public areas bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Early Check In, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: allenweiner
Reviews.Content: The true judge of a great hotel is how they treat you after a 17-hour flight and you arrive in the wee hours. The Pan Pacific truly soared on this count and many others. Quick check in to gorgeous room loaded with amenities. I had lounge access which entitled me to food and drink of almost all varieties. The staff was helpful without being obsequious. Much of the stay is a memory as I had four hotels in four cities in five days, but I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Almost Excelent”
Reviews.Author: mthiago
Reviews.Content: The location of this Hotel is superb. You can reach the coolest areas of Singapore by walking. The staff is incredibly polite and always smiling at you... not a fake smile as I got on other hotels. The room is spacious and wowed me and my wife by the first impression. Electronic curtains are really cool :) But, this is not a fairy tale. The shower is hard to adjust the temperature, keeps leaking water making noise at night, the air conditioner also was making noise :/ Frustrating for a hotel of this level. Of course I've complained in the reception, but for my surprise, my requests wasn't attended. Another bad surprise, was the pool... not hot water, so although you can go there at night, it will not be pleasant. In summary, is a good hotel, but I believe that you can get a better experience by this price.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Holiday at Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: Katykev
Reviews.Content: Pan Pacific Hotel Singapore We have just returned from our second 11 day stay at Pan Pacific, fabulous hotel, wonderful staff. From the moment we checked in, which was a speedy check-in to our speedy check-out we had a fantastic holiday. We were upgraded to an executive suite for this holiday and there was everything we needed and the suite was kept spotlessly clean. The staff from the Lobby, the Atrium, Brunch, Global Kitchen, Hai Tien Lo, Pool Area, and Executive Level treated us like royalty and made our holiday very memorable. We hope to return to Pan Pacific again in the near future. Hope that after the refurbishment the original staff will be back working there. Well done Pan Pacific you have made our holiday amazing again.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access, style a bit outdated”
Reviews.Author: Cymia
Reviews.Content: Good location as it is connected to shopping mall, lots of restaurant nearby. Room and furnishing are standard...nothing special. Have wifi in room and hotel lobby, which is very convenient. But i hate that they don't have clear directional signage on each floor, so you have to guest which side your room is on! Banquet and catering is so-so. Not to expect much for breakfast buffet. Overall, it's okay but not impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Staycation at Pan Pacific Singapore”
Reviews.Author: mkw-sg
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2 night staycation at Pan Pac over the weekend with my family under their weekend preference package. In summary Pan Pacific provides excellent service and good value for your money. All our needs were taken care of by the team from Pan Pac who were excellent in their jobs of making one feel right at home.More details in my review below: Price: I took the weekend preference package costing SGD341(after tax) a nite for a paranomic room. This comes with free upgrade to the next room category or a complimentary fruit platter, daily buffet breakfast, free wifi, free parking and guaranteed late check out at 3pm. This is definitely value for money if u compare to similar priced hotel which costs around the same but does not include complementary parking, wifi and late checkout. Smooth Reservations and Fast Check in: I saw the deal on Pan Pac website and tried to book thru their website but unfortunately their server was down so i had to call to book. This was a breeze and the reservation desk was very attentive to details right down to when i'm arriving and what kind of bed configurations i need. I arrived at 1230PM on the actual day to check in and was allocated a room within 5 mins. All the things that i've asked for over the phone were taken care of. Impressive! There were no queue at the counter during the times we were there to check in and out which is another bonus. Nice clean Room with good layout: i was upgraded to the paranomic room with balcony as part of the package. The room had a view of the Marina Bay per my request. In terms of the room layout i have no complaints. Reasonable amount of space for my belongings and to move around after placing a baby cot. What i really liked is the bath room. They have seperate enclosed area for shower, toilet and bath. Room was clean and everything was working which was great. Excellent Service: I tested their service desk a couple of times with different request and their response was great. Calls answered promptly and it took them almost nothing to revert with the things that i've asked for. I ordered in room dining one of the night and the food was served on time with full table settings (iced water included without me having to ask). When we are done with the food, the person showed up within a minute of calling to clear the table and trays. Everyone from the reception to the cleaners are friendly and very good at their job taking care of our every need. Excellent service. Breakfast: We had buffet style breakfast at Global kitchen and they had a pretty good spread for breakfast compared to other hotels which i've tried. The breakfast would appeal to folks who are into Asian food as they had a pretty good range of Asian style breakfast. On the two days that we were there they had Dim Sum, congee, wanton mee soup, nasi lemak and prata for the Asian selection and the usual bread, sausage, Ham, eggs, fruits items which you would expect from the continental breakfast. There was also no queue to get into the restaurant for breakfast which is a good thing when u have two small kids who are hungry. The restaurant provided baby chairs and children utensils so if u have kids they are well taken care of. Location: In terms of location Pan pacific is very convenient. It is connected via underpass or overhead bridge to three shopping complex and two MRT lines. No more worries if it rains as u can walk across to Marina Square, Suntec and Millenia walk via the connected walkways or underpass. If u want to venture further the CIty hall MRT train station is a short walk away thru marina square. You can also take the circle line from Suntec which will bring u to the Marina bay sands integrated resort if you are interested to visit the casino. There's plenty of restaurants and food courts all around the hotel so food and shopping is easily available. Pan Pacific definitely rank high up in my list in terms of Service and value for money. I will definitely recommend this hotel to others visiting Singapore and i hope they can keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ivan_w1992
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my brother for 6 nights during December. After reading many good comments about the service and the hotel we decided to try it ourselves. When we arrived at the hotel we went to the desk to check-in, unfortunately the room was not ready yet so we had to wait around 1 hour 30 minutes for it to be ready. While we waited we were given a complimentary cocktail for the bar. Our room was impressive with a great view of Marina bay area. We could also see a bit of the Singapore flyer. Service was standard but not the best. They did not treat us like a customer at times and i think its because that we are still young. While we were lining up for the taxi the door person at the hotel told us to wait for the next taxi because someone needed to use the taxi. It wasn't fair because we waited for a while for the taxi and it was our turn but they let someone else go ahead of us. We tried out the Hai Tien Lo Restaurant at level 37. The food Quality was great, we ordered the set menu which was a 5 course meal. It was a bit pricey but well worth it i think. The view from the restaurant was breath taking!

Reviews.Title: “Third stay at Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: 4rubylou
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights and enjoyed it once again. Our room was ready early and bags arrived promptly. Had a small problem with being questioned no less than three times by three different staff about our entitlement to included drinks on our first night. Once resolved this did not occur again but was disappointing. Service otherwise was good and on ordering ice for our room were impressed that it arrived within 5 minutes each time. Taxis always available and the location is perfect for shopping. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: CriMa82
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night at Pan Pacific, but that was enough to really make an impression on us. The serivice was top notch on every level, and everyone seemed to enjoy doing their utmost to make our stay comfortable. We hung out at the pool all day even after checking out (we had a late evening flight), so we felt very welcome indeed. The location is good, with proximity to the Marina Square Mall, and a straight and easy route to the airport. If you want to go to the action in Chinatown or around that area, you probably will have to take a cab though. The hotel feels like it's 50% business guests and 50% leisure guests, so it's not all drab and stuffy. People were walking around in shorts an t-shirts, and we liked that the atmosphere was quite mellow. We booked through agoda.com and got terrific value (ca €150 for one night in deluxe room with king size bed and a great view). The only downside is that breakfast was not included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: sandgropers2
Reviews.Content: We recently had a night in this hotel. We had heard is was a very good corporate hotel, which it may be, but not for the average tourist. The staff were efficient but not particularly friendly. It took an hour for our bags to be bought up and then only with a phone call. Then 2 hours after we checked in a service person came to check the mini bar and accused us of taking out items we hadn't. They need to check the mini bar immediately after prior guests check out. We couldn't fit out own items in the fridge to keep them cold and with no ice on the floors we waited another hour for ice to be delivered. Breakfast was included but we were charged for it when we left (along with our phantom mini bar items) So our stay was a bit of a let down and rather stressful with having to negotiate the bill. We have stayed at other Pan Pacific hotels which were awesome, so don't let our opinion of this one ruin your opinion of the others.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and excellent .”
Reviews.Author: debcox
Reviews.Content: We spent a few nights here and were more than happy with the excellent standards that its only right to expect of this chain. We had our room early without any problem and the room and reception impeccable. The inside is most impressive and the views over the bay also great to take in. Also if you get fed up of hotel food which was also by the way Supurb there is a hawker market where you can sample all those amazing dishes the orient is famous for. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Atrium fab”
Reviews.Author: ClioPerth
Reviews.Content: Wonderful atrium set hotel Room good, balcony overlooking harbour better!! Dated furnishings,but has electronic fridge........if you move can or bottle for more than 30 secs you are charged!!!!!! But it gives you tiny space for milk etc Mall next to Motel for dining/shopping. Superb choice from 5* to fast food. Huge hotel, impersonal, people can enter from mall, so not happy re security.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but Worth It!!”
Reviews.Author: DesertCA
Reviews.Content: Shared a large room with balcony with two others on a 3 day layover prior to cruise and WOW! -- we felt so pampered. Very clean and comfortable with great design features, and we especially loved the huge, very modern bathroom. We're pretty budget-minded, especially when traveling (like to spend our money on other -- important things -- like shopping. But this hotel has such classy service from the front door throughout, that we felt like royalty (well, close anyway). We used the "connected" mall across the street for breakfast, and were touring most of the rest of the day, so the total cost was, for us, about the same as a 3-star hotel with meals. Well worth the upgrade! A total pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good!”
Reviews.Author: Mark A
Reviews.Content: Centrally located - about 20 minutes in a taxi from the airport. Staff are very friendly, attentive and efficient. Hotel has a funky design with a shopping centre "attached". Rooms are smaller than other similar quality hotels however clever design features and great views make up for this. Restaurants and room service are very good. Would I stay there again -absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “The great, the good and the areas of improvement.”
Reviews.Author: Daniel T
Reviews.Content: The great - First of all I have to start by saying that the service in this hotel is nothing like I have experienced in any hotel, anywhere in the world. I stayed in one of the Pacific Club Rooms and the service from the pacific club staff was nothing short of outstanding. I like to think of them as "Yes People". I don't think a single request of mine was met by a NO. You do pay a premium price for staying in the club level of such a hotel but it always makes you feel better when you leave feeling your money was well spent. The pacific club rooms are well equipped and the bathroom and products are impeccable. The good - The pacific club allows you to enjoy your breakfast in a few different locations in the hotel and the breakfast is on par with what one would expect at such a hotel. Not outstanding but definitely adequate. Area for improvement - The one aspect of where the room was lacking (which many business travelers consider the most important) was the bed. The bed was not as plush and comfortable as ones I have slept in the Marriots, Hiltons and Four Seasons of the world. It is harder than it should be and I really hope this is something that is looked into as the hotel undergoes major renovation. Secondly even though the hotel by itself is excellent, its integration into the GHA loyalty program is a little choppy. It is something that could be a little smoother. Also all major loyalty programs offer a point system which can be redeemable for free hotel stays. This is one of the major draws for a business traveller, and one reason someone might choose from a Hilton, Marriott or Starwood group of hotels. I stayed over 20 nights at the hotel and havent earned a single free night. Whereas one of the aforementioned hotels would have earned me at least a couple of free nights. But all in all, if you want to be spoiled by one of the friendliest staff, in a premium location, this is defintely the hotel to stay at in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Returning to a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelCamel
Reviews.Content: This is my third visit to the Pan Pacific. The superb experience of saying here commenced when booking the room via email where I received excellent and professional service from Joohee of Guest Care Services. My arrival at the hotel was efficient with the usual courteous and friendly welcome. A lovely touch was that several of the staff (and not just those at reception) said "Welcome back!" which did make me feel valued. I chose the Delxue King Balcony Room, which was an excellent decision. Rooms face the Marina area and even though I was not on a high floor, I was still very happy with the view. I had to briefly leave the room, but when I returned the porter had just finished placing the bags in my room - but the problem was that they weren't my bags! This was quickly rectified by a very apologetic porter, but I just laughed it off as one of those odd incidents that can occur when travelling. The room is delightfully decorated in warm tones, but perhaps not as pleasant as the Pacific Club (where I was upgraded on my previous visit). The bed is massive and comfortable, and provided me with a very restful sleep. The bathroom is one of the best I've seen at a hotel, and the dual-headed shower and decent-sized bath gives one plenty of options to unwind at the end of a day. A sliding door opens onto a balcony which, at this level, was surprisingly noisy. I originally entertained the idea of sleeping with the door open, but since I do prefer sleeping in silent surrounds, closed the door before retiring. The presence of this balcony and its view certainly makes this room better value for money than the Deluxe King and if one is paying a lot of money to stay here, it is worth spending a bit extra to obtain a better quality room. I ordered room service for dinner, and it was punctual. The food was again of a high standard, but as one would expect, it cost more than one would pay in areas outside of the hotel. I didn't eat breakfast here, so cannot comment on this aspect of the hotel on this occasion. Internet access within the room was free and even better was that if one visits the business centre there is no charge in completing an on-line check-in and printing a boarding pass. This is one of those extra features that makes this hotel special. All three of my visits have only been for one evening at a time due to the expense of staying here. However, I am determined to stay for at least two nights on my next visit later this year as this is a place where a extended stay would really allow one to absorb the ambience of this wonderful hotel. Even though this is an expensive option in Singapore, it certainly is worth the money if you wish to pamper yourself (or someone else) in a hotel where service and comfort combine to provide an experience that is rarely matched.

Reviews.Title: “Triple Celebration”
Reviews.Author: Josephine V
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT HOTEL... Very affordable, easy access to three malls, very friendly and courteous staff. The hotel rooms are neat and tidy, the executive lounge is great, the concierge is very accommodating, No hassle making the reservation and checking-in and out.. GREAT PLACE TO STAY :-)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Abby1005
Reviews.Content: It is in an excellent location. We had a great view and a spacious room. My husband had his birthday during the stay and received a complimentary birthday cake, a delicious chocolate one. I thought it was a nice touch. Breakfast gave a wide choice. We enjoyed swimming in the pool. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: Nicole L
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed twice at this property to and from our trip to Europe as a stopover. Check in was fuss free and I received a very warm and friendly welcome each time. In fact, all the staff at this property are wonderful and always greeted us with a smile. Had a room on the Executive level both times - worth the extra to receive access to the lounge facilities, morning/afternoon tea, evening drinks and free wifi etc. Room was spotless and very well appointed with great views over the harbour. I had late flights out and was given complimentary late check out until 3pm with access to the pool area and showers afterwards. This was greatly appreciated and allowed us to relax and freshen up before the trip out to the airport. Nothing was too much trouble in this respect. Initially I had wanted to try the Marina Bay Sands but so glad we chose the Pan Pacific. After visiting the lobby area and surrounds at Marina Bay Sands it felt like a massive, busy Las Vegas hotel, whereas the Pan Pacific was very personal and felt more welcoming (thanks largely to the wonderful staff). Strongly recommend this property if you're visiting Singapore or just stopping over.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: tyara
Reviews.Content: Quick check in, great rooms although a bit outdated, spacious bathroom and very clean as well, great choices for breakfast, and a clean and fast checkout. The price was good as well. What I love most is the location. It's adjacent to shopping malls and the first store you get to see directly when you get out is Muji, my favorite store. Needless to say, it was very convenient for me :) Definitely will stay here again when I'm in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A nice location and great views”
Reviews.Author: ZiadR
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at around 2:30 in the afternoon with reservations for 2 executive floor rooms. We were informed that the rooms were not ready and that we would have to wait around 45 minutes for them to be ready. Having just come off a 14 hour flight we were not very happy but did not make a fuss and to the hotel offered us complementary drinks in the lounge cafe. The lady checking us in also made quite a muddle of our names, muddling up rooms etc. But nothing serious. She was polite. The rooms were nice with fantastic views of Marina Bay and looking across to Marina Sands. We got the use of the Executive floor lounge for breakfast, afternoon snacks and happy hour, complementary every day and the staff there were excellent, always remembered us and our names and were very helpful. A nice hotel if you like shopping as you have access to at least 5 shopping centres in the vicinity including Marina Square and Raffles City, all accessible through an underground network. Our only problem was that we had some minute ants in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Well Appointed with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: vincepapale
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite hotels in Singapore. Outstanding service at all levels of the hotel staff. The spa area and pool is excellent. The restaurant is very good with a nice atmosphere. Most rooms have outstanding views with excellent amenities. The location is great, adjacent to the Marina Square Mall. Most locations in the city are a short taxi ride. This is a great hotel for business, or for holiday. I strongly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Staff earned this "5" mark”
Reviews.Author: Stephen_Lloyd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly iconic in Singapore with it's outside lifts and similar ones in the artrium. There's a strength and possible weakness too. I'd expected that the inside and outside lifts covered the same floor, but they do not. The staff booked me into the 30th floor meaning I had to go outside. No head for hights so they rebooked me immediately to the 18th - no fuss as it must be a common request, and done with a smile without making me feel a fool. Top service. Worth noting that up to floor 22 is inside, above, including the top club floor rooms. The Business floor lounge is on 22, so if you're booking it may be worth noting the difference - or just close your eyes in the lift! The room had a balcony view of Marina Bay Sands and the Merlion, a nice seat for relaxing outthere, good work facillities, a 32 inch screan which is a bit small by many room standards, and a reasonable bathroom but I found the rain shower very hit and miss. So it overall would have been a 4 from me, until I was checking out. I was going to the Conrad, just a few minutes walk away (this was an add on booking) and the lady checking me out insisted on giving me and my colleague a free hotel car ride around the corner. No trouble too much - she was a winner for me and a credit to the hotel. Also a credit are the team working in the Business lounge who a little raw at times but friendly and serving with a warm smile. Overall the staff in the hotel were just very very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oceanmum
Reviews.Content: The room was lovely with wonderful views and great touches throughout. The hotel had everything we needed and more for when we came home tired from our busy days of sightseeing. The staff were very friendly and the room was super clean. We would definitely recommend this hotel. The location is great and we made the most of being next door to a huge shopping centre. Loved our time in Singapore and having a great hotel helped.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Pan Pac Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Rafalicious80
Reviews.Content: Thank you for another great stay in your hotel. I had 2 rooms booked on the 20th floor, with Executive Business Privelages. Rooms clean, fresh, spacious, with great views of Marina. Big plus for Wifi and cable internet access, which I always keep forgetting to mention on my previous reviews! Great location of hotel, close, walking distance to shopping centres, CBD, Marina. Superb service. Wide variety of breakfast options on level 3. Big, comfortable beds! Enjoyed the sleep! good quality cosmetics. My only concern is where will I be staying in April and May during the upcoming renovations? The hotel will be closed for next 2-3 months! By the way, I am surprised about that!!! As many other hotels in that area definately require refreshing much more than the Pan Pacific. Hope it won't effect the prices and will continue having a great ambience. looking forward to coming back soon...

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay that will get better”
Reviews.Author: alpha1960
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 8 nights at the pan pacific marina and would highly recommend.the location is good with a short walk to mrt station (all undercover in air con comfort),marina bay area,connected to a shopping mall and lots of food options nearby.we had a room with balcony that faced the marina on the 17th floor-fantastic.the hotel lobby is just superb and creates a good impression as soon as you enter.the lifts are quite unique as they are clear and you get a nice view as you travel,clever idea when it was built due to the open atrium i assume. Check in was smooth and you are assigned a customer relations person who accompanies you to the room and runs over everything with you.the breakfast buffet at the global kitchen is one of the best if not the best i have ever seen.so much variety and of high quality.we also ate dinner one night at zambuca's within the hotel,again superb.the pool and the surrounding area also of high quality with piped music when under water (a unique touch).as soon as you walk into the area staff are there to give you a towel and a bottle of cold water.in fact the hotel had other grounds within the area that are a great surprise when you explore the hotel. The free wi-fi worked well and was of a good speed.the room itself is of good size and quality with the only minor thing i would say is starting to show some little signs of dating but with a update of the hotel occuring from april,i'm sure they will look brand new again.same applies to the carpets in the corridor but both these comments are only very minor. The good thing about the design that i noticed is that when you walk out from your room you step into a nice open area not straight into corridor.one of the best thing's though that this hotel has going for it is the staff,so professional,friendly and efficient.i would hate to single one out but will say special thanks to Mr Jiun Lee. Overall i cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and look forward to staying there again the next time we are in singapore.i expect it will be even better after the renovations/updates.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: lynnzie513
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Pan Pacific at the Marina. When we booked the room on the hotel's website, we were offered two free upgrades so we chose to upgrade to the club floor and have complimentary breakfasts. The value for dollars spent was excellent. Our guestroom was spacious, nicely furnished and had a large balcony that looked out onto the water. Service was gracious and unobtrusive. The concierges were extremely helpful with suggestions and maps. They helped us make the most of our visit. The lounge was the perfect place to grab a latte and a snack or dessert while checking email. The choices at the breakfast buffet were almost endless and the food was delicious. The hotel has an expensive Chinese restaurant on the top floor of the property. The food was interesting and delicious. Since we were there during the new year celebrations there was a special menu with foods appropriate to the holiday. The pool area is lovely, but there's so much to see in Singapore it's hard to stay poolside. You can walk so many places from the Pan Pacific; there is a huge mall that connects to the hotel. It even has a hawker center (a food court area with about 30 different stands), upscale shopping, movies and more. You can walk to the Science Museum, the river boat rides, the SunTec Conference Center, the Merlion, Raffles. The world-famous orchid garden inside the botanic garden is a cab ride away, but cabs are reasonably priced and plentiful in Singapore. Should we be lucky enough to return to Singapore I would happily stay at the Pan Pacific again. Everything was exactly as it should be and at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “truely memorable stay......”
Reviews.Author: freebits
Reviews.Content: beyond our expectations. the only way to discribe our nine night stay at the PAN PACIFIC. We were on the 17th floor with stunning views over the harbour, the room was fantastic with all the luxuries one can imagine. The international breakfast buffet is a must, and with so much choice we varied our palate daily. The staff were first class, catering for our every wish, even our breakfast waiter SAMI took the time on his day off to show us some some amazing sites, thank you SAMI. A quick mention to the swimming pool team who provided us with bottled water and clean towels at every opportunity, well done. I can honestly say that my trip to singapore was complemented by the PAN PACIFIC and its brilliant team, but you dont have to take my word for it, GO SEE FOR YOUSELF.

Reviews.Title: “all that sparkles is not gold”
Reviews.Author: gidgetsurf
Reviews.Content: Booked in here 3 days ago. First impression was what a beautiful hotel. The doorman was great getting our bags but then pointed to the checkin queue and said checkin there. I explained i was staying in executive floor and will check in level 33. No no he said you check in down here. Bad start. I paid a lot of money to be treated special and its not happening. Asked for a late check out. Not possible. I explained my husband is sick and has not been going far from room. Reply was check out is 12 then go shopping for 4 hours then they will give us a room for an hour to freshen up. Not good enough. The next day i begged and they have given us our room until 4.30pm today. Better than nothing. Have used butler service 4 times all 4 times i have to call Nd remind them about our request. Says on sign in room open pantry with icecream and soft drinks....we cant find any only fruit cake and juice. Says we can use levels 3 and 33 and 22 for breakfast. Went to floor 22 yesterday to be told by a rude man that we are not allowed to eat on this floor. When making our booking we told them we are on holiday celebrating our wedding anniversary. Would of been nice of them to acknowledge that. Under water music in pool? Stayed in 20 minutes i could not hear anything. Over all room is small but clean and comfy but service is terrible. Hopefully check out tonight will go smoothly but not holding my breathe. Wont return.

Reviews.Title: “Still Number 1 in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: The_Boo_Radleys
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Pacific Club at the Pan Pacific Singapore. From the glass evelvators, to a seemless check in and throughout our entire stay, nothing was too much trouble. The service in The Pacific Club is what one would always hope 'service' would be but rarely would recieve, no matter what the price of the hotel. Sipping champagne overlooking the harbour as you watch the fireworks and the lights below is indeed a truely memorable occassion. I feel I must mention Mr David Devasarayan who, through his thoughfullness and help, made the whole experience all the more enjoyable. We hope to return next year - we fully anticpate that it will still be at least as good!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a stop over”
Reviews.Author: mocha88
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent a night at the Pan Pacific Singapore Hotel as a stop over and was delighted with the hotel. We were greeted as soon as we entered the building, lobby looked modern and not too busy. Check in was speedy. I've read previously that this hotel is outdated but i was impressed with the bedroom size ( our package included an upgrade to the Superior room ), Whilst the bathroom looked a bit old, it was clean and sufficient for us. The only issue we had was the street noise, we stayed on the 15th floor and my partner had trouble sleeping from all the traffic even after midnight. Location was superb, a 5 minute cab ride to Marina Bay and the Marina Square Shopping Centre is attached to the hotel. Buffet Breakfast was included in our package, big range of cuisines offered. The hotel is going through a refurb this year and i can't wait to see the improvements next time i'm in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “a good option”
Reviews.Author: micius
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in an useful area of the city, at a good walking distance from many attractions and very close to hop on hop off bus stop (an useful way to visit the city during a stop over). Rooms are of a good standard also if not at the level of a 5 stars hotel. Breakfast is truly impressive, with choices of food from every part of the world also if the breakfast room is without windows and a little bit dark and oppressive. The pool in really wide also if the dressing rooms are the opposite: too narrow. Staff is efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value. Deserves it's T'Advisor rating”
Reviews.Author: travel_intelligence
Reviews.Content: Being close to the Esplanade, Marina Square and easy walking distance to the bus hub for the Hop On Hop Off was a major advantage for our stay. The staff were all very lovely and we enjoyed our stay very much. On returning home I answered feedback survey and was very impressed with how my feedback was received, they are genuinely interested in making sure they take good care of their guests. Rooms are well designed, have everything you could need. Very clean and were pleasant in terms of decor. The Atrium bar downstairs is great for drinks or a meal or snack. Food was very good there and is a comfortable place to hold a casual meeting or sit for a drink to work out your plans. I asked for particular room requests and they certainly allocated me a room that fit everything I asked for. Here's a tip if you want a quiet room make sure you ask for a room away from the lifts, is then perfectly fine. If you don't sleep well you'll want to give up a balcony room. It can be a little noisy. The views were amazing, but it did add a bit of noise. When next in Singapore am definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a perfect position”
Reviews.Author: ozjulier
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific Singapore offers luxury, comfort and excellent services. From the moment we arrived we were given the “red carpet” treatment. After having advised that we were arriving in mid morning after a long overnight flight, we were greeted with our room ready ahead of time and the reception staff personally ensured all was to our satisfaction. Wherever we went in this hotel the staff were friendly and extremely helpful, often going that little bit extra to add to the incredible service. We had a delicious meal at Global Kitchen, one of the many restaurants in this hotel, and would highly recommend it. The Atrium Bar/Café offers a variety of light meals and coffee as well as alcoholic beverages. There is also a deli/bakery on the ground floor which has a selection of cold meats and delicious pastries. This hotel is walking distance from shopping centres, transport and tourist attractions and an ideal spot to start your Singapore adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves It's Rating”
Reviews.Author: travelinstead
Reviews.Content: This hotel was first class all the way from check in to check out. The staff go above and beyond and the customer service is always there wherever you are in the hotel. Rooms were clean and well designed - they were a little dated but still were nice rooms. The gym was excellent as was the pool. We would highly recommend this hotel and if in Singapore again we would definitely stay here. For Singapore hotel prices, this was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay- my diet no problem”
Reviews.Author: warnesIpswich
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay in Singapore, and most convenient for many of the City's attractions. An excellent standard in all areas but in particular the Global Kitchen in meeting my gluten-free diet requirement. Diana at front of house in the Global Kitchen restaurant was very very helpful in making sure that my needs were met.. The Hotel had arranged for gluten free bread to be always available - made in house by the bread chef. And every evening the items available in the international buffet were introduced by one of the chefs who explained how each dish was made enabling me to be confident about which dishes I could safely eat. I could also have had something specially made and I very much enjoyed a specially made gluten free dessert.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: gundogjh
Reviews.Content: Located close to the Raffles Hotel, Clarke Quay, Orchard Road and many other attractions the Pan Pacific has offered a high standard of accommodation for many years. Everywhere you go in the hotel oozes quality and the atrium with the glass elevators is truly impressive. The staff treat every guest with a friendly, smiling helpful attitude which makes any stay there memorable. Having stayed at a few hotels in Singapore, the Pan Pacific will not disappoint and is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The best 5 star hotel we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: coralhayward
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we knew it was a quality hotel. Too many people are quick to complain when they receive poor service,but first and foremost we would like to thank everybody at the hotel for their attentive service, happy smiling faces, and delivering memories we will cherish for ever. The hotel management must be very proud of their team.The hotel is excellently situated, we stayed in a deluxe room on the first night before a cruise.It had the most spectacular views of the Marina you have ever seen. Upon our return from the cruise we had the delight of an Executive Room and well worth the extra money for the additional benefits, it makes you feel very special having your breakfast served in a private room on the Executive 22nd Floor, plus afternoon tea and evening house pour drinks in the early evening. Check in on arrival and departure was totally stress free with their assistance for luggage after a long flight from the UK. If any-one is a smoker like myself, be rest assured that the hotel does have smoking areas around the hotel which the concierge are pleased to show you, I was concerned with the Singapore no smoking laws but didn't find it a problem at all. We only ate in the Brunch Restaurant which is situated on level 4, good quality food, drink and service. The hotel is modern, spotlessly clean and the glass lifts both internal and external are a marvel. We will definately return to this hotel and highly recommend it, you won't be disappointed, it's breathtaking!

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Matoluk
Reviews.Content: A truly outstanding hotel; I can't think of a better place I've stayed in any country. My partner and I visited Singapore on route to Austailia as part of a holiday of a lifetime to celebrate my 50th. Our room was large, well appointed and comfortable with a quality bed. Coupled with superb views over the harbour we couldn't fault it. I found this view quite inspirational as I like to draw and paint. The icing on the cake was just that: a delicious cherry chocolate cake coupled with a birthday card was waiting for me on arriving after a day trip. Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and the location is great”
Reviews.Author: DLMC88
Reviews.Content: I am impressed with the attentive service in this hotel which made my stay very enjoyable and I look forward to returning. The only minor issue i had was that on checking in the sheets on the duvet were stained - however this was changed very quickly when I complained.One of the key advantages of this hotel is its location. Many people may prefer to stay in Orchard road. However for me over the years Orchard road is really getting too crowded for my liking. As such the location of the Pan Pacific is terrific - being close to Marina Square - adjoining the hotel and you can walk through via the hotel and then connect to Suntec City - all undercover. If you would like to go to Orchard then you the MRT is within walking distance and the taxis are cheap and abundant. The hotel has been around for a while now and I think it has been renovated and updated over the years. Although I think they spent this around the lobby area and perhaps the spa area however the pool and rooms were not really updated except for perhaps the bathroom. LCD TV, electronic blinds and new carpets. Beyond that the decor of the room is quite bland although the standard rooms are quite spacious and the bed although a little hard - very comfortable. The other area that I am impressed with he hotel is the quality and taste of their room service - their breakfast, burgers and also asian menu were very tasty and over the years with my business travel i have eaten a lot of room service. All in all with the service, location, large rooms (may it be a little bland) - this is a great hotel and deserves its positive ratings by the majority.

Reviews.Title: “Overated, a very old 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: dtai010
Reviews.Content: This is a very old hotel, friendly staff, good location, but just too old. Got a premier room with king bed, at the first look, everything looks ok. But when I stepped into the bathroom, it is so old and small, feels more like a 3-4 star hotel that is 50 years old. Overall is clean, but just not 5-star standard. Small bath tub, budget shampoo, cheap towels etc. Quite a disappointment really when I shower there. The location is good, located right next to a big shopping mall and the SUNTEC convention centre. One more thing, the wireless internet is free, but extremely unstable. I am not sure if it is just my room.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: koray k
Reviews.Content: my 6 years old son & my wife just fall in love! very nice hotel. connected to shopping malls. very clean room. very friendly staff. we also visited Bintan Island_Indonesia by their assistance. Indian restaurant in the hotel is extraordinary. glad to stay & felt bad when we are leaving. thanx 2 u all !!!

Reviews.Title: “Average at most - especially in Asia”
