Reviews.Author: Traveller2theworld
Reviews.Content: Don't understand the current ranking to be honest. It is a very average hotel, rooms are a bit worn and old fashioned design. Breakfast is reasonable, but again nothing like true 5 start hotel in asian region. Service is also mixed had to waitn a while to check out at the departure desk, while at the arrivals desk 2 employees were concentrated on their computers. I have stayed in much better hotels in Singapore and will probably not choose for Pan Pacific again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: SoniaNorthwich
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pan Pacific for 2 nights on a SIA Stopover on the way back to the UK from New Zealand. We arrived at the hotel just after 8.00 am doubting very much whether there would be a room available for us so early but we were absolutely delighted that a room was available straight away. Check-in was very efficient and soon we were in our room (912). King Deluxe with Balcony and what a superb view even on a lower floor. The night time view was breathtaking - singapore flyer, Marina Bay Sands, Fullerton Hotel and the CBD buildings all lit up. The room was very spacious and spotlessly clean. Free wifi, electronic mini-bar (be careful very expensive and items are automatically charged to your account if removed for more than 30 seconds), remote control blackout blinds which ensured a good night's sleep, every conceivable adaptor supplied for your laptop. tea/coffee making facilities, dressing gowns and slippers, fabulous bathroom toiletries, white fluffy towels, wonderful separate shower, huge superking size bed which was very comfortable. The staff were absolutely outstanding. Ivy on Reception handled our check-in extremely efficiently. Our luggage was brought up to our room within 5 minutes of arrival. The Pan Pacific certainly knows how to look after their guests. We only ate in the Global Kitchen - we took advantage of the 50% discount food voucher offered by SIA Stopover Holidays. We had breakfast there on both mornings choosing from the a la carte menu (the buffet american breakfast would have cost 35 $$ each and we could not have used the discount voucher so the a la carte menu worked out cheaper and we did'nt have to queue at the buffet counter). The food was amazing, everything was cooked to perfection and we spent about 25$$ each after the discount. If you prefer to eat breakfast outside of the hotel there are many places to choose from at the Marina Square and Suntec malls which are easily accessed direct from the hotel. Drinks at the hotel are very, very expensive. A draught Tiger beer (pint) was about £9 at the Atrium Bar!! The pool area and gym facilities looked superb, although we did not use them except for the showers. Our flight from Singapore was late at night and our checkout was 12 noon so we could use the shower facilities at the pool and they were superb (towels/shower gel provided). Alternatively you have the option to book some time in their hospitality room to freshen up before your flight and this can be done when you check in. If you need to printout your boarding passes for your flight home, simply go to the Business Floor and they will allow you to print your passes free of charge. The SIA Stopover holiday package is great value - the free transfers to and from the hotel were well organised, 50% food discount on the a la carte menu at Global Kitchen, free Hop on/Hop off SIA Bus which stops just by the hotel, many discount vouchers and free admission to many attractions. This hotel is being refurbished this year I love it now and would love to return after the refurbishment (hopefully one day I will return).

Reviews.Title: “It was ok - nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Rene J
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights as we travelled to Phuket. The staff were friendly and helpful. There is nothing wrong with the hotel itself however it is starting to show its age. Our only issue was finding something to eat. My wife is vegetarian and other than the Indian restaurant (which we did not feel like eating at that night) there was very little choice on the menus at the various eateries at the hotel. We did end up ordering room service where the options were greater than the restaurants however we did not want to eat in our room. Breakfast was overpriced. Based on our experience we will look for another hotel next time we are in Singapore. We are currently on our return journey through Singapore and are staying at the New Majestic Hotel in Chinatown. Check it out. We are loving it here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality and service”
Reviews.Author: IanT276
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the pan pacific for a two night stop over further to our holiday in australia. From the moment we checked in to our departure time, everything at this hotel was first class. The staff, The bedroom, the pool, the bar and the restaurants and their food were second to none. A special mention must go to " The Global kitchen " Where you will find the most extensive and quality breakfast menu ever !! My only dissapointment was that our stay was so short !! After visiting relations in Australia, it is always sad to say goodbye, but i cant stress how uplifting our stay at the pan pacific helped us on our journey back to England. Ian & Wendy Thompson, Carlisle, England

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susy-1974
Reviews.Content: I come back regularly to this hotel and have been in many different room categories. Even the standard rooms are quite big and comfortable. The strongest asset of this hotel is service, especially at the business center, but not only, employees are trying their best to help customers. Furthermore it has a top location in Marina Bay Area and is often booked out as it is just opposite the Suntec Convention Center. Has an Excellent Indian restaurant on the 3rd floor (Rang Mahal) and a very pleasant lobby lounge with live music in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “The Pacific Club floors are excellent”
Reviews.Author: GvKl
Reviews.Content: Neither the smartest nor the grandest nor the most sophisticated hotel but, if you book into the Pacific Club rooms on the 33rd to 35th floors, this hotel is undoubtedly one of the best to stay at in Singapore. The rooms, views, service and facilties up there are excellent. Included in the price are a good breakfast, tea (sandwiches, scones), drinks and canapes between 5.00 pm and 8.00 pm each day, snacks from the fridge in the breakfast area, soft drinks from the mini-bar, laundry (limited to two items per day) etc. I do not think that I would now stay anywhere else - but then, if I stayed at this hotel (which I would), I would probably only stay in a room on the Pacific Club floors because, having had experience of those floors, I would not wish to be elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: jacqui13PerthWa
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a 6 night stay at this hotel I have only good things to say. Excellent location with direct links to two shopping malls and the MRT station very close too. Our room was on the 17th floor overlooking Marina Bay with great views during the day and at night. Comfortable king bed and with the electronic curtains and blinds gave us the very best nights sleep. The breakfast which was included in our room rate was first class with a huge choice to suit everyone. But the standout feature of this establishment are the friendly,helpful staff throughout every department even just passing you during the day in the hotel you are always greeted with a smile and hello. Even the very best hotel is only as good as their staff.Big recommendations from us to all our friends and TA readers.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Coco2012
Reviews.Content: My partner and I loved the Pan Pacific. Not only is it a beautiful hotel inside it has great restaurants and facilities - we could have spent 2 days just enjoying the hotel. The room was lovely and had a great view of the marina. We also had access to the executive lounge and breakfast was really good. The staff were really helpful and friendly. The location is great and close to the Singapore flyer (where allot of tours depart from) and Marina Bay Sands (the new luxury shopping complex). I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone as we really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Missi0nary
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in the Pan Pacific Singapore. I had requested a quiet room when booking and we ended up being upgraded to a beautiful 2 room suite (we had booked and paid for a panoramic room)...it was as quiet as a church! The location (near SunTec City) has easy access to the CBD, Quays and is a short(ish) walk to Orchard Road. The gym is very well equiped and my wife was very happy with her massage and facial at the in-house spa. We had breakfast one morning..it's a large and varied European/Asian mix with something for everyone; although at S$35++ per person doesn't come cheap. The hotel may not be as new and flashy as some others but at the price point it was a big hit with us; we'd certainly return if/when in Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, accommodations and location”
Reviews.Author: AJ J
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Singapore and we were impressed by the Pan Pacific's location. It was within walking distance/a metro ride from many of the city's "must sees." The hotel service was excellent and the room was large with stunning views of Singapore. We especially enjoyed the free wifi. Guest services (located in the lobby) was extremely helpful in recommending places to eat and attractions to see. The food at the hotel was a bit pricey, but delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Home Sweet Home”
Reviews.Author: Shaz57
Reviews.Content: 3rd visit to the Pan Pac - made to feel special everytime. Upgraded to a room on the 33rd floor with spectacular views. Breakfast included - lobster dim sum for breakfast? Wonderful stuff! Can't wait for my next trip "home"

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, would return in an instant.”
Reviews.Author: csalmon79
Reviews.Content: Awesome place to stay for a few nights before heading back home. Service was excellent, staff were very attentive. Rooms were spotless and beds very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: Loris99
Reviews.Content: For what you pay you could have more, nice location, funny elevator but that's it .... I got two bad surprise : booked a room with balcony and actually payed for it, but I got a normal room with a window and was not even possible to open it !!! And second surprise , 1 of the night was charged me 150$ more with no reason.... I had to fight hard for get the correct price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Only regret, just spent 12 hours there.”
Reviews.Author: Harry P
Reviews.Content: Took a stopover in Singapore for a night on our way back to Australia from Langkawi on our babymoon in June 2011. We were to land in Sangapore around 10.30 pm and had a flight out next day in the evening. Thanks to a small delay, by the time we reached the hotel it was just past midnight. Check in took a bit of a while as there were a couple of people ahead of us, or maybe I felt it to be long as I was half a sleep. We were given a free upgrade to a higher category room. The room was fantastic. Ultramodern with motorised blinds and curtains. As the room was on a higher level, we had a nice view of the city. Having a hot shower before going to sleep was heavenly. We were even allowed to check out an hour and a half late on request. They took care of our luggage while we could meet some friends and do some shopping. The best part was the location. Close to two MRT stations, the major malls and Marina Bay. My wife loved the location as it was very shopping friendly. The only sore thing about this stay was that I just got 12 hours in this fantastic hotel. This is now our preferred hotel in Singapore and am looking forward to stay there next time I am in Singapore. Thank you Pan Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: FITCHICK711
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple of nights at this hotel and found the location excellent for shopping, food and great views of Marina Bay. The hotel is connected to at least 3 malls that I can remember. I got a really good deal with Expedia through the TA website. Our room overlooked Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Flyer. Excellent customer service all throughout the hotel. We were very happy with our room. The only thing I did not like are the elevators but this is only because I'm afraid of heights. My husband thought the lifts were awesome!

Reviews.Title: “World Class Service”
Reviews.Author: lianKualaLumpur
Reviews.Content: Just back from a conference in Pan Pacific Singapore. Left my luggage at the concierge during check out as the conference ended at 5pm that day. When I went back to get my luggage, to my shock one of the three luggage was not mine at all. After searching and finally approached by Rene who sincerely and honestly told me that he is not sure where it is but he will try to find it. At first, I had lost all hope of getting the luggage with sentimental items in it when he told me someone else took mine by mistake. Took my flight back. And on the taxi back near to midnight got a call from Mark who call and said my luggage was found in a neighbouring state. Mr Mohd Ibrahim drove all the way from Singapore to Kuala Lumpur (thats about 500km!) and took it from the person who mistaken my luggage and handed to me the next morning. I was so grateful that my luggage was found. No amount of money could actually replace it. Ibrahim drove back to Singapore after handed me the luggage. I have enjoyed my stay in Pan Pacific Singapore for 3 nights. The room was great. Comparable to most 5 stars all over the world. Mistakes do happen. But its how Pan Pacific Staffs -- Rene, Mark and Ibrahim reacted that showed that how responsibility, sincerity, honesty, care and kindness makes the difference and makes it truly WORLD CLASS!

Reviews.Title: “Pefect hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoykoShumen_Bulgaria
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel,clean with very good preakfast and perfect location-nearby malls and on a walking distance to Marina Bay,Merlion and sky Park hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, safe hotel. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: cee-food
Reviews.Content: I'm staying in Singapore for work, and playing tourist at well. First, let me say that the views from the upper floors, and going up the external elevators are impressive. Needless to say that the location is excellent. City Hall and Esplanade MRT stops are nearby and can get you anywhere in the city. China Town, Orchard Park and the Vivo City link to Sentosa are all short rides. The taxi stand outside is staffed by hotel attendants and always seems to have several taxis waiting, for near immediate service. Watch out for "limo" taxis. They cost more but queue up like regular blue, silver and other taxis. The Pan Pacific has met all of my expectations for a good work-travel hotel. If I could afford it, I would happily stay as a tourist as well. The hot water runs consistently and freely. The cleaning staff are reliable, and don't move my things around, but they also don't use a bit of clutter as an excuse not to clean. Bathroom, linens and surfaces are always sparkling. The "Service One" concierge staff are prompt and accommodating. The laundry/dry cleaning service sends someone up right away and returns (as if by magic) your clothes directly to your closet. It could get expensive for a long stay, but laundromats are few and far between. The towels are large, clean and absorbent, and the robes are nice. The toiletries are good enough quality for my long hair and sensitive skin. The wifi provides a fast and consistent connection. The hotel provides all relevant cables that might be useful to hook up some electronics to the tv (hdmi, dvi, svga, etc.). Some (all?) of the outlets in the room are international, so you can plug in your NA adapters, as long as they support 240V. The hotel happily (invisibly) complied with my request to empty out the min-bar so I could store my own drinks/food. Three malls (Suntec, Marina Square and... one other) can be accessed directly from the 3rd and 4th floors of the hotel, through the "back" entrance. The malls contain cheap but tasty food courts, coffee shops (including 2x Starbucks) and more shopping than any one person could ever need, from higher end/luxury items, to good "bargains". The restaurants are expensive, even for Singapore standards, but good. The Sushi in the restaurant on the 4th floor is some of the best I've ever had, but for SG120 ++ for a 9pc Nigiri set meal, it's pretty steep. The gym looks pretty good. I haven't checked out the pool yet, but I probably won't, so I'll send off this update sans-pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great value option in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: yezzum
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time in April and it was a great introduction to this wonderful city. Experienced a two night stay in comfortable and pretty spacious room. Certainly large enough to spread yourself out without feeling like your in a shoebox sized room! Good views, especially from the floor to ceiling windows. Within walking distance of MBS and the Flyer. Several shopping centres close by along with a 7/11 across the road. Staff here were excellent and helpful with a fast and efficient check-in. Always prepared to answer any questions and chase up tour operators who may be running late in picking you up! Nice lobby bar with live entertainment in the evening which is great for a quick pre-dinner drink.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, great staff, fantastic room”
Reviews.Author: Redhowe
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I visited the hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The staff on arrival were incredibly friendly, busying my 1 1/2 year old daughter and giving her a teddy bear (which she loves). We were escorted to an executive room on the 28th floor and the view was spectacular - I assume the 'partial harbour view' noted in their bookings is to save them from the difficult customer. We all enjoyed the room - practically silent air-con, comfortable bed, great chair at the desk, big bath, a powerful shower, all great. It's worth noting that the Bering Suite - to which executive room customers have use (or is it to do with the booking type) - will allow access to children whilst they're not serving alcohol. I'm not sure if this only applies at weekends or during the week as well. It's a small selection of snacks and (good) espresso but appreciated when you want to escape and read the paper!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, stunning views, comfortable rooms, good food and an awesome service culture”
Reviews.Author: MarinTravelDude
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific in Singapore has a lot going for it: Great location, stunning views, comfortable rooms, good food and an awesome service culture. This visit I chose a Club Level room, and I really think it is worth the price. Instead of standing in a line in the lobby, I checked in at a desk on the 33rd floor.... very civilized, especially after a long trip. Jayrick, who checked me in, urged me to call with ANY request and really made me feel welcome. The sunrise and sunset lounges have nice buffets with breakfast in the morning and snacks and cocktails in the evening. I thought about trying the Mandarin next time, but with an experience like this, I'm sticking with the Pan Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Best view on the Bay”
Reviews.Author: szaboline
Reviews.Content: Great location with probably the best views in Singapore. The rooms on the executive floor with a balcony are fantastic! Even better are the rooms on the Pacific Club Floor! Here you have the best service possible! Further you have access 24-7 to a pantry serving all kind of drinks, snacks and warm food. Free Champagne for breakfast and the highlight is the Pacific Club Sunset Lounge. Here you have a great view on the bay and you can enjoy complimentary champagne, cocktails, wines and snack foods! Great! The only downturn is that the hotel has not been renovated for a long time. But this will change this year and than it will be most likely a Grand Hotel. Summary: Great Location - Best Views - Good Service

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with awesome view of the Bay”
Reviews.Author: Der_CoMander
Reviews.Content: To keep it short: this hotel deserves to be among the top 3 in Singapore. Staff is always nice and helpful Rooms are very large and luxurious with balcony and spectacular view of the harbour. location is great with the direct access to Marina Mall. We upgraded to executive package, which is highly recommended: complimentary 5 o'clock tea, drinks, wine everything. Only the breakfast is in a rather small room with not too much choice - but still more than enough.

Reviews.Title: “good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: andnobodyknows
Reviews.Content: Rooms are excellent and very clean; views of the harbor are spectacular. Pool and gym are very nice. We didn't eat there; kind of expensive. But you can't go wrong here if you are looking for a high class business hotel with all the standard amenities. Location is okay if you are being driven to wherever you want to go. To me it felt like a real treat to get to stay in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stopover”
Reviews.Author: maryh1972
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific on a stopover on journey to New Zealand. A great place to stay. We checked in ealry at 9 am with no bother. The staff were welcoming even though it's a large hotel. Rooms were great. It's in a good position for walking to sights.Fulfilled expectations. Near Raffles too.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars all around”
Reviews.Author: Thomas C
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Pan Pacific Singapore. The staff were all extremely friendly, from the beginning through to the end of my stay. I arrived around 1:30PM on a Thursday, their stated check-in time is 3:00PM, and was offered a drink on the house while I waited for my room to be cleaned. On my last day I received a late check-out and I used their hospitality room later that evening to take a shower and clean up before I headed to the airport. The pool is great and the gym has brand new machines. For a light snack I recommend trying the "goujons" from the bar that's outside near the pool. The "shark attack" at the Atrium bar is one of the better rum drinks i've ever had. Also, spring for a balcony room with a full harbor view if possible, it's worth it. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect breakfast and good location”
Reviews.Author: PaPE03
Reviews.Content: Very big hotel. Perfect breakfast. Even though the room is simple it is very clean and the bed is comfortable. The staff is very helpfull and friendly!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DenJo565
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed at the Pan Pacific Singapore for 2 nights on the 19th January 2012. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel welcome, with the staff being very friendly & helpful. The staff made us & especially our two children feel at home. The hotel was very clean & spotless. We were allocated a room on the 31st floor, overlooking Orchard Road & Raffles. The view was just amazing. Access was gained via the exterior lifts, which the kids thought were amazing. We were very pleased with the room, with more than enough room for the 4 of us & it was cleaned everyday, with fresh supplies provided. Even fresh bottled water was supplied. We ate breakfast in the Global restaurant. There was such a variety of food for all cultures but also tasted fantastic. The food supplied was good value for money. One of my children is quite a fussy eater, but even she enjoyed what was on offer! The pool was spotless and the staff again were very friendly. Towels & ice cold bottles of water were made freely available to us. We couldn't find fault with this hotel, every member of staff that we came across greeted us with a smile, and were all wonderful with the children. The level of service was exceptional. We have never visited Singapore before, but have left with happy memories and have no doubt we will return back to Pan Pacific in the future. Thank you all at Pan Pacific Singapore for making it a memorable stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: x_tan
Reviews.Content: Even we came for check-in at 9AM, and the staff still did their best and got a room for us around 12; and in the meantime, we spent sometime in the hotel pool. The best alternative to 'early check-in'!

Reviews.Title: “best price/performance ratio in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Toygar K
Reviews.Content: I have already stayed at Marina Mandarin and Conrad Centennial before during my business trips. This time, we were in Singapore during CNY week for a family vacation and I took the tripadvisor advice to stay in this beautiful hotel. PPS is a big, clean and well-run atrium style business hotel. Atrium hotels are always nice to stay in, with the corridors are illumunated by sunlight coming from up. Everywhere inside the hotel was full of real living orchids and it was a very nice touch. We stayed at the 30th floor with a bay view. And that was priceless. Nothing was blocking the view at that level and we had enjoyed the CNY fireworks like sitting at the front seats of a theatre. Our room was an executive with a balcony looking to the bay and I really advice to get that type room. It is well-worth the price. The hotel was quiet. The beds are firm and comfortable. The bathroom was better than average and very functional. The furniture was a bit old, but clean and didnt bother us at all. BTW, I heard that the hotel will be going under a renovation period during May and June. The location of the hotel is simply excellent. Some nights we returned at midnight and tried to enter the hotel from the Marina Square shopping center connection or from the Millenia Walk connection and we didnt have any trouble entering the hotel from the doors at level 2 or 3 (by swiping our room cards). This is surely a plus and gives you privacy. It is a feeling much more like returning your own home. Overall; we stayed as a family of three for a week and we are very happy that we selected PPS for our stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service at its best!”
Reviews.Author: HungryHun
Reviews.Content: We booked our room at the Pan Pacific through the SIA Singapore Stopover Holiday Program and was taken to the hotel quickly in the SIA shuttle stayed late January. Upon arrival a bell boy quickly took our luggage and gave us a little card to retrieve our luggage at check in. After there was around 4 Ferraris and a Rolls Royce in the valet car parking area which was quite a spectacular site and we took the opportunity to take a picture next to the Ferraris. Now entering the hotel building itself we were shown towards the checkin counter where there was two staff there and no guests but they both said they were busy but then a lady quickly came up to the desk to check us in so we barely had to wait. I think here name was something along the lines of Shirimini, she was absolutely wonderful greeting us warmly with a smile giving us a great first impression. Whilst checking us in we asked if there was a chance for an upgrade and she without hesitation gave us a fantastic upgrade to a room on the 32nd floor with a great view of the city and also the upgrade included breakfast which was nice as we didn't have it included in our original booking. We had to take the glass lifts which was spectacular especially as we arrived at night looking at the city below. When we entered the room we were pleased with the size and layout of the t.v. Beds, desk, chairs and the overall design of the room. We couldn't find anything in the room that could be faulted although the bathroom door was unable to be looked easily because the door didn't not line up with the hole for the lock so I had to play around with it for while before I could the bathroom. Some say the rooms look dated but I think they look modern enough and the room is very practical like the ability to control everything in your room just at the side of your bed. During the stay I managed to get tonsillitis and found it increasingly hard to swallow without acute pain so I went down stairs to ask if I could see a doctor and the lady said that they don't have a doctor on site but there is Raffles Hospital with 24 hour emergency there. I then said oh because I have a sorer throat and find it painful to swallow and just like that she made a quick call and then a manger I think came and gave us two taxi vouchers to get to the hospital and back to the hotel and personally escorted us to the taxi. Upon arrival to the hotel after the hospital the concierge came to us and asked how I was and then when we arrived in the room after 10 seconds the manger called and asked if I was ok and if we want more water and we said yes please so in a minute or two a man came up with 4 bottles of water (we already had 2 from this mornings turndown service so now we have 6) We found this to be really nice and thoughtful of the manger to ask how I was and offer us more water and she also said for me to drink lots of water which will help with my throat. The Pan Pacific really know how to treat its guests and this was another case of that which made our day. Unfortunaley there was a small comment made when leaving global kitchen after the buffet breakfast by the lady at the front desk of the restaurant which went like this she asked if we enjoyed our meal we said yes she then said to my father I can see he enjoyed it alot and started shaking her stomach implying that he enjoyed it alot because it is big which is true but is not needed tobe commented on and luckly for her my father easily shrugged it off and took no notice of it but it still is quite offensive especially to hotel guests. This was the only problem we had with the hotel but it is minor so I'm not marking down the hotel because of this one lady. The hotel also has a pool of good enough size and a 24 hour gym which is smallish but quite adequate. Check out was OK, the man gave us a bill for breakfast but we told him our room included it so he quickly took the bill back, then he never asked for the room keys back when he said goodbye but I asked if it wants it back and he said yes. Overall the Pan Pacific is a superb hotel and is great for anyone wanting a hotel well located and has the best customer service of any hotel I have stayed in and accomodates families well. Will definitely come back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average or better for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: cvdwl
Reviews.Content: It's a modern business hotel. Foo'd fine; the breakfast buffet looked like it had been sacked by Huns when we got there, but the food was decent. It's big, clean, impersonal and generally well run. It's a safe bet and not unreasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “A classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: bd007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a classic. The 35 story atrium is spectacular. With 1700 guestrooms it should seem busier but you don't get that feel. It is attached to a large shopping complex and many good restaurants are within shopping distance. The rooms are nice, if somewhat basic (although its my understanding the hotel is about to go through a major refurbishment). The rooms are clean. The bathrooms are very clean, and have all the ammenities needed, on the downside they are very dated (however it was explained to me these would be addressed during the upgrade). The breakfast buffet has everything imagineable. The fitness centre is clean and well equipped. Bottles of water are provided upon entry and apples are offered when leaving. The pool is very large and the staff their are incredibly nice. What sets this hotel apart is the staff. They are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “deserving the 5 stars will be back”
Reviews.Author: globetrekker90
Reviews.Content: best for business,honeymooners,family,friends,solo, whatever lol so great that i went to their hr department and asked for a job within their hotel.(hope they consider it though!) Because it has a great service, great marketing!! the staff knows how to please you! Breakfast is very good, rooms are amazing, just ask for a high floor room and you'll be pleased! Honestly I would stay at this hotel everytime i consider going to singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fabulous room.”
Reviews.Author: devlink
Reviews.Content: We booked this at late notice and were very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel and room. We were offered a room upgrade with breakfast for an extra £25 per night (for 2 of us not each) on check in which we accepted. The staff were very helpful and efficient and the quality of the room furnishings was excellent. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Julie K
Reviews.Content: What can you say about a 4 to 5 star hotel. The service fantastic. The rooms immaculate. However the drinks were expensive even for a beer around the pool area. Walking distance to everything. Views incredible. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: BellaMBJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Chinese New Year and was not disappointed . The views from this hotel are spectacular across the Marina bay area - ideal for any of the main events which take place there. It is close to the new casino and the Esplanade There is also an MRT station alongside the hotel to get out and about , or walk ways airconditioned with shops underground ,for most of it, to get out to Raffles Hotel area or to the theatre, and the open top bus tours start near by at Suntec. Food courts in the malls attached to the hotel .Why anyone wants to stay on Orchard Road I don't know , for sightseeing this area is much better and not so crowded in the local cafes. Beds are on the firm side but still comfortable , room ameneties are good Food choices in the hotel are good , especially like the Japanese restaurant . The best bit about the hotel though are the staff , very friendly , very helpful - everyone from the toilet attendants to the senior staff who you see passing around .

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great service, good price”
Reviews.Author: ANME002
Reviews.Content: for our second stay in singapur, at the end of our trip (4 weeks sleeping in hotels around malaysia), and beeing a bit disapointed about our first hotel choice in singapur, we choose to spend the night at pan pacific. the hotel has 37 floor (we spend the night at 31) you acces with glass bubble lift, and with a nice view over singapur (we hab a view over the raffles). the staff at the reception was excellent, and mastered many languages. the room was a bit old fashioned (brown) but with anything you need, and really spacious. and the bed was on of the best of our trip! they was no breakfast inkluded and we didin#t test the bar, because the hotel is directly connected to marina square mall over a backdoor. you can reach mrt, shopping malls, places to eat without getting out (what is nice when it's raining!). the hotel is not far from merlion / marina bay sands, which is a really nice location to enjoy the light show in the evening! check-in and check-out were fast!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: Amity S
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Singapore we took part in the Singapore Airlines stay over deal and opted to splurge and stay at the Pan Pacific. The Pan Pacific is an exceptionally beautiful and impressive hotel with an amazing lobby (one of the best of the big hotels in Singapore) and awesome views from all the rooms. The service was up to par as well, as was the location and nearby amenities (easy mall access, close to the Singapore flyer, the marina, Asian Civilization Museum, and transportation, even a 24hr 7-11 across the street!) . Overall we were impressed. Given the exorbitant cost, however, we probably won't be back for a second visit. A biggie was the cost of food and drinks served at the bars and restaurants in the hotel. Prices were absolutely obscene and border lining unreasonable, so we had to eat elsewhere. To compensate for the lack of affordable eats, we simply walked in to one of the gargantuan malls connected to the hotel where there's a plethora of eateries. The only problem with this is that if you want breakfast you may be subjected to fast food given that most mall restaurants don't open till 11am or later. Major plus is that you can check in anytime (we checked in at 8:30am and upon departure saw people arriving as early as 6am). This is awesome. No need to worry about what time your flight gets in. Great but expensive experience. Splurge if you're up to it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Matosh
Reviews.Content: Booked a staycation package which included S$100 F&B credits which were used at Keyaki (which is a fabulous japanses restaurant). Stayed in a deluxe room, decor although slightly dated was all functional. Bed was comfortable if not a little too firm, more than enough pillows and a good selection of cable tv channels. Toilet was well stocked with seperate shower area and bathtub. None of those modern "see-through" glass windows though (if that is a consideration). Hotel service was prompt and polite as well. Ordered dessert in-room and was delivered within half an hour (and was yummy..try to lemon upside-down cheesecake). Overall was an enjoyable stay, but as mentioned in a couple of other reviews, hotel is a little dated (one of the older 5 star properties in the area) but the price you can get on some deals reflects this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Venkatesht
Reviews.Content: Great Location, nice restaurants and very comfortable rooms. Had a nice view from my room which was on one of the higher floors Staff was friendly and service was professional & quick Improvements needed: Internet was slow - which for a business traveller is inconvenient. The shower was leaking, which did not affect my stay, but is ecologically terrible especially with the water concerns in Singapore Overall, I experienced significantly better service levels than in the Mandarin Oriental where I had stayed one month earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: anniemh2o
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby - to start - is very impressive. Our rooms were very well appointed and the hotel had endless amenities. The food was outstanding. I would very highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “High on Promise, Low on Delivery”
Reviews.Author: NischalKap27
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific in Singapore leaves the impression that it used to be one of the best hotels in Singapore. I stayed here for one week in September. Service and rooms are old and stinky. The pool and the Gym are OK. The location is great but they are not leveraging it from a quality of service.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute top of range”
Reviews.Author: gsebire
Reviews.Content: Great location at marina,excellent choice of restaurants. Rooms very spacious with excellent blackout curtains ,comfortable kingsized beds and all amenities provided. Nice pool and well equipped gym Efficient and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, location and service”
Reviews.Author: alex-creative
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my Girlfriend on a two night stay and found the hotel and the service excellent from the minute we got there. The room was great and to a high standard. Large flat screen TV, electronic blinds, floor to ceiling windows with a great city view and spacious bathroom. The location is also excellent, right in the centre of town and a short and very cheap taxi drive away from the river and Skypark complex. The only down side was we found a hair in the fruit salad from room service but this was quickly amended and the salad taken off the bill for the inconvenience. Please don't be put off by this, accidents do happen and the cleanliness everywhere else was excellent. The gym is good and very modern with the latest equipment. The pool is a good size as well even though we didn't have time for a swim on our stay. All in all great hotel and i would love to stay again at some point.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic view from upper floors”
Reviews.Author: DengyD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, the Singapore was our stopover when we went to Bali. I stayed at many 5 * hotels so my expectations and standards for this hotel were high. When you arrive in front of the hotel you will not be amazed by its outside look - just a standard pretty tall hotel, that is what you see from the ground. But once when you get inside, you get to see very interesting and strange design and shapes.Very refreshing and different, I loved it from the start.The hotel is not a tropical paradise nor it was ment to be one, I would classify it as primarily business hotel, but well adapted to the needs of any kind of travellers to enjoy. The service: Check-in lasted for 2 minutes and the room was readyfor us although we arrived before the regular check in, which was gret after a long trip. The sam was for the check out and there were no "accidentally" added items to our bill at the end. everything went quite smoothly.As this ws not my business trip we did not use any of business fcilitiesbut I saw there were so many coneference room so I could tell that the offer for businesses is quite good as well. Few times we were sitting at the Atrium bar and the quality of the offer was good,though they were little bit slow and once I got a dirty fork, but they were so embarrased when they saw it so it was clearly an hones mistake, but should not happen any way in 5 star hotels.As we used this hotel just to sleep and have breakfast I can not say much abouut the quality of other facilities. There is a gym on the ground floor, seemed quite spacious.The pool and pool are are quite nice and oppening hours are good, I did not have time, but would really recommend daily relaxation near the pool.There is taxi line at the hotel entranceand it goes quite fast, but if you do not want to wait you can simply book a cab in advance in the lobby.The hotel is connected with the Marina Square shopping mall (was not crazy about the offer of it, but there are some ok restaurants/ fast foods), so you get to enter the mall from the hotel and you do not have to get out. Staff was generally verry polite and helpfull. The room: Very clean, quite enough space for everything you need, bathroom was great with bathtub and shower and separated area for the toilette. All the amenities of a 5 * were there. We asked for the executive room with the view over marina and it was well worth it. Ask for as upper floor as you can get, because there is another hotel in front so if you are on the lower levels it could block your view. At the highest levels there are Club members rooms. Our room was at the 26th (2613) floor and had a terrace and I was really happy with the view - over whole Marina, famous Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Fullerton hotel, Financial center, all the tall buildings from the postcards :) The food: The breakfast buffet was great, the offer from the food from all over the world was really more than enough and I can not imagine that there is a person who could not find something excellent to eat. Everything was really tasty (and I can say I have pretty sensitive taste budds :)). The offer at the Executive lounge was not that big, several things to choose from but it was all delicieous. Of course that asian food dominates but is was so tasty and made in a way that any European or American would be satisfied.The hotel has several restaurants, one near the big one with buffet breakfast with good wine selection and the other one is on the last floor with fantastic view over the city. All hotel restaurants are (as expected) quite expensive. There is huge number of restaurant outside on the Singapore river banks (Clark Quay and Boat Quay and all around Marina) Internet: Very good every time I accessed. Surroundings of the hotel: Location is very good and we went to Marina and Clark Quay on foot (longer walk). But be aware that the hotel is tall and from the terrace you get to see everything and everything seems so close, but when you get down you have to walk a lot. The location of the hotel is such that everything you want to see in this area is not very far so the cab is not expensive. If you are not into walks, just grab a cab to where you want. Orchard road, Zoo, Sentosa are not in the city center to the cab bill is expectedly higher. Highlights: - great great view over Marina Sands Bay, - interior of the hotel (little bit "cold" but soooo different), lifts are capsules made of glass and those used for upper floors slide on the outside wall of the hotel (nice view), - food at the breakfast and in executive lounge. - will definitely come back again to this hotel and ask for even upper floors. Shortfalls: My trip was 5 months ago and I can not remember any bad things, so it really made good impression on me, and I trully recomended this hotel to my friends (one already booked it).

Reviews.Title: “The absolute best!”
Reviews.Author: Cha0sOnTheR0ad
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotels 160+ nights a year worldwide. The Pan Pacific is the best hotel I've ever stayed in. The service is unbelievable! I booked into a Pacific Club room for a week. After the first day, the concierges remembered my name and went overboard in order to ensure my stay was perfect. Thanks to Judd, Jayrick, Siti, Mariana, and especially Shine! The Pacific Club amenities made the stay even better. 24 hour access to the lounge, appetizers every day, champagne breakfast, laundry service, the list goes on and on. The location is perfect for shopping (Marina Square and Suntec City) and the MRT station (Esplanade) is 5 mins away. I never wanted this trip to end! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cas S
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The service was friendly and efficient. Staff were always willing to help. The rooms were very pleasant and I loved the complimentary upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Band_on_the_Road
Reviews.Content: Travelling to Singapore with Jetlag needs some luxury to get normal again. We travelled with 3 kids and got a nice large room. Food excellent.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: PRJ01
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night stay at this great hotel. The location, the highly professional staff, the magnificence of the luxury offered here is pure 5 STAR. Hotels don't come much better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely hotel great staff”
Reviews.Author: Lisa R
Reviews.Content: Right from the start i was treated very well. The reception staff was very friendly and helpful. although i was checking in a little early - she was still very accommodating to me. Can not tell you how lovely this was. The room is very clean and neat and spacious- it is pretty simple but the views are amazing and the air conditioning works very well. I really don't have any thing to complain about i can very easily recommend this hotel to anyone i noticed that there were young families in the hotel and they seemed to be very happy as well. I can honestly say i will be back to stay in this very clean hotel that has excellent staff

Reviews.Title: “How could this be the second best hotel in Singapore amazes me”
Reviews.Author: Riveredu
Reviews.Content: Nothing wrong here, but the hotel is dated, you can see it in the rooms or in the building. Room service was nice, the pool good, the gym was also dated. They were overbooked so I couldnt stay another night (I had a late flight), but at least they allowed us to use the facilities until departure. Free WiFi all around the place was much appreciated, but it doesnt make up for the age of the building/rooms. I wouldnt come back unless I hear of renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Rob2037
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night on business in January 2012, having stayed previously (also on business). The hotel is great, has everything that you need for business travel and was surprisingly affordable. I selected the hotel through tripadvisor and was surprised at the "headline rate" and was pleased to be able to get the room at an even lower rate through Agoda. One of the best touches was the fact that both wired and wireless internet connection ere included in the price. The room service menu has a reasonable (if not surprising) range at prices which are comparable to those at Singapore restaurants. The hotel has a direct entrance to the Suntec City Mall. This has good shopping (but not as wide a range as Orchard) and convenience stores as well as alternative places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Traumatized Experience”
Reviews.Author: nunoon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for our honeymoon with my husband but we were harassed and intimidated by a group of young men in the lift. The hotel staff did not do anything about it and did not attempt to reassure us so we felt fearful and anxious throughout our time in this hotel. The hotel attracts young people and it is not an ideal hotel for couples or family. We had to spend most of our time outside hotel and we were let down by Singapore pan Pacific. Instead of having memorable time we were traumatized in this hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “F1 vacation 2011”
Reviews.Author: jennyfox2
Reviews.Content: Well let me give you the good and bad: Good: 1. Fantastic location, even better for F1, as the track runs by the hotel and from some of the balaconies you can see a massive stretch of the track. 2. Staff were brilliant and the hotel was extremely clean and modern - no complaints at all! 3. The year that we travelled to watch the F1, the Ferrari team were staying in this hotel, clearly shows that it is a great location for the track etc... 4. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants but did order room service that was excellent, and fantastic value for money. Bad: 1. When we arrived, due to the location of the hotel and the F1 we had to exit the taxi and walk to the hotel as streets were blocked off. Distance wasn't too far but when you are exhausted and you have luggage its not ideal. 2. Although the hotel does have a small pool etc... you get the distinct feeling that you are in a business hotel, It felt like you were to be ushered into a conference room or something - doesn't have a holiday feel about it at all - very clinical. 3. This may only affect people staying during the F1 race - but, a bar/club had set up a temporary tent building that might as well have been in our room! We were 33 floors up and the noise coming from this pub/club was so loud, we were kept up till 6am (when the music stopped) for two nights, we slept with the ear plugs in used for the F1 and pillows over our heads. We only stayed a couple of nights and it totally ruined our stay, I would definately check that this won't be the case if you visit for the F1, or at least specify you would like to stay in the other side of the hotel. Noise was horrendous! We did complain though and to be fair to the hotel they wiped the bill clean, and we were not charged for any room service etc... to be honest I think they had had many complaints about the noise! I think this bar/club travels with the F1 so you may not have any problems any other time of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: SimonB1104
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our children overnight on the way back from Melbourne to the UK and was very impressed with the hotel and the service was second to none. The staff were very very attentive and helpful and would completely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for something a bit special. Will definitely stay there next time we travel through Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, exceptional service!”
Reviews.Author: Like2trave1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Pan Pacific Singapore & found the hotel excellent & the service exceptional. The staff were always friendly & willing to assist. The rooms were clean & well appointed. The location is great & we would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: QueenMeerkat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days, and the hotel is amazing, really spectacular lobby, and the rooms are great - size, cleanliness, views. The hotel staff were fantastic, very friendly and helpful.... and the hotel is very centrally located as well. I would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Akesnov M
Reviews.Content: Even though I stayed only single night, I'd say that the service very good. The room very large, with nice property. I hope someday to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_LH
Reviews.Content: What can I say, what a hotel! The rooms are lovely and spacious and the view from the windows of your room are wonderful, with fulll picture windows. The hotel lobby is amazing, and when it says shops are close, you have a massive shopping mall on site that connects to the hotel. The swimming pool with under ground musi is lovely. Singapore itself is lovely and an amazing experience, espeicially Raffles hotel which is a must, to enjoy a Singapore sling.

Reviews.Title: “Base yourself here in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: HanD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and were very impressed with the hotel. Gym, wifi, pool and reception services were all exactly what you would expect from 5 star hotel. We were upgraded so I can't say what the basic room was like but the on the 18th floor are lovely. 10 mins walk from raffles, 2 min from 2 malls and less than 5 to the tube. A great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Singapore Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vesna W
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Pan Pacific in Singapore several times a year. I started staying at this hotel some five years ago on the recommendation of a colleague and it has never disappointed. The staff are all pleasant, welcoming and helpful. The lobby is stunning and spacious with a great lobby bar. The rooms are well furnished, clean and the beds are so comfortable. The restaurants are great and the food at the Global Kitchen is excellent. The location is great for getting around and shopping, and it removed enough from the frenzy of Orchard Road. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is considering a stay in Singapore. It is the only place I would stay. My stay late December 2012 again exceeded my expections.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: edolondon1965
Reviews.Content: Three days in Singapore staying at the Pan Pacific, just excellent. Stayed on the 25th floor taking the outside lifts with great view! Breakfast can keep happy even the fussiest people, delicious!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: gillydukes77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in November as part of our honeymoon trip to the Far East. As we arrived early at the hotel (way before the quoted check in time), they offered us a hospitality room to get a shower and freshen up before our room was prepared for us, which took approxmiately one hour. We fully appreciated this gesture after a long flight from the UK. I would definitely say that this is more of a business hotel, rather than a vacation complex but the rooms were excellent and we had a beautiful meal in the italian restaurant located within the hotel complex. Hotel is within a 2 minute walk of Raffles Hotel and 10-15 minutes walk from the Singapore Flyer. Prices in the hotel are fairly extortionate for food and drink but I guess that's to be expected from a 5 star hotel. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here and would return!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay especially since we got a great week end delight rate”
Reviews.Author: vickidfenton
Reviews.Content: Family of 5 stayed here, very nice rooms, good service, very nice week end rate. The rooms were a good size, the customer service was very good only disappointment was we could not stay one more night for the same price. Very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: shalala00
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Pan Pacific using a hotel deal website and was really happy with my stay - they placed my boyfriend and I on the 32nd floor. The staff were very friendly, easy to deal with and the room was a reasonable size. Room service was really good - lovely food and generous servings. They also accommodated us having a later check out time and offered for us to use the hotel facilities after check out if we wanted to shower. There is several shopping centres across the road, which made the location great as well. I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: vickynjim
Reviews.Content: We really couldn't fault this hotel unless you want to mention the cost of a G&T at the bar but that seems to be Singapore in general. Rooms, staff, food and cleanliness are exactly what you should expect from a hotel of this calibre

Reviews.Title: “Nice view but having technical problem with Internet & Breakfast was not great.”
Reviews.Author: Cheery66
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I booked into Pan Pacific due to the great review from Trip advisor. However I felt the rating is probably a little overated. It was not bad but not to the extend of as one of the top 3 hotels in Singapore. Probably the higher the expectation, the higher the dissapointment. Our initial plan was to stay in Pan Pac for 2 weeks but we decided to checked out on the 7th night. I shall make a summary on our stay: Pro: Room: Very Nice view, I like the separate shower room. Swimming pool & gym : Swimming pool is nice and all the gym equipments are new Good location Cons: Breakfast is free however it is always full of people and long Q to get to the buffet booth which is ridiculous. It became worse when we were Q'ing for food, the food are not replenished and you are just looking at the empty tray. We spoke to the day manager at the concierge, no improvement on the next day. Internet was down every night after 11pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and facilities”
Reviews.Author: dp191244
Reviews.Content: True 5* hotel in excellent location. We stayed on club floor and well worth extra cost for peaceful breakfast and excellent evening cocktails. Rooms are fine with great city and marina views.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: aussieguy69
Reviews.Content: Ok - i know i wrote a review about this hotel 10 months ago... and i rated it based on being one of the best value for money 5 star hotels in Singapore. We'll following an incident that happened during my last stay, just before Xmas - i wanted to highlight the excellent and responsive service recovery I had... Makes me want to recommend this hotel to everyone i know. A few days before Xmas i spent almost a week at the hotel, and was on a special 4 nights for the price of 3 nights rate. When i checked in, i confirmed the rate, and they said that the 4th night would be given free on check out... No problem. Except when i checked out a few days before Christmas - i didnt check the bill properly (it was very early in the morning and i was racing for a flight) and they forgot to deduct the 4th nights room price from the bill. It was not until between Christmas and New Year that i picked up the error - but by which time i was back in Australia. I found a contact email address on their website - and promptly emailed them with my predicament. Thinking that i'd be lucky to hear a response. To my surprise someone from their Finance Department promptly replied - acknowledged the error and indicated that my credit card would be credited with the exact amount within the next few working days. And to his word it was done. I was pleasantly surprised by the prompt service and rectification of the problem. It further entrenched my view that this is one of the best hotels to stay at in Singapore. It has excellent value for money (cheaper than most other 5 star hotels in the area), large rooms, and now excellent customer service. Thanks Pan Pacific... you have got a customer for life.

Reviews.Title: “Good customer service + strategic location”
Reviews.Author: Megat_Ishak
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at Pan Pacific, the first time being back in 2005 whilst on a business trip. This time around it was with my wife and kids. The good things - excellent customer service where we felt we were rightly pampered. As for the room, it was spacious, clean and quite plush with LCD TV and several key news channel. However, the kids complained that there was only one cartoon channel, which was Cartoon Network. It would be great if they added Nickleodeon or Disney. As for the facilities, the 24 hr gym is a great idea, and the wide pool served its purpose of engaging the kids. As for the location - its great. Walking distance from Suntec Shopping area, the Millenia Walk, and a 15 minute walk to Marina Bay Sands. And about a 5 minute walk from the nearest LRT, which is Promenade. All in all, a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I like this hotel, so they still get things wrong”
Reviews.Author: benbee1
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th stay at the Pan Pacific in Singapore. I love the location and the view over the marina bay, and the attached shopping centers make life very easy. The hotel is modern, clean and overall about 4 1/2 star. They really do the room comfy and useful rather than luxury. But I don't mind that. The tea/coffee was very easy, lots of closet space and a user friendly bathroom. The gym is nice and 24 hours with a key card. And on the whole everything you would expect. There was a couple of things which were annoying. They have a service one button on the phone, which basically is someone who can sort anything for you. Problem is that it can take as long as 5 min for someone to answer, and you get put on hold with a recorded message. Even at 4am when i wanted to book a wake up call ! This happened very often. Another thing is the towels, hard and they smell a bit weird. And there is not enough light in the bathroom for a lady, they really need a light above the mirror. My Mrs was standing in the tub to use the mirror there, as the was more light. Overall its good for the price, and the Food has got better.

Reviews.Title: “Good City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kyla64
Reviews.Content: Three night stay, rooms are large standard hotel rooms, with good quality fittings and amenities. The room has electronic curtains with blackout blinds, so it is very easy to sleep. The hotel has a number of good restaurants with a shopping centre adjoined to it so you have a large choice of restaurants within easy reach. Although once the centre has close there really isn't much around the hotel to do. If you are not a fan of lifts then this isn't the hotel for you. The lifts (elevators) are glass and go up the outside of the building or inside dependant on which floor you are situated on. As this was the first leg of our holiday we wanted to do the usual sightseeing tours, we were picked up by coach for all excursions and we did have to travel a distance to the what appeared to the the central point for all excursion pickups which is by the big wheel.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Jordan1201
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great choice for a stay in Singapore. Marina Bay, Esplanade Mall, Raffles (Long Bar), City Hall metro station all within walking distance. The rates are very reasonable compared to other nearby options. We did not stay long enough to enjoy all of the amenities, but the restaurants, bars, pool area, etc. all looked very nice. The service was excellent. Check in and checkout were quick and simple. They actually have different desks for arrivals and departures (why doesn't everyone?). When I go back to Singapore, I will stay at the Pan Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Well enough, but nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: KlaasH
Reviews.Content: As the hotel with the best 'rating' (8.9 at the time of booking) the choice for the Pan Pacific was easily made. The 'average' rating I was about to give should be placed in our context of four and five star hotels in the large Asian cities, such as Singapore, KL or Tokyo. All hotels in this area in Singapore are well connected through the underground corridors, subway stations and shopping centers so we weren't too worried with the specific location. This hotel is connected to two smaller shopping centers and Suntec. Having booked the panoramic view at a surcharge we expected a room facing the water, but we got a city view, which from the 27th floor was fine, but we could've saved ourselves the extra charge. The room was nothing really special but had everything one might need and the electric curtains are always a nice touch. We could've done without the concrete beam blocking some of the view. The compartmentalised bathroom creating a separate shower and toilet seemed a bit too much at first, but was actually very pleasant for our two adults and one toddler use. Too bad about the constant flooding from the bath which went all over the bathroom making it quite slippery, even around the toilet. The pool looked fine, but we didn't have the time to try it. Not that we needed to as our next stop on the same trip was a beach resort. The elevators are nice. Staff was as you would expect for such a reputable hotel. Of all the local hotels though, this one does seem to be off the radar. The taxi driver from the airport didn't know it and even the express service bus to the zoo and such - which has a stop at this hotel - doesn't mention it. This low key status also makes the hotel a bit harder to find from the MRT than other hotels. Should the available price be right than go for it, but other hotels might be easier to find or get around from.

Reviews.Title: “How soon can I go back?”
Reviews.Author: Minigirl24
Reviews.Content: Friendly, super efficient staff, check in was spot on and personalised with the staff member taking us up to our room and showing us how everything worked. Great start. The room on level 24 had a nice view out to the harbour shoreline. The room was clean and spacious with a king size bed. The bathroom was a good size and it had a separate bath/shower. The first night we dined in at the top floor restaurant Ha Tien Lo. The food was great but watch out for the soft drink prices, $8.00 for a can of diet coke! We spent three nights here and had the buffet breakfast each day at the Global Kitchen, really nice food and chefs are happy to cook your eggs however you like them. My partner enjoyed the pots of hot chocolate that were made up for him. The pool area is a good size with plenty of umbrellas and sun chairs. Very central to shops the city, the harbour and the MRT. We had requested a late check out and were prepared to pay for a half day but on checkout at 6pm we were told that there would be no charge. I already know where I will be staying on my next trip through Singapore, you have won me Pan Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “50th in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Tony T
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Pan-Pacific for a week to celebrate my 50th with my 11 yr old son.....Was upgraded to executive suite.......Also breakfast was up on the 24th floor of executive suites.......Great stay....The view over the marina was spectacular.....Everything from its proximity to shopping malls/restaurants and service was top notch....Highly recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, friendly and good location”
Reviews.Author: ozmadmax
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times and returned recently over the holidays. Service is always excellent and quality is reliable. Check-in was busy but efficient. Room was clean and fitted out well. Bathroom is great. Breakfast selection was ok. Rate for holidays was reasonable and recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A world of its own.”
Reviews.Author: GAMR
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel again for 4 nights over Xmas and again thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The pool area is fantastic and I love the location. Staff extremely friendly and helpful and everything seems well organised so little or no delays when checking in or out. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. Probably due for an "update" and I believe this is happening within the next few months.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: CheekyChan
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights in Dec 2011, booked deluxe balcony, great views but very noisy. Each time we asked for another keycard to the room, we have to produce ID, many attempts required to use keycard in elevators, many other guests were annoyed too. Lift had loud rings which goes through the room. We came back from our wedding celebration, very tired, both are keycards didn't work, approached staff who asked for ID again, after staying for 5 nights, my immediate reaction was: you can't be serious!! New keycard was issued but only with showing of ID!! There were no short of apologies to a point of I thought I cannot hear another word 'sorry' We had 2 other families staying there and they were all in different floors, although I have written to inform them

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Orchids”
Reviews.Author: ABWidodo
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel in the middle of Singapore. Many features I have found in this hotel and very detailed in-term of placing any things in the room (but they did not promote it, I dont know, maybe becoming as surprise elements). This hotel can be accessed from the Mandarin Square. One thing that I impresed, that so many Orchids near with swimming pool. You can imagine, so many colors of orchirds, that very maintained orchids surround the pool. This is very excited for me. And guess what, they gave my room the small present ... three stalks of orchids!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and very comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaKirsty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at PP Singapore in September 2011 for 7 nights. From the first second we arrived at the taxi door we were shown first class service right to returning home and having a email from Guest Services inviting us back to stay again. It was a wonderful experience and I would highly recommend to others. We picked up a deal online that was very reasonable which had all our friends in Singapore asking just how well we were doing to afford this hotel! The hotel has so many positives; excellent customer service, free fast wi-fi and local calls, a later checkout offered to us for no charge, large generous room size with hi tec gadets galore, comfortable bed (not loving the pillows that much as too soft for me personally but easily forgivable) and the interconnection to Marina Square Shopping Centre (no need to experience the Singapore heat to go for a wander), close walking distance between your pick of two MRT stations and numerous dining options (we only dinned at Global Kitchen once). A few small minor negatives which are likely to be throughout other reviews; the lifts (yes they can be slow but we were on holidays and who could stay impatient when each ride is like your very own Charile and the Chocolate Factory experience in the glass elevator!?) , the fact we found none of the shops surrounding the hotel open until 10.30-11am (not PPs fault at all, but I would strongly consider getting brekky included next time we return to the hotel) and the annoying mini bar being pressure sensitive so we could only just jam in our fruit for fear of being charged sky high. We dined at Global Village at PP on our first night as we were tired, it was very tasty, beautifully presented, great service and food reasonably priced although the menu was not very exciting we found the drink prices very expensive (which is the same all over Singapore). Nothing special however I dont think we will ever forget my $8SG pineapple juice (from a bottle too!). I got the feeling the hotel would be more for business travellers, so I would suggest best for business travellers or solos/couples (those not looking for a romantic getaway). Overall outstanding customer service and a comfortable stay in what could be described as a very efficient hotel. We loved it and would consider returning again - thank you PP for giving us such a wonderful first experience of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Considering the crowd and the size of the hotel...very good!”
Reviews.Author: Nazda
Reviews.Content: We went there during Good Friday, didn't realize that it was a holiday in Singapore. This is a big hotel but surprisingly everything is very organized and well managed. Didn't have to queue up that long to check in and check out. A short walk from a metro station. Room was clean and modern, enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “You never have to leave!”
Reviews.Author: BearInPNG
Reviews.Content: As a frequent visitors to Singapore on business and passing through on leisure travel to parts of Asia we have stayed here quite a few time. It is quite remarkable since, if you have already seen all the sites of Singapore, you really never have to leave. There are three outstanding world class restaurants: Indian, Chinese and Japanese, as well as the usual buffet based cafe and an informal outdoor eatery which are just OK. The rooms have great views, the pool is large, and all the other amenities you would expect are of top quality. The staff are very pleasant and efficient. The hotel is attached to a shopping mall which is in turn attached to another mall, so if shopping is your thing then it would be hard to see how you couldn't get what you want without a taxi or train ride. However if you don't mind paying a little extra I would thoroughly recommend the Club floors where breakfast is served in a separate dining room and afternoon tea and cocktails are available for free each day. The main cafe buffet breakfast is rather inefficient and there are often long queues to get in. Many of the dishes sit empty for quite some time before being refilled. It's not all that terrible but way less than you would expect in an otherwise so excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was alright...”
Reviews.Author: viroze
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice and the latest is during the New Year. Cos of that, the hotel was offering $200 Double Preference promo where I've chosen free breakfast for 2 and $60 worth of F&B credit. Another sweetest thing is that the hotel offers complimentary car parking, which is a plus when you're in SG. And oh, you've gotta love the location - sandwiched in between the shopping malls, 7 mins walk to MRT train and probably 15-20 mins walk to Marina Bay Sands. Check-in process got a bit delayed due to the NYE hangovers, so the receptionist was kind enough to offer me with a room with panoramic view of the CBD from the 25th floor and a round of complimentary welcome drinks. Not so sweet notes, food quality and hotel interior/exterior not as good as I'd expected for a 5 star hotel. The bath tub is not at its best (a lil old and scratchy), so didn't use them. Also, there was a long line to get into the restaurant for breakfast. And not to forget, faced twice the occasion where the cleaning staffs kept opening my room door without knocking (the 2nd person only knocked AFTER he opened my door). The reason could be that the hotel has checked me in late and the staffs are not aware of the 'late check-in offer' at 3pm, which comes with the promo I've got. Thank god I was fully clothed on both occasions... But hey, with the rates and convenience, I guess it wasn't all that bad, in fact it was alright :)

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel on Marina Square!”
Reviews.Author: John_in_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with one purpose - to have a room with a good view of the New Years Eve fireworks in the harbour. Our Executive King room on a high floor (27th) was well-appointed and delivered the nice harbour view we wanted. The room had a large open balcony which was much bigger than I expected, with a lounger and table and still plenty of space. The room itself had plenty of floor space, desk, chair and a nice bathroom with separate shower & bath tub. Luggage was handled very efficiently on arrival (arriving no more than 10mins after we checked in) and on departure. This room had access to the Bering suite, with complimentary breakfast, afternoon tea and early evening drinks. Our only gripes - the hotel is big - 770+ rooms over 37 floors. The 8 lifts really struggle to cope with the number of people staying here at busy times, although the outside bubble lifts do give a lovely panoramic view. Check-in and check-out was painfully slow at this busy time of year. Only 3 desks for check-in and 3 desks for check-out. As we had pre-paid the room rate in full and had used a few minibar items we would have been happy to use an express check-out facility (had there been one). Instead, we waited over 20mins in line behind umpteen people who queried their bills at length until a kind lady escorted us across to the Pacific Club desks, where check-out was efficiently handled in a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: vivian78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pan Pacific Hotel Singapore over the X’mas weekend and it was a very pleasant experience. We found the hotel to be very customer-friendly. We booked online and the response was swift and efficient. Upon arrival at X’mas eve our request for a late check-out four days later was met without extra charge. We were starving and went to have some snacks at the Atrium (The bar). The waiter there gave us very good recommendation for food. Other ‘customer-friendly’ measures and people include free local calls, free internet access in the room though we didn’t use it, and helpful staff at the arrival and departure desks, the concierge and room service. The only criticism was that the lifts closed so quickly that you were shut out unless you stood right in front of the right one. Our room was called ‘Panoramic King’ and it was a good size of about 41 square metres. The furniture was modern and functional, though not ‘classy’. There was plenty of storage space and the bathroom was huge. At about SGD 300 per night we think it was quite good value for money in this peak season. We would like to recommend especially the open air café near the swimming pool – it was breezy and cool and the food was reasonable. Good place for a quiet chat.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: charlotteharris
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Christmas/New Year 2012 and glad we did. Check in was ultra efficient with clerk coming to the room with us to complete paperwork and showing us in. room very clean and well appointed and the bed very comfy! Staff were very quick to respond to all queries and very happy to help. We used the pool quite a bit and it was fantastic, as were the staff there. We had breakfast included in our package and it was unlike most hotel buffets as it was really good, with foods from all over the world; well worth getting. The only negatives (and really they are tiny) are that our key failed several times meaning we needed to go down to reception to get a new one, which at Christmas takes a while in a big hotel!) but overall, really good.
