Location was good as directly linked to one of the many malls in Singapore so plenty of choices to eat in the food courts. A little further to walk if you want to use the MRT but no more than 10 minutes. It's about a 20 minute walk to Boat Quay etc but very pleasant - Singapore seems quite a pedestrian friendly city (certainly compared to Kuala Lumpur). On our final day, we weren't due to leave until 9pm but the hotel staff were great and we used the pool area (which is very good) for the day and arranged to use a hospitality room to change before leaving. Overall, a great stay and I would recommend this hotel in terms of both cost and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in reasonable cost”
Reviews.Author: rajkumar3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice place to stay with good ambience and delightful food options.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - 32nd floor. Breakfast amazing.”
Reviews.Author: 1plato23
Reviews.Content: Breakfast - best ever in a hotel. Was included in our room rate so cheap enough.The views were not great from 32nd floor but room was lovely. Receptionist delightful. Close to attractions. Really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: YasuhikoY
Reviews.Content: Good location, comfortable outfit, and great hospitabilities of the staff people. Totally satisfied with the quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kiwichik
Reviews.Content: The hotel was remarkable. Pool was lovely and clean and open early morning to late evening. Nice touches were the free bottles of water delivered to the room each day and given to you at the pool, much needed in the heat. The Atrium bar makes a nice Singapore Sling and has a good choice of cocktails. Buffet breakfast was served at the Global Kitchen and set you up for the whole day. Definitely recommend a stay here. The Hop on Hop off Sight seeing bus stop is just outside the hotel so handy for getting about.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service from very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kali737
Reviews.Content: I’d love to say I had a great stay at Pan Pacific but unfortunately I was really quite ill and spent most of my stay in bed so didn’t get to use the gym, pool etc. Thankfully, I found the bed very comfortable, unlike some previous reviewers. However, I do want to review the wonderful service I received from the staff in the butler service. They were attentive, friendly and service was very prompt. For instance I asked if they could provide different body lotion as I didn’t want to smell like a freshly squeezed lemon using the L’Occitane stuff in the room. Five minutes later a handful of bottles of alternative lotion was delivered to my room. They went to great lengths to help me change my plane ticket which was much appreciated. Spending my birthday ill, alone and stuck in a hotel room was no fun but my day was brightened by the fact everyone I spoke to when I called butler service wished me a happy birthday. It was a delightful surprise when they delivered a delicious birthday cake to my room – complete with candle! A special word of thanks to Judd who on my last evening came to my room so I could settle the bill and I mentioned I was ill. He seemed genuinely concerned and although I said I didn’t want anything he must be a mind reader and said ‘how about some ginger tea?’ Actually that sounds really nice, I thought. ‘Some carrot juice?’ My favourite juice! He was soon back with tea, juice, a fruit platter and sympathy. Thank you Judd. All in all the service was fantastic and I’m looking forward to going back to Pan Pacific and making the most of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Singapore so far”
Reviews.Author: Peetsie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for my 2nd time for 2 weeks in the Pan Pac and still my favourite hotel in Singapore. What makes it good? Big bright clean room, comfy bed, electric roller sunscreen and curtain that is almost blackout, balcony, good work desk, TV with cables to connect ipod for video and sound, master light controls by bed, bright decor, very good staff service, good Indian restaurant, Marina Square and Suntec right next door for restaurants and food, Durty Nellie's pub 5 minute walk, Raffles and MRT 10 minute walk (soon to be 2 mins to a new station), the best smoking area beside the lifts! Have previously stayed in the ShangriLa, Marriott, Hilton, Hyatt, Marina Mandrin, Ritz Carlton (see my other reviews), but have now made the Pan Pac the default hotel for myself and my work collegues. The Marina area is great - lots of choice of restaurants and shops, less busy than Orchard area, nice views over the bay and skyline - ask for a room on bay side - taxis are plentiful also. Lobby is bright and welcoming, atrium style hotel, but noise does not travel up to rooms, breakfast has large buffet selection multiple nationalities catered, pool is nice (best pool by far is Capella on Sentosa btw...), prices are comparable to other hotels, offered late checkout and a room to change before taking midnight flight. Nicely decorated with red lanterns in atrium for chinese new year (see photos) A great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific & Singapore Exceeded Expectations read details of Singapore Trip with Family”
Reviews.Author: witwisAlex
Reviews.Content: Travelers: 1 woman, 1 girl age 9 Purpose of trip: Fly to Singapore from Florida to board cruise ship in SING We flew to Sing a few days early to enjoy some sightseeing. We checked into the PanPacific at about 2am local time, we had paid for the night before to ensure we would have a room upon arrival. Huge time difference from home, so my daughter kept waking up at 3am everyday wanting breakfast :) The Pan Pacific was fabulous, super clean, modern, and exceeded all expectations.The room was super contemporary,clean, big tv, fancy electric operated window shade, great view of the city. The rooms overlook a central atrium, a style that I like (no dark hallways). The hotel has a full buffet breakfast that we enjoyed 2 mornings, it is expensive ($aprox $50pp USD) but very good. You'll get both local foods & western style foods. My kid loved it. We also went to the rooftop Japanese restaurant. This is a spectacular place, do go look at it! The food was WAY OVERPRICED, but it was very good (not great enough for the price). We saw the swimming pool, it looked fine, but we didn't have time to go in. The hotel is connected by a hallway to a large shopping mall. The mall is something you could see in any western city, your typical chain shops. BUT there are alot of restaurants there, including a nice mcdonalds. We ate some breakfasts at the Mcdonalds, saving us some money. Regarding the Concierge: They were helpful, but gave out some bad advice, especially about taxicab prices. The taxi cab prices were always quite a bit higher than what the concierge quoted. The taxis are metered, you pay for time & distance. We spent alot of money on taxis! We booked a 1/2 day afternoon trip through the hotel to the Juorong Bird Park. We didn't realize that the park is a long drive from the city, and the tour was way too rushed.As soon as we got on the tour bus the guide was telling us " we don't have much time at the park, we are in a hurry to return" because he had another tour to do! We barely got to see anything at the bird park. The next day we decided to take a cab (in the morning) to the daytime zoo. Again, alot of trafic getting out of the city, taxi was very expensive (I think $50-60USD) one way. The zoo was excellent. This is not a huge zoo. My kid was able to FEED ELEPHANTS, and she was chosen to participate in the sea-lion show. You must feed the elephants, its about $5USD, the animals are in the swimming pool and reach their trunks up to grab the food. I've never encountered this in any US zoo, this was the highlight of the zoo visit. When we tried to leave the zoo in the afternoon to return the hotel, there was a long waiting line at the taxi stand, no taxis in sight! I asked another couple if they were heading in our direction & we decided to share a cab back to the Marina hotel area. This was great, & we all saved some $$ by sharing. Later the same day we went back to the zoo for the NIGHT SAFARI. This is the BEST thing to do in SING. You get onto a tram, which takes you through the NIGHT ZOO (different from the day zoo). Fabulous! I have never seen any nightime zoo in the states, this was a real treat. You can get off the tram at various places to have a look around. Walk through the BAT enclosure, you'll never forget it!! You can buy a multi park ticket for the Bird park, the day zoo, and the night safari. This is what I suggest. Forget about the tours from the hotel, just take the cab & buy the multi ticket. This is your best value. We also went to the China town night market, nice to see & maybe take a rickshaw ride, but shopping is mostly just junk. We wanted to go to Sentosa to see the dolphins, but the dolphin exhibit was closed, so we didn't go. The sky-ride to Sentosa is also closed for repairs. Weather: try to get going early, it rains alot in SING! pack some of those small disposable rain ponchos. Safety: As a woman traveling with a child, safety is always a concern. I found SING a very safe,modern, super clean city. No jungle here. As in any metropolitan area, use common sense. YES I would definitly stay at PAN PACIFIC again & recommend this hotel to anyone. Very good location too. To get the best price at the hotel we went on their website & paid in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjg298
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel and certainly wasn't disapointed after such good previous reviews. Staff were very friendly and helpful at all times and made the stay the more enjoyable. We had a room with a balcony situated upon the second floor, with views over the marina bay and raffles place. Although there are other hotels situated in front of this hotel, the view was still excellent, especially at night. The hotel is situated adjacent to three shopping malls so there are plenty of places to visit and eat at close to the hotel. The hotel has excellent facilities and the rooms are very well layed out and equiped, with all the connection leads etc you could require to connect any divice to the internet or tv system. There are plenty of restaurants and bars within the hotel as well. During the day the hotel the has access directly into the malls making it easier to get to them as outside of normal working hours the hotel and area can be difficult to navigate (lots of walkways etc). We got to Singapore City centre from the airport via the train and alighted at the City Centre Station. During the day, it is easiest to walk through the shopping centres to reach the hotel, but during night you will need to travel via the roads (using underpasses etc sometimes without escalators), which is the sole reason why I have marked down the location slightly. Alternatively just take a taxi - its easiest.

Reviews.Title: “Stay nowhere else in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: BM615VGS
Reviews.Content: Travelling up from Perth and arriving at 4am it was great to be met with a smile. This Hotel has 5 stars all the way except that the beds are very firm, too firm really, but hey that's just for us.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel, only let down was the mattress was too hard”
Reviews.Author: ci1705
Reviews.Content: I can give a big tick to all parts of the hotel and staff we encountered and it was a quality hotel. We are just a little spoilt by having stayed at a lot of hotels that have pillow top mattresses, like the Intercontinental chain, Westin, Sheraton etc. This bed was like sleeping on concrete to us. Otherwise, breakfast was very plentiful and varied, rooms were very clean and decor and ammenities modern and nice. Staff were friendly and helpful. It was very busy at the hotel due to the airshow but it wasn't noisy. Elevators were great, loved the ride to the top with the views. Location was good, walking distance to Singapore Flyer and Marina area and some shopping. I would recommend this hotel however would make sure that people knew the mattresses are very firm.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff Ever”
Reviews.Author: Starkerama
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel during Chinese New Year and there were numerous celebrations and treats left in the rooms. The hotel is gorgeous and modern inside and the rooms are very well appointed. The breakfast buffet offered extensive variety and was very good. The location is within walking distance of the harbour and a few malls. Aside from the decor, the staff at this hotel were the best we have ever encountered. We never waited in a line, the concierge was extremely helpful. They were constantly asking if we needed anything remembered who we were... Very friendly and genuine. I can't say enough good things.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderDO
Reviews.Content: Stayed several times in the Pan Pacific Singapore. The best hotel I've ever visited. Great rooms, great service, nice staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SurferBoyCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Would definately recommend the Pan Pacific hotel. I arrived after a long journey and was early for check in but they gave me an upgraded room straight away. The room was quiet and comfortable. On my last day they gave me a later check out all at no extra charge. Was very impressed with all the staff there especially Aisha (sp?) on reception ..thanks for recommendation for DXO - super food and not too expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Elevators are so cool, Wonderful Stay, Definitely coming back!”
Reviews.Author: ozTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: We (my partner) and I purchased one night through wotif. It was about $280 Aussie dollars. This included breakfast buffet for 2 people as well. I had stayed here when I was a kid (6 year old) and I remember the elevators were just so cool. And it is still is, 24 years later! You must go see it for yourself. Wonderful external views of Singapore. It was a perfect stay and we could go shopping to the Marina Square which is connected to the building. The pool was nice, but perhaps not enough sun loungers. The kind person who checked us in (Komitha) gave us a late checkout as we were not flying out until 10:30pm the following night. Late checkout as in 4pm, and then we were allowed to borrow a room for 1 hour so that we can waship between 6-7pm before we left for the airport. The beds are very comfortable and clean, and I just loved everything about it. We also stayed at the Fairmont which is at Raffles City, but Pan Pacific is heaps better! If I come back to Singapore, I will be definitely staying at this hotel. Just to add, we ate breakfast there and that was good. Better than average, lots of variety. We also had dinner at Zambuca (italian restaurant) and that was also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoadAgainOslo
Reviews.Content: been to the Pan Pacific at the club floor for a short stay of three nights. the hotel is living up to standard described on tripadvisor. Check-in procedure was very efficient, room is very silent and well furnished, bathroom is splendid, especially the shower. the little snacks provided at the club floor were also of much used as I did not feel like eating in the evening. I also received a complimentary late check out, which is apreciable on a short stay. So nothing to complian about during this stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great, especially considering the price.”
Reviews.Author: bwaadass
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay here based on the positive feedback on Trip Advisor. I'd say that this hotel is a good "safe bet" but nothing exceptional, particularly given the price. It's easy to see why business traveller's love it though! +ve's: Staff were plentiful, immaculate and always friendly. Outdoor swimming pool on the 5th floor was fabulous. Very clean. Super views outside (especially in the lifts but also inside looking up/down!). -ve's: Not cheap to start with and we had an extra room service + internet charges added to the bill which put on another £15-£20 per night. View from the balcony was 120degrees not 180degrees (only an issue because the 120degree view was so great we wanted more!!). We could hear constant footsteps on the floor above our room which I think was tiled (we may have just been unlucky and been the floor below a function/meeting room). It is a little out-of-the-way and a 10min walk to the MRT. Not a big deal for us but something you might want to consider as there isn't much to do in this area for holiday makers. We stayed here as part of our honeymoon and it was the only hotel we stayed in that didn't give us a freebie gift (although we did get our photo taken in reception which was sweet!). A glass of bubble or some chocolates would have been a nice touch!! As an aside, we ate an amazing £10 evening meal (yes £10 for two with beer) at the "Hometown Cuisine" stall within the Chinatown Complex - 2nd floor, number 153 (see attached photo). It was a brilliant meal, one of our best of the holiday and we ate in a lot of nice £££ places - thank you Peter!!

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: LLJay1612
Reviews.Content: it was a Xmas gathering with my partner and friends. We requested for joint room (queen/king bed)when we booked online, n were informed upon checking in that one of the room would be twin beds, the checking in was slow though, guess it was due to the holiday season. We were given a welcome drink foc. nevertheless, we were upgraded to higher storey with balcony and a pretty view with the singapore flyer in view. We later learned that the room that we were upgraded to cost $350 in actual price. Room was big and clean, high and comfortable bed, and cables ( for tv, hdmi etc) were also provided. Room was peaceful too. Bathroom was wonderful, though we only use the basic (shower).. Wanted to visit its swimming pool but it started raining. I loved the elevator, with nice music and all, especially at night. Yeah I'm weird I know...... Breakfast was wonderful as well, with freshly squeezed orange juice, ha. really pleasant experience, room is more for business rather than leisure, not really cozy but formal, comfortable nonetheless. Would definitely visit again to have a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Somethings dont change and thats great!”
Reviews.Author: travelwithlisa
Reviews.Content: A great hotel ,as it has been for many years. I first stayed at this hotel back in the 1980's and back then it was one of my favourites. Its good to see that somethings dont change, the hotel was just as good. I visited Singapore with my two children aged 6 and 8 years. We had a great room that was super quiet and allowed us to sleep well and recover from our flight. Breakfast was very good, but very busy and crowded. Nice pool area and a nice touch with cold bottled water that is supplied at the pool. My only gripe is they kept asking for my husbands details- pretty irrelevant when he is not there!

Reviews.Title: “5 star service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: LittleJo_K
Reviews.Content: We finished our New Zealand and Australia trip with three nights at the Pan Pacific. Staying in a Panoramic room, the quality was excellent. Although not cheap, the hotel represents good value for Singapore. From the moment we pulled up outside, the staff could not do enough and made our stay a pleasure. The pool area is very nice, with towels and cold water freely available. TOP TIPS: The hotel restaurants represent good value, however drinks very expensive! Go to the Carrefour supermarket and pick up a few bottles of wine (for your room). Raffles Hotel is only two blocks away. The Marina is a short walk also.

Reviews.Title: “Great for young families!”
Reviews.Author: EGrocks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Pan Pac in mid February with our 6-month old son for a 6 day holiday from Australia. We were upgraded at check in to the top floor of the deluxe rooms and given a choice of free daily breakfast, airport limousine transfer or Internet all because we booked through 'perfect escapes'. Naturally we chose the buffet brekkie which turned out to be awesome with local and western food waiting for you. The staff were extremely accommodating with our little one from providing a cot, baby toiletries (oils, soap, bath toy) and offering a high chair, cutlery and even bananas (not in the buffet) so we could purée it for him. The restaurant staff eventually recognized us after the 3rd day and always greeted us warmly at breakfast. With the upgraded room we had an awesome view of the marina area. For a fun ride I recommend travelling via the external lifts for a panoramic view of the city. We managed to go for a swim almost everyday to get baby used to the water and the pool staff were once again friendly. If there's a downside, my only minor gripe was that the MRT station was a little walk (5-10mins). However one could view this as a postive to a) walk off the generous buffet breakfast and b) look at the shops on the way as the route on the way to the MRT is underground, air-con and filled with an abundant of shops. So if u want a reasonably affordable family and baby friendly 5-star hotel in the middle of the city, then look no further than the Pan-Pacific and book through Perfect Escapes for your guaranteed upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Functional but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: hereinbody
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a fantastic experience at the Mandarin Oriental in KL. Service was fine but a little distant and cold. Location is great and facilities are good (pool and gym). Did not breakfast eat at the hotel so cannot comment but the Japanese restaurant is great. We were in a room near the lift (were moved there after we had requested a higher floor and were put on the bottom floor of the category of rooms we were booked in). One tip = try the tennis court which is connected to the hotel, great fun playing with high rises surrounding you.

Reviews.Title: “great!”
Reviews.Author: a07
Reviews.Content: good rooms...fantastic staff...great business hotel....loved my stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend This Place..”
Reviews.Author: jeeva
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th stay at the Pan Pacific. And every stay just gets better. They actually pay attention to all feedback... even though its been a year since my last stay, they remembered my feedback from then and addressed my concerns. Well done Pan Pac! Rooms are 'businesslike' but comfortable. Breakfast buffet is good but you may want to also check out the buffet at the Marina Mandarin...if you're not into hotel buffets, the hotel is attached to a series of large shopping malls which cater to all tastes. The Underground/Metro is located a short walk away and connects you to the rest of Singapore. Internet is not free...but if you take your laptop to the lobby or the mall, you'll be able to connect to a 'random' free wireless network. Overall...its a great place to stay at a reasonable rate. Will upload some pictures later.

Reviews.Title: “Great all round”
Reviews.Author: YeahPants
Reviews.Content: The whole experience couldn't have been better. Staying with an infant (just under 1 year old), the Hotel provided a baby toiletries pack, a nice cot and a stroller on request for the duration of our stay. The room was clean, modern and spacious, bathroom was lovely and the staff couldn't do enough for you. The only issue we encountered was realising a day after we took some things out of the fridge that there was an automatic sensor which charged you the high prices for the items. However we spoke to reception and told them we needed more space for baby supplies and they had someone clear the mini bar with no problems and no charges. All in all it was great, couldn't ask for better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in the heart of shopping district”
Reviews.Author: Turki_Saad
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel, very organized, neat , very helpful staff and quite spacious room. Nothing to observe against it , definitaley i will come back to this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the Singapore shopping district”
Reviews.Author: DerbyDon
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and the central location make this a very nice hotel. I was here for the Singapore Air Show 2010 and the hotel was an excellent choice. The pool is nice and there is a lot to do within walking distance. My only complaint is that the bar music can be heard in the lower floor rooms, so going to bed early can be difficult. But even that is only an annoyance because you seldom go to bed early in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: maioste
Reviews.Content: Confortable place, modern and in a very good position to visit Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Clearly the Best”
Reviews.Author: Sheldo57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the PanPacific for 5 days and found it to be the best Hotel we have stayed at in Asia (for that fact anywhere). Service was excellent with friendly efficient staff, including the faulty light fixed when they said they would. Complimentary cake for my birthday was a geat touch. Lovely lobby bar and excellent accommodation and facilities. When we go back to Singapore this will be our Hotel. The only place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: patanddave
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific for 3 nights on way back from a month travelling Australia. We were greeted at the door and a porter quickly whisked our luggage away while we were escorted up to the 33rd floor to check in as we had booked a club room. They had a cold towel and a glass of fresh orange waiting for us while we filled out the registration. We were then shown to our room/suite on the 35th floor and it truly was amazing!!! The extra money we had paid was well worth it as this was probably the best place we have ever stayed in .... The bathroom was huge and there was even a kitchen with a top of the range coffee machine,a complimentary mini bar, lovely lounge/dining room and a beautiful bedroom. Also included in the club rooms are complimenary laundry. 24 hr butler service, free internet and sooooo much more. The club lounge serves free drinks and nibbles for about 4 hrs an evening ... I have never drank so much Champagne ... Its even available with breakfast. Every member of staff we met were so polite and nothing was too much trouble. It's in a really good location and easy to get around Singapore... Taxi's are really cheap and plentiful. We have done nothing but rave about this hotel and its easy to see why its rated no 1 by tripadvisor

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: timnicebutdim
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific in Singapore is right up there in my eyes. We didn't go to the other 5 star hotels but we have nothing to complain about. The deluxe suite was spacious and very well appointed. the pool was good and well needed after a wander around the City. We didn't use the restaurants as there is so much choice outside but the bar was always busy and welcoming. There may be better in Singapore but we couldn't fault the Pan Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific Singapore - nothing is too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: GregL2259
Reviews.Content: The spirit of SIngapore lives i this delightful and unusual hotel with smiling faces great facilities, wonderful food and a fantastic location!

Reviews.Title: “Very good but very average pool area”
Reviews.Author: dingo_hb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of times, both in July and December 2009. Don't get me wrong - it is a very good hotel. The staff are very good and apologised profusely after mistakenly giving me an early morning wake-up call (6am!) on one occasion ;) Breakfast is superb but not cheap at 30 SGD ++ Lobby isn't breathtaking and the singer at the bar ... well enough said ;) Suffice to say she was there in both July and December and we promptly went straight to our room! And now to the pool. I'm afraid my 16 year old son didn't find it up to scratch and most children probably won't mainly because it is boring - no spa, no jacuzzi, no slides, no pool bar - no fun! Somewhere like the lower-class Merchant Court - where we'd stayed before - had a better pool. Also, you'd think they'd have free Internet by now. Come on Pan Pacific! Best part about the room - the wonderful dual-head shower! Very nice! All in all a very good hotel with a couple of issues.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless service”
Reviews.Author: rdv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 3 night stopover on our way home from Oz. Our room on the 12th floor had everything including a balcony and great views of the Merlion and Singapore Flyer. The staff (and there are lots of them) were always helpful, polite, cheerful and very smart. The grounds and superb swimming pool are beautifully maintained and the interior design of the hotel needs to be seen to be appreciated. This is where we'll be staying next time we're in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL TO BE COMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellers62
Reviews.Content: This hotel is second to none. My stay was pleassant anda memory i will never forget thankyou pan pacific. The staff are lovely pleassant and very willing to help you. The hotel is decorated very tastefully. The food service is second to none lovely western food as well as asian. The rooms where beautifully clean and serviced every day. Well i give this hotel my thumbs up well done . and THANKYOU

Reviews.Title: “How to handle a mini-crisis - Superb Hotel Management”
Reviews.Author: Alan&Sylvia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific on New Years day as a stopover on our way to NZ. In the afternoon I was taken ill with severe pain in my lower back. We phoned reception and asked for a Doctor to be called. This was done and the Duty Manager rang the room after ten minutes to confirm a visit. The Doctor arrived within 20 minutes and was able to administer pain relief. Again the Duty Manager called to ask if there was anything the hotel could do to help. They even arranged for the fees to be put onto the bill. On checkout the Duty Manager came to see me to, again, ask if there was anything that we needed or that they could help with. It's when things go wrong that you really find out how good a hotel is, And this is a great one with a superb and caring team. Well done and I would recommend this stylish, elegant and surprisingly good value hotel to anyone without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel with great staff and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: SoloChick09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on a stop over on the way home after being away a month. Arrived very late at night and was very tired, just wanted to go home actually, but as soon as I arrived the staff were very accomodating and helpful, even got upgraded to a room with a balcony. My room was very clean, had a great view from the balcony and the bed was ideally comfortable. Concierge were very helpful with places to go and see and best ways to get there. As the hotel is in between two major shopping centers there is really no need to go up to Orchard Pde, but if you do the best way to get there is on the hop on hop off buses, that leave from Sun City right beside the hotel, where there is an ajoining bridge. Also, the breakfast at Pan Pacific is excellent and well worth the money. The only thing about this hotel is that the drinks are expensive (but they are in most of Singapore) and the room service food is a bit pricey for what you get. All and all a great place to stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: BobDong
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific exceeded my expectations. I read about the good experiences of other travellers on TripAdvisor and decided to stay here. The rooms themselves were clean, well equiped and most had good views over the city itself. We made good use of the outdoor pool area to aclimatise to the weather and always had attentive staff providing us with drinking water. Would definitely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good value luxury - and great location”
Reviews.Author: gingerwife
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific for 3 nights, and all the good reviews on Tripadvisor were accurate. The hotel is large, glamourous and scrupulously clean, with excellent service. Check-in was quick and efficient, and we were upgraded to a balcony room. The room itself was a good size with a beautiful bathroom and plenty of storage; amazing views over the Singapore skyline. We found the bed large and comfortable with big fluffy pillows. The buffet breakfast in "Brunch" was included in our room rate and there was a good selection of food, including fresh omelets made by a dedicated chef. The only minor gripe about the hotel is the price of drinks - £7 for a Tiger beer - although this seems to be the case in many places in Singapore. And to the hotel's credit, they have complimentary bottled water in the rooms and by the pool. The hotel adjoins a large shopping mall, and you can walk through the mall down to the Esplanade and harbour front in about 10 mins. You can then walk along the waterfront - with amazing views - and arrive at all the main sights in another 10 mins. We ate out on Boat Quay and North Quay a couple of nights, and you get a real feel for old SIngapore. Overall, a fantastic city and a wonderful hotel to use as a base for exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: susnus
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was superb. Very elegant hotel, nice staff, the kids loved the lift's. No complaints from this family

Reviews.Title: “They clean you room twice a day - Love it”
Reviews.Author: aurelax2000
Reviews.Content: We loved our 3 night stay at the PP Hotel. They allowed us to check in at 8am, which was great after so many hour flight. Our room was big, modern and confortable. Only one thing was missing is some furniture for our balcony to sit down. We were only on the 9th Floor but the view of the city was already great. We loved they breakfast that catter for a lot of difernet nationalities and the welcoming lady at breakfast was the friendliest and helpfull staff I met. Its seems that breakfast can get really busy but because of the jet lag we were they at 6.30am and it was lovely and quite. Unfortunately on the last day we ask for a late check out (due to a late flight), but they were fully booked, but the good news was that you could still relax by the swiming pool have lunch take a shower... I even got a massage from the shop recomended by the hotel just outside the hotel. It was a great 90 minutes massages. Its true that the MTR is too far but same time taxi are so cheap that you are better off taking one where ever you go. And the last good thing is that they cleaned your room in the morning and if you do take a nap they will do it again in the afternoon without you asking for it. If I go back to singapore I will definitly stayed back at the Pan Pacific

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY CBD SINGAPORE”
Reviews.Author: mk2004
Reviews.Content: To start a new innings of live, we choose the Beautiful Singapore as our Honeymoon destination. In singapore we had a lot many choices of Hotels to choose from and from it we chose the pan paicfic in Singapore. The hotel was a dream destination for the newly weds and we were floored by its ambience. The rooms have been astentically designed and are really presentable. The hotel being centrally located has very fasr and convenient access to ll the happening places of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful choice”
Reviews.Author: oldchemprof
Reviews.Content: Nice room, really friendly and courteous staff, and good location. If you reserve on the hotel website and have a Singapore Airlines boarding pass to show on checkin, the wonderful buffet breakfast is included for free. The hotel is attached to malls with food courts, restaurants and even a supermarket and also to the convention center from which Hippo buses that circle the city leave. It is a fairly long walk to the MRT (subway). A warning: If you, like me, are afraid of heights, don't get a room on a very high floor. You reach it by a glass elevator on the OUTSIDE of the building. Even the lower floors are reached by glass elevators (because of the atrium design of the building), but they are interior and if one just faces the door, the ride up or down is not too frightening.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: malandy
Reviews.Content: The room and the service at the Pan Pacific is by far the best we have ever received. However, the prices of the rooms and drinks and services available were too high. We travelled through Singapore at the end of our holiday and it was a very expensive few days.

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific Hotel, Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: AndrewS3
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the panoramic rooms on the 24th floor, the room was faultless. The room had everything you could possibly have, service was always spot on. The atrium inside the hotel was very nice, with nightly entertainment. It was a short walk to either Marina Square or Suntec city shopping centre, and only a short taxi ride to the famous Orchard road shopping strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms But Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: StillPhone
Reviews.Content: Basically an OK business hotel but dull as ‘boring’... The Pan Pacific (original rather than the renamed one at Orchard) is located next to the SunTech Towers but that about it. The nearest MRT is miles away and frankly there aren’t really any restaurants or bars nearby except those in the adjacent shopping centre; Starbucks and Outback Steakhouse (which was terrible). The hotel is best described as dull. The rooms are fine but the only bar is in the reception area and has the atmosphere of a Scandinavian parking lot. There is a bar with a little character by the pool (sadly they removed the wonderful circular pool bar (of which I have fond memories) but this is really for the staff to relax and they urge you to sit in the remote seats while they play at the bar. Strangely they all seem to have terrible sniffing colds which is annoying if they are delivering your meal... My chap sneezed on mine… That said the room did have remote control electric blinds which were great so if you get really bored sending then up/down from the bed is great fun... There are loads of other interesting hotels in Singapore so I will avoid this one and don’t get attracted by what might appear a low rate because what you save on the room you’ll invest in the taxi industry...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: ff9473
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, rooms are spacious, equipped with the latest technology and bathrooms are fantastic. I booked it online and was given quite a reasonable rate I thought. However at checkout I realised that there was a 17% charge added on the daily rates quoted online. I found that a bit dishonest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base for your Singapore Stop-over”
Reviews.Author: onebadhatharry1
Reviews.Content: I have been to Singapore once before and stayed at the Intercontinental however after reading the many positive reviews on Trip Advisor i decided to try Pan Pacific. I can state that I was not dissapointed. Myself and my wife arrived after a fourteen hour flight at 1600hrs. Our cases were immediately taken off us at the lobby and we were given a ticket. We checked in in under five minutes and was taken up to our room (A Panoramic King Size Double at about £120) by the very helpful staff member. We got the outside glass lift to our floor which allowed a lovely view of Singapore City Scape. On reaching our floor the first thing we were hit with was the lovely smell of a Pine Christmas tree which was situated outside of the lifts. We walked past the coffee lounge where there are free 24 hour hot drinks and directly to our room. The room itself was of a good size with a room length window overlooking the city. The furnishings were modern and the bed was very comfortable. There was a 32inch wall mounted LCD television and electric blinds allowing you privacy. There was also tea and coffee making facilities and plenty of cupboard space. The bathroom was also very roomy and had both a bath and separate power shower. Overall it was of a very high quality. Also waiting for us in the room was a beautiful chocolate cake as a gift from the management. We didn't have dinner in the hotel and decided to ask the concierge where would be good to eat. He gave us a map and told us the best places to go, from top quality restaurants over the Marina (No Signboard) to Singapore Food Markets. Again he was extremely professional and helpful. I was also aware that there was a lovely outside swimming pool (with under water music) along with a Gymnasium but only being there for one night I did not get to use these. Overall the Pan Pacific is a fantastic base for exploring Singapore. It is in a fabulous position allowing easy access to everything in the city. Yes, the hotel is a little impersonal (which is to be expected with a huge hotel with hundreds of rooms) but it offers everything and more for your stay. Singapore is a wonderful city and you could do a lot worse than using the Pan Pacific as your starting point.

Reviews.Title: “Pity it was a stopover.... a holiday would have been more appropriate!!”
Reviews.Author: crawfie
Reviews.Content: This is a brief review as the comments are all possitive, and I really cannot criticise anything about the pan pacific. We stayed on a 2 day stop on the way to Oz and intantly booked back in for the return. The hotel is very large, but has none of the drawbacks of other such establishments. The staff have the enviable ability to relate and remember you individually, and make you feel welcome. The pool and gym facilities are great, and breakfast is a monumental affair, covering many international tastes. We had an excellent meal in the in-house Indian restaurant one night. The rooms are excellent, and the views over the city are fantastic. I was dubious about Singapore before going with the sanitised asia image, but was pleasantly surprised, and after a 12 hour flight, I couldn't hope for a better experience. Next time we'll linger longer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff & service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Englishviajera
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay at the Pan Pacific on our recent stopovers to and from Oz after reading the many good reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel surpassed our expectations. Despite being a vast and busy hotel the excellent staff service makes you feel very special and very welcome. The Pan Pacific is not the newest hotel in Singapore by a long way but is well maintained. Bedrooms were large with great bathrooms and the balcony we requested to allow my husband to smoke. Breakfast was available at a variety of locations and of good standard. The Marina Bay location is a good position, you can walk to nearby shops & restaurants and sights or take one of the many taxis outside the hotel day & night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence with a spectacular view.”
Reviews.Author: Sade7274
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Pan Pacific on Raffles boulevard for one night in December and we could not have had a better experience. I booked based on trip advisor ratings and was not dissapointed at all. We were greeted by name at the entrance on our arrival by Genie Park who is a guest relations officer to the hotel and who made us feel like we were special guests.We were upgraded to a room on the 27th floor with a Panoramic view of the Singapore Marina as a special gesture as it was my birthday which they had very kndly noted. We did not have to go through a lengthly check-in procedure as Jennifer Wong, the hotels Guest care manager organised a pre-check-in for us when I did the booking by email. She also had a beautiful gift awaiting my arrival with a hand written note wishing me a happy birthday. Exceptional attention and care which is really commendable. Our room had every single thing we could possibly need and more.A panel with every configuration of internatioal plugs is available so you don't have to take adaptors.A panel next to the bed controls every switch in the room from the bed...excellent! An ironing board and iron is available in the wardrobe.The room has a good size working desk should you need to do some work.They are spacious,light ,airy,modern and chic and have glamorous bathrooms with seperate showers and bath. The business centre in the hotel is also state of the art...everything you could need from Apple Macs to printers. We had dinner in the Chinese rstaurant on the top floor which has a panoramic view of the Marina.....a very good experience all round and made ever more special by such excellent guest care management..

Reviews.Title: “Great way to spend Xmas”
Reviews.Author: Chesty1
Reviews.Content: Spent the night here on Christmas Eve in a standard Deluxe room on the 20th floor. This really is a nice hotel, the customer service you receive from 5 star hotels in Singapore never ceases to amaze me. They leave hotels in Australia for dead. We had Christmas Lunch in the Global Kitchen with unlimited Champagne and it was very special. Highly recommend it! Nice room, great looking lobby and nice pool area for a business hotel. I have also stayed at the Conrad across from the Pan Pacific and I have to say that it is probably the better of the two hotels though, but only just. If you choose to stay at either then you cant go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive hotel with smelly pillows!”
Reviews.Author: LavanderiaChina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is considered one of the best in Singapore. The rooms were big, with excellent view The breakfast is pricey , but quite yummy. I went there with my Wife to spend a romantic night there. To our big surprise the pillows and covers were smelly. they had the stall smell of someone who does not shower and lied on the covers. Obviously they did not change it or did not wash it. We called to change the pillows and an unhappy staff changed for us.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for money but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: citysites
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after staying at the Grand Hyatt for a week on business (had to move out once started paying my own tab!) so my review is probably biased by this fact! The Pan Pacific looks pretty non-descript from the outside, but once in the foyer you will be impressed by the atrium, which stretches up the entire height of the building, with snazzy glass elevators that reminded me of Charlie & the Chocolate Factory!, but would not be ideal if you are afraid of heights. We chose a room with a balcony as one of us smoked, the view from the balcony was tremendous, however dont expect any furniture on the balcony they dont seem to want you to sit out there, only stand and smoke! The rooms were adequate but a bit tired looking. They were kept pretty clean, despite our messiness! We like walking, and Singapore is a very safe place, even at night, so we thought nothing of walking from here to clarke quay, boat quay, little india, and orchard road, although you need a comfy pair of shoes for this. The minibar drinks were ridiculously over-priced (its cheaper in the Hyatt!) and so were the restaurants. The foyer bar did however make some delicious cocktails. The breakfast was nowhere near as good as at the Hyatt, poor selection and stale food, although it was the same price, it wasnt worth the money. The pool was nice, serving complimentary bottled water. However the staff were not so good, one refusing to take my order as it was 2 mins past 3, even though she'd given me the menus 15 minutes previously and then disappeared. There were numerous malls around, Suntec City being the largest but somewhere i hated with a passion, much too big and no maps or directions, nightmare, especially for husbands!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay, incredible staff and service”
Reviews.Author: SallyCC
Reviews.Content: We arrived to a welcoming smile from all staff, and were told on check in that we had been upgraded to a Pacific Club room, and would be checking in on the 33rd floor. At this stage we were thinking that's nice to be upgraded, but had no real conception of the full meaning! Anyway we were personally taken up to the 33rd floor, via the impressive glass lifts that travel up the outside of the building, and checked in by Jayrick, who then showed us to our room, and explained the main advantages of the upgrade to the Pacific Club room. Wow - the room itself was huge with a massive bed, chair and desk, mini bar, robes and slippers, flat scrren TV etc etc. The bathroom was luxurious, and had a huge supply of soft white towels and L'occtaine toiletries that we replaced every day, and a shower with massage jets. However the best bit was the balcony and view - to the left the Singapore flyer and in front the Marina Bay area and all the attractions, and then to the background and right various iconic buildings and tourist attractions. We stood on the balcony and sat on the furniture every day, never tiring of the view, and the NYE celebrations we saw from there were second to none. Onto the upgrade features - we we offered a personal and initimate breakfast in the lounge, including champagne, smoked salmon, cooked products, fresh exotic fruits, cereal, pastries etc. Between 5.30-8.00pm we were entitled to free drinks in the Pacific Club lounge, and assorted nibbles, but these were with a difference - cavair topped, salmon, crudities, beatiful little cakes, and of course champagne! We could have some dry cleaning done every day, use the internet for free, choice of pillows, and 24hr access to the pantry with snacks, soft drinks, ice creams, fresh fruit, crisps etc, and our own personal butler! The hotel itself is in a great position, and we were able to access the Hippo bus tours by walking through the Suntec shopping centre. Shopping and eating is a vital part of Singapore life and we enjoyed it! The hotel pool was great, and if you swim underwater, you will literally hear music! Thanks a million to the Pacific Club staff, especially Jayrick, Tashida, Sitta and Elena for making our Pan Pacific stay so outstanding, and we will be back next time we make it to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL!”
Reviews.Author: TinaAmeliaOsman
Reviews.Content: Everything was just beautiful of this hotel. A well recommended place to stay!! Shopping too is not too far away. I would definitely come back to this hotel when I get the chance to hit singapore again...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Wing
Reviews.Content: Well, what can I say, this Hotel was superb! It wasn't stuffy like some 5 stars can be, staff were friendly. We needed a bay cot which was provided with baby toiletries! Breakfast was outstanding, even happy hour cocktails were great. We were a bit jet lagged and always left the hotel room quite late. All we had to do was let room service know and the rooms were cleaned immediately. I really can't say enough about this hotel. I stop over regularly in Singapore and I think this will become a regular!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Location...”
Reviews.Author: nshafz
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Christmas break in Pan Pacific Marina Bay. Very well located, connected to shopping malls thru 2nd floor- Marina Square and Suntec City. Can walk to MRT station in City Hall (10-15 mins) which along the way have lots of shops and also connected to Raffles Shopping Mall (at the very end) where you can find Robbinsons, Coach and lots other shops. Hotel has comfortable bed, flat screen TV and nice shower-need to learn though how to operate the shower (though had stayed all over the world's hotel)... like taking a bath in the rain! Good housekeeping, fast check in and check out. Will stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in good prices, near city center...”
Reviews.Author: LamprosD
Reviews.Content: A very new & modern hotel (the first impression). Near the most sight seeing of Singapore city. The staff was so kind & a smile was all the time on their faces. And what can i say for the breakfast... excellent!(We booked the hotel with GTA Hotels & it was the only site with breakfast included for this hotel in the price). We booked a panoramic view room... & it is highly recommeted! The MRT is about 10 minutes away, but if you go from the aircontitioned underground ways that connects the hotel with all this shops & malls & the metro(MRT), you'll not feel the walking distance... Certainly i'll come back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: aussie_h
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pac on the way back from Europe. This was one of the only hotels that had Day rooms - i.e. 6am to 6pm, which were extremly good value. The room was very nice. Large, with an excellent bathroom. The room also had a balcony and a view looking out over the Marina and the CBD. It also had electronic controls for the blockout curtains to the balcony. The room felt very modern - flat screen tv, ergonomic chair at the desk etc. The hotel also has a very nice pool and gym - a lovely tropical feel. The hotel is near the marina, which also means its close to suntec city - the convention centre, esplanades on the bay theate centre, and a variety of shopping centres. The staff were friendly and helpful. Couldn't fault this hotel on anything. I've stayed at several hotels over the years in Singapore, I would strongly consider staying here again, and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectation Like a fine wine This Hotel ages with grace & Style”
Reviews.Author: PerthOztraveller
Reviews.Content: Over the years My wife & I I've travelled to many 5 star resorts .The last time I was at this hotel it was in May 1987.Trust me this hotel has not dated it has been totally refurbished with all the Mod/Cons & has kept up with current trends.But where it has improved dramatically ,is the people skills & homely hospitality.Literally we were floored by the kindness of the Team Especially at The Executive business floor.The $70 Singapore dollar per night upgrade is worth every cent.(This includes breakfast,drinks & snacks & canapes ,Cocktails between 5.30 to 8.00p.m. daily) The Executive area opens out to a balcony has also a beautiful backdrop of the City Skyline.Also the team was very accomodating to our early arrival in the morning & we allowed to check into our rooms earlier without penalty or charge.Also all the usual facilities like Gym, steam room,restaurants etc..Also Pan Pacific connects into Marina Bay Plaza (Brilliant Shopping!) Jean-Pierre Michel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not the best location”
Reviews.Author: TheGreatDane33
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Pan Pacific Hotel in Singapore for two nights from December 13th to December 15th. I arrived very early in the morning on the 13th and I therefore wondered if I would have access to my room right away. No problem - Not only did I get my room I also received an upgrade. I stayed at a very nice room at the 31st floor with balcony and view to the harbour. The room was clean, aircon worked perfectly and the bed was brilliant. During the next couple of days I enjoyed the warm hospitality from all of the staff members. I would however especially like to mention the people in the breakfast restaurant. Speaking of breakfast I cannot reccommend enough how great it is - Don't go anywhere else. I had a great stay at the Pan Pacific. Would I stay here again? hmm.... I probably would even though it might not be in the very best location. I was a little surpriced that the noice level from outside was relatively high but the hotel management have ensured me they are actually looking into that already.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but great for a leisure getaway”
Reviews.Author: MikeB1981
Reviews.Content: We had a city break for a few days towards the end of November, and decided on this hotel based on its number 1 ranking on TripAdvisor. Compared to the boutique and 3 star hotels that we normally go for, this place was great. The lobby is huge and very attractive with the lifts shooting up and down. All of the staff were very attentive and helpful throughout our stay. The room was spacious and very clean, with a great shower. A minor gripe is that I couldn't really work out the air conditioning system (and I couldn't find instructions) so it spent a lot of the time turned off as we were too cold. At breakfast time you can try the buffet. There's a good selection, so make the most of it to get value for money. We also tried the pool out during a spare hour or two, and it was nice, quiet and spacious. If you go underwater, you hear muzak - quite a novelty! Location-wise, it's fine. Raffles and some of the big malls are about five minutes walk away, and it's close to the marina where you can find boat tours, nightlife, etc. Honestly I don't have a bad thing to say about this hotel. The only thing is, it's not cheap. But if you fancy splashing out like we did, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what all the fuss is about”
Reviews.Author: DavidJ
Reviews.Content: If you like bland, corporate hotels this could well be the place for you. Otherwise, try elsewhere. The Pan Pacific is underwhelming and I just don't understand it's TripAdvisor No1 rating. Don't get me wrong, there is nothing bad with the hotel. It's just a bit dated, bland and unmemorable. We paid for a panoramic view expecting vistas across to the CBD. What we actually got was a view of the Conrad hotel opposite. It turns out that you have to pay a premium for a balcony room to get the iconic views. We ended up paying the extra but were then given a room with partial views, obscured by the concrete wall of the neighbouring room and a large concrete overhang. The balcony had all the charisma of a multi-storey carpark. Tip -avoid floor 32. The location is okay if you don't mind walking through souless shopping malls to get there (the nearest underground station is a 10 minute walk away). On the plus-side, the staff were friendly enough and the breakfast was fine but overall, in my opinion it's just not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, airy and light”
Reviews.Author: ScubaZorro
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific Marina Square is a good hotel with excellent service. The "hollow" triangular construction give it a great feeling of space on the inside. Facilities are excellent, including the gym, pool and business services. The business centre provides extensive and friendly service incl. printing, scanning, faxing, etc. Computers for use include PC and Mac. The hotel is conveniently located very close to Suntec convention centre. It features direct access to Marina Square shopping centre for food and other shopping requirements which is also very handy. Standard for Singapore, taxis are always available at the entrance. Public transport is also reasonably convenient with a bus stop located across the street from the hotel and City Hall MRT about 10min walk via air conditioned shopping malls. Negative... Internet is very expensive compared to what locals pay for access. Starts off at S$5 for 1 hour and goes up to S$ 24 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “We got what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: aycs
Reviews.Content: Before leaving on our 20 night holiday, my wife and I decided to spend our last 3 nights in Singapore at a nice hotel, and because we were after somewhere that rated highly and was located amongst the shopping centres and restaurants, we decided on the Pan Pacific - and it turned out to be a great choice. As soon as we walked in, we were greeted by staff asking us how we were and how our flight was, and were personally directed to the checking in counter. My wife and I got our times mixed up and were trying to check in at 2pm, whereas the check in time is actually 3pm, but the hotel didn't mind us arriving early - we were still able to get a balcony room on the 12th floor - all they had to do was get house keeping to join two single beds together and remake the bed. Our room had a fantastic view of the bay, the Merlion, financial district skyline and the Flyer and the room was also located in a way that no one would walk past your room unless they were specifically coming to our room, so our privacy was well looked after. And with the elevator access limited to room card holders only, our security was also well looked after. At night there was always a cabaret singer and/or pianist in the lounge on the ground floor and their voices and music would float up through the floors above and make the experience quite pleasant. And although you could hear the music once in our room, it was only audible when we were standing at the door or in the bathroom. The room itself was very spcious with lots of storage area, a decent sized desk and comfy chair, big flat screen TV with 40 odd channels and the bathroom had a separate toilet door, a shower area with double shower heads and an ottoman to boot. There were also a lot of spare towels, so there was never a need to ask house keeping for extra towels whenever the wife wanted to wash her hair. The blinds to block out the light did exactly that - blocked out the light. The blinds are remote controlled and you can choose to have the heavy blind down to block all the light, or you can lower the lace blind to let in sunlight but give yourself some privacy during the day. The bed, although joined at the middle, was very comfortable and big and the room also came with dressing robes, slippers and a safe. We didn't use any of the facilities or restaurants at the hotel because there were so many other places to eat and shop around the hotel. We had a choice of Marina Square, Suntec City and also Citylink (which also leads to the MRT) to spend time in and the cost of a taxi from the hotel to anywhere around the island was always very cheap. On our last night, we wanted to know where we could keep our luggage for a couple of hours (and do some last minute shopping), because checkout time was 12 noon and we weren't leaving for the airport until 2pm. Without being asked, Mar (who was working the desk) simply extended our checkout time till 2pm the next day, which made things a lot more simpler for us. It gave us a chance to run around all morning, then freshen up before heading out to the airport. My wife and I would love to stay at the Pan Pacific again, but because we like to stay in Singapore for weeks at a time, it becomes a costly exercise to stay in such comfort and style for the duration of our visit. Yes, it is an expensive hotel, but it's well worth it and money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: TheYorksTravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights and found the rooms good sized, clean and comfortable. The public areas are very spacious and although we did not eat there, there was a good choice of restaurants. There was a nice pool to cool off in at the end of the day. The best thing though was the location. You are right in the middle of town with plentiful buses and trains (10 mins away) to take you to the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Number 1 for the price”
Reviews.Author: 4leaf1981
Reviews.Content: There are probably more luxurious hotels in Singapore, but I doubt there are better for the price you pay for the Pan Pacific ($187SG/night). The service was excellent from the moment you got to the front door, the rooms were large and clean, the bed big and comfy and the buffet breakfast was worth the $41SG you pay. The closest thing to a negative about this place is the location - it's probably a 10 minute walk from the City Hall MRT, but the walk is completely through air conditioned shopping malls, which are in themselves a bonus for shopping and restaurants. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel nearly without flaws”
Reviews.Author: AndyTheGameInventor
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this hotel, and would stay here again in an instant. It's a pretty large hotel, 30+ stories. Rooms are spacious and well-appointed. I stayed in what is probably a mid-grade room and it was spotlessly clean with very comfrtable bed and pillows. There are more luxurious rooms available, but at $150/night it was a great room at a great price. What distinguishes the hotel from others is the service. I decided to buy two of the hotel pillows since I found them so comfortable. The business center worked to find the cost of shipping them, then when it was higher than I wanted to pay, called the airport to see if I could store them there for the return trip. When I decided to take them, a doorman found a cardboard box and packed them for me. I never felt like I was imposing, and no one seemed to be angling for a tip. The breakfast buffet was wonderful, with tremendous variety of high-quality western and asian foods, and again great service. (It was a bit pricey though at about $30 USD). I had free internet, though apparently this depends on your rate plan. The hotel is connected to a good-size mall (OK, nearly everything in Singapore is connected to a mall!). The nearest MRT (subway/metro) station is about a 15-minute walk, but all of it is covered and all but 1 minute of it is air-conditioned (you literally walk through a series of connected malls). I highly recommend this hotel. period.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: leannenufc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Pan Pacific for two nights as part of our honeymoon, and we were really happy with our choice. The first thing we noticed on stepping into the hotel was just how huge and busy it was. We have stayed in our fair share of big city hotels, but the Pan Pacific was really a step up from a lot of the hotels we've stayed in previously; if I was to compare it with anything, I would probably say it had a feel of a Vegas resort hotel about it (especially with the interesting design and awesome lifts!). To go along with this first impression, we therefore automatically assumed that on check in, the staff would be friendly and professional, but impersonal. However, we couldn't have been more wrong; the girl who checked us in was probably the friendliest and most outgoing person I've ever dealt with in a hotel! Knowing it was our honeymoon, she asked us all about our wedding, our holiday so far, our plans in Singapore etc, and it really felt like she was genuinely interested in everything we said. It really made me smile and was so unexpected in a big, expensive hotel like this. Throughout our stay, we found that the staff were always very friendly and helpful, and it really made us feel welcome. We were given a deluxe room with a balcony, which we were initially pleased with; however, on returning and checking our booking, I did find that the hotel were supposed to give us an upgrade to a Panoramic room as arranged by our travel agent. I'm not going to let this affect my review of the hotel as this may have been the fault of the travel agent, and we were still really happy with the room...but if anyone else has any promised upgrades, it might be worth keeping a check on them! As I said, we were very happy with our room. It was very clean, modern, a good size and we were particularly happy with the bathroom which was very elegant and neat. The only thing I would say is that there was nothing particularly original about the room. It looked great and was very comfortable but there was nothing that made it stand out. We still had a good view (looking out towards Merlion Park and with the Singapore Flyer to the left) despite only being on the 9th floor, instead of the upper floors that we maybe should have got! Amenities-wise, there were electric drapes, bottled water, robes, an electric safe and basically everything you would expect from a hotel of this quality. As our time there was so short, we didn't have a chance to try out any of the hotel restaurants or pool, but as the hotel pretty much oozes high quality, I doubt we'd have had any complaints if we had! We'd been in the room for about five minutes when there was a knock on the door from room service; on answering, I was presented with a large piece of chocolate cake and a really nice card from the hotel congratulating us on our wedding. It was a nice touch, and something that was only matched by one other hotel out of the six we stayed in throughout our trip (and the chocolate cake tasted absolutely gorgeous!). We were also very happy with the location of the hotel. The hotel is attached to a large network of shopping malls, and it's a 5-10 minute walk to the City Hall metro station (which can be reached by walking through the malls, if you want to avoid too much walking in the heat!). We preferred walking around the city as much as we could, and it probably took around twenty minutes to get to Orchard Road, ten minutes to Merlion Park and around fifteen minutes to Clarke Quay and Chinatown. There is still a lot of construction around the Marina Bay area, but there were never any problems with noise. Given the opportunity, we'd love to stay at the Pan Pacific again. It was very comfortable, incredibly clean and we were sad to leave it after only a couple of days. It seems to be catered more towards business customers than leisure holidays, but I can strongly recommend it to anyone looking for a high quality hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Smokers Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Stevieboy18
Reviews.Content: This may be a smart hotel with excellent staff but it is let down by it's attitude to customers who smoke.There are no rooms for smokers, and we were told at reception that we would have to pay a considerable supplement for a river facing room that had a balcony, in order to be able to let my partner smoke.A nice way to fleece potential customers who only wish to indulge in a legal activity.Don't think you can get away with a sly drag either.You have to sign a declaration saying you understand that charges will be made for 'refreshing' the room if smoking activity has been detected.There are plenty of more amenable hotel for smokers in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: FordyPerth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just amazing and we could not fault it at all from the moment you walked in you were treated like royality. We travelled with some friends who had not been to Singapore before and were blown away with this place. No complaints and would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Singapore, and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “loved the structure”
Reviews.Author: anirudh22
Reviews.Content: 25.06.07 singapore Really like the structure of the place and the architectary of the hotel it is like best in its rates according to its services and also because of luxoriouness of the rooms and quality of services they provide.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: pearl11Bangalore
Reviews.Content: This is centrally located in the Marina Square The famous Singapore Lion called Merllion in the Esplanade is very much within the walking distance. I understand the water front view rooms are very good and even the city facing rooms are good. The vegetarians get a few items for breakfast apart from the continental one but the other facilities like the pool, the spa and the gym are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable 12 night stay, the staff make this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BarryandThel
Reviews.Content: We decided on staying in the one place for 12 nights and chose the PanPacific. No regrets at all, we had a Deluxe room with balcony and view of Merlion around to the Singapore flyer. This also gave us a great view of the Casino under construction ,but 19 floors up, we were not troubled by noise or dust.The room was huge, spacious and very well fitted out. The bed was massive. The Staff, from Room Maids to Front Desk to Concierge were fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble for them and they would readily stop for a chat and ask about your day's adventures. We had breakfast included and that was excellent value, gets a bit busy on weekends but , again, the staff really work at getting everybody seated as quickly as possible. The MRT isn't real close but access to the station is mostly underground or through shopping malls and therefore airconditioned. One small disappointment was that I made the effort to write a letter to the Hotel Management, after we had been there for 5/6 days and complimment them. I received no acknowledgement which surprised me. Maybe they get a lot of them !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with top notch service!”
Reviews.Author: silverfox85
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience during my stay at Pan Pacific Singapore. I literally don't have anything bad to say about this hotel. The only thing that I could think of is that they don't have a lounge were they could offer free internet for their guests. The location was spot on, right in the middle of everything. The hotel itself was of the luxury kind, with several restaurants, round-a -clock gym, spa, tennis courts, swimming pool, playground, garden, tailor shop, flower shop, meeting rooms etc. You should try out the chinese restaurant on the top floor with exquisite food and a fabulous view of the island. And for the service, I simply couldn't be more delight with. It was just outstanding. Friendly and punctual. The staff certainly make you feel like a VIP. They even let you check out late if you need to. They asked me at the arrival when my return flight was and without hesitation they said that I could stay in my room until 2pm as my flight did not departed before 4:05pm. As a 5-star hotel you get what you expects of amenities, don't bother bring your toilet bag (if you're a guy), cause they have everything you need. The room (panoramic twin) was clean and spacious and provides everything you need. It also have several cables that you can use, such as, HDMI, VGA, Audio, S-Video, Audio, RGB. So, if you want to hook up your computer with the LCD TV, then you can easily do so. Another cool feature is that the window drapes are electronic, that means that you can control it by using a remote. Some of the rooms also have intercontinental doors, which is very convenient if you're traveling with family or friends. In overall, this is probably the best hotel experience I have ever had. Thumbs Up!

Reviews.Title: “Good 5* - but be aware of the extra taxes.”
Reviews.Author: squirrel2203
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night here and booked with a Preferences package - a guaranteed room upgrade and a choice of various extras (we went for the breakfast). I think we were upgraded - we had a city view room which, judging by the shape of the rooms from the central atrium, was bigger than others on the other side of the hotel, although i'm still not entirely clear whether it was an upgraded room as the website isn't very clear about the different room types. Anyway! Impressed with the room - a good size, good decor and furnishings and the bathroom had separate shower and bath, and a toilet in it's own little frosted glass cubicle! Very clean too. Public areas were also good and the breakfast had plenty of choice. One big negative - the price quoted on the website does not include taxes, so when we checked out the bill was 17% more than we expected and it all felt a bit sneaky. I'm not sure why the hotel wouldn't just give an inclusive room rate (maybe the total price would put people off!) It's worth mentioning that 3 weeks beforehand we stayed in the Marina Mandarin which is almost next door, and not only did we have a better view but had an equally good room and a better breakfast for £40 per night less!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a getaway”
Reviews.Author: jennywren62
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Pan Pacific and couldn't fault it. The rooms (we were in a Deluxe) were spacious and comfortable and we had a good view overlooking the pool. We arrived at 6:30am and a room was available straight away, very welcome after a night flight from Perth. Breakfast was excellent with a fantastic choice. Found the Atrium Bar very pricey for drinks, but Singapore on the whole is expensive for alcohol. As we were on holiday we didn't mind too much. The Bar staff were very friendly as was the young singer who was entertaining each night. We could walk from our hotel to the MRT via the shopping mall so we didn't have to go out in the humidity and although a little removed from the hustle and bustle of downtown Singapore, a $8 taxi ride soon found us in the heart of the city at night. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: CT_travelling_around
Reviews.Content: I got into Singapore really early after a12 hour flight and no sleep. The staff were so lovely when I arrived, upgraded my room, and gave me access to it straight away! The room is large and so comfortable! With a large shopping mall attached, great place for a restful stop over. Would certainly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “7 Night Family Stay: Good & Recomended (no acknowledgement of our special occasion trip though!)”
Reviews.Author: R8SKM
Reviews.Content: First things first: this is a very good hotel with excellent service as has been well documented in previous reviews. It is also very good value As regular visitors to Singapore; the brief for our trip was a tough one hotel-wise as we were taking both elderly parents back for a Golden Wedding celebration together with our children (12 & 6) and our 18 year old niece. The welcome was good and we booked Panoramic Rooms with a harbour view (we received long stay benefits for our 7 night stay including internet access, laundry and 25% food and beverage discount - all welcome!). The room was pleasant and immaculate if slightly dated, especially in the bathroom (which looked identical to the Marina Mandarin bathroom when I stayed there in 1995!). The balcony was a bonus but - and maybe this is a British thing - they don't seem to want you to use it! There are a couple of chairs and has fabulous views but the balcony itself is quite stark. The construction work across the bay for the new casino complex also means that there is lots of dust as indicated by the soles of your feet when you checked! The staff at the pool and the Brunch restaurant are just fantastic and deserve 5 stars on their own (thank you!). We also ate at the Hai Tien Lo on the 37 floor. The food there was sublime but service a little below par (rice arrived 10 minutes after our main courses). Breakfasts are good (if included in your rate but don’t pay extra) but you may have to queue. So why 4 stars rather than 5? Well, and perhaps I am being a little churlish here, but there were two main factors for me. Number one is the Mandarin Oriental. Admittedly that hotel is more expensive but I reckon you get what you pay for as it was slightly more luxurious, slightly more stylish, and had nicer rooms and bathrooms. The second point, somewhat parochially, is that the Pan Pacific failed to acknowledge in any respect the main reason for our S$8000+ stay: my parents' Golden Wedding. They had been advised of this on booking and whilst we didn't exactly expect the red carpet treatment, maybe a bottle of wine or some flowers might have been nice? Still, as I say, this is an excellent hotel with good staff. Recommended - but don’t forget your special occasion guests as my parents wouldn’t stay with you again.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelDH
