Reviews.Content: A very good hotel made extra special by the incredible level of service. A few examples being: 1) Although turning up very early at 10am and were immediately checked-in with a cheery "we don't like to keep our guests waiting". 2) On our final day we were granted a complimentary late checkout of 5pm, a service we were prepared to pay for as access to shower facilities prior to a long flight is absolutely essential in Singapore. 3) A final touch that really made us feel like celebrities - after checking out, 4 members of staff absolutely insisted on taking our luggage, one apiece, the 100 feet from the desk to an awaiting taxi and farewelled us as if the most esteemed of guests! This excellence in service means we won't bother looking anywhere else on our next visit. (We got a great rate too!).

Reviews.Title: “Full of OKs”
Reviews.Author: imran_rahman
Reviews.Content: - Nice room with view of the swimming pool - Love the huge ceiling to floor glass. - Breakfast was ok, the restaurant was a bit claustrophobic, no windows, felt like i was having breakfast in the closet - Near to Suntec, so it was ok - People from front desk, bell and restaurants were friendly and warm - Good for business trip, ok for couple

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel! Well worth it...”
Reviews.Author: S28
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my 7-year old son for a week, in a Panaromic room. Excellent rooms and service. Location was a big plus. The hotel is connected to a couple of shopping malls and a short walk (through the malls) to the MRT station. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “customer service second to none”
Reviews.Author: kotekCambridge
Reviews.Content: we spend 4 nights at this hotel to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. we had asked for a high floor with a view of the harbour and we got it! the panorama was fabulous. we enjoyed the icy cold mineral water handed out by the pool and the courteous and friendly service throughout the hotel. watching the lit up outside elevator cabins sliding up and down the hotel facade while swimming at night in the pool was pure bliss. we will definitely stay at the Pan Pacific again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & service”
Reviews.Author: Dutch_Tiger
Reviews.Content: Wife & I stayed here for 4 days 3 nights and loved it. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful. I recommend getting the breakfast buffet deal which was also really good. You can get anywhere via taxi, bus, or MTR (trains) and all modes of public transportation are cheap. Also this city is very safe and everyone speaks English. Theres also an attached mall if you dont feel light going far to sight-see.

Reviews.Title: “Very ordinary. Very blah. Very forgettable. Nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: PondiRoad
Reviews.Content: I was here for 3 nights and I forgot I was there as soon as I left. Not sure why all the rave reviews this is just a very ordinary corporate hotel. The location is good enough to the convention center and the esplanade but the hotel rooms and the bar are all just very ordinary and really nothing special. The food at the restaurants are pretty good. The concierge is ok not particularly helpful. The entire experience was just so forgettable--neither great nor bad that I am confused by the rave reviews below.

Reviews.Title: “A Superb Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Worldtreader1
Reviews.Content: This really is the best hotel in Singapore, we've stayed at a few ! Like most of Singapore, it runs perfectly, nice, friendly staff, very responsive, very clean. For the quality, not THAT expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: n0maDz
Reviews.Content: This was our favourite hotel during our 3 week holiday in Asia. We chose it based on the reviews in Trip Adviser and it exceeded our expectations. We stayed in a family suite on the executive levels with superb views across the city. The rooms were huge with spectacular floor to ceiling windows. Our 16 year old son was impressed with the flat screen tv and speakers in the sound system. The lounge area had a full size dining table and ample seating. The main bedroom was huge with a modern style four poster bed and another flat screen tv. I loved the bathrooms, one of which had a dressing area and two mirrors with with sinks and bench tops. We had access to the executive lounge which enabled us to have breakfast, afternoon tea, evening drinks and canapes. The service was first class. We also had room service dinner one night and again the food was excellent. The gym facilities were great and our son was impressed that the staff were available to give advice on his weight training program. Adjacent to this was the spacious pool area . The location of the hotel is great. It is connected to several shopping centres and an easy walk to the hop on hop off bus, train station and other attractions. Taxis were always available and very cheap. The staff were brilliant. A casual request for the location of a store led to Shirley going out of her way to locate it and print off a list of alternatives. Phone calls to reception / housekeeping etc were always answered with a greeting using our name. Ensuring a taxi was there for our early morning check out - no problem. It seemed that they were genuinely happy to make us happy during our stay. We loved this hotel and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Mrsyoohoo
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel to stay in, especially for a stop over. Great rooms, very helpful staff,especially in the business centre. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfy and Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: chikai
Reviews.Content: Quick check-in, bags taken to our room about 20 mins late, but no complaints! We ordered a late night snack via room service and it took about 45 mins (we were quoted 30 mins).....to our surprisee, a fruit tray was delivered with a letter apologising for the delay the next day. Great location, close to alot of shops. Hotel is connected to Marina Square Mall which then connects to City Hall Mall and the City Hall MRT station. It takes a good 10 min brisk walk from the hotel via the underground shopping malls to get to City Hall MRT....great way to beat the heat and jump on the efficient train stations. Room was serviced every day with free bottled water. Hotel breakfast buffet was good, but not the best for $35/pp. Good mix of western, Chinese, Japanese and Indian foods to choose from - the variety was impressive. Great pool....free bottled water on arrival with towel service. Large gym, nice amenities. We got a bonus free internet service with our entire booking, so that was VERY convenient as some hotels charge up to $30 SG per day for internet! There is wireless access in the entire hotel property. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to families, couples and business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good amenities”
Reviews.Author: Joel1950dc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days and was surprised that I really had no sense of how huge this hotel is. Just about the only people I had contact with were the Pacific Club floor employees (except for breakfast one morning) and they provided excellent service. In the Club lounge, Jayrick was particularly friendly and sincere. The hotel provides every amenity and service one could ask for. As other posters have mentioned, however, in this day and age they should not be charging such high rates just to use their Internet connection with your own computer. The Club lounge was a bit small but provided excellent food all day and night with terrific views. And the drinks at sunset were superb. Another reviewer commented on how unfriendly the breakfast staff was in the restaurant. Usually I don't notice these kinds of things, but traveling alone you would think I could at least get a smile or nice greeting from the people waiting my table. After I was seated, however, I was virtually invisible so the next day I made sure to eat breakfast in the Club Lounge rather than return to the bigger restaurant downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mark1403
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped through the doors of the Pan Pacific we felt welcomed. All the staff would acknowledge you, say hi. If you looked lost they stopped where they were going and asked if they could help. It is an amazing place to look at, the rooms were great. we stayed in a Panoramic room on the 17th floor and they views were really good. The amenities were excellent. The pool was a great place to "hang" to relax. Breakfast was really nice, catered for everyone's tastes. Ordered some snacks/lunch by the pool and it was really nice. The pool staff were attentive and really nice. Cost wise, I felt that you got more value for your dollar by staying at the Pan Pacific. Close to 3 major shopping centres, easy walk to Clarke key and area. Concierge answered all your questions. I will definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Customer Service and great value in Pacific Club”
Reviews.Author: TanyaMumOfTwo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights on our way home to Australia after a month in Europe. We wanted the full-on R and R treatment so we booked a room in the Pacific Club where we enjoyed many "extras". The best "add-on" to this room rate was the guaranteed early check-in and late check-out. We arrived in Singapore at 7am on Wednesday 7th October after an overnight flight from Paris, and we left Singapore on Friday 9th at 9pm. The Pan Pac was the only top end hotel that would guarantee, in writing as part of the reservation, access to our room at 8am while still only charging us for two nights. Sensational! There have been lots of reviews on the Pan Pac so I won't go on too much - but I agree that the Customer Service is amazing. Mainly I will say that by paying a bit more for the Pacific Club we essentially had three days for the price of two and this included breakfast on arrival, free internet, lots of opportunities for drinks in the lounges (best Singapore Sling ever!!), plus snacks and soft drinks at any time from the help-yourself buffet and kitchen in the Sunrise lounge. I came up after a late swim one afternoon and the wonderful desk staff on the Pacific Club floor reminded that there are ice creams in the freezer in the kitchen available any time...just a very kind and friendly "vibe" on this floor. I was stranded on a lower floor one day as I forgot my key card and I found a phone and they came and rescued me....so concerned that I may have felt anxious!! The pool was great - icy cold bottled water and towels on arrival and never too busy. As many have mentioned it is a bit of a walk to the MRT but for these two days we used either a taxi - or on our main "touring" day we used the SIA hop-on hop-off bus. The stop is right out the front of the hotel opposite Marina Square Shopping Centre. A very convenient way to get around - we love buses!! And a direct route out to the fabulous Botanic Gardens - even the MRT doesn't have a stop out there!! We love Singapore and we loved the Pan Pacific - particularly the Pacific Club. Worth the extra!!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: fathead77
Reviews.Content: Good service, especially Noor on the Executive Floor, she was fantastic. Great doorman, excellent check in, great gym, nice pool, nice room really a good hotel, except for one....had to pay for internet. Drives me nuts. I'm there on business, I've advised them as such and to have to pay for internet access is ridiculous. Especially in a hotel catering to business travellers. Besides that, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...this is REALLY nice”
Reviews.Author: anjaintokyo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pan Pacific for one night on our way to Darwin - but the night was really comfy and the hotel simply has a great location. We were there just a few days before the F1 race which literally goes through the reception area. Our room had great views over the city and was located in 16th floor. The hotel service is impeccable, rooms are clean and spacious. Great value for money with the special offers they had going and it is just 15 minutes to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location & great hotel”
Reviews.Author: alice123London
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at the Pan Pacific at the start of our honeymoon in a Panoramic Room on the 30th floor. View over the city was spectacular, particularly at night (see photo). Good size room with all facilities you would expect from this class of hotel. Clean with a good sized bathroom. Breakfast was included in our package and this provided a good selection of food. We also ate in the restaurant on the 37th floor and this was superb. Overall the experience was very good although the food/drinks tend to be pretty expensive in the hotel and generally around the City. Would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to others

Reviews.Title: “High Expectations - Quite disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: federDubai
Reviews.Content: As most of the reviewers, I picked this hotel due to the Trip Advisor reviews and the perception I had from Pan Pacific Vancouver. The hotel is well located and the rooms are a decent size. Unfortunately we seemed to have had a number of misfortunes: 1. Booked the hotel limo from the airport to take our family to the hotel (2 adults + 2 young children). We were missed when we got off the plane and went to the limo after which they paged the staff member - could happen, so no problems. 2. Arrived at the hotel and was treated very well by Cai Ling - no issues with service there. We were also given the room several hours prior to official check-in. Only problem was that the room was for 4 people but we only had 3 towels and 1 bar of soap. We called for more towels and they came with more towels after some time. We also asked for some small plates and got large ones - could happen so no problems. 3. Buffet breakfast was not a pleasant experience. On day one, we arrived late at around 1030. Breakfast technically ends at 1100am. As we were in the midst of eating, the staff was busily rearranging the furniture around us for lunch. Very unpleasant from a customer service perspective. My espresso was actually served as a half cup of regular coffee but ok... On day 2, we also arrived late at around 1040. Clearly they already started cleaning up. Orange Juice was "finished" and by 1050, the food was basically out of bounds. I brought this up to the restaurant manager who was apologetic and basically said they were overwhelmed due to a conference next door at the conference centre. I suggested that if they wanted to get everyone out by 11am, then breakfast should technically end earlier - say 1030. 4. After breakfast we left the room at around 1 pm and returned at about 7 pm. To our horror the room had not been cleaned. In 20 years of traveling this had never happened to me. I raised this with the hotel manager directly and he was very apologetic promising to look into the issue which I'm sure he did as we received an extension to our check out and several follow-ups after I filled in the customer survey with less than the highest ratings. 5. Quality of the room cleaning was very much average. Room was not cleaned thoroughly and as for the bathroom we gave up on 4 towels... Every day the cleaning staff would only replace the 4 towels with 3. After much reflections, we realised that actual issue is that the staff was not fluent in English. In all likelihood, we had a communication problem. Unfortunately for the Pan Pacific, we had just arrived from the Mandarin Oriental in KUL which was several notches better in all respects. Service in KUL was fantastic and the staff in all areas spoke perfect English. They also called us by name at every turn whereas the Pan Pacific was hit and miss and they didn't realise that they kept addressing me by my wife's name. I'm sorry to say that my experience was not great for an Asian chain. -pf

Reviews.Title: “Always Again”
Reviews.Author: Elementex05
Reviews.Content: This high story building is perfectly situated inbetween walking distance of many shopping centres and close to a tube station. A great hot breakfast buffet, rooms like a football field and very friendly staff... definitively a travel worth!!!

Reviews.Title: “great breakfast, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: alfie1709
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Singapore after 10 days on a basic Malaysian island and found it a real joy. We were travelling with a 13 month old and all staff were very helpful and knowledgable when it came to getting in/out of taxis with a pushchair. The bed was so comfortable and even baby toiletries were provided. The buffet breakfast was marvellous and my son was even given his own Thomas tray. The drinks in the bar were expensive but, hey, we were in a 5 star hotel in Singapore-would they be anything else?!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Yet!”
Reviews.Author: nkea07
Reviews.Content: Compared to my first hotel stay in Singapore, this hotel was great! I can think of no negatives. I would recommend this place to anybody wishing to visit Singapore. Staff were friendly and considerate. This is a top class hotel which I would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but stay at raffles if you can afford it”
Reviews.Author: cbz_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because there were no rooms left at Raffles on the last two nights of our holiday when we extended our trip. We picked Pan Pacific because it was highly rated on trip advisor and because it was cheap, but I have got to say I can't why so many of trip advisor's members love it so much. It is clean, the service is great, the prices are good. It has no faults at all. But it's not any better than any other five-star hotel. Nor is it Raffles, which is the place to stay in Singapore if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Magic”
Reviews.Author: Sazzar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific for 3 nights to celebrate our second wedding anniversary. Upon arrival, we were greeted by the duty manager who took us up to our upgraded room on the 21st floor. She gave us a tour of the room and made us feel very welcome. Not long after our bags had arrived, we received a cake and a card to help us celebrate our anniversary. This was completely unexpected and added a beautiful personal touch. The room was clean, comfortable and well presented. The views from the balcony were fantastic. Breakfast had a good variety of foods and was always well stocked, even towards the end of breakfast. Facilities were good, especially the pool which was of a good size for a hotel. The gym was more than adequate. The hotel is a short trek to the nearest MRT station (City Hall), however, it does go through air-conditioned shopping complexes. Everything was just wonderful and we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectio!”
Reviews.Author: kazz_usher
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pan Pacific, mostly thanks to the reviews that i had read on Tripadvisor.com. I was not dissapointed and I dont see how anyone could possibly not like this place! Right from the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty, got an early check in and the room was all set up for us, including the cot that we had requeseted. The cot isnt like any other travel cot that you would get for a baby in a hotel, this was a proper wooden crib, with baby toy and baby toiletries! Absolutly brilliant. Room was lovely, spacious and above all - clean clean clean! Ate at the breakfast buffet every morning and there was a lot to choose from, very yummy. Location of the hotel is great, shopping centres are 2 mins walk away, and you can get a taxi very easily to any other sites you want to visit. Great views can be had from the hotel as well. Staff are lovely, taking the time out to greet you as you walk past. Swimming pool - Lovely and big, although it was quite cold for me, but Im a big sook sometimes! If you put your head under water there is under water speakers playing music!! You also get free bottle of water at the pool. The lifts in the hotel are really pretty, however beware there are only 3 lifts and at peak periods you do have to wait a little longer than you want :) If you dont like heights, dont stay on a high floor because it really is HIGH! I would highly reccommend anyone to stay here :)

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tracei009
Reviews.Content: The service I experienced was great. I cannot say anything bad about this hotel. The room was okay. I have stayed in bigger rooms. However, it was big enough for our family. The location is right in the middle of the city. And if you want to go somewhere else, the cab fares are cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mitty_Hobart
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The property is beautful (the central atrium which goes up to the top floor is quite spectacular). We had a Panorama room which has floor to ceiling windows. We overlooked Singapore. The cleanliness and facilities in the room are top notch. The bathroom is particularly lush. The service was spot on throughout our 4 nights there. They are particularly accommodating on check out if you have a late flight, you can have a late check out or use of a hospitality room to freshen up before you head to the airport. In a great location, within walking distance of CBD, very close to Raffles, and can walk to Chinatown if you don't mind walking 20 mins in the heat. It is about a 5-10 minute walk to City Hall MTR, and you can go undercover the whole way should you choose to. It has the best buffet breakfast I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Delightful”
Reviews.Author: aussieeuro27
Reviews.Content: What an amazing experience, this is definatley one of the many examples when Trip Advisor gets it right. This place is amazing. Had heard some reports that it may have been a little dated, however that is OLD news. This place is completely renovated and is one of the better hotels in Singapore. The service was great and the overall stay was wonderful, also at a very reasonable price!! Highly recommend the Pan Pacific, just wish I could have stayed on longer!

Reviews.Title: “Are You Kidding??”
Reviews.Author: susafoxSeattle
Reviews.Content: How could this hotel be well rated? What a dump. Worn out, noisy, very middle of the road business hotel. We were shown our room, small, dirty, smelly and completely unaccpetable. We switched hotels. When we checked out 20 minutes after we checked in they offered us the penthouse for 2500 SGD per night. Not an option. Surrounding the hotel were plenty of ladies of the night, so maybe that's why the hotel is well rated. Not a place to bring your spouse! Avoid!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: ijano
Reviews.Content: They surprised my wife and w/ a bouquet of fresh flowers at the front desk when we got there because my travel agent informed them we were on our honeymoon. That pretty much set the tone for how we were treated the whole time we were there. They also gave us a free upgrade to the a "Platinum" room, which are all the rooms at the upper levels. We were on the 22nd floor (or something like that). The platinum rooms were higher, had outdoor balconies, and amazing views of the Singapore skyline. They even had their own set of elevators so you wouldn't have to wait ages to get up to your room (only those with room keys on those floors could even call for those elevators). The first night we were there, we returned to find not only the standard turn down service, but also a gorgeous chocolate cake that said "Happy Honeymoon" and also a large plate of fresh exotic fruits. It was sooo nice and really made us feel like special guests. The rooms are very modern. Ours even had remote control blinds. The entertainment center even let you hook up your iPod to the TV and watch your movies on it, or play your music throughout the room. The morning brunch is excellent. Plenty of variety of both Western fare as well as Asian food. It was included w/ our room. The swimming pool and area are fantastic. The location could not be beat as it was close to everything and even attached to a really nice mall w/ plenty of dining and shopping options nearby. All in all, this is one of the absolute best experiences I have ever had in a hotel and I've done plenty of traveling w/ 30 countries on 5 continents under my belt to compare, including some VERY nice hotels. It's about the best service you could ever imagine w/ out staying in a small hotel or B&B. And it was a great value for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Bring Your Own Coffee”
Reviews.Author: Eights-n-Aces
Reviews.Content: I'll be short. This was a very good hotel with excellent rooms and friendly staff. My only complaint was the unavailability of coffee. Before 8:00 am, you're only option is to pay $35 for the buffet or $10 for a cup of coffee. There is no instant coffee in the rooms although there is a hotpot for boiling water. There is a Starbucks a block from the hotel but they don't open until 8:00. Further away (15 minute walk) there is a McDonalds a 24 hour Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladyrain12
Reviews.Content: i'm wondering does the pan pasific at marina bay and pan pasific orchard are same management???? actually, i've never stayed at pan pasific marina, but stayed at pan pasific orchard near hard rock cafe singapore. it was a great hotel, big room, big swimming pool but lack of variety breakfast but its ok, coz it has very good location near to shopping center and easy to get food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel at a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Charsn
Reviews.Content: We decided to book this hotel after reading the reviews here and talking to friends who stayed here in the past. Overall, this hotel exceeded our expectations. We were able to find a good rate online, and once we arrived at the hotel, we were upgraded, which always leaves me with a positive impression of a hotel! The hotel itself was clean, sleek, very modern, and well organized. The staff was wonderful and always greeted us with a smile. The location was pretty good, although a little far from the metro. Another plus was the wonderful breakfast in the morning. Hotels in Asia always seem to have great breakfast spreads, but this was one of the larger ones that I have seen. If I make it back to Singapore I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to anyone else heading out that way as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: globalgourmet
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all of you who posted rave reviews that led me to book at the Pan Pacific. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here, at bargain rates. The standard rooms (called Deluxe by the hotel) are big, comfortable and very quiet, complete with automatic shades and LCD TVs. The bathrooms are also large, beautiful and well equipped. The breakfasts are amazing. And the staff just can't do enough for you. FYI, the hotel is about a 15-minute walk from the MRT, through the CityLink and then the Marina Square mall. The MRT from the airport cost me just over $1 US. Taxis are also cheap. Although the hotel charges for Internet access, they have a plan that will allow you one, continuous hour for about $3.50 US; not bad. As many have said before me: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in--and I've been to hundreds of hotels

Reviews.Title: “Have to agree -- it is very good.”
Reviews.Author: daisycutter
Reviews.Content: Our fifth time staying in Singapore and thoroughly enjoyed this hotel.The service from staff is a big influence on my hotel ratings and here they rate very highly. Our check in experience was first rate and this continued through the performance of the rest of the staff. Had dinner one night at the Global Kitchen and enjoyed our meals and we thought they were reasonably priced. Great views from our room on the 25 th floor and the room is very well furnished and comfortable. Have stayed at Pan Pacfic KL Airport and always found it to be an excellent hotel--probably my favourite hotel but this one comes close to it.

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasant hotel, great service, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: SoEtFlo
Reviews.Content: Good service, nice rooms We have been twice there and it is pleasant. Also pretty well located even if nothing magic around. Big mall, some nice restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Some Pros and Cons for Your Consideration”
Reviews.Author: bilibalahk
Reviews.Content: What I like about the hotel is the: View - the room assigned overlooks the landmarks of Singpaore, the Merlion, Fulleton, Singapore Flyer etc. Interesting to watch the scene during different times of the day. Breakfast - impressive tea selection. If remembered correctly there're over 10 choices. Tea leaves instead of tea bags are used. Swimming pool - there's music under the water, a fun feature that I didn't encounter before. Price - reasonable room rate regardless the means of reservation, taking into account the overall quality of the hotel. What I like less about the hotel is the: Walking distance from MRT - it takes us around 15 mins to arrive the City Hall station. I have hesitation when thinking of going back in the late afternoon for a rest, before going out again in the evening. I should say the way to MRT is connected by malls that saves us from exposing to the heat though. Internet Charge - we stay in basic room and incur the expense. Free internet access is an advantage when I choose a hotel. In sum, I enjoy the stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the stay!”
Reviews.Author: NWandJP
Reviews.Content: We stopped off at the Pan Pacific on our way to Sydney on honeymoon for two nights. Arriving at about 9am we thought we were going to have to leave our bags and check in later but the hotel staff could not have been more helpful and we were checked straight in (took no more than 10 mins). We were impressed with the room, clean, spacious and a nice cityscape from our floor to ceiling windows. The only minor problem was the shower door leaking but as I say this was only minor. The pool was good, especially the staff who were ultra efficient. Although we did not have the chance to use many of the other facilities there was plenty on offer. We did however visit the Global Kitchen in the hotel and although the food was good it was very expensive (£10 for two cokes) as well as the service being slow. This said we did complete an online survey from the hotel and are convinced this will be addressed (they have even said there will be a bottle of wine waiting for us should we ever return). The location of the hotel was ideal with easy access to countless shopping malls (there are hundreds!), the Singapore Eye and the harbour. Raffels and Orchard Road were all well within easy walking distance. We had read that taxi’s were a bit of a problem in Singapore but we found them not only to be very easy to come by but cheap, clean and efficient. PS My wife would like to say that Singapore Zoo was her favourite zoo we have been to so far and that includes quite a few worldwide.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: 4rubylou
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Had previously stayed at Ritz Carlton and must say we enjoyed this hotel more and found it to be better value. Plus, we were pleasantly surprised with an upgrade to Pacific Club on arrival. Would not hesitate paying the extra for this next time. Can't wait to return on our next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Even Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: tfc10
Reviews.Content: Chose the Pan Pacific for a 4 day stopover en route back from New Zealand as it seemed good value and the location looked ideal. Certainly made a good choice. Large rooms, tastefully furnished, immaculately clean, ultra friendly & helpful staff. Fantastic views of the city and harbour from the panoramic rooms and the exterior glass bubble lifts of this triangular tower hotel (if you are a vertigo sufferer you might not want to stay here). There is a superb large outside pool and well equipped fitness centre too. The upgrade package for use of the executive facilities on floor 22, with inclusive breakfast, snacks and drinks throughout the day and unlimited internet was a good deal. The hotel's restaurants are not as expensive as one would expect and also useful is the direct access to shopping malls so you can walk right through to the city centre and MRT station without venturing outside during the tropical storms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MATravellerDxb
Reviews.Content: I was planning a trip with my mom, so I wanted to make sure that we had an excellent hotel. I booked the double preferences package on the hotel's website, and chose a one way airport limosine pickup and daily breakfast. The pickup was prompt and punctual - they actually had a very pleasant lady waiting for you with a signboard the moment you got off the plane, the limo was a new Merc with a very friendly driver, and the checkin in the hotel was so smooth that you did not even have to wait at the check-in counter: a lady was already awaiting and took us directly to our room to check in! All in all, it was very quick. The room we had was a panoramic room with a balcony on the 25th floor. I have requested that we get a view of the Marina Bay, and it was indeed very very beautiful. The room itself was big and very modern, and everything was new and clean. All in all, an excellent first impression and a very classy hotel. The breakfast was also nice, with a wide choice and variety to chose from. There's also a gym (which I did not get a chance to use - was too busy) and a pool. The pool area is nice and relaxed, though at times when everyone decides to go down and swim, it might sometimes be difficult to find a place to park your towel, if you know what I mean. :-) All in all though, we always managed to get a spot and relax. The location of the hotel is excellent. There are three shopping malls right under. Most of the stores are not branded designers (if you are looking for that kind of thing) but there are many standard brands that you can find in any country - Zara, Massimo, Women's Secret, Aldo and what not. If you are not interested in that, then there are still plenty of restaurants around and some very good foodcourts in some of the malls. All in all, there's always a place to go. The hotel is walking distance from a lot of places ... It is very close to the Esplanade, the two durian looking buildings on the marina and you can have an excellent chilli crab over there, then it is very close to the marina itself, and you can go for a walk and see the statue of the Merlion (where SO many tourists take pictures). If you want to go and have a Singapore Sling at the Raffles, it's also a 5-7 minute walk from the hotel ... It's really close. Then you can also go for a beautiful walk by the Quays ... You can take a boat ride there and go to the dozens of bars and restaurants over there at the waterfront. However, I have to warn you, because the quays is such a touristic destination, the prices there for food and drinks are quite overpriced. For example, a coconut drink there might cost 6 Singapore Dollars, and in some other place, it might be 3 or so. However, worth a visit. All in all, it's a nice place. The hotel also offers different tours. You can just go down, get a brochure, and everything will be organized for you. In short, I really liked the hotel and would gladly stay there again. I felt sorry to leave and go back to 'relaity'! :-0

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe!”
Reviews.Author: sagethyme
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights - very good experience. The hotel is situated in the Marina Bay area, which may not be immediately central, but train stop is nearby, and with that you can go anywhere you like in the island.

Reviews.Title: “Believe everything you read - SUPERB”
Reviews.Author: Dumbeldore
Reviews.Content: Believe everything you read about this hotel it is truly superb. From the sumptuous rooms to the excellent restaurants and impeccable service throughout. Surely on of the best hotels in the world, and at this price fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, excellent, excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ambrosiano
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel on TripAdivsor and I was extremely satisified. A suggestion: spend some more money in upgrading to a top floor room!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected $382.00US Breakfast Charge!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Highpocketsagain
Reviews.Content: The Front Desk uses a new definition of the phrase "Yes, all included!" Our travel agent was told breakfast was included in the room rate. My husband (there on business) asked when we checked in "I understand that breakfast is included in the room rate?" "Yes', she said, 'All included". Each morning we asked the restaurant cashier "is the breakfast included in the room rate?" because she had each patron give their room number and SIGN THE TICKET upon entering the restaurant for breakfast. Yes', they said, 'all included". We were there 5 days. Upon check-out my husband spotted the $382.00US restaurant charge on our bill!!! He asked again "I understood the breakfast to be included in the price of the room!?" "Yes', she said, 'Its included". We haggled, she stood her ground but said she'd refer the dispute to management to see what was said to our travel agent. We informed our travel agent when we got back to Texas. She said she'd take it up with the hotel. To date, they have stonewalled her. Can't recommend because they "messed with my money!". Other than that spoiler, the view from our harborside 26th floor room was wonderfull. I could spend my day walking to Chinatown and the canal restaurants, shopping etc. Unlike other writers here, I found the lobby to be dingy, not fresh and crisp. The pool bar is their best amenity...Zen-ful. There were lite showers daily, like on Maui. And "no-see-'ums" bit me - probably like the sand flies in Panama, Central America. (They're resistant to Deep Woods Off, and REI's Jungle Juice. Try taking 1000mg of odorless garlic 2-3 times a day and spraying Avon's Skin-so-soft on your skin.) We speak plain American English. Hopefully you'll be luckier than we at finding clairty regarding the "all included breakfast charges"! Ah, travel. Can't live with it...can't live without it. What are you gonna do.

Reviews.Title: “Best view looks towards the Raffles, not Marina Bay”
Reviews.Author: Graham_Williams
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice and it really is an excellent hotel, indeed it offers a model of what a hotel really should be (take note UK hotels!) The first time we stayed we had a standard room looking towards the Raffles and the second time we had a balcony overlooking Marina Bay. The balcony room's view was actually obscured to the right (as you look out) by a large piece of the building. Take a look at the hotel from Marina Bay and the piece I'm referring to is the on the left. Anyway, I'm being really picky, it is outstanding and would recommend it to anybody... in a standard room. Excellent pool and a great gym right by it, you won't find a hotel gym/ pool much better. try the barbecue if it's on when you go; best salmon I've ever tasted.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - pity about the view”
Reviews.Author: Brisbanite65
Reviews.Content: When I decided to book a hotel in Singapore I went out of my way to make enquiries at several hotels regarding whether they had views of the harbour. My vision was of resting on the bed or sitting on a chair and looking at the harbour. The Pan Pacific website says: "Travelers will enjoy the availability of Panoramic rooms offering panoramic views and balcony rooms that feature dazzling views of the Marina Bay harbour and Singapore's financial district." This was confirmed in an email to me which promised a Panoramic Balcony room with a spectacular harbour view. Imagine my surprise when the "panoramic room" turned out to have a massive concrete wall blocking the view when anyone in the room was lying or sitting down. The balcony walls are waist high. It is also pointless going to sit out on the balcony because when sitting on the one lounger provided, the wall blocks any view. The only way to see the view of the harbour is to stand on the balcony or near the window. When I expressed my disappointment the general manager confirmed that "all our balcony rooms have an external concrete wall".

Reviews.Title: “Surely cannot be the best hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Sportbilly121
Reviews.Content: As a former long-term resident of Singapore married to a Singaporean we were looking forward to staying at the Pan Pacific having stayed at other Singapore hotels recently mainly die to the #1 rating it gets on this site and others. In summary if the Pan Pacific is the best hotel in Singapore then things are a lot worse than they seem, in brief, I do not understand it. The hotel is decent enough but simply not that good. Be careful to check what is (or more to the point, is not) included in your rate. We were attracted by the rate only to learn that it is a basic room only rate and every other expense / cost is additional (and high, certainly not value for money). The location is not great either and requires a considerable walk to the public transport or taxi (again, time and expense). In house dining is mediocre, breakfast painful and tasteless (there were queues as the breakfast area is undersized for the hotel's patronage). Rooms were reasonably nice, quite spacious though not 5 star though. It's an old hotel, that has been reasonably maintained and nothing more than that. We shall try elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MumbaiMan
Reviews.Content: Good basic 5 star property at a good location! Decent sized rooms, 4 fixture toilets, good pool, and a decent breakfast! Helpful staff, early check in (8AM) and late check out wasnt a problem. Well located, nice walk across the river from Boat Quay/Clark Quay. Esplanade is right next door ... for a CBD business hotel its right up there as one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, will return again”
Reviews.Author: Phillis_d_sa
Reviews.Content: This was one of two hotels I stayed in on my latest trip to Singapore, and was definately one of the better hotels I have stayed in. We had the double preferences package and picked the internet and airport drop off options, and was upgraded to a balcony room (which is essential for smokers). The room had everything you could have wanted and was nicely presented and quite large compared with some hotels I have stayed in recently. We had dinner at the Chinese restaurant on the 37th floor, the food and the view were both amazing. I dont really have that much more to add about the hotel that hasnt already been said. However it is a great hotel with lovely staff and I will definately ensure that I will return here on my next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent hotel - much better than Raffles / Fullerton”
Reviews.Author: Greyrock
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at the Pan Pacific Singapore at Suntek Mall. Newly renvoted rooms (better than the Pan Pacific Orchard Road). Makes for a change from the usual business hotels in SE Asia due to its service: Always there, but not overbearing. I did not notice pool attendant at 06:45 a.m. until my empty bottle of water had been exchanged for a chilled fresh one. Very reasonable on-line prices. Spent S$ 25 on the 2-option upgrade to include upgrade to a better room (ended up with a room that would be considered a junior suite elsewhere) and pick-up from the airport. Note: The pick-up from the airport is a plus, especially if you arrive p.m. from Europe as taxi lines can be long at Changi airport. The hotel waits for you at the gate (!), before immigration.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: kerryBurpengary
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at Pan Pacific, and we have no complaints. All staff were more than helpful, great idea with the cold bottles of water offered as soon as you arrived at the pool and fresh towels waiting of the sun lounger. Every staff member we came in contact with were happy, friendly and helpful. The bedrooms were spacious as was the bathroom. Our room was on the 24th floor. Loved the glass external and internal lifts, the view from them was amazing, unless you were like my girlfriend and backed into the lift and stared at the door the whole time !! We found the buffet breaky that was included in our package had more than enough variety and was very tasty. Did the Tour East "Night out @ Chinatown" would highly recommend it. The trishaw ride being the highlight, they were so much fun ! Great hotel, Great Staff and in a Great Position. Kerry

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, Great Service, but you pay for it.”
Reviews.Author: bigteacher
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel centrally located with lots of available shopping and dining options in the neighborhood. The service was terrific. When mistakes were made, they did their best to rectify them. You will get charge very steep rates for anything charge to the hotel. Overall a very nice experience, the staff here was professional and diligent.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but bad breakfast”
Reviews.Author: danesian
Reviews.Content: Overall the service was good, but the hotel breakfast at The Global Kitchen was a big letdown - the bread and pastries were not freshly made, the roti prata was hard, the bacon and sausages taste awful. It was definitely overpriced and would definitely fail Gordon Ramsey's test, and it always take a long time for the coffee to come, and you have to ask for cutleries and plates for your toddler - everytime. We booked a standard deluxe room, and was upgraded to a room with balcony and panoramic view on our return to the hotel (we stayed there in 2 periods in Singapore). Honestly speaking, the supposedly more expensive panoramic room was not as impressive as I thought it would be. The location was good as it is away from Orchard road, and about 8 minutes walk to the nearest MRT station (City Hall MRT), and Marina Square is just downstairs with many choices of restaurants. A pity that there is no supermarket or bakeries nearby. Besides the breakfast - which we would definitely not recommend to anyone we know, it's an OK hotel with good service.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely enjoyable, great in every sense”
Reviews.Author: Bobomjon
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Pan Pacific for 4 nights. We were on our way back to Australia from KL and decided to stay near teh marina (Suntec/Raffles) as opposed to our previous two stays near Orchard Rd at another excellent hotel Grand Hyatt (see separate review). And we are glad we did. Pan Pacific is simply a delightful luxury hotel, with great staff, fantastic location (minutes walk to Raffles hotel, raffles Place (shopping Cemtre), Singapore Flyer, and little Taxi fareare to the main parts of Orchard Rd (25 minute walk). The hotel's breakfast presentation was one of the most extensive I have ever seen and even the quality of room service meals were very good. We look forward to going back to Pan pacific. It's an absolutely delightful hotel, with great staff, a fantasic bar on the ground floor, and a minute away from sunTec City complex.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money in a great location”
Reviews.Author: itchy_feet_at_my-age
Reviews.Content: Having read many reviews of many Singapore hotels, I settled on the Pan Pacific Singapore for a 4 night stay with my 20 yr old son. I wanted a quiet, spacious hotel room with good sized bathroom and our Deluxe twin room on 12th floor was just that. Housekeeping visited twice daily, including a turn-down service when they replenished the complimentary bottled water. One note of caution - the minibar has one of those "sensor thingies" whereby if you remove an item from its location for more than 30sec, you're charged for it. Thankfully we read the notice! Breakfast was included in our tariff and it was an extensive buffet selection of western and Asian foods. If I'd had to pay separately I would not have bothered. SGD35 pp is too expensive when there are so many alternatives nearby. As others have mentioned, the staff at PPS are excellent. Nothing is too much trouble and they remember your name. On one occasion I wanted to take public transport to a slightly off-the-main-area location and Charles, at the Concierge desk, went to the trouble of finding out which buses I could use, where they picked up and set down. The pool is blissfully quiet early in the morning. It gets busy with families during the day. The poolside staff offer towels (large) and bottled water. There's also a bowl of apples, a nice touch. Location is very convenient, with buses out the front at Millenia Shopping Centre, next door at Suntec or a few minutes to The Esplanade. The MRT is about 10mins walk by either underground link or above ground through a small park, past the Civilian War Memorial. Raffles Hotel is 2 blocks away. The Marina area, even with construction, is much less hectic than Orchard Rd. Shopping centres abound - the hotel is connected to 3!. In the evening, a short walk away near The Esplanade Theatres is Makansutra's Glutton Bay hawker centre. Very convenient after a late night arrival into Singapore as it's open until 2am. We too were able to use our room until 3pm on the day of departure, and bags can be left in safe storage after that. The luggage room even has a set of scales if one needs to weigh one's cases. The changerooms near the pool are great for that last-minute shower before departure. On a previous visit to Singapore I was lucky enough to be put up at the neighbouring Mandarin Oriental Hotel, but this time it was out of my price range. So I guess I was quite often mentally comparing the PPS with the MOH. I was more than satisfied with the PPS and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this World!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_Birch
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th visit to the Pan Pacific Hotel at Marina Bay. We adore this hotel in every way imagineable. We now always stay at the Pacific Floor (floors 32-35) and this time were upgraded, free of charge, to a Harbour Suite overlooking Marina Bay. We were celebrating my husband's 50th birthday, and the staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. We knew some of them from previous visits and, despite there being many hundreds of guests since our last visit, they remembered us and treated us like royalty. We checked in at 11.30 pm, as we flew from New Zealand, and had lovely cold cocktails and cold flannels waiting for us. Judd, one of the Pacific Floor staff, greeted us very warmly and sailed us through the check in process. He also presented me with a bouquet of flowers! Our suite was amazing, masses of storage space and a view to die for! We had two plasma tv's, one in the bedroom and one in the living area. Free sweets on the table and a large bowl of fruit and bottles of water. As we were on the Pacific Floor we had free laundry for 2 pieces of clothing each day, which we made use of. There are masses of other advantages of being in this part of the hotel, well worth it. Breakfast was better than ever in the "Sunrise" room, they had expanded it since our last visit, and the choice was amazing. After a day or two the staff knew our drinks and had them waiting for us. If you want something they don't have, ie. I wanted watermelon juice, this was not a problem and appeared as if by magic! The ambiance in "Sunrise" was peaceful and relaxing. In the "Sunset" room afternoon tea was enjoyed and then cocktails between 5 and 8 pm. This really means drinks, but they are all free, so you can have as much as you want, as well as helping yourself to nibbles. The pool area is just as lovely as ever, but one tip, they have changed the sun beds and I am sure a man designed them! They are contour shaped and don't lie flat! The back of them only go down half way so you can't sunbathe on your stomach, unless you lie on the floor! Everyone thought they were a daft design and I even spoke to the Head of the hotel and complained. Hopefully they will sort them out before our next visit. Most things are now quite expensive in Singapore and a watermelon juice will set you back just under £5 each. This can mount up especially as it seems to be getting hotter in Singapore. There is free cold water available by the pool which is topped up all day long, so if you like water you will be laughing. I had a problem with the queen sized bed in our suite as the hotel has been redecorated. The bed was very hard, which I couldn't cope with, but the staff very quickly found a mattress topper for me, which was a lot more comfortable. They also have a choice of pillows and additional bedding if you require it. All over the hotel the staff were fantastic and couldn't do enough to help. The doormen at the entrance of the hotel were super organised and never kept you waiting for a taxi. If for any reason there weren't any there (which only happened once) they called and ordered some. This didn't happen anywhere else we visited. A hotel which we will always go back to and one in which I cry when I leave!

Reviews.Title: “We love it”
Reviews.Author: Popcornlovers
Reviews.Content: Stayed for (unfortunately only) one night on the flight back to Switzerland at the Pan Pacific Singapore. We had a room on the 19th floor, just excellent; nothing to complain at all, everything was taken care of as we asked for. We found that maybe the way to the restaurants from the elevator was a bit fare and left Railway station impression/feeling. We had Dinner at the Global Restaurant; 9 out of 10 Points, congratulations. Breakfast, excellent only one thing, but since I am Swiss I am maybe a little keen on it: the Cheese “corner” should be renamed to the Cheese tray and needs some urgent attention. I understand that Cheese might not be the most loved thing in Asia but the available choice and the condition of it was poor to bad. But don’t get me wrong the Buffet is fantastic and the staff is great. Maybe get the gentlemen cleaning up the bread crump’s on the bread station a proper tool to do so, he was working hard and I know myself how difficult it is to do this just with a napkin. Menue card in the room would be nice, also a pricelist for the costs of phone calls. We shall be back… thank you very much. Our daughter loves the rubber squeaky bear.

Reviews.Title: “sensational”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneCazza
Reviews.Content: Great location, excellent staff, very clean, great in room dining stayed 3 days on a stopover from Brisbane (Qld) to London based on reviews on trip advisor. Could not fault anything about the hotel. Highly recommend it to anyone thinking of a stopover or a visit to Singapore. Also, very efficient airport and travel to the hotel is very quick and the gardens and trees along the roads are stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: jac1999
Reviews.Content: The perfect end tto a very long and enjoyable travelling holiday. Rooms were wonderful, bathroom was exceptional and the service was superb. I asked for a late check out (my flight wasn't until 10) and they gave me the room until 3 and then gave me an hour in a hospitality room to shower at the end of the day. Couldn't ask for more!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good indeed”
Reviews.Author: travellerJack
Reviews.Content: Above all, I appreciated the service here. E-mail contact with the hotel prior to arrival was answered immediately. Check in was efficient and exceptionally polite. A minor issue I had with my room was immediately and generously resolved. All the staff I interacted with were service oriented, polite and happy to help. A very pleasant stay in a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome - You are missing out if you don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: baddream1
Reviews.Content: This hotel rates as one of the best in the World - It was recommended to me and I have also recommended it. It's not just the opulent spacious rooms, fantastic pool area or even the outstanding service - it's everything! If you are looking to stay in Singapore I can't imagine why anyone wouldn't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, undoubtly one of the best in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: YoussefAustralia
Reviews.Content: What do you want from a hotel?. Friendly and caring staff, clean and comfortable room, good location and value for money. The Pan Pacific, Marina has all that and more. I would highly recommend it with all honesty.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: KANDO71
Reviews.Content: I was delighted with this hotel. It was so clean... rooms and bathrooms beautiful. A lovely swimming pool with excellent service by the pool. Friendly well presented staff. Beautiful views. In the heart of the city. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Great Service, Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: REDcrazy
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Singapore in time for Liverpool FC's Asian Tour (July 26) and to do some shopping as well which was in time with the tail-end of the Singapore Sale Season. We opted to stay here for four nights based on the reviews here on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. I booked the Deluxe Balcony Rooms at SGD 196. Upon arrival, we were showed to our room by a member of the staff. As we took the lift overlooking the outside, we commented on the lovely views from the lift. The staff said that the view was even more scenic in our room because we've been upgraded to a Panoramic room. Great, I said. As we entered our room, she showed us to the balcony which true to her word, had a breathtaking view of the Harbor, Merlion, The Fullerton and The Esplanade with the Financial district's skyscrapers in the backdrop. She then completed our check in process in the room's desk area which by the way, had the very comfortable Herman Miller Aeron chairs. Another pleasing detail. The rooms were beautiful, well appointed and quite spacious and is even more pleasing in person than in the photos we saw in the reviews. Just like any good hotel, it has everything you would need. LCD TV, an electronic safe safe which could fit your laptop were just some of the amenities in the room. The bathrooms were also impressive and again any photos you may see does not reflect the true state of the bathrooms. A tub and a separate toilet and shower stall. When I saw the photos here before, I thought it was just OK and was a bit put off by the red marble countertop and floors. But they looked really nice in person and was always in pristine condition. The Hotel's location is also a plus. Even though the nearest MRT stop is quite a walk, Orchard Road and other shopping destinations you might want to go to are just a Taxi away and they're quite affordable as well. Check out was quickly done as well and the service during the entirety of our stay was excellent. The value for money is definitely there. I'd definitely stay here next time and would definitely recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Luxury”
Reviews.Author: JamesGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visit the island of Phuket annually and have always enjoyed a few nights stopover in Bangkok on the way home. However this year, because of underlining political problems in Bangkok we elected a stopover in Singapore. After using Tripo Advisor (as we always do) to seek out a suitable hotel in Singapore to suit the budget, we settled on the Pan Pacific on Raffles Boulevard. This hotel is close to the Suntec Shopping Centre and easily accessable to the Singapore CBD. On arriving we decided to upgrade to the Pacific Club floors because it was only a few dollars more ($SG130) and we were offered free wifi in our room, late check out (6pm) free breakfasts in the club lounge, a butler service, free cocktails at 5.30 each night, complimentary morning and afternoon tea, free travel within the CBD, and access to the Pacific club pantry where you can help yourself to pastries, icecreams, espresso or tea, fruit and a variety of cold drinks and snacks 24/7. What a great service! On top of that, the room was impeccable, a luxurious bed with a choice of pillows, exceptional lighting, complimentary mini bar (excluding alcohol), and a great view with a virtual private elevator. We`would like to mention the staff at the Pacific Club as they were the friendiest bunch of folk we have ever met on our trips. We particular wish to mention David, one of the assistant managers in Pacific Club... he is an awesome guy and a major assett to the hotel. We look forward to going back there in 2010. By the way, avoid the Singpore Sling (or sting as we call it) at Raffles Hotel nearby. It is just ice water and cordial for $23 each plus tax. Ask David to make you a genuine one, you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Love The Location”
Reviews.Author: Balustroid
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a few times before and I love it everytime. I was given a room on a high floor with a stunning view of the city. The linen was clean, the bed was comfortable, the aircondition temperature setting was just right, the tv channels were good with a sports channel showing the live English Premier League games which is an important point if you are a fan. The bathroom was clean, with a good size bath tub, a separate toilet and shower.I love the bathroom floor. To me, a clean, comfortable bathroom is very important. The bathroom has a wooden sliding door. What I like the most about this hotel and why I stayed here many times is because of the location. Downstairs you have Marina Square with food outlets, shops, 7 Eleven store (24 hours mini mart) and plenty of taxis if you want to go elsewhere. There is also Millenia Walk with more shops, restaurants and furniture shops and closeby is Suntec where there are more shops, Food Pavilion, Toys R Us and pharmacies etc. This means, I don't have to waste my time travelling in a taxi going to other area. All I need is to go downstairs and I can go there as many times as I like during my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: Ajibon
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience from the moment we checked in to the time that we left. The staff were amazing, service excellent and food great. Convenient location to get out and about. Highly recommend this hotel! We will definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: ExcitedTraveller25
Reviews.Content: This is my first ever review but I had to do one as this hotel was so fantastic. My husband and I were on our honeymoon and stayed in the Pan Pacific for 3 nights in July. We had just arrived in Singapore and had not slept on the plane so were feeling a bit worse for wear! The hotel were great and took us to our room straight away despite it only being 10am. We had been upgraded and the room was fantastic, the view alone was worth every penny. The room was clean and very large for a city hotel. We had breakfast there every morning, which was lovely and meant we didnt bother with lunch most days. The location is right in the centre of the city and it is easy enough to walk to most of the major sights, although if you want to travel further afar the MRT is great and very easy to use. I would definately recommend this hotel to all of our friends and family who are lucky enough to visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed here for three days and could not fault it.”
Reviews.Author: deniadoll
Reviews.Content: The service was consistently good and the staff were professional but friendly and approachable. I booked a standard room which was clean, well stocked and enjoyed good views over the pool. As a first time visitor to Singapore, I was happy with the location especially as taxis were readily available and cheap to hire. Marina Square Shopping Mall is directly accessed from the first floor of the hotel, and there are a number of good restaurants within the mall. I loved the ambience of the hotel and the impressive lift pods. I least liked having to ask daily for more milk, as there was never enough for more than two cups of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the Marina district”
Reviews.Author: freqflyer1832
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pan after a short stay at the Fullerton. Not surprisingly, in terms of luxury, the Pan is one step lower than the Fullerton. However, for the money and for work, the Pan is way up there. The work table and chair is more conducive to work. The table has tons of electrical outlets for my laptop etc. The service is top notch at the Pan. I arrived at the Pan at 8am and was given a room even though I had not asked for early check in. For the money, I would definitely come back to the Pan.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scubagary
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel having taken into account the exceptional reviews on Trip Advisor. It is all true and this is truly an exceptional hotel. It is very much a 5 star plus hotel therefore this makes the reasonable rates that are charged even more surprising. It is in a great location with the Marina, shopping malls, great restaurants etc etc all within easy access. The rooms are of a very high standard. We only selected the basic room and this would be considered to be a superior room in many other places. Staff are exceptionally helpful and attentive. Front desk were great and I think the thing that made the hotel stand out was that staff always appeared to be polite and helpful not because it was their job but because they genuinely wanted to. The staff are what make the hotel exceptional. If you can get a package with breakfast included then this is worthwhile as it is a large feast. The only problem is that you will probably over eat as selection is so large and with so many other great eating options, you need to leave some room for later. You do have to pay for wireless internet access. Many places have this as free now but I would not complain as I felt that room rates were so reasonable. It was S$5 for one hour, S$12 for 6 hours or S$25 for 24 hours access. I actually had problem with it on one occasion and when I phoned up, I was transferred seamlessly to external IT experts who tried to help then realised that other reports coming in so it was a wireless issue for all guest and not just me. I had paid for 6 hours and this was charged. I explained at front desk and they sorted this out immediately and I was not charged. Singapore is a great stop off place for trips to/from Australia/NZ and would thoroughly recommend it for a 3/4 night stop off.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: QatarPossum
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific was great. I was surprised at how cheap the room service menu was compared to other 5 star. check in was so easy they were so helpful as i was totally wrecked after a long flight. the room was heaven. the only thing that wasn't perfect was the meal i ordered through room service. a minor thing - the chips were reheated and not fresh. however i filled in the email survey they sent me and they immediately refunded my room service bill. since then i've had reassurance that they've advised the kitchen and quite a few emails of apology. I"d say thats a pretty good indication that this is a well run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, could not fault a thing”
Reviews.Author: SuebeePerth
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. The location, staff, rooms, breakfasts everything was of a very high standard. The most comfortable bed and pillows I have ever had the pleasure to sleep on away from home. Loved the touch of a bottle of water given by staff as you entered the pool area for a swim. Connects directly to 3 great shopping malls. Great places to eat in all price ranges two steps out the door. If you use the MRT at City Hall go above ground it is heaps quicker. Deserves the #1 spot.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: denimdynamo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a nights stay at Pan Pacific, check in was as normal,room was good , 5 star standard, extra beds were requested and delivered on time, bathroom was great. We were really there for a quick city guide and it suited us, breakfast was good but had to queue for entrance to the buffet restaurant,,which was a pain !! I has requested a drop off to the airport to be organised by the hotel, the driver was over 45 minutes late so we had to take 2 cabs instead, the hotel were not very helpful in this matter and seemed not too bothered that we were close to missing our flight !!! This meant that I was unable to claim back the sales tax refund at the airport due to lack of time ( another 50 pounds lost !! )Also the doorman was over friendly and very patronising and still expected a tip !!! Not great service from a 5 star hotel , you could do better than book this hotel for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “i love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pangpanglin
Reviews.Content: the rooms are clean, service staff is friendly and most importantly its value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Still a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brit-abroad-in-Asia
Reviews.Content: I'm back again to my current favorite hotel in Singapore and again, can't speak highly enough of this hotel. The room I'm in is spacious, clean and have a great view, with a nice big balcony. I booked on line and was offered a choice of two of four added extras - I opted for the room upgrade and free internet access. The only potential downside is that the gym is being renovated - but even the temporary gym has good equipment and a nice atmosphere. Breakfast was a fantastic choice and the staff were pleasant and service was good. All in all, for location (walking distance to Raffles City and the business district), value for money and an generally nice place to be - this hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: eaop
Reviews.Content: Booked on their own web page. At check in I was a bit grumpy, as the room had "internet connectivity" included, but not "internet access", which I had to pay something like 15 USD extra for. I them asked if the balcony was included, or just the possibility to use it, for a fee... The lady at the check in got a bit nervous, and then asked if the whole balcony thing was essential for my stay, and I said "no". She then upgrade me to the top floor, free internet etc. - free of charge. Below is what I got, for no extra charge! What's not to love? "The exclusive Pacific Club provides discerning travellers with plush luxury evident in the designer Axminster carpet, pillow menu and designer bathroom fittings. The Pacific Club butlers are available round-the-clock to assist with special requests and guests have privileged access to the Pacific Lounge serving breakfast, afternoon canapés and evening cocktails and the round-the-clock pantry, well-stocked with refreshments and ice cream. Pacific Club privileges include check-in at the dedicated reception on level 33, complimentary minibar (excludes alcohol), internet connectivity and clothes pressing, laundry or dry cleaning (up to two pieces daily) amongst others. Privileges: * Dedicated check-in at the Pacific Club reception on level 33 * Limousine airport transfers at preferred rates * Welcome amenities and complimentary in-room fruit selection * Complimentary clothes pressing, laundry or dry cleaning for up to two pieces daily * Personalised round-the-clock butler service * L’Occitane bathroom amenities * Pillow menu with a choice of Buckwheat hull (organic), contour, or foam pillows * Complimentary high speed wired / wireless internet connectivity * Privileged rates for secretarial services * Complimentary one-hour use of private meeting room * In-room facsimile services, laptops and mobile phones upon request at a nominal charge * Complimentary mini bar (excludes alcohol) * Elegant split-level Pacific Club Lounge with floor-to-ceiling window views of The Straits of Malacca featuring: > Champagne breakfast > Afternoon canapes > Evening cocktails & liqueur service > Round-the-clock pantry access with juice bar, ice cream, specialty tea and snacks "

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - absolutely deserves its top rating with trip advisor.”
Reviews.Author: tbugnz
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to many places around the world and never before felt the need to write a review however this hotel deserves the feedback. We three (husband, teenage son and myself) stayed at the Pan Pacific for 6 nights. We had only planned to stay for 3 or 4 but it was all so easy and comfortable that we extended our stay. When we booked we were upgraded from deluxe to executive as part of the booking deal - we were happy with that and then on arrival we were again upgraded to the executive panoramic room - on 36th floor - it was soooo nice to have the fabulous views from our good sized balcony. Room was great - we had a foldaway bed for our son which was a proper mattress so very comfortable and room was still plenty spacious enough. The hotel service was faultless - rooms well serviced daily and staff very very helpful with any of our requests. The breakfasts were the BEST - so much choice and delicious. Pool was great and appreciated the chilled water apples and icey cold towels that were given to us - nice touch. So hotel fabulous - and location perfect for walking to singapores sights or to underground for further afield. We were happy for our son to go off on his own and meet us back at hotel - its all so connected and safe that it was perfect. We used underground often and again an easy walk through the malls to the City Mall station. No hesitation at all in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, relaxing, good value luxury hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: lalalee
Reviews.Content: Why can't Western hotels learn from the Far East and the type of hotels and service that is given to guests in this part of the world? London for example is a total rip off for hotels; expensive and really bad service. I mean it does not matter where you go from Singapore to Hong Kong to Bangkok to KL - luxury hotels deliver everything to their guests - the Pan Pacific Singapore does not disappoint. It is a lovely looking hotel, great lobby, good location, fab restaurants, excellent staff and service, wonderful pool and the list goes on. The most important thing too is that the rates are reasonable and the rooms are beautiful, immaculate and and comfortable. This is a great hotel and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Garden3
Reviews.Content: We booked the Pan Pacific in part due to the reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. Our room was on the 31st floor and had spectacular views over the harbour. Bit noisy during the night due to the construction work going on on the marina but the hotel provided ear plugs so sleeping not a problem. Pool area is one of the best in Singapore. Nothing is too much trouble and the attendants supply you with cold water, apples and cold towels at regular intervals. The staff at the hotel are all friendly and knowledgable. We returned to the hotel and were greeted by name by a number of staff. Nice touch. Would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonably priced luxury hotel in a good shopping area!”
Reviews.Author: Mohtrix
Reviews.Content: Service at the hotel was quite good. We arrived in the early hours of the morning, before the normal check-in time, and much to our delight we were provided with a room promptly. This was a good start to Singapore, as much needed sleep was required. Our deluxe room was awesome. Very clean, nice automatic vertical blinds, king bed, plasma tv and neat bathroom. The hotel amenities were adequate. The pool and sun bathing area was spacious. The gym was reasonable as well. Location of hotel is good for people interested in shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,great location,great shops.”
Reviews.Author: SJBLimerick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late June and July,on the way to and from Australia.The hotel deserves its place as number 1 as it is a fantastic hotel.On the way out our room was on the 19th floor,on the way back we had an upgrade to the 30th.The staff were excellent and always offered us advice with a smile.Our two children ,five and three, loved the pool and the outside lifts.(The Raffles hotel is nestled between other larger hotels).Breakfast was superb,the choice huge.The hotel is located amongst other top hotels all linked by an underground shopping centre.The Pan Pacific is a great place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RagnhildNorway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific in Singapore 3 nights in July 2009. I would say that this was a hotel that gave great value for the money. The rooms were newly renovated, and in great condition. Breakfast was great, almost too many things to choose from. Staff at front desk very helpfull and friendly. We had our flight back to Europe at midnight, so the hospitality room offered for free at the day of the departure was very nice. There we could shower and change, and repack after a last day of shopping before going to the airport. Al in all a great hotel, that I would recommend frieds and collegues travelling to Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: CowTrain
Reviews.Content: So far, this is the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in. The service was exceptional. The room was extremely spacious and comfortable. The bathroom facilities were excellent also. There are pool and gym facilities and a variety of restaurants. The room service menu had a great selection and was good value. The hotel is very conveniently located to shops and transport. The only downside I found about this hotel was that there were no free internet facilities available. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Pan Pac is a winner”
Reviews.Author: balmac
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed at the Pan Pac four times - coming to and from Europe / NZ and it is consistently excellent. Our son loves the novelty of the glass lifts but more seriously, the rooms are top class the pool area is also very very good and the breakfasts are always eagerly anticipated! I see that the Pan Pac is consistently rated number 1 by tripadvisor so I'm not sure that my review is actually needed - suffice to say that I want to give this top class hotel our vote of confidence. Good gym as well. When we checked in this time, we 'only' had rooms on 7th floor but by waiting one day, we were able to move up to 19th which was spectacular. To cap it off, top floor restaurant did a superb job with our farewell dinner. Thanks again Pan Pac!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nat632000
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pan Pacific on the first and last night of our honeymoon and it was fantastic. On the first night when we arrived I was given a beautiful bunch of flowers and we were upgraded to an amazing room with a view of the pool area. We went out for dinner and later when we returned we had been left a yummy chocolate cake as well... heaven! :-) The hotel itself is very clean and the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. When we returned for our last night (another chocolate cake left in our room!) we spent the day by the pool which was lovely and the Pan Pacific staff were going around constantly handing out Ice cold bottles of water and chilled apples… it was great.
