I would recommend this hotel to anyone and it is situated in a great location to get to most places in Singapore…I hope we get to return there again soon :-)

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel surpassed only by its welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: habtheory
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a couple of nights here at the start of a second honeymoon celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. We were greeted very warmly by a helpful staff member and as we were early for check in to the room we were escorted to the atrium lounge/bar and given complimentary coffees and cake which was very enjoyable. We were not kept waiting long before being taken to our room. We were congratulated on our wedding anniversary by a few staff members and I must say the staff were so warm and friendly and were very happy to provide suggestions (like upgrade to club access - well worth doing), tourist info and general info on singapore. If you do the club thing you are accommodated higher up with a lovely room, butler service (nothing is too much trouble), snacks anytime, breakfast at any of three areas within the hotel, afternoon tea, cocktails etc. The rooms by the way are elegant and very comfortable. Upon returning to our room after some shopping we had been left a chocolate mousse cake from the hotel deli which we enjoyed after dinner. I thought this was a lovely touch. The top three floors are connected also by a spiral staircase so you don't have to keep using the lift to get your snacks/drinks - this makes it feel quite discreet when you are in a snacking mood and they didn't mind us taking cocktails up to the room. Tea and coffee making is available in the room but you can also make one in the club room and even get a takeaway cup if you're on the go. The pool area is very good and the moment you take a sun lounge you are presented with ice cold water and towel, once again with a warm greeting. In the pool area is a day spa - a bit expensive for what it was but we did enjoy a massage before returning to our reserved lounges. The chinese restaurant at the top was a bit unusual in some of its offerings but we had the most delicious fish I've ever tasted which melted in the mouth. The gym is currently being remodelled but if you just want to use a treadmill or step machine it will do for now. We really couldn't fault the hotel on much at all except perhaps sometimes the coffee (cappucino/latte that sort of thing) was not so good.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveBGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in the pan pacific twice now. It is a great hotel in a great location. Would definitely recommend it. The rooms are very good. We had an executive room with a panoramic view of the marina. Excellent! We werent allowed to take the kids into the executive breakfast though. fair enough, when i am business travelling i like to be away from kids! We got a great breakfast in the normal breakfast area. there is a nice outdoor pool that the kids really liked. hotel is easy to get to from the airport via a taxi, cost us $18 and took about 20 minutes. the staff were very helpful, especially with the kids. would definitely stay there again. The building is pretty much exactly the same design as a hotel i stayed at in Delhi a few years back!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel, Very Clean Neat And Beautiful, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rukshana
Reviews.Content: It's a wonderful hotel, very luxe and with a great and helpfull staff

Reviews.Title: “Why it's No 1 hotel on TripAdvisor for so long!”
Reviews.Author: travelmaker4
Reviews.Content: We stopped over in Singapore for a couple of days on our way home from Europe recently. Although we’ve visited Singapore many times in the past, we have never stayed at the Pan Pacific for no specific reason. This time we decided to stay at this hotel after reading positive reviews on TA and we were not disappointed. It is a great hotel. Staff at the reception was very friendly. Checking in & out were fast and efficient. Our flight from London arrived in the morning and it was a pleasant surprise to be told that our room was ready when we checked in later that morning. After the 13 hr flight, it was really nice to be able to unpack, shower and change before going out. We were upgraded to a balcony room which was another nice surprise. The room was well appointed, spacious and clean with a king size bed and comfortable pillows. The en-suite bathroom was large with a separate bath, shower and toilet. The double-headed shower rose was fantastic. The room had excellent curtains (remote-controlled) to keep the room really dark and nice for sleeping in. The only gripe we had was internet access. The hotel charges SIN $10 per 15min for the use of internet in the business centre which we feel is expensive for most travellers. Hotels in Singapore should consider providing internet access to guests free of charge or at nominal cost for limited-time usage, as in many hotels in many countries. This service will be well appreciated, especially by leisure travellers (who dont usually take their labtops on holidays) to check their flights & other travel plans. Singapore does not seem to have any internet cafés in tourist areas, none that we could see anyway..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fannyLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at this hotel with my wife and 2 kids-aged 12 and 8 yrs old- during recent school holiday. Check in was fast and only done in few minutes. We picked this hotel because it's close to Marina Square and Suntec shopping mall where my wife can do some shopping, she loves shopping in Singapore especially during Singapore Great Sale. The nearest MRT station-City Hall is about 10 minutes walking. The room is great and spacious, the bathroom is quite nice where they have a separate shower and bath tub. We love the bed as it's king size bed where my wife and kids can sleep together while I sleep on the extra bed, it's free of charge but you have to request before you check in. My kids enjoyed swimming at the hotel swimming pool and they were given free water bottle after they swam. The only downside is the breakfast where not many food selection available, also we almost had the same food every breakfast. It's OK for those people who only stay 1-2 nights but for someone who stays longer than 2 nights, they definetely will get bored eating the same food. We decided to have breakfast at nearby food court on day 4 because my kids didn't want to have breakfast at the hotel. Overall, my family and I had a great time staying at this hotel and will stay here again next time we come to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “more than expectation”
Reviews.Author: Saman1980
Reviews.Content: Generally I got more than what I have expected, I had read reviews about the hotel and I knew that this is one of the top 10 recommended hotels in Singapore , But I still got more than what I have expected. From the begging they surprised me with the early check in and also a room promotion without extra charge just because I have asked them to give me a room with a better view in high levels , so they upgraded my room to a balcony. Moreover the rooms are comfortable and the house keepers do their best. The Pool and it's surrounded area worth mentioning because there are not so many hotels that have a yard with an outstanding landscape and a beautiful attractive pool inside an open area.

Reviews.Title: “Just like 1998! Great!”
Reviews.Author: RYUKHAN
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this hotel back in 1998. It is good to notice that it has maintained its high standards over the years. It's definitely value for money compared to other hotels within its vicinity. Great location, courteous staff, nice rooms. Take the panoramic balcony room and you will get a great view of the harbour, especially in the night. On the down side, perhaps, their bathroom needs renevation; still looks the same! But I would still recomend this place and will definitely stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful -- deserves to be #1”
Reviews.Author: md001
Reviews.Content: We couldn't be happier with our stay at this hotel. The rooms and facilities are beautiful, and the view from the upper floors is breathtaking. Everything is spotless and well designed. The beds are incredibly comfortable. The staff was very warm and welcoming; they even sent up a cake, since I was celebrating my birthday here! The breakfast was excellent, too. Love the glass elevators. . .great pool and fountains. The location is perfect, attached to the convention center and several shopping malls, and right on the harbour. We will definitely stay here again the next time we are in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rover82
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is excellent and service is quite good. It is supposedly the largest hotel in Singapore (with 750 odd rooms). The rates are also reasonable as comparable hotels will cost you 350+ while the Pan Pacific often goes for around 250+....Room service was good with items replenished everyday...... Dont forget to ride on the external elevators, specially at night! The hotel is connected to Marina Square and Suntec City malls which is convenient when its raining.... One of our few gripes was that it was a 15 minutes walk from the nearest MRT, so we often ended up taking a taxi as we were in a hurry or too tired to walk. Also wifi was expensive but I guess thats the way it is in Singapore...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, service a bit slow”
Reviews.Author: Hello-Ms-B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights and changed rooms after the first night. The first room had a connecting door and I was listening in on the conversations my neighbour had until 2 a.m. Wasn't even his fault, no shouting or such but the door simply was not padded / sound proof and it felt like the guy was standing right next to my bed. Gave reception a ring at night and asked them to be moved first thing next morning. It took 2 more phone calls from my side to eventually find out that the room wouldn't be available till 11.30. Fair enough, but they could have let me know. I then suggested I'd pack my stuff and leave it it the room and they agreed. When I got back everything was sorted and I got a room on the 26th floor with a nice view. The hotel itself is very modern and nicely furnished, breakfast with wide variety and attentive staff. All in all a nice hotel I'd recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: joesidhu
Reviews.Content: We decided to leave Orchard St behind as we had done it on our last trip. This time we chose a hotel close to the Marina to explore this part of Singapore. The location of the hotel could not have been better as its linked to several malls, and many restaraunts close by. The first thing that strikes you with the hotel are the sheer number of rooms as you look up from the lobby, this is no boutique hotel. Check in was ok, the kids enjoyed the free lollipops as they waited. The rooms were spotless, though smallish. Bathrooms were great the shower had dual showerheads and a handshower. Hotel is very generous with its amenities - lots of moisturisers, shower gels, slippers - all replenished everyday. We felt the airconditioning in our room was not very effective and the hotel reception was very prompt in finding a new room for us. The pool is a nice size with a restaraunt that offers BBQ - but only on Fri & Sat Try to avoid the hotel during the weekend as you many have to line up for breakfast, weekdays seem much quieter. All in all, a nice stay with the staff eager to help - but make sure you ask. By the way we asked for a late check out for 3 rooms (we were traveling in a large family group) and there was no hesitation from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: tenrab
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only 2 nights on a stop over to Oz, but it was a brilliant 2 nights.Check in was quick and efficient with extremely pleasant staff, who you felt really meant it when they wished you a nice stay,rather than the false formality of many a hotel. We stayed in a delux room on floor 16, which was very clean and had all the luxuries you would expect from a hotel of this rating. The bed also was very comfy, which is always a plus! Be warned if you dont like heights, dont go out on the balcony on a high floor as it is quite stomach churning, although we personally liked it. Another must for great views is a trip in the external lifts which service the higher floors and Hai Tien Lo restaurant on floor 37, anyone can go to the top and the views especially of a night are brilliant. We only ate in Global Kitchen for breakfast as our deal included this, and again you could not fault it, there was plenty of choice for both western and eastern tastes, and again the service from the staff was excellent. Also it was open from 6 a.m which is great, if like us you have an early flight to catch. The hotel is situated quite close the Singapore flyer, thus away from the more hustle and bustle areas of Orchard Road, but still close enough to amenities to get about, it is also connected to both Suntec and Millenia shopping centres, which have a huge variety of shops. We did a lot of walking, and Raffles hotel as a focal point is probably 15-20 from Pan Pacific, however local taxis are efficient and cheap, and whenever we caught one from Pan Pacific the door man would indicate to us and the driver how much it should be, so that everyone knew where they stood, which helped. Pan Pacific is also right infront of the stop for the Singapore Airlines hop on hop off bus, which costs about £6 each if you have flown with Singapore Airlines and produce your boarding pass, and is excellent value. Overall an excellent hotel, very good value for money, and one which we would not hesitate to recommend. Tip:take your trunks and try out the hotel swimming pool it has music playing underwater!!!

Reviews.Title: “The quality of service and facilities are unsurpassed. We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: ichigolo
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the ratings provided by other readers, and we were not disappointed! The Pan Pacific sure was exceptional. The staff were fantastic. If there is anything you want, they will see to it & very quickly! The facilities were top class, spotless and well stocked in everything. It was close to Marina Square Shopping Centre and Suntec City Mall. Clark Quay & Orchard Rd shopping district were both within walking distance too.

Reviews.Title: “superior hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: icook
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times while in Singapore. Its a great hotel. The rooms are super (get the ones that overlook the bay and downtown). The hotel has excellent amenities (the gym is great, there is a super pool). Its located in Suntec City attached to a large mall so all the convenience of that. Its a short cab ride from the airport (about SG30) and close to downtown. The staff is very helpful. My only gripe is that internet access is extra -- about SG25/day (here is wireless which works well). I have suggested they include in the price. I got a polite response that was essentially -- "everyone charges separately so we do as well". I say -- set yourself apart and offer a combo rate.

Reviews.Title: “I can see why it is number 1 on tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: Dapster
Reviews.Content: After doing a lot of research I decided to book Pan Pacific for our stay in Singapore. We spent two nights there and I could not fault the hotel. At check in we were upgraded to a balcony room at no extra charge, which afforded a lovely view of the harbour. Also, we flew with Singapore Airlines and even though we technically didn't get a free breakfast with our rate, the lovely guy at reception added that on for us as part of their promotion at the time. They also gave us free late check out and stored our bags for the remainder of the time as our return flights was not until night time. Freebies apart, the room was great and everything you'd expect from a hotel: New, comfy beds, fantastic shower (and separate bath too), a writing desk with an array of international plugs (a nice touch we thought!), a big plasma tv (again with all sorts of cables for anything you'd need to plug in there). All the furniture was new and modern too. The breakfast was fantastic. There was great variety and the quality was great. The pool was really nice with nice comfortable loungers and the pool staff would clock you coming towards a lounger and come to give you a free bottle of cold water. Again, nice touch. There was also a shower room by the pool with lockers, which we used on our last day to get ready for our flight home. The location was great too. All in all, great service, great food, great location and modern hotel. Everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel and services”
Reviews.Author: SydneyPilot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in December 2008. The hotel was great. The service was excellent. I booked 1 room for 3 nights - with special deal stay 3 nights pay for 2 and 2 other rooms for 2 nights with Singapore Airline deal with free breakfast. Pan Pacific Hotel staff called me a few dates after I booked the rooms to offer a special cake for my sister and nieces birthday, cool. We arrived the hotel on 2 different dates but they make sure that our rooms are opposit the other. They also put an extra bed in 1 room free of charge. The free chocolate cake and fruits delivered to our rooms on date and time requeted. The chocolate cake was so yummy. I love the staff, they are incredile always with smile and helping us. They even told the taxi drivers the places we want to go and look after our luggages. The rooms are huge even with extra bed my little nephew still can run around. The view are stunning. The bathrooms are big with separate bathtub, shower and toilet - also plenty of complementary toiletries. I love the remote-controlled drapes, Herman Miller chair. Breakfast wa delicious many choices. Swimming pool is also huge, love the chairs around the pool and the view. Both inside and outside lifts were amazing. My niece forgot the password of the safe, the staff turned up in a couple minutes to fix it. We will definite stay at Pan Pacific Singapore again and again. Thanks for your great services.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore stunner”
Reviews.Author: KatieBerkshire
Reviews.Content: This is a really wow place from the moment you enter the foyer to the automatic curtain and sunblind raiser! The breakfast was magnificent and everything beautifully presented. Cold water (and fruit if wanted) were immediately handed to you at the swimming pool and the lady attendant made sure we had a plastic bag to put our wet costumes in afterwards - useful as we were about to fly home. A little far from the MRT station but you could walk there through the cool shopping malls. The bus stop was right outside the hotel. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: fuhok
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my Wife and 2 year old Daughter for 3 nights. I chose this hotel based on the revewis posted on this site. The hotel did not dissapoint. The rooms were large, the bathroom was nice. Breakast had ample choice and the service was very good. The hotel is in a good location and is in easy reach of all major attractions and shopping centres.

Reviews.Title: “Best in show”
Reviews.Author: helix77
Reviews.Content: I stayed one week at Pan Pacific. I made a choise to stay there because I wanted to try something else this time. No problems to check in and keep that in mind I was four hours early. My room was clean and there were people taken care of my every needs. Once every afternoon they came to see if I needed water, towels or just to make my bed again if I had made as mess since the morning cleaning. I only once had breakfirst in the hotel, I didn't feel that the price I was paying (not included in the room) was ok for what I got. I have had better breakfirts in Singapore. The rest of the days, I found this wondeful coffee place just 5 minutes walk from the hotel. I ate one of their morning specials, it was fantasic. There is no free internet. With the rooms comes a very high tech standard. One thing you should notice is the mini-bar. It's the new kind they have. When you remove something you have 20 sec, to decide if you want this or not. What happends is that the computer reads that an item is missing and puts it on your bill. As always mini-bar is expensive. The hotel is connected with the Marina Square Mall. The metro station that are closest to the hotel is City Hall. You can walk inside all the way and it will take you about 13 minutes. A cross the hotel you have Sun Tech that has a big mall. Sun tech has a Carrefour were you can find everything from food, wine, games, clothes, It's like a mall within a mall. The fitness center is located by the pool. It has the basic stuff you need. There is two tennis courts, not own by the hotel. You can rent a coach but not bring your own. While I was there I had my birthday, not an even number. Once I got back from my shopping trip I found a message and cake. That says everything about this hotel, to send a gift. I like it. To stay here was worth every cent I spend. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! Raised the bar!”
Reviews.Author: Myna-san
Reviews.Content: Memories of Pan Pacific brings smile to me even as I write this review. Its an outstanding property! The lobby has a huge and colourful atrium. The room we booked had a partial view of the Marina Bay. The room was very spacious and very stylish. The bathroom was one of the best designed one. The spread of breakfast was best in Singapore. We also tried their Indian restaurant 'Rang Mahal' and the food there was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ravinic
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with a lot of class. The views from the hotel are panaromic. I stayed there for 1 month when I moved to SIngapore. The staff were all excellent and the service was very good, A bit pricey but I guess thats the price in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “truely business”
Reviews.Author: globetravellerMumbai
Reviews.Content: With 778 well-appointed rooms and suites and 26 meeting and banquet venues, Pan Pacific Singapore presents the choice accommodation option for a business or leisure traveller, merely 20 minutes away from Changi International Airport. Immerse in 37 floors of luxury presenting beautiful views of the bustling financial district and the beautiful Marina Bay while the hotel's central location amongst three shopping malls, including Suntec Singapore International Conventions and Exhibitions Centre, offers over 500 shops and restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: MasterBlasterMumbai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Pan Pacific for two days for official purpose. It was a comfortable stay. The good thing about Pan Pacific its location, we can have a sea view from the rooms. Moreover, it is close to the central business district and convenient for business travellers. Hospitality is good, food quality is in line. Overall my stay at Pan Pacific was good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, location”
Reviews.Author: pinkcoatb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year for a business trip and experience high quality service from the start to finish of my stay--check in, room service, room cleaning, concierge, check out, valet. The rooms are spacious and well-appointed, and the pool and fitness center were top notch. I particularly enjoyed dining in the bar area near the pool, and the recommendations of the staff for local dining were well received. The hotel is perfectly located relative to the conference center, and airport transfers (bus there, cab back) were very easy. My only qualms are that the elevators were slow and the business center is extremely expensive, even by Singapore standards. International phone calls from my room, however, were not as bad. It was cheaper for me to phone a friend in the States for 15 minutes than it was to use a computer in the business center for the same amount of time.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves to be #1”
Reviews.Author: Targetsea
Reviews.Content: I went wondering how the old PP could be the top pick for trip Advisor reviewers - how would it stand out from all the other big box hotels in the area? Well after a four-day weekend with wife and kids, I can only join in all the other reviewers praising this place. Great service, great rooms, great hotel. I would add that their pool side service is first class. All those free bottles of iced water. The gym has a good range of work out equipment in a largish space. The Rang Mahal Indian restaurant has fabulously good Indian food. Zambuca has good Italian food but a strained relationship between the kitchen and the staff. The Global Kitchen restaurant is good for the breakfast buffet, but dinner was more pedestrian (limited choice and not great execution on my roast salmon and prawn). Go for the burgers which looked terrific. On the other hand, the 25% early bird discount is perfect for families with kids - and my daughter says their banana split is the best she has ever had - and she is an expert. Had brunch at the Hai Tien Lo cantonese restaurant. The ordering system - a 'virtual' buffet you pick from a menu - takes some understanding. But the food has excellent interpretations of the usual Cantonese fair - and some interesting extras. Son says best duck he has ever tasted and he was born and raised in Hong Kong. Personally I found the bed a bit hard - but the rooms were large, well appointed and newly refurbished. But the staff make the place and it is reassuring to know that staff in hotels can be genuinely warm, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Everything excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Lovecraft
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for being #1 in Tripadvisor, and definitely it's well earned. We were lucky enough to be upgraded on arrival to a Pacific Club room in floor 34 and what a view!! The staff was always helpful, attentive and friendly, seems like they enjoy working at this hotel. Room was excellent, with a comfortable working area (Aeron chair is a big plus), and the electric curtains are really nice. Bed is huge, but a little hard for my taste (this is personal opinion). Bathroom was large, with a tub and shower, and lots of ammenities. Breakfast was great, we had it at Global Kitchen in floor 3 (large selection) and at the executive lounge in floor 22 (less selection but more personalized service), and both were excellent. They definitely won a customer and I would book Pan Pacific hotel again if I'm back to Singapore or to any other city in which they are.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: theverdict
Reviews.Content: My husband organised this for some down-time after touring Oz and what an absolute delight it was. Were upgraded to Pacific Club and would highly recommend these floors to everyone. Would easily have booked this if we had known what to expect before arriving. Staff exceptionally friendly in a genuine way and there just didn't seem to be anything that was too much trouble - everyone was out to please. As said before, the atrium is really quite amazing as are the carpets in the lobbies!! General point:- If you can get this fantastic service in one 5* hotel, why can't they all be the same? Hats off to everyone at the Pan Pacific (especially David in the Pacific Lounge) - very well done indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel - well worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: harleysmeow
Reviews.Content: Loved Singapore all around, but this amazing hotel topped it off. Staff at check in were friendly in a genuine way (not 'transactional') and the hotel lobby is beautiful. The room - wow what a view, fantastic decor, flat screen tv, beautiful bathroom. I'm not sure what the twin rooms are like, but our shower and toilet were not very private, which we didn't mind but thought would be strange when sharing with a friend. Pool is great for a relaxing swim or to read a book on a sunbed. Also, it's attached to a shopping centre :) This place was over our budget but we are soooo glad we went for it anyway. Tip - Go in the glass elevator on the outside of the building! What a view/ride

Reviews.Title: “Wish service like this existed in the UK!”
Reviews.Author: Anon123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights in November 2008 after escaping from the Thailand airport riots. We didn't want to spend too much money after finding out our travel insurance didn't cover us for getting out of Thailand and having to spend £800 on flights. We arrived at 3am to find the hotel fully-booked, but after hearing of our plight the staff not only took pity on us and found us a room, but also gave us a very reasonable discounted rate. It was a great hotel in terms of everything else aswell - no complaints about the rooms, service, food etc, a truly 5 star establishment with great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent warm and welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: deanie756
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are warm and welcoming. The view is stunning from the balcony window. The service, food, rooms and location are perfect. Thank you Pan Pacific for a lovely couple of nights! I hope to be back very soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Slow check in then excellent...”
Reviews.Author: Austraveller49
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 2 occassions, first 2 days then 4 days after a short tour into Malaysia. Both check-in procedures were exceedingly long and involved the staff in conferring with each other and paying more attention to a PC screen than the guest. We cannot understand why this was such an involved and lengthy decision! Location is excellent with sky walks to Suntech City and Marina Square shopping Centre which also links to the MRT (About 15 minutes walk mainly through air-conditioned buildings.) Room size is good and condition is excellent as is the toothbrush, comb, slippers, robe and much more. Definitely very happy with our stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful heritage”
Reviews.Author: Privateman
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific has is big in size and heart. It has good rooms and some very good restaurants. Being connected to the Marina Plaza shopping mall gives it an advantage. Its closeness to CBD makes it good for business and pleasure. You should try its Indian restaurant. It is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: gilesnorman
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice for 3 nights a piece with wife and 6 month old daughter (who loved all the attention she got!). Early-check-in was no problem and our request for a cot meant there was one waiting for us when we arrived. Good value, great room and good location. Breakfast area busy and crowded but staff very friendly and helpful. It is the staff's attittude and helpfulness that move the Pan Pacific from 4 to 5 stars on the rating scale. Would recommend and will do so!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...plus attention to details!”
Reviews.Author: Calvynz
Reviews.Content: There are many great reviews already of the Pan Pacific Hotel in Singapore. No doubt, the hotel is top notch, the service is outstanding, the location is ultra convenient. What I wanted to add is the hotel's attention to details which makes every experience even more special. From having fluffly towels, lots of closet space, to easy to use thermostat and easily accessible A/V cables (better than the Marriotts around the world)...Pan Pacific's got everyting covered! Great job!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: dnmec
Reviews.Content: I have visited Singapore 3 times and each time have had the pleasure of staying in the Pan Pacific. The rooms are well-maintained and clean, the location is excellent, the breakfast was great value with a large variety of dishes, but it is the staff that stand out and make your stay all the more enjoyable. The concierge was very friendly and organised some excellent tours for us and the reception staff are extremely friendly and efficient. The last time that I visited, one of them noticed that it was my birthday and ten minutes after getting to our room a birthday cake was delivered with compliments of the hotel. I love this hotel, and will definitely be staying here on my next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: radhikaIndia
Reviews.Content: nice hotel ,comfortable stay.......... with all mod cons

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel good rooms with all the mod cons.”
Reviews.Author: hatchs
Reviews.Content: Great place for a stopover in Singapore, not too expensive, nice pool and all the room luxuries you would expect.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: hamutukness
Reviews.Content: Been to the Pan Pacific twice and enjoyed everything. The hotel is classy and the staff is kind and prepared. The rooms are spacious and those on the executive floors have a spectacular view of the bay from the terrace. Needless to say that they're spotlessy clean. Never tried the breakfast nor room service or restaurants. I was transiting both times so the location didn't matter too much, and I really enjoyed the shopping in the nearby mall (is actually in the same complex). The first time (executive room) we were assigned a personal concierge for in room check in who also gave precious suggestions based on our personal needs (where to go for dinner, shopping etc). They were also very kind to grant a late check out (for personal reasons) until 4pm on short notice (by phone) without syndacating the reasons like great hotels do. Very reliable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast Area Let This Hotel Down”
Reviews.Author: ShaunScotland
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in the Pan Pacific hotel and my last. I have stayed in many hotels in Singapore but this was my most disappointed one. Firstly the hotel is ideally placed in the marina area with exceptional facilities and the rooms are quite large and very clean and well kitted out. Just as you would expect in a 5 star hotel in Singapore. My main complaint was with the Breakfast area World café I believe it is called after paying over $300 AUS a night I go down for breakfast and find I have to queue for 10 minutes before I can get in. This happened on the 3 days that I was there not very good. It reminded me of queuing at a food van or some cheap all you can eat buffet breakfast in a Vegas hotel. Inside was not an experience I wish to repeat. I am not sure what sort of customers the Pan Pacific is targeting but everyday I had to put up with screaming children, or parents walking their little precious pride and joy through the food area to teach them to walk getting in the way of other people or kids playing on the floor while you are trying to walk through. The eating area is quite small but surely they could have an area where families could sit with the kids so that they do not disturb others. On one day a large family of 8 at a table stuffed one of their kids with so much food that the kid was sick on the floor. The family just wiped the kid down and threw the napkin on the floor beside the vomit and carried on eating. Many of the staff saw what had happened but nobody cleaned it up for the 15 minutes that I was there. Even the restaurant manager looked at it but did nothing. The family happily carried on gorging them selves on the buffet without even an attempt to get it covered or cleaned up. Very poor and disappointing. Not what you expect in a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mahlerfan
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my recent three night stay at the Pan Pacific. A very modern, spacious room with flat screen TV, high speed wireless internet connection, and comfortable bed. Very large bathroom with separate stall shower and bath tub. Excellent view of the swimming pool and surrounding area. The location is ideal. A three block walk to the MRT station (City Hall) through the air conditioned adjacent mall. Within walking distance to the Raffles Hotel, Orchard Road, Clarke Quay and Chinatown. Very friendly and helpful staff. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Singapore. The only drawback is that there is no coffee/tea in the room and you can hear music at night from the lobby that carries through the atrium and into the rooms; however it is barely noticable and ends by midnight.

Reviews.Title: “short but sweet stay”
Reviews.Author: Allthebest2
Reviews.Content: Am just back from a 2 night short but sweet stay at the Pan Pacific Hotel in Singapore. The service was outstanding...with all staff very friendly and helpful. The room and bathroom were spacious and very comfortable with a great bed! Enjoyed the multi cuisine buffet breakfast which came complimentary as i was traveling on Singapore Airlines. I would not hesitate to recommend it to both business and holiday travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Five star service at a three (ish) star price, you can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: Ptibbs
Reviews.Content: On arrival the check in process was very straightforward. The room was very nicely presented, the electric blinds and curtains were a nice touch, and also a small bowl of fruit in the room made arrival after a long flight a little more pleasant. The rooms were incredibly quiet. The pool area was very comfortable, and staff were well trainined to give just the right amount of attention. Breakfast in the global kitchen was a very pleasant experience with a wide choice of buffet options. Staff were always very welcoming. All in all and excellent hotel for the price, and I would recomend to anyone staying in Singapore for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore a must see city”
Reviews.Author: sam8
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Singapore in april, The city is spotless, we stayed at the Pan Pacific Singapore and we were glad we did. Handy for Everything, Service was excellent, hotel dec or very modern and spotlessly clean, would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property!!!”
Reviews.Author: Janeesh
Reviews.Content: One of the best five star property I have stayed in... Great Rooms... Away from the crowded city but still can be said that the hotel is in the city itself... great dining options... cleanliness is at par... at most value for money... recommended.....

Reviews.Title: “Very Customer Focused”
Reviews.Author: djonce
Reviews.Content: We had 20 hours in Singapore between flights on Star Alliance so the wife and I booked the Pan Pacific Hotel thorough the United Airlines hotel service. We were completely satisfied with our choice. Getting to the hotel was a simple, grab a cab from Changi Airport which cost just $16 S for two persons and two pieces of luggage. Due to our late night arrival, the taxi queue was empty so the total trip took under 20 minutes. Check-in provided our first taste of Singapore hospitality. The process involved a unusual amount of manual paperwork during the filling out of which the check-in clerk engaged us with opening questions such as ‘where are you from’, ‘how long are you staying’, ‘what are you planning to see / do’, ‘where are you headed next’, ‘what’s it like back home’, etc. While these questions sound like something straight out of the hotel check-in clerk handbook, the follow-on discussion left us with a sense that there was genuine care and interest about us as guests. Upon discovery of our itinerary the front desk offered us a complimentary late checkout till 6PM. The hotel did not appear busy and so delaying the turnover of a room by a day did not involve additional expense. For jet lagged travelers on the other hand, having a place to shower and change after a day in the Singapore heat was a god-send. The Pan Pacific Hotel earned a loyal repeat guest. We booked a room on the executive floors [# 22 and higher] in order to secure a view of the city skyline and which included breakfast, tea, and free internet. The views of the city were exceptional and we have many fine photo’s our album. The internet was fast and robust – however getting connected required a wired connection in order to retrieve a password before using in a more convenient wireless mode. The room was clean and comfortable with appropriate finishes. Breakfast was tasty, nutritious, and filling. There was the usual assortment of European and American favorites including cook to order eggs. One asian dish – called 'dim sum' -- was included. We took our breakfast in the business center on floor 22 in order to enjoy the view and sacrificed an even larger selection on floor 3 in the main dining area. Since we had a late checkout we decided to try the afternoon tea—served from 3-5. When we arrived at 4:30, we were the only guests and had a delightful array of pastries to choose from as well as a favorite hot beverage or cold juice. During afternoon tea we encountered our second exceptional display of guest service. The hostess came by and inquired if we had just arrived and then added that she had not seen us at the hotel before. As we described our travel arrangements we found ourselves once again talking with someone who seemed genuinely interested in our journeys. The Pan Pacific is built in Atrium style with glass elevators running inside and outside. Either elevator ride is a treat – on the outside one overlooks downtown attractions while on the inside, one zips up and down the interior atrium. The hotel is elegant but stark with minimal local charm. Overall, we thought the friendly staff, central location, and the great views of the city were among the best assets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel to stay with”
Reviews.Author: Byreddy
Reviews.Content: Cordial invitation from reception. Hotel is very clean and every staff is cordial and helpful. If you are staying with that hotel for more than 21 days, you will be given a executive suite for normal charges.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: JP01
Reviews.Content: I have used trip advisor a lot with healthy sceptisim but this hotel deserves it's number 1 rating. The standout is the service, 5 star boutique standards from a large hotel, relaxed but always a step ahead and friendly with it. All the little things right. We tbooked on the hotel website using the Singapore Airlines offer and got upgraded to a business room. Didn't look at any other rooms so have no idea what this meant but the view over Singapore from the 24th floor is excellent. Breakfast great with all the normal options + dim sum! Nothing negative to say and I normally shy away from a hotel with more than 20 rooms ....

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding - Raised the bar”
Reviews.Author: Sanjay_Jain
Reviews.Content: I planned a family holiday to Singapore in Oct 08 with lots of meticulous planning and wanted to be right for everything from the word go. I wanted to go the best property in terms of service and customer satisfaction and Pan Pacific was my first choice with all reviews by tripadvisor users. While checking the rates on net and comparing with the hotel site, they immediately matched it and upgraded me to a Deluxe Balcony room with partial view of the marina bay! Besides, I always find that most hotels 'optimise' their room air conditioners at night much to my irritation. I prefer my room 'chilly'. While most hotels express inability to do anything to the room cooling for a single room, I started requesting for a table fan! Some of them dish out greasy table fan's, some dusty never cleaned. Since you do not have an option in the middle of the night, I realized its better to put up with them than do not have it at all. But Pan Pacific was something else. They got me a new fan, as I had requested in advance for a fan in the room! I could just say 'Vow"! I am happy my wife liked the hotel too. That gives me immense satisfaction. To start with the room was large with a balcony and they also gave me a complimentary bed for the child. Despite two beds the room had lots of space and didnt look cramped. The room had HDTV with all cables - first for me and a panel where one could connect to their equipment. My heart just skipped a beat when I saw their bathroom - large enough to be a room for oneself. Separate cubicle as shower room, separate with bath tub and a seating for one who wants to rest while tending oneself. How thoughtful. The pool was clean. Tried their Indian restaurant Rang Mahal. Best Indian food in Singapore. Very happy and want to come back again. Thank you guys for making it special for my family.

Reviews.Title: “well known for being the #1 -attitude of making you feel important-”
Reviews.Author: mexicoduke
Reviews.Content: Great location when you go for expo´s in SUNTEC, just croosing in a tunel... being in the executive floor , with panoramic view, wow! Very good breakfast....I would return in my next visit ...a pleasure staying with people that makes you feel comfortable at every time.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: krawimi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. I didn't get to use any of the services because I was there such a short time, so I can't comment on service. The room was very nice and comfortable. The lobby and common areas (and the atrium) were really amazing. The entire hotel was clean, comfortable and modern.

Reviews.Title: “It's great hotel with best of service and good loactions”
Reviews.Author: amit2207
Reviews.Content: It's very nice spacious, safe and perfectly located hotel near to down town. Major Shopping Malls.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: AsiaSteve72
Reviews.Content: One of the best city hotels i have stayed in, The Pan Pacific just gets everything right, great service, great rooms, you should try and get one with a view of the harbour and city, these are much better, we had an exec fkloor room, again worth the extra as breakfast included, drinks and snacks all day and free drinks in the evening and given the cost of alcohol in Singapore this is worth every penny. Great location, you can walk to Boat Quay, Clarke Quay, Raffles is just around the corner so all the major tourist sites, Orchard Road about 5-10 minutes in a taxi but these are very cheap, lovely pool area if you want to escape from sightseeing and shopping. Room service is fantastic and the lobby bar is lovely with superb staff and a good atmosphere. Having compared many hotels and prices I think this was exceptional value for Singapore which is notriously expensive, and it really doesnt feel like a large corporate hotel, a lot of leisure travellers as well as businessmen here so a good mix. Would stay here again when in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Easy to see why its the No.1 hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: kennystag
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive you feel you are the most important person there. We stayed here as part of my wife's 40th birthday celebrations in April. I had e-mailed them previous and they had arranged a cake to be sent to our room on arrival. We were upgraded from a panaramic to a deluxe room, however, we felt the balcony made the room appear dark and we asked if we could have our original room to which we were assigned a executive business room, very nice. The bed was firm, not a problem for me, but my wife asked if they could provide a softer mattress and on our arrival back at the hotel that evening an additional softer thin mattress had been made up on our bed. Bathroom was very spacious, Separate toilet and shower area. Have you ever seen a bigger hand held shower head!! Every mermber of staff was extremely polite and courteous and having an overwhelming attitude to please. The doormen who hail the taxi's for you are particularly helpful. In fact we spoke to them more often than the concierge. And on more than one occassion rather than being told how to get to an ATM say or the nearest entrance to the shopping mall, we were walked there by them. The hotel is massive yet you don't feel overwhelmed. I note the previous comment about the sound proofing between rooms, but it never bothered us. The restaurant on the 37th floor serves the best Dim Sum my wife has ever tasted apparently. It has a cracking location and when the marina is finshed, it will be the envy of the rest of Singapore, if it isn't already. I see comments about people not being able to walk to places, but that is for alot of Singapore. Taxi's are cheap anyway. I have to say that the tube network (although clean and comfortable) isn't the best, but they're still improving it. It appears the network is geared to getting the locals into the city from the outlying areas rather than having a station at every tourist hotspot. We were there for 4 days and the most we spent on our mad dash around Singapore on a taxi was Singapore $7 (around £3) to take us from the hotel to chinatown at peak time via the ERP. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to the Singapore Flyer (which blows the London Eye out of the water by the way, there's even a small tropical garden underneath it!!). The boat quay, city hall and Merlion park all a 20 - 30 minute stroll, longer if you're married and have a credit card (not looking forward to that bill!). Shopping Mall Prices by the way are no cheaper than UK, in fact often higher. Bugis Junction mall had the more realistic prices. All in all a fantastic hotel and holiday. Would I stay here again - Are you mad!! I'd be mad not to! So why not the full rack of 5 stars across trhe board. Well 4 out of 5 for value. Only because they allowed us to keep our room until 7,.00 p.m. but charged us a half day's rate (they do provide a hospitality room for a hour for those who have late flights) but we wanted to relax before our flight and not have to rush. And me being an English northerner is always looking to save where I can, but hey they are a business and it WAS a fantastic room.

Reviews.Title: “At Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: GeminiMumbai
Reviews.Content: Breathtaking - that is how I would describe the view from the 30th floor of the Pan Pacific (where I was staying). Right in the middle of Marina Bay are - the hotel is very conveniently located. Nice rooms, good facilities (pool & gym are nice) and reasonably close to the airport and the market place. Taxis are available close to the hotel round the clock. Staff is very courteous and helpful. Not too many options for vegetarians, but otherwise - the food is good. Infact, one of the few large Singapore hotels to have an Indian restaurant. The one thing to note though is that the closest MRT station is around 20 minutes walking distance. That gets a bit inconvenient. However - I understand that another MRT station was coming up at Suntec (which is very close to the hotel). For Indian travelers who usually prefer to visit Little India - this hotel is a little bit out of the way. But if you are in Singapore for business - this is in the middle of the action. Infact - the perfect location which is close to the Merlion park and other shopping malls.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Muitou
Reviews.Content: Similar experience with other reviewers: superb staff, from doorman, checkin/out counter, to chefs at breakfast buffet. Can't ask for more. Kids love the pool. The only less-than-ideal part is that besides the shopping malls around, you can't really walk around the area much.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bonedigger
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to the rave reviews on TripAdvisor. Great location, clean, efficient, excellent staff. I have only two small comments. First, the number of elevators to service that large of a hotel are woefully inadequate - on several occasions it took over 10 minutes to reach the lobby. Second, there was some confusion as to whether breakfast was included in my stay. I was told upon check in that it was and went to a lovely buffet breakfast (excellent and extensive) but was presented with a $42 bill at the end of it. I then opted not to eat breakfast at the hotel for the next two days, only to discover at checkout that the meal was included. I wish this had been made clearer. Otherwise, great hotel, lovely large rooms, recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel i've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: justme11224
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on two occasions during my Singapore/Malaysia vacation. During my first stay I got a free upgrade to a Suite. The suite was impressively large and consisted of two rooms. First room had bathroom, table with 4 chairs, large couch and a flat screen TV. Second room had a large king bed, flat screen TV, large bathroom with a standing shower, bathtub, and a wash room. The windows of the suite overlooked the large swimming pool located on the 3rd (or 4th?) floor. During my second stay I got a regular room that was about half the size of the suite but still sufficiently large. The bonus of this one was a large outside balcony that had a nice view of the downtown area (merlion, fullerton, skyscrapers) and a partial view of the ferris wheel. The location of the hotel was also quite good. It is linked directly two two large shopping malls (Marina Square and Suntec City). Using the labyrinth of passages in the malls you can make your way to the City Hall subway station without even stepping outside. I haven't quite mastered this walk, but if you follow the signs you should find it without much trouble. Overall this hotel is top notch and by far the best I've ever stayed at. I just got back from Singapore and already want to go back just to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love Pan Pacific hotels”
Reviews.Author: pinewoods
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel having stayed in 2 other Pan Pacific hotels during a holiday in Canada - we were not disappointed. The room was very comfortable with quality furnishings and a very nice bathroom. After the hustle of the city it was lovely to return to such a nice place. The pool area was very relaxing and the staff were attentive giving out towels and bottles of water and apples if you wanted one. There are 2 shopping malls which can be located from the hotel - Suntec city mall and Marina Square mall. The city tour and duck tours leave from Suntec so the hotel is ideally located. I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “The staff could NOT be any more helpful.”
Reviews.Author: ekidna6
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a four day short stay with my wife. From the moment we arrived at the lobby, we found the service staff could not help us enough. We arrived early, and were given a room then, at 0800, much earlier than the 1200 regular check-in time. The staff had organized a cake for my wife as it was her birthday, and this was delivered to our room. The room (which we received a complimentary upgrade to) was very spacious, and very clean. The pool area was delightful, with towels and bottled water given to us when we arrived, and again through out the day. At the end of our stay we were allowed a late check out which also made our trip more comfortable. The Marina square shopping center is attached to the Pan Pacific, which is both handy for shopping, and convenient when it is raining. The only draw back of the hotel I feel is the distance to the nearest MRT station, although once we did get to the train, we loved it for getting around Singapore. This one negative about Pan Pacific is sure out weighed by its positives, and the staff would be the best and most helpful I have ever seen at a hotel. It is a credit to them, and I would surely stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, exceptional customer service”
Reviews.Author: Mango_Pudding20
Reviews.Content: I booked directly from the hotel official website. Stayed 3 nights, paid for 2 and got 1 night free. The location was great with lobby access to Marina Square Mall, a short walk to Suntec Centre and other shopping areas. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. We got a room on level 33 with a fantastic city view. We enjoyed our rides on their beautiful bubble lifts. The room was very clean and comfy. This is one of the best hotel I have ever stayed in. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Looboo9
Reviews.Content: Moved to the Pan Pacific due to noise problems where we were staying in an apartment in Bugis Junction - next door to a building site. The hotel is lovely, from the outside you would never guess what lies inside. The room was very comfortable, with a huge wide screen tv, large shower separate from the bathtub, huge bed you can lose your partner in! We were luckily upgraded to a balcony room facing the harbour with great views too. Unfortunately there were still some building works taking place opposite which were audiable from our room, luckily they weren't so bad, but because I'm a light sleeper we called room service for some earplugs - the staff couldn't do enough for us - they offered to change our room immediately (at 2am), but we just asked for the earplugs which they bought up straight away. In the morning they sent up a free fruit basket and chocolates to apologise for the noise - even though we hadn't actually complained, just asked for earplugs! Then when we checked out a couple of days later the manager came out to apologise again and organised a free taxi ride for us to the airport. So it would seem the staff just can't do enough for you - an excellent 5* service in my opinion. Singapore will now always hold a special place for me now as my boyfriend asked me to marry him on Sentosa Island - we'll be back - and definitely to the Pan Pacific!

Reviews.Title: “A very fine hotel, but a couple of negatives for me.”
Reviews.Author: Wellingtonian2
Reviews.Content: Staying here right now on my third day of a three day trip en-route to Brisbane. This is without doubt an excellent hotel. Modern, stylish, fully equipped and actually with quite excellent service from the impeccably mannered staff. I upgraded to an executive room for $40 extra per night, as these room offer better views, free internet access and complimentary afternoon tea and evening drinks in the Bering Suite. I think that's not a bad price, though in my opinion, a five star hotel should be providing internet access free of charge to every single room. The pool is very good, and the gymnasium well kitted out. The use of these facilities each day made my trip particularly enjoyable. Small complaints? Well I know it's true at so many places in Singapore, but £3.50 for a can of Coke (yes, it's delivered in a can) is a joke. Drinks seem soooooo expensive yet food isn't too pricey. Also, will anyone ever invent quiet plumbing? We've sent a man to the moon but is it really so difficult to make a toilet flush quietly? Not a big deal in everyday life, but to the jet lagged traveller being woken at 3:00am it's a huge pain. The soundproofing too doesn't befit a five star establishment. You really shouldn't be able to hear next door's phone conversations. Maybe that was because our room had a connecting door, but it's still not an excuse. So overall, this is a beautiful hotel. Excellent service and the room prices represent good value. An upgrade to executive is probably worth the extra too. Just a couple of small-ish moans stop me from giving a maximum rating in any category other than service.

Reviews.Title: “You wont go wrong”
Reviews.Author: Kubica
Reviews.Content: The top 30 hotels in this list are all good, its very hard to pick a winner. Before I start, I'll say you cant go wrong with any, SIngapore Hotel standards are very high. So I'll be nit-picking in this review. Room : Comfortable sized rooms, nice full height windows, with electric blinds. All fittings excellent, room design is modern with LCD TV. Very good business table, with expensive ergonormic chair. Bedding faultless. If you're looking for grandeur, look elsewhere. But clean, modern design, this rocks. View: Great views with full height windows, but a balcony would be even better. I stayed at the Swissotel with a older, poorer room, but it had a balcony, and when u're on the 50th floor with a balcony, its unbeatable. There is nothing wrong with the view here, but I just prefer a balcony. Bathroom: Excellent. SHower is wall mounted, or hand held, comes with DUal powerful heads, so 2 people can shower at once and not have to share the water jet stream. Fittings are nice, but not grand. Location: I would say excellent, you're connected to 4 shopping malls, so even if it rains, u wont get wet. Its also very near the business area, walkable in 10 mins, but train is better, because SIngapore is hot. But still, it doesnt get 5 stars because the Train STation is 10 mins walk away (although its through beautiful malls, and airconditioned all the way). Swissotel is just right on top of the train station, 30second walk. But dont let this be a major consideration, unless you're gonna go back to the hotel 4-5 times a day. Value: Great. With UOB credit card, stay 3 nights for the price of 2. I recommend this hotel ! U wont go wrong. Definitely top ten in Singapore, but number one ? Hmm.... it lacks the charm to be number one. Its just a very very good hotel in a very very good location. FOr me, I'll take the swissotel on the 50th floor, and make do with a poorer quality room.

Reviews.Title: “A bit expensive for what you get, but hotel not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Valueskr
Reviews.Content: I'd have thought that with such rate and being one of the best chains in Asia, the hotel would have the latest (i.e. flat screen tv). IMO they have upgraded their rates but not everything in the hotel. Very nice pool, lounge area, great service staff, restaurants were good, good quality and variety food, a bit pricey though. Best deal is if you include everything in advance (i.e. Breakfast buffet and internet) because if you got two days of internet and ate twice at the breakfast buffet in one week, you already reached the break even than if you had signed up for the package in advance for 6 days. The location is not bad, very safe walking area, shopping all over.....but not close to Clarke Quay (nightlife). As opposed if you get a hotel in Clarke Quay, you get shopping restaurants and nightlife steps from your hotel. As mentioned everything is good, just a bit on the pricey side, I think you pay for the name.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Service, Space, and Location in abundance”
Reviews.Author: VisitedNewPlaces
Reviews.Content: I thought I knew what good service was until I stayed at this hotel! Their follow up was excellent on all matters, all associates were eager to help. The property was stunning, well maintained, and a delight to be at. The rooms were huge! The bathrooms were immaculate, with huge marble stand alone showers. The location was excellent, next to the Suntec City mall. One thing to note about SIngapore; If you walk 50 yards and don't find a Starbucks, your eyes aren't open. I have stayed at the Stamford Hotel prior to this stay, and teh two properties do not compare in terms of service. Choose the Pan Pacific if you desire the best in quality and service Singapore has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and memorable stay!”
Reviews.Author: moon83
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I had a 1 night stay over at Pan Pacific during last weekend.. We are both local, therefore, this is just a short getaway stay.. due to the fact my hubby just returned from his oversea work assignment. We did not expect very friendly treatment from the hotels in Singapore as they might think that we are not tourist so, there is no need for such good treatment. But to our surprise.. me being also in the customer service line, and i expect the stand to be there, Pan Pacific staffs are really friendly and nice and make us feel very welcoming!! Upon check-in, the lady over at the arrival counter take note that its our anniverary, so she make and effort to congrats us!! That surprises us and make us feel important!! Further to that, the customer relationship executive/ manager come to us and gave us our room keys.. and we were told that they will be sending a cake up.. we are very surprise!! and when we open the room.. we are welcomed by a very good city view that I've requested, and furthermore, we were being upgraded to a balcony room!! We really appreciate all the effort that Pan Pacific puts in.. they treated us liked tourists!! the room is very big and the toilet is big and clean as well! We loved the room very much till I feel liked I was in my own bedroom.. I always had this eerie feeling whenever i go to a hotel room, but this room doesn't give me any eerie feeling! Infact, I feel very at ease!! Lolx.. The cake was really delicious and nice.. if not for me going on diet, I would have finish all by myself!! The location of the hotel is also good and accessible. Its within minutes of walking to marina square and suntec. Hubby and me had already decided to make an effort to go back for a stay for our anniversary and birthdays celebrations or even a short getaway..

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel where service is paramount!”
Reviews.Author: NedGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: We stayed eight days for business and pleasure. The hotel is magnificent, the rooms are beautifully renovated and the service is first class. The guest relations reps meet you, greet you, take you to your room and familiarise you, ring you throughout your stay to ensure all is well, and even farewell you. They have first class rertaurants, agreat cocktail bar serving tapas and relaxing music to wind down by. We have stayed in a number of hotels in Singapore, and this one is number one!!! Kel N.

Reviews.Title: “Marina Bay Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: LukChang
Reviews.Content: Got to spend a few days here whilst on business. Booked through a website. Upon arrival everything was as per my booking, room on high floor with large balcony, non smoking, could not fault the receptionists, even down to escorting me to the lift. Room was large, clean & overlooking the bay finished with high quality materials that were maintained to a very good standard. Breakfast was part of my package, looking at what was charged if not inclusive then it was a very good price and the quality / service also good. Got to spend ½ day around the pool, all sunbeds that were free already had folded up towels on them, and plenty more towels available from poolside. Also given free bottles of chilled water, fresh cold towels, apples & sweets, did not even have to get up from the bed, they were brought round. The only down side for me was I was not able to get in for a spa, they seem to be booked well in advance so don’t do what I did & leave it to last minute. Looking at all the bookings can only imagine that it was also a good service. Can’t fault the staff or hotel in anyway. Great place to stay & centrally located for flyer, shopping centres, other hotels and a short walk to the subway. Definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Real 5 stars hotel, unforgetable stay, best staff ever.”
Reviews.Author: coockie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I we stayed in March 3 days at the Pan Pacific Hotel Raffles Boulevard, following a week's holiday in Thailand. Following all the good comments on Tripadvisor, we were curious to find everything out ourselves. The entry to the hotel is a bit hidden amongst various shopping malls and drive-ways, but once the taxi leaves you at the entry, you start the realise you are in a for a good stay. The lobby and registration desks are quite impressive, as is the building from the inside as well (from the outside it may look a bit less inspiring). Since we had received an email some two weeks prior to checking in requesting us to give the maximum of data already (passport numbers, addresses, room preferences), etc..., checking-in should be a matter of minutes. The evening we checked-in happened to be my birthday, and this was noticed by the check in agent, who asked to be "excused" for a second. Upon her return, we were told that we would be upgraded to a superior room, and that further registration would take place in the room itself. A very kind and genuinely interested customer assistant then continued to registration in the room, and we also received a birthday cake. We really appreciated this gesture, and it made a special day even a bit more special. The room was very nice, with nice modern interior, large enough for three day, and all details needed for a stay were available. Nice hard double bed, very silent airco, large TV, and like everything in Singpore, all very well-maintained and clean. The next three days, we really felt at home in the hotel. What makes the difference is that everyone without exception is just genuine kind and helpful, without being forced or "artificially kind". They are able to combine good service with a relaxed, feel-good attitude. The staff at the concierge-desk is there to help with any "logistic" question you may have on Singapore, with good inside-tips, help with reservations, etc ... We did not have breakfast in the hotel, and only had drinks in the top restaurant, so cannot comment too much on that. The last days, we spent some time at the swimming pool, which is pretty large for a city hotel, and where again, all details (towels, complementary water, newspapers, magazines) were taken care of. For business and privately, I have had the privilege to stay in a lot of nice and well-known hotels. There will always be a hotel which in some aspect (location, design, etc ..) stands out, but I never stayed in a hotel where I just could not find any negative point, and where the service was of such a constant very high level. I have a "6th sense" for fake or not-genuine service or friendliness, and what really made the difference at the Pan Pacific, with its staff which have exactly the attitude we like: a feel-good factor, not intrusive and making you feel at home from the moment you step in. I would not doubt a second to return and would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Singapore, and can only hope some European hotel managers have a shot stay at the Pan Pacific to experience it all by themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmpurcell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on for 2 nights. From the moment we entered the hotel the service was amazing. This was our first stop on our honeymoon and I was greeted with flowers and they upgraded our room. Breakfast was fantastic - and the location is great. There is nothing negative I can say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely rennovated, true five-star value”
Reviews.Author: tulipjones
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several hotels in the Marina area, and this one is the hands down winner for value, good food, and an all around good hotel. I also like that it is a bit closer to the subway than the Ritz or Mandarin. The staff is great (they look after you without being in your face) and the breakfast buffet wonderful. The emphasis seems to be on just being a good hotel than being a pulsating trendsetter.

Reviews.Title: “Real Staff! Spledid Service!”
Reviews.Author: redribbonstriker
Reviews.Content: Pan Pacifc was great place to stay. So pretty convenient in terms of shopping center, tourist spot, business center and the hotel looks so gorgeous. Not only that I was so amazed with one of their staff who brought me straight to my room. She is almost the same name with my daughter Eva. Almost the same but her spelled Ava. She was very professional, she was real! She knew I had a 6months old daughter she had prepared the baby cot in my room and gave me an extended late check out with out charge due that day my daughter was a little sick. She was just amazing that she can understand my needs. My advice is, if you need a real Help look for her at Pan Pacific Singapore. She is the best staff i ever encountered since the day me and my wife been travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location... great value”
Reviews.Author: QKL
Reviews.Content: Was there for a getaway in february as it is my wedding anniversary. location: perfect! there are links to 3 shopping malls - marina square, millenium walk and suntec city. short distance to esplanade too. room: spacious with a huge bathroom (separate tub and shower cubicle). looks posh. I especially like the various plugs and connectors provided in a well-organised drawer. overall... great value! do check out for attractive promotions from the hotel's website!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: exitrose
Reviews.Content: Our recent trip to the Pan Pacific was also our first, and we were upgraded to an Executive Level room. The main facilities of the hotel are open to all, and the friendly staff on the desk treat everyone with the same degree of courtesy and respect. The lobby is tastefully decorated, with a bar on the ground floor (where continental breakfast is served in the morning), and there are a number of restaurants within the hotel. We ate breakfast in the Global Kitchen restaurant, and the large variety available on the buffet (contintenal, Japanese, English/American cooked breakfast, dim sum, pastries, etc) is impressive, and of a high standard. As the Executive rooms are on higher floors, they have great views of the city through the huge floor-to-ceiling windows. The rooms were very tastefully decorated, spotlessly clean, and have great bathrooms. There are tea and coffee making facilties, a mini-bar, and robes/slippers available, and high-speed wifi is free in this level of room. The best thing about being in an Executive Level room is the access to the Executive Floor, which contains the lounge. Breakfast is available in here in the mornings (smaller range than the main restaurant, but still a good variet), and there's even an egg chef to cook your eggs to order. They serve morning coffee, afternoon tea (which includes cocktail sandwiches, bite-sized cakes, scones, and dim sum), and hors d'oeuvres and free house pours (really great wine choices) from 5:30-7:30- all of which is free of charge. Tea, coffee and hot chocolate are available 24-7, again without further cost.. It's great to be able to pop in after a day of sight-seeing (or straight from a trans-atlantic flight, as we did), and know there are refreshments available. The hotel is very well located for access to the MRT stations, or for walking. Boat Quay, with its many restaurants, is only a pleasant 10-15 minute walk away, for example. Taxis in Singapore are cheap, so don't be afraid to hop in one if the heat is too much for you. Many cabs will take cards, but do check before you start driving! We enjoyed our stay so much, that we booked a room here for our one-night stopover on the return leg of our journey. Although the Executive level rooms are more expensive than the standard (and in Singapore, most hotels are expensive!), we felt it was worth the extra money (though perhaps not, if you don't intend to have breakfast at the hotel) for the level of service, and the fact that they could guarantee an early check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: moonbather
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on way back from Australia. As we were flying with Singapore Airlines we were provided with complimentary buffet breakfast which was among the best we have seen. We were upgraded on arrival to a panorama room and had an amazing view of Raffles from the huge window in our room, our room also overlooked the swimming pool. The room was very large as was the bathroom, the room, linen and towels were all beautifully clean. The staff were amazing very attentive and helpful, this includes the pool staff who were very quick to bring towels and iced water to us when we approached the pool side. It is a little walk via the subway to the MRT but the walk is all air conditioned. Taxi to the airport from the hotel at the end of our stay only cost $13.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: adhunaiv
Reviews.Content: Pan Pacific Singapore is a courteous and comfortable hotel right at the Marina. Location-wise it is one of the best, well connected to places of interest as well as business district and nearly all modes of transport including bus and MRT are nearby. Rooms are of comfortable size, and remote-controlled blinds are a special attraction! In these days of 5-star terror, their level of security was really comforting. The key-card-only access to lifts and staircases is limited to the respective floor only (e.g. a 1916 no. room key will give access to 19th floor only through both lift and staircase); and there are plain-clothes security casually roaming the public-access floors to watch for any untoward incident or loitering public. Service is courteous, they try their best to help their guests enjoy their Singapore stay. What impressed me the most was the way our casual comment at the time of checking-out, about the cooling-time of the room a/c (it was more than expected on 3 days out of 7), was taken up really seriously by the management : we received a mail 2 days later how all their equipment was checked and the problem was traced and cooling time of any room will now be equal at the very minimum.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with amazing views”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel051
Reviews.Content: As a first visit to Singapore it was worth paying the extra for the bay view. Brilliant lifts on the outside giving panoramic views. Very clean with helpful and charming staff. We would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for our Family Stay in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Pavalia
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit to the Pan Pacific Hotel and we stayed for 4 weeks, during July; a family of 5, with children aged 7,3,3. This 5 star hotel is wonderful value for money; clean, good-sized bedroom with huge bed, and we also had an extra single-bed put in, so that we could all be accommodated in the same room - something that was very important to us with small children. The bedroom has a flat-screen TV. The bathroom is large and very well thought out.......a very comfortable stay. Staff are very friendly, helpful, courteous and welcoming. Room service fast and efficient. We enjoyed the fantastic buffet breakfast every morning in the Global Kitchen.........a huge choice of foods, and so tasty - my children still talk about it! Also do try to have Sunday Champagne Lunch Buffet there - (starve yourself beforehand though!)....it is to die for! We will definitely stay at the Pan Pacific again.......it is really a business hotel, I think, but it met and surpassed all our needs and was perfect for a great family stay. There is a great pool there too, and we also liked the proximity to the shopping centres.

Reviews.Title: “luxury,convenient, perfect”
Reviews.Author: LondonChiswick
Reviews.Content: Perfect central locations for shopping and to watch the new year procession which we were fortunate to catch that night. Concierge very helpful with what to see and how to get there. Well equipped, clean room, ours was on the 14th floor, quiet, luxurious bathroom. Like the "international" plug sockets which took UK style plugs. Warm welcome from reception and immediate offer of a late checkout without having to ask. Gym opened at 6:30am and well equipped with at least 2 cross trainers, several running machines, weight machines, free weights, remember to bring your own music their music wasnt working. Note about Singapore If you are on a quick stopover and wanted to do sightseeing at 8am on a Sunday morning, nothing is open except the Ferris Wheel which is very expensive and not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Everything it should be”
