Reviews.Author: Marcus_and_Wendy
Reviews.Content: There are 2 Pan Pacific hotels in Singapore - one on Orchard Rd and one on Raffles Blvd. The first thing you'll be asked by your taxi driver is 'which one do you want to go to', so it is wise to be prepared for this question. This review is about the Pan Pacific on Raffles Blvd. It is a large, modern hotel with good facilities for both business and leisure travel. Its a something-for-everyone style of hotel with everything from a very large resort-style pool outside to a classy and quiet late-night bar inside. We found the service to be excellent, with friendly staff eager to make our stay as pleasant as possible. The hotel is linked by an enclosed walkway across to the huge Marina Square shopping centre, and from there you can link to an underground mall through to the City Hall MRT station. There is plenty of English signage both to the station and then back to the several big hotels in the area, so no chance of getting lost. Our experience of the Pan Pacific was that it was everything it should be - large, clean room with good facilities and impressive view, attentive staff, good location and good atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality”
Reviews.Author: AliceAsiaFusion
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Chose panoramic room with fantastic view of Singapore harbour. This hotel has excellent service especially at check in desk. Welcome warm. Location very good for sight-seeing, shopping and restaurants. Can easily buy breakfast nearby if reservation does not include breakfast. Hotel has a bakery on the ground floor. Only minus: service in ground floor bar very slow, waitresses speak insufficient English.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is first class”
Reviews.Author: seekinghoney
Reviews.Content: I couldn't recommend this hotel high enough. The hotel is fantastic, which is remarkable - given it's size!! We stayed here on our honeymoon, as the customer service desk could not do enough for us. Jen, who works for the hotel is a true professional when it comes to making you feel welcome. The location is good, although a bit of a walk to the MRT, but don't let this put you off as it truly is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: apawley
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in December with my wife and children (ages 9 & 12). Had interconnecting rooms, high up in the hotel. Service was excellent, interconnecting rooms represented excellent value, with great views. View inside the atrium, with lit lifts going up and down is very impressive. They had a wonderful ginger bread house (full-size) in the atrium! Good location, by conference centre and Singapore flier. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - excellent value”
Reviews.Author: DanBloomsbury
Reviews.Content: Turned up and the hotel had not received booking from agent (Opodo) but everything sorted out and price (excellent value) honoured. Room excellent, service excellent, bed very comfortable, shower worked well, location excellent. How a business five star hotel ought to be. Within a few years will need of a makeover, but highly recommeneded.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for shopping and food”
Reviews.Author: Hotelme
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a Pan Pacific hotel before and was really impressed with my first stay. I was lucky enough to be upgraded to one of the Harbour View rooms. The hotel is well located to Suntec shopping area and is only a short walk to Harbour Foreshore. I loved the restaurants within the hotel, they have a signature Japanese and Indian restaurant within the hotel. I loved them both and ate there twice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: CzechTravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three days during our honeymoon trip though south-east Asia. We arrived at hotel very late (aroud 10 p.m.) directly from our last treck in Borneo. At the reception there was no problem with our a bit dirty clothes (due tu the treck) and with late hour, the receptionist was very pleasant and complaisant. And above all my wife got a wonderful orchid flowers as a gift to our marriage. A bit later a hotel guy served us the great chocolate cake with congratulation to our honeymoon.It was really heartwarming. We had a clean room in 22nd floor with very nice view to the town and to the superb swimming pool. We swam there every late evening (opening hours are till 11 p.m.). We were very satisfied with all hotel’s services which were at the level of 5-star hotel. The hotel has a wonderful atrium. Elevators with big glass windows have an interesting view. Vitek and Paja, Czech, [--]

Reviews.Title: “Just an Average Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: TravelerExplorer
Reviews.Content: I've seen some good reviews about this hotel so I decided to go with Pan Pacific. However, I found the hotel to be simply average. The room, the service, and the facilties were just average. Pan Pacific, located near the Marina, is great if you want to do shopping at either the Marina Square or the Suntec Mall, but that's about it. I wasn't impressed especially after they failed to have the room ready as requested. I had requested an extra bed because I was staying with my wife and two young children. At checl-in, I was amazed when the receptionist told me that I did not request an extra bed. She obviously didn't want to admit mistake on the hotel's part. Luckily, I had a copy of the e-mail that showed the request. The issue was resolved, but I would recommend that you take a copy of your reservation with you. Pan Pacific makes mistakes but will not want to admit it. My recommendation is skip Pan Pacific. Go to Shangri-La. It's more expensive, but it's well worth it. That's where we stayed at the end of our vacation in Singapore and I wish we had stayed there throughout our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pool”
Reviews.Author: PennyScotland
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific Singapore (not to be confused with the PP Orchard Road, also in Singapore) has all the facilities one would expect of a 5* hotel. However, as we did not use any of these, apart from the swimming pool, we make no comment on them. The swimming pool is very good. Large, sheltered, suitable for serious swimming and for small children. We rated it very highly. When approaching the pool an attendant immediately provides a towel and a bottle of cold water. The gymnasium is adjacent so one can work off previous excesses and cool down with a swim. We arrived very early at about 0800 expecting to put our bags into store. Very helpfully we were allowed to book into our room early because occupancy rates were low. Nevertheless this was a very good start. Throughout our stay the staff were friendly and very helpful. Rooms were cleaned twice a day. Like most 5* hotels, laundry costs were expensive, eg £6 per shirt. It would be more cost effective to buy shirts from one of the adjacent malls and either throw them away or take the with you than pay for laundry. We stayed in a Deluxe room (which really means standard these days) which was very generously proportioned and the bed very large and comfortable. Beware the fully stocked minibar which has wizzard technology and anything removed for more than 30 seconds is automatically charged to you account. So if you want to make room in the fridge for something of your own, bear this in mind. We mostly ate out but food in the hotel was OK albeit slightly pricey. The same quality is available at much lower cost elsewhere. Two large shopping malls can be accessed directly from the hotel. Shops range from high end European designers to the French Carrefour supermarket. There are dozens of cheap eating places in the malls, but fast food rather than quality. Overall impression: We liked the Pan Pacific, particularly the pool, well proportioned room and bed, and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: overseassoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ the Pan Pacific for 8 nights over New Year. Service was outstanding and efficient, yet personable. The rooms were modern, clean and finished to high specification ie separate shower and bathroom. We had a room on the 20th floor overlooking the marina so spectacular views of the city @ night. Breakfast excellent although we explored the many hawker centers for a cheaper and ethnic option. Fantastic swimming pool with "underwater" music, staff on hand to ensure access to towels, water, sunscreen and bar/menu requests. A truly pleasurable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: brendoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific as stop over on our way to Ireland. From the moment you step near the entrance, you are pampered by excellent staff whom aim to please. The hotel has maintained a high standard from reception to room service. Nothing was too hard and yet the service was never over powering. We had 4 days of luxury prior to spending Xmas in a cooler climate. We booked direct with the hotel and got a great rate but you need to be able to accept exchange rate fluctuations.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ccrr77fr
Reviews.Content: Pan Pacific is a very comfortable hotel with nice bedrooms with great views and perfect bathrooms very large and clean and i could say, it's a very good adress in Singapore. I've stayed in this hotel in the middle of 2008 for business and i've been very happy with all the things i've experienced. The room was large, nice and super comfy, the staff so smily and efficient and i've been invited, as Pan Pacific frequent guest, to a management cocktail with a lot of delicious canapés and some nice talks with management staff members. I've stayed in some other hotels in Singapore but this one is a bit better and the value is more attractive. For example, between the expensive Ritz Carlton Millenia and Pan Pacific, i would choose Pan Pacific because the staff is better and the design of the bedroom more actual. The only bad thing is the location. I don't especially like the location in the middle of busy roads full of cars and you can't find a nice and cool restaurant around in the evening. It's too quiet and a bit dark at night. An other thing which disappoint me a bit is no response from the management after a congratulations letter. The GM should take a better care of the guests who are happy... But this is a very good hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: danusz
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Pan Pacific for 3 nights during my honeymoon trip to Asia. The hotel is fabulos great location in the Marina Square near rhe malls.The room was great,big and very clean. The staff was very polite. I highly recoment this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short stopover”
Reviews.Author: damilster
Reviews.Content: I recently had to hastily arrange a stopover in Singapore and opted for the Pan Pacific. I did this because I had too much time to just stay in an airport hotel. It turned out to be a good choice. You get all the amenities you expect from a 4 star hotel and it is close to the Singapore harour area. Whilst flying in my bag had been damaged in the plane's hold and as I was travelling to a number of destinations I wanted to get it sorted. The hotel staff were great, they organised everything. I gave them the bag at 7pm and by 8am I had picked it up again as good as new.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality as expected”
Reviews.Author: Fandango'ne
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at a Pan Pacific before we were confident in selecting this hotel for our 1 night stop-over. We were not disappointed. Reception staff were v professional and friendly. There is a very large and stylish lobby area with glass lifts. We took a room upgrade under the Singapore airlines scheme. The room was large, the bed was very comfy and the whole room was 'singapore clean'. Nice modern bathroom with separate spacious shower. Breakfast is of epic proportions, with incredible variety (eg 4 types of smoked fish), and seemingly endless choice. Large swimming pool and the whole outdoor are was very attractive. Warning: Drinks at the lobby bar are incredibly expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pac was great!!”
Reviews.Author: happitraveller72
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at the Pan Pacific Singapore near Marina Bay from Dec. 26 to Dec. 30, We immensely enjoyed our stay at this fabulous hotel, the service and the staff were all happy to help and assist in any way they can. Rooms were clean and adequate in size. (The pillows were a bit hard though....my only complain). The buffet breakfast provided with our stay was a feast, juices,bread,congee, salads you name it they have it. Convenient location as you can stroll through Marina Centre Mall, to the Esplanade or Suntec City Mall. You can even walk to the Singapore Flyer as it is just around the corner. Nice glass elevators inside and outside view of the city. Overall, a great stay at a superb hotel!! Keep it up Pan Pac!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not deluxe, but great service”
Reviews.Author: JamieKate
Reviews.Content: There are quite a few hotels around the Marina area in Singapore with not much to distinguish them from each other. The Pan Pacific falls into this category in that there is nothing amazing about it, but I found it a very comfortable hotel. I had a spacious double room with a balcony. The design of the interior is innovative and despite all the rooms being round an atrium there was no noise from the lobby. The rooms are quite bland, but clean and functional. Other plus points of the Pan Pac - extensive room service menu with good quality food, lovely Japanese restaurant in the hotel, friendly helpful staff on reception, at the concierge and taxi rank, comfortable large beds, separate bath and shower, good location for CBD and if you are there on holiday. Downsides - I went to the spa for a massage and was kept waiting for nearly 20 mins, to get to the pool and spa areas you have to go outside, which isn't great if it's raining, spa is not luxurious and definitely overpriced for the setting, which is a bit tatty. If you want beautiful, then like most of the Marina area the surrounds of Pan Pac are v. concrete and look like a multi storey. Overall would definitely stay there again, liked it better than the Shangri La and value for money it beats the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn´t have asked for a better hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: stef1981
Reviews.Content: We chose this Hotel for our honeymoon and were not disapointed. it was our first time in Singapore and the location was perfect. On arrival we were given a room upgrade, wild orchids for my wife, a cake, fruit and our own concierge to give us help during our stay! The hotel is very impressive from the moment you walk in, clean, modern and with very friendly staff. It is connected via a shopping centre on the entrance lobby to lots of other underground shops. Within 10 minutes you are at Raffles hotel and in a further 5 minutes at the Merlion on the harbour. The hotel pool is lovely and there are several good restaurants in the hotel although it´s quick and easy to get to others nearby. On our first night we ate in the restaurant on the top floor and had a great meal whilst watching the city at night. Can´t recomend this hotel enough. We had a great time in Singapore which is a clean, friendly and interesting introduction to the east.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Stopover Choice”
Reviews.Author: RobFindlater
Reviews.Content: My wife, her mother and our daughter stayed overnight at the Pan Pacific en route back to the UK from Australia. I'd pre-arranged the booking direct with the hotel after initially selecting the accommodation from reading Tripadvisor reviews and then from looking on the hotels web site I noted a good deal if you were flying with Singapore Airlines and signed up to their KrisFlyer programme. Providing certain travel criteria were met and you could show inbound and outbound Signapore airlines boaring passes the deal on offer was a free upgrade to the next available room category, a late check-out and either a limo collection from the airport or a meal subsidy, (we chose the airport collection). Based on my booking experience, which was extremely easy, and my wife's feedback I'd have no hesitation in recommending this establishment. Room - a decent size, great facilities and very clean. Staff - exceptionally friendly and couldn't do enough for my family, especially my baby daughter. Service - fast an efficient. Hotel facilities - excellent, all amenities that my family requested and a very good and clean swimming pool to relax in. Price - I found it offered good value for money based on its star rating, the facilities on offer and location. Location - centrally located, right next to a shopping area if you are after that sort of thing and within 20 mins drive of the airport. Overall - An excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doofyboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the location for a Leadership training held by the company. We had only two days to spare beside the actual training and we wanted to make sure that we had a hotel with a staff who would guide us to the right places (not the usual Sentosa stuff). We landed at a time when the hotel was undergoing a major renovation. However, we never experienced any discomfort on that count. The staff were very knowledgeable about genuine Singapore experiences and guided us to some joints most tourists would not have heard about. I would love the opportunity to go back now that the renovation is over.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: jacko657
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews on Tripadvisor, I booked directly with the hotel. I had some problems with contacting with them by the e mail initially whilst trying to arrange an early check in and was starting to get annoyed with their lack of response. Once I got in touch with them they could not have been more helpful. Upon arrival at the hotel, I actually thought I had been mistaken for someone else! I felt like royalty! The staff are wonderful and cannot do enough for you. I was starting a trip to Australia and Hong Kong and now I am back this was the best hotel by far. The elevators are a delight every time and the reception when you walk into the hotel is great, so helpful. My hotel room was beautiful, very spacious, lovely bathroom, great balcony looking out over the Merlion Park and the hotel is only a 5 minute walk from the Raffles. The housekeeping come to your room every night for a turn down which was really nice and everything was so clean. It is central to everything, trips to Sentosa, the Flyer, Orchid Gardens, if you don't do a pre booked excursion then they are within half an hour in a taxi. I have nothing bad to say about the Pan Pacific, it was simply wonderful and when I go back to Singapore I definitely want to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Delakotam
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Great staff. Wonderful experience. The first floor bar prices are way too high though.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Ninjaman0714
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel. Room was very clean, great bathroom. Balcony was convenient with a great view over the Marina. Staff were very friendly, and even allowed me a late checkout at no extra cost - and this was on the evening of the start of the F1 Grand Prix weekend, and my room was directly overlooking the circuit. I was very pleasantly surprised that they facilitated me. Staff also attempted to get me linked up with another hotel to check out the Night Safari (as a group, since they themselves did not have any arrangements for that evening). Even though they were not able to find any spot for me for this, this was pretty much my fault, as I only gave them about 3 hours notice. Nevertheless, they made the effort, and when they could not find a group tour for me to join, they gave me full directions and advice on getting it done solo, which I ended up doing, and had a great time. Location is fantastic, connected directly to a few shopping centres. Within Suntec, you can also find a lot of tour companies (close to the food court), such as HiPPO tours (hop on hop off bus tour). Also, within a few minutes walk are the Raffles Hotel (to stop in and have a Singapore Sling), New Asia Bar (71st floor of the Swissotel The Stamford - a must to-do just for 1 drink to take in the view at night). Clarke Quay is also just a few minutes taxi ride away. About 10 mins drive to Little India and Chinatown, Sim Lim Square (great for electronics), 25 mins drive to Sentosa Island, 35-40 minutes to Night Safari. Taxis are easy and affordable, so no big deal. I use the Pan Pacific a lot in Kuala Lumpur, so was pretty confident of the quality when I decided to book this one. No regrets, worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Over The Top !”
Reviews.Author: Travelor42
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific Singapore was by far the best hotel we have ever stayed in! The service is excellant, as a matter of fact, when you exit the cab, the greeting is "Welcome Home" and they sincerly mean it. If you ring for room service, they ring you back in a matter of minutes to ensure that your need was accomodated. The breakfast buffet in the Global Kitchen is simply wonderful, and the staff there are the most amazing people. Not to mention the most beautiful views in all of Singapore. Each and every person there is truly devoted to the task of excellance, and they are indeed, the Best of the Best!

Reviews.Title: “Top quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mindaiste
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night in October with a 2-year old. Everything was great. The hotel is very well situated, not too far from the airport, though close to the old district and linked to a huge shopping center. The design is impressive (those elevators...), the room was cosy, well designed, with all the comfort you can expect from such an hotel. The breakfast was abundant and had a lot of diversity (from hash browns to lobster dumplings). The service was really excellent, with everybody trying to please you and smiling. We had a late check-out (3pm) as our daughter needed to nap before flying. They have an offer with Singapore Airlines boarding passes which is really reasonable. Honestly, I have nothing bad to tell about this place. Definitely will go back there when in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosietas
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Pan Pacific. Really beautiful hotel and the staff were exceptional. Our room was very nice, well appointed and clean. The only drawback was we were very tired after our flight and went to bed early but couldn't sleep because of the singer in foyer! Never had that problem before! We were given a late check out because our flight was delayed by 8 hours and we were very grateful. A very nice touch and I felt the hotel staff couldn't do enough for us and seem to really care that we were held up. The location is very central and there are numerous shops and restaraunts in the area. Raffles is a short 10 minute walk away but beware if you dine there! We had a glass of house wine each, a peice of fish between us and a serving of fried rice and the bill came to over $125! I kid you not! A once in a lifetime experience! Little India and Arab Street are within walking distance if you like to walk which we do. If you don't you can use the Hop On, Hop Off service outside the hotel. If you fly Singapore Airlines it's free or $12 if not and you can use the ticket all day. It takes you all around the city and is great value. Don't be afraid to travel by public transport as everyone we met were extremely friendly and helpful. So my only real problem with the hotel and I left it until last because I hate to be negative is that before we checked into the hotel and after I paid for the accomodation in advance I sent an email requesting information about doing something special there for our anniversary. No reply and I couldn't help wondering if any one had actually read it! It might not have been important to management but it was to us as it was our 30th wedding anniversary. So one tiny suggestion is that they read emails from their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Gissy44
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at Pan Pacific Singapore on a stopover. From our very first booking contact to our final check out we were given superb service. Great location for access to the Hop on Hop Off bus and Suntec. We were given a late check out and were able to continue using the pool until late in the day as we had a late flight. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the business district”
Reviews.Author: tvarad
Reviews.Content: Booked a two night stay on my stop-over from Bali last month and was not disappointed. I got a 21st floor room with a nice view of the pool. The hotel exudes comfort and it was just great to collapse onto the luxurious bed after an exhausting day. The hotel is attached to the Marina Bay Mall with a gazillion shops and good eateries through which you have to walk to get to the City Hall metro station. It's a little longer walk than people may like though. All in all, a great experience and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel i've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Katieflossom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was unbeliveable! by far, the most amazing hotel i've stayed in. I was lucky enough to stay here for 9 nights on a business trip. The hotel was definately a 5* - the room was amazing, huge double bed, SO clean, hude tv, loads of storage, desk by the window (which was huge and had a great view of the skyscrapers outside), remote control blinds. The bathroom was the best bit for me! It was all glass, and so beautiful. Huge deep bath, huge shower, toilet was behind its own little glass door, massive marble sink and counter, and dressing table with big stool and huge mirror and stand alone mirror to do make up in. I felt like a princess! The room service was very reasonabley priced, and i ordered dinner to my room one night and it arrived in 10 mins and was delicious. There are about 5 restaurants in the hotel, and the breakfast was exceptional. There is also a hotel enterance into the Suntec shopping centre, very convenient as you can stay in the cool aircon! I would very much recommend if you are staying in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Do It!!”
Reviews.Author: Sportsvaughan
Reviews.Content: This place is the dog's doo-dah's of hotels in Singapore. From knowing plenty of people who've spent time in Singapore during stop-offs and business I think we got it right. This was the first part of our week in the region, and it set the standard. From the breathtaking moment of entering the tranquil, HUGE reception, to the well-wishes and smiles on our departure, the Pan Pacific got it spot on. Location couldn't be any better, with everything literally on the door step from raffles to shopping malls, to transport, to Food courts. Facilities were perfect, and the rooms were outstanding. Our stay was 3 nights, and would have been extended if our itinerary wasn't so short. Don't miss this experience!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: mscah100
Reviews.Content: Was here about a year ago to this day (can't believe I didn't review it!) on a 2-day business conference. The staff who handled my check in was excellent, very personalised service, asked me about my newspaper preferences, when I would be checking out, offered me a room to freshen up after the conference ended. The room was very big, with a very comfortable king-sized bed. Large bathroom, very clean and impeccable quality. Relaxing rain shower with separate bath tub and toilet. Nice view of the pool and whatever was on that side (can't remember that part). Good location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific sets the benchmark”
Reviews.Author: Lone-travels
Reviews.Content: We booked the Pan Pacific for a short business/ pleasure trip. The price for our booked room seemed very reasonable compared to hotels with similar facilities. We arrived a little earlier than the published check-in time and our room was not ready. However, we were immediately upgraded to a panoramic room which was ready without additional cost. The new room had amazing views over the Marina and was furnished to a high specification and was immaculately presented. We could not fault the room, any of the hotels facilities or the tremendously high service standard of every employee from the reception to cleaning staff. We didn't eat or drink in the hotel as the city has such a stunning range of restaurants. However, the bars and restaurants looked every bit 5 star as the rest of the hotel. The hotel has covered links to the local malls and convention centre so you don't have to venture outside unnecessarily. This proved very handy as there were some heavy showers during our stay. Also, it is slightly difficult to access the hotel from the street.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel in which to end our Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Jankiwi
Reviews.Content: We booked the Pan Pacific for on the way back from a tour of China. It was more than we payed for the hotel which we stayed in the last time we stopped in Singapore, but we knew that prices generally had increased somewhat and we figured we would be in need of a bit of luxury by the time we got there! It was was worth every single cent! We arrived at 7am, very tired from an overnight flight from Beijing expecting at best to be able to store our rucksacks somewhere. The friendly receptionist not only found us a room for immediate check in but upgraded us to a balcony room and organised a late check out for us! Needless to say we were already sold, but it just got better and better! Nice touches like fresh towels on the sunbeds and staff appearing with bottles of chilled water as soon as you sat down and smiles and greetings from staff as you walked around really topped off our already amazing holiday. And if you think hotels never read your online feedback, think again! On our second to last day, I received a request for feedback in my email, which I was only to eager to fill in and complement them on their excellent service. The only minor (very minor!) complaint I had was that my husband would have like the aircon to be a bit colder. 2 hours later I was sat in the room when an engineer came around to check the aircon unit having picked up the comment on my feedback! I can not recommend this hotel enough, it was fab!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel- A Gem”
Reviews.Author: sailorann
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific, Marina Bay hotel in Singapore from October 11th - October 14th. This hotel is right in the heart of the maria square area and is attached to the marina square complex. We arrived at our hotel at 1:30 am due to a delay in UA arrival. The hotel staff was extreamly friendly and warm even at this late check in. We got a great room and our bagged were taken up to our room waiting for us. The room was spectacular! All the ammenities you would expect from a 5+ star hotel. It felt like the spa treatment. The room was comfortable and all international plugs, etc. worked no problem. No adapators needed. The hotel is attached to a huge shopping complex (on of the national passtimes is shopping). We wisely, did not take the package for buffet breakfast as the shopping mall and Suntec city have a variety of places to eat that are substantially lower price than the hotel breakfasts. At night you can also go through Maria Square and get to Glutton Bay. There are a variety of hawkers that set up stalls here where you can sample a variety of local cuisines. Also great for Muslims, as many of the stalls are halal. Take the shuttle bus from the airport it only costs $8 SG per person. You cannot book the shuttle bus back from the hotel, but you can take a taxi. It costs around $21 SG for two people, so a few more dollars than the shuttle bus. If you really want to save a few dollars, then you can go to the Mandarin Hotel also attached to Mariana square, and you can book the shuttle bus from there. Would recommend you also get the tourist card at this mall, it's free and saves you money at a lot of the establishments within the mall. We saved quite a bit of money here! The downside of the location of this hotel is it is a good 10- 15 minute walk to the closest MRT station City Hall. You can walk underground all from the hotel, but it is a bit of a distance. Overall, I loved this hotel. The hotel was beautiful and modern, and the room was fantatic. The staff went out of their way to help us out and answer our questions. They attended to our every need with a smile. I would definely stay here again. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “First class, with a few glitches”
Reviews.Author: jjstives
Reviews.Content: Review for Pan Pacific Hotel, Singapore By almost any standard, this is a first rate hotel. It sits in the fast-paced Market Square area of the city and is close to several great shopping mall complexes and the waterfront. It is not in the more crowded and hustling “downtown” area where many other hotels like Marriott, Hyatt, Four Seasons, Hilton and Goodwood are located. The nearest subway station is a good walk from the underground lobby of the hotel. The four night stay was booked through Bookings.com and prepaid. I had a room on the 30th floor that had no great view, looking out on the façade of the Conrad Hotel next door...not the best view and certainly, as it turned out, not the quietest. Before criticizing, I must point out that Singapore, its hotels and its airline in particular, currently seem to be the most hospitable in the world. From the time I boarded SIA flight 0001 in San Francisco, the courtesy, customer service and facilities exceeded anything I have seen elsewhere in many years. I would compare the hospitality and interest in guests’ and visitors’ comfort and welfare in Singapore to that of Bermuda in that those people in tourism related businesses seem to understand that service is the key to tourist good will and return business. I must also point out that I picked a very busy and special event week for my visit, even though I did not know this until I got there. It was thus an unhappy turn of events when, on my last night there, the party noise from outside the hotel was such that sleeping in my room was impossible. The volume of what some might call “music” and drumming that would overwhelm the most intense Koto Japanese Drum performance was unending, even for me with less than perfect hearing. The racket started at around 9PM and went on until after two in the morning. Several calls to the front desk yielded apologies but also the response that there was nothing they could do about it. Unable to sleep, I got dressed and went to lobby and the front desk where a serious, but affable night manager told me there was little they could do because the music was not coming from the hotel but from somewhere nearby. It was, according to him, a party for the drivers of the Formula One competition that was being held in the city that weekend. If in fact the Gran Prix Race car drivers were partying after 2AM on the day they were to take qualifying rounds on the city’s newly build racecourse, it seemed unlikely that they would be doing much driving that day. In any case, the manager told me that even the police could not stop it and moved me to another room for the rest of the night. But my sleep cycle was ruined and I left for Hong Kong the next morning, hardly refreshed and having paid over $900 for the noisy room. Singapore has some of the strongest laws and law enforcement in the world. Penalties for even small infractions are strict and harsh, so it seemed odd that in this climate the city could not deal with such a disturbance. While it can be argued that this was an abnormal situation, I found it unacceptable at any price and the hotel had nearly tripled its usual rates for this event week. I think that when they do this, they owe a great deal more to the paying guest in terms of meeting normal expectations and common needs, such as a quiet night’s sleep. My trip had nothing to do with the F1, but everything in the city that week was calibrated towards it, so heaven help the poor soul who, like me, just happened to be there then. The hotel offered no compensation, only apologies. Not enough for the ruined four day visit and certainly not enough to have me recommend the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel to stay in, In Singapore!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Harvsman
Reviews.Content: This was the last leg of my trip back to Australia from Europe and Dubai (Emirates are a fantastic airline by the way) I had decided to have a 5 day 4 night stopover in Singapore and had originally booked the Fairmont. However when i saw that the Pan Pacific was nearly $400 cheaper and getting better reviews i cancelled the Fairmont and booked here, best decision i ever made!!!!!! Upon arrival i noticed they have dedicated lines for Arrivals/Departures/Concierge etc, "What a great idea" i thought! The guy that checked me in was very polite and efficient, Before i knew it i was heading up the glass elevator/lift to my room on the 18th floor. The Atrium is amazing and about 40 stories high. Once i got into the room i noticed it had a bit of a Polynesian theme to it, As does most of the hotel. Truth be told the room itself is probably more of a 4 star but it's the facilities and staff that make this a 5 star hotel. The bed was very comfortable and the plasma tv had about 25 channels including Star World, Star Movies, Mtv etc etc. My room had a nice view of the Suntec Convention Centre and the Conrad Hotel. My room also had electronic blinds but didnt have a balcony, Apparently some rooms do, Some dont. I had a shower and bath, with decent tolietries in the bathroom. I also had a Clock with built in Alarm, etc. I didnt get to use the bar but i noticed each night they had live entertainment with a woman singing. The pool is fantastic and open until 11pm each night! I had a few swims in it and loved the fact they pump music under the water, Great to just lie on your back and look up at the sky! The deep end must of been at least 3 to 4 metres. it was so deep i could never touch the bottom, And i'm 177cm tall so it must be very deep! I never got to use the gym but i did use the business centre, The Internet was very good and the staff up there are so polite and friendly! The location: Probably the only downside but not enough to keep me away. About a 15 - 20 min walk through Citylink, Suntec City and Marina Square mall's. I'd suggest you don't take the MRT from the airport to City Hall MRT and walk to this hotel unless you know the area, Otherwise you could be walking for hours! It is signposted but you've got to know where to look, (If you see a HMV and an American Diner you're heading in the right direction) I'd suggest taking the MRT too the airport on checkout, As by then you should know the area! Staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble! If this is an indication of how all Pan Pacific's are i will be making sure i stay in quite a few! Will definitely stay here again next time i'm in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Stylish, Pan Pacific sets a brilliant perspective of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Kittoos
Reviews.Content: Top of the line business hotel. Makes you feel elite, makes every other hotel a compromise. I travelled with my parents. They feel they've spent their most memorable five days of their lives. The staff's world class, warm and friendly (singapore's all about friendly people), special mention has to go to jolin & co. at wellness village (the hotel's spa), they made our vacation really really special!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dvh2
Reviews.Content: You will not be disapointed. The best views, the best food, the best service & the best value five star hotel in south east asia. My wife & my daughter stayed here on our trip to and from Europe. After the second rate service in Europe coming back was a god send. What an exceptional experience to finish our trip on. My only advice would be to book a high floor with harbour views. Why would you want to miss the fantastic views. Exceptional hotel & staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, slightly out of the way for tourists”
Reviews.Author: bakerbass
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay at the Pan Pacific and received wonderful customer service at check in, check out, and after my stay. The room was very large and extremely well done, and the bathroom was one of the better ones I've seen. For business, it would have been a perfect location as it is near where I've been for business in Singapore on other trips. But for tourism, one of the other Pan Pacific locations might be better. However, I was very impressed with the hotel and will look for others of that brand on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “extremely stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: michelleNorthampton
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific is the most stylish hotel I've ever stayed in. It was beatifully decorated and spotlessly clean - as you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The staff were so friendly and helpful that we felt nothing was too much trouble, even allowing us up to the higher floors to look around the business centre. The atrium and lifts are exceptional - it is the highest atrium in Asia, and the outside lift which goes all the way to the restaurant at the top was an experience in itself. The rooms were spacious, and we were lucky enough to have a balcony, even though we were on the 14th floor! There are all the facilities you can imagine, and more, within the rooms, with large and immaculately presented bathrooms. In fact, the hotel was so nice, it almost made up for the fact that a pint of beer cost £10! But, to be fair, alcohol is expensive in Singapore, wherever you go - even at Clarke Quay which was a brilliant night out. A superb hotel, and an excellent choice for a base in Singapore. Much better than Raffles!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: alimac77
Reviews.Content: A superb hotel. We booked the Pan Pacific because my girlfriend had stayed here with her family years ago and insisted that if we were staying in Singapore we HAD to stay at the Pan Pacific. We only stayed here for a night, but we arrived early morning and left at midnight the following day, so essentially we had 2 days there. Check in wasn't a problem at all despite our unreasonably early arrival. Our room was ready and one of the 'Welcome team' took us ot one side to give us all the information we needed, before showing us to our room, whilst our bags were taken by the concierge. From the very beginning to the very end we were given a very personalised service which I didn't expect from such a large hotel. Our room was on the 19th floor (the top floor for deluxe rooms) and we were given a harbour view. The views were fantastic, although we used the outside lifts to get views from the roof top restaurant on the 37th floor. The room was plush. Extremely comfortable, with a superb bathroom attached. We had breakfast at one of the restaurants and I 've never seen so much variety on offer. We made the most of our short stay and so ate out in the evenings. The night life is at Clarke's Quay. We were also given a late check out of 3pm and the hotel locked our bags away until we returned at midnight. We were then given a 'temporary room' so we could shower and get ready for our flight, which was very much needed. It ended our short time there perfectly and there's nothing that I can think of that would have improved our stay at the Pan Pacific hotel. An excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply "5" Stars”
Reviews.Author: DelightYourSelf
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Pan Pacific last July for 6 nights and we found that room design and aminities are excellent and above our expectation as my family were delighted and talks about the hotel all the time despite we have set in Grand Hyatt Dec 2006 but in Simply Pan Pacific was better in terms of the rooms and overall design, room service 100%, staff was very polite and helpfull, nice balcony especially that overlook the esplanade mall "Smookers will like the balcony", room furniture found all new and also the decoration was fantastic. the location was better than orchid as i did not expect that my family will have fun with many shopping malls around the hotel where 3 of them are directly connected with the hotel. Swimming pool was nice and clean. and from my side i like their Bars and the friendly bar tenders. We kept our laptops and money sometime in the room and when we came back from outside we found everything in its place. Check in and Check out was very smooth..."Well Done Pan Pacific"...I highly recommend to stay at the hotel as we intend to visit it again if we have any plan to visit Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: jjblue
Reviews.Content: The wonderfully friendly and helpful staff really make this stand out from the usual run of modern hotels. Greeted by name, nothing too much trouble, generally pampered, but we always felt it was genuine. Nothing of that feeling we've sometimes had in big hotels that the whole place is there to rip off guests in any way they can. Room service meal was very good and quick, all room facitities excellent. Makes a terrific place for a stop-over to get rid of jet-lag: you can really seal yourself off from the world and catch up on sleep! One minor grouse: the door to the en-suite lavatory was flimsy and noisy and there was no alarm or phone near the bath, so perhaps not suitable for elderly people. But the staff really were wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in a wonderful hotel.......”
Reviews.Author: trvlbufElmhurst
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights end of June/beginning of July at this wonderful hotel. The staff was very serviceable throughout. Our room on the 32nd floor had spectacular views of the city. Large bathroom, nice toiletries, very comfortable bed, desk, coffee/tea making facilities, complimentary bottled water, morning newspaper, internet access, HD TV, mini bar, etc. In other words, the room had all the modern conveniences expected from a 5* property. The swimming pool was beautiful and they offered cool bottled water upon arrival. They also had complimentary apples, lollipops, and sunblock. What a nice touch! The hotel connects to the Suntec City Convention Center. Extremely convenient. It offers a wide variety of dining and shopping. It also connects to the Esplanade and the MRT. Great location. Would gladly stay here again if we visited Singapore again. Excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: “More than expected”
Reviews.Author: leilaniPhilippines
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel last August 10, 2008 and we were simply astounded with the following: 1.Up-to-date room features such as the remote controlled blinds, dual rain showers, separate glass enclosures for the toilet and shower areas plus bath tub. The beds and furnishings were also tastefully designed. The room area was also bigger than most hotels. 2. Very friendly staff. When told that we did not consume anything in the minibar (since we re-arranged the contents in order to make room for our own drinks, the staff must have erroneously thought we consumed some drinks), they immediately rectified the mistake without much ado. Plus they made sure that checking in and out was as quick and hassle free as possible. Everyone was friendly... as in everyone from the staff... from the doorman to the concierge. 3. The nice acoustic pool. Too bad we did not get to enjoy it as much as we would have loved to. Towels and drinks were provided automatically without being asked. 4. Very close proximity to Suntec and Marina Square. You can do all your shopping, eating and other needs without going out. 5. Affordable room rates. The price range is actually lower than other hotels (whose quality pale in comparison). All in all, the stay was simply perfect and I will make sure I will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “First-class hotel”
Reviews.Author: charliechunk
Reviews.Content: Myself and my hubby stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on the way to Bali for our honeymoon. We were very impressed when we walked into the hotel lobby as its very large and has marble flooring, and a lovely large bar in the centre. Check-in was done in super-quick time. The staff are tremendously efficient and very friendly too. We were upgraded to a room with a balcony and being on the 29th floor, we had an amazing view. The glass elevators on the outside of the hotel are very impressive, if a little bit scary the first time you get in them. Its worth taking the elevator right to the top where the restaraunt is, even if you dont eat there, as its on the 37/38th floor (I think!) and the views over the city are spectaculor. Our room was really nice, however we had twin beds and not a double, but we pushed them together and they didnt seperate at night so there was no falling down the crack incidents! It really wasnt a major problem as we were only there for two nights. The bathroom was lovely too. It was quite big and had a really nice massage shower which we enjoyed very much. We didnt eat in the hotel as we ate out on both nights, but the menu did look nice with a variety of dishes. On our second day, after being shopping, we came back to the hotel to find a huge bunch of gorgeous lillies, a massive fruit basket and a chocolate cake with 'congratulations' iced onto it, which was really really yummy! The hotel is conveniently located and is attached to a shopping mall (one of many) which takes you to the MRT and then its a just a short ride away to the different parts of the city. We got a tourist day card for about $8 sd, which we felt was really good value. Be aware that you will be fined if you are caught eating, drinking or smoking on the MRT. It may seem a bit harsh but when you look at how clean everything is you can understand why they do it. All in all the hotel was a brilliant start to our honeymoon and we'd definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “5* all the way!”
Reviews.Author: p0rtia
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check out the Pan Pacific was a fantastic and stress-free experience. My husband and I have travelled widely and this was a genuine 5* hotel with polite and helpful staff and all the facilities we could need. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ciao68
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 9 nights at Pan and it was surpurb from the time we entered the door. Check-in was with out hassle and quick we asked for connecting rooms which we got. The rooms were beautiful and very clean. It was the little things like chocolate and fruit upon arrival and jar of choc chip cookies half way through our stay. Taxi easy to catch infront of hotel. Pool was great kids loved it. Even the thought of being offered bottled water and apple by the pool just made things nice. Kids loved the lollie pops. Try the wood oven pizza by the pool really nice. The fact that this hotel when you get off on the 2nd floor connects to the Marina Square shopping centre and Suntec makes it a fanstastic location. The marina is a beautiful part of Singapore to stay in. We booked all our tours with www.Isango.com was well worth it booked all tours before we left prices were greated cheaper than getting the tours in Singapore itself. Had confirmation letter under our hotel room door upon arrival. Tours were very well organised must do ZOO, Night Safari and Afternoon at Sentosa. Food easy as Marina Square had lots of places to eat. Had breakfast at the Coffee Club there appears to be one opening up as you leave the Pan Pac on the 2nd foor and go through the Marina Square shopping centre, turn left - American B/fast for S7.80. All in all Pan Pac made our holiday one to remember and enjoy, would definitly book again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Texas-Tamu
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel. We upgraded, meaning we paid an extra $80 per person to enjoy an incredible breakfast (taken in one of the three breakfast areas), business office services and snacks 24/24. The staff are courteous and prompt. Downside: the hotel is not anywhere near the MRT.

Reviews.Title: “Well,, we had a great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: Janarella
Reviews.Content: Researching our annual "Mum and daughters" holiday is as rewarding as the actual trip and it is a real bonus when everything falls into place - Pan Pacific gave us a great welcome - We were on the 32nd floor (Panoramic view) facing the harbour. The fruit bowl and mazipan were greatly appreciated. It was also my birthday on the 2nd day and it was a nice surprise to find a yummy birthday cake waiting for us after a day of shopping. There was suficient room for the 3 of us - the balcony gave us extra space - the bathroom was a good size - with bath and separate shower. I slept like a log everynight so I didn't have any problems with the beds - I was up most mornings at the gym - they have a great gym with friendly instructors. I am a bit greedy and like to have the gym to myself - 6.30 to 8.30 it can be a little busy but after this time it is fine. I am not an air conditioner fan - I would sneakily turn it off at night but my youngest daughter complained. Singapore was practising for their National Day so this was another bonus - watching air and water displays, fireworks and what we couldnt see was on a big screen. If you like shopping this is the place for you - right next to the Suntec Centre. Also the Convention Centre that was holding the Singapore Garden Show (if you like orchids like I do it shouldn't be missed) We also tried the Chinese restaurant on the top floor but we weren't too fussed with it - I think we needed a lesson on how to order food but did enjoy the bar on the ground floor - It was pleasant sitting with nibbles and a glass of wine people watching - But anyway we had a great time - We loved the Pan Pacific - bit pricey but what the heck. (We were there for 9 nights)

Reviews.Title: “Possibly one of the best hotels i've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Londoner_8
Reviews.Content: Singapore has many good/clean hotels so their standard is quite high. The Pan Pacific is absolutely perfect. The location, the staff, decor. I don't think i can add anything in this review that hasn't been previously mentioned. The only thing i would mention, for those who are use to American/Canadian hotel rooms, Singapore hotel rooms are quite small in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ghtraveller
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and I would stay here again. The rooms were spacious and clean with good facilites. The beds were comfortable and the linen changed daily if required. The bathroom was large and had a good selection of toiletries. The shower was very efficient all though it did take me a few minutes to work out how to operate it. On the whole the hotel was quiet but we did have some noisy neighbours with a child who loved ringing doorbells at all hours of day and night. I cannot hold the hotel responsible for this and it did not disrupt me too much. I tried all the resteraunts and particualry loved the Chinese on the 37th floor. The food was superb as was the view and the service excellent. I also enjoyed the bar outside which was agreat place to unwind in the evenings. The spa at this hotel was one of the best I have tried in Singapore. The staff were efficient and the spa clean and reasonably priced. If you don't want to eat in the hotel there are plenty of places nearby. A great little Indian resteraunt called Demi-Fusion is close and from there you are a stones throw from the excellent lobby bar at the Conrad Hotel and listen to the music of Louis Soliano.

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific - great for business...”
Reviews.Author: Fozzy279
Reviews.Content: My experince of this hotel is that while it is very nice, it is very much business orientated with prices to reflect someone else footing the bill. We were on our honeymoon and received a room upgrade to a "panoramic" view overlooking part of the city. The room had all the ammenities you would expect from a 5 star hotel, and some I'd never seen before - such as a sliding panel allowing you to connect a laptop/USB etc to the large LCD TV - along with a comprehensive set of video/audio leads to hook up your MP3 player to the in room speaker/TV system - a nice touch, but again shows the empasis towards business users. Another nice gadget was the remote controlled blinds/curtains. The 28th floor where our room was was reached by external "capsule" lifts. I don't suffer from vertigo but felt myself hanging on a few times!!. The hotel is part of a shopping/hotel complex. I felt the shops were all more expensive than home (UK) and was very much geared to the Japanese shopper. This whole complex was expensive proably due to its trendy shops, boutiques and eating places - there are much cheaper places to eat and drink.... I felt the food and drinks at the hotel were outrageously priced - especially for holiday makers - again, if a business is paying its not such a problem - a point I made on my customer satisfaction form. I was informed they were "competitive" with other hotels in the area - but as I later found not competitive with hotels in less trendy areas. As a result, the bars and restaurants were never full and only sparsley filled with busniess people on phones & laptops and as such didn't have a very socialble or relaxing atmosphere. By going to Boat or Clarke Quay - about 10 mins cheap taxi - there are plenty or bars & restaurants offering large discounts and freebies to get you into their establishment - all have a great atmosphere and are very reasonable considering the expensive drinks in Singapore. When I asked the concierge if there were any good places to eat - he didn't know or didn't want to tell - as he wasn't very helpful. Overall, nice hotel, but wouldn't rush back but ideal for business users. Facilities too expensive for holidays if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the splurge!”
Reviews.Author: cgycivil
Reviews.Content: After five weeks of cheap hotels across Asia, I decided to splurge in Singapore and the Pan Pacific was worth every penny. Top-notch service, incredible room, and great view of the city. Be sure to have a Singapore Sling in the atrium.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic start to our Honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: JB&CT
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on our round the world honeymoon and we could not have asked for a more perfect hotel!! Super Quick check-in, we were given a room with great views on the 31st floor. Upon check-in we were both congratulated and my wife was handed a beautiful bouquet of orchids. When we got to our room there was a very tastey honeymoon cake and a wedding card. We found the hotel was in a great location close to shops, restaurants and MRT station. All of the staff were fantastic and could not be faulted in any way. The pool was very nice and there were plenty of sun beds. Breakfast was excellant!! If we were to travel to singapore again there is only one hotel i would consider staying at! The Pan Pacific!

Reviews.Title: “Good for business, expensive for casual travellers”
Reviews.Author: aussiegirl3000
Reviews.Content: Pan Pacific Hotel is, itself, quite nice. The rooms are large with comfortable beds, plenty of English language cable tv channels on the plasma tv. The common areas, bars etc are nice. The staff are all accommodating (if not a little eager for a tip). Its is, however, primarily a business hotel and if work were paying for your coffees and snacks then you'd probably like it more. First, its right in the business district, where there is very little to walk to except shopping centres (you can get to an underground station by walking through the convention centre and then the suntec shopping centre). I got a good deal on expedia for the room rate, however, I found the services very overpriced. For example, using the internet in the business centre (which seemed very well appointed) was S$8.50 plus GST plus service charge (which worked out about S$10) per 15 minutes, whereas the internet cafe in the Suntec centre cost $5 per hour. A cafe latte in the atrium coffee bar was over S$12 and a glass of NZ sav blanc in the "brunch bar" was S$22 and a not particularly nice hamburger $20. The bathrooms are also well appointed with a small bathtub, separate shower and good lighting. The pool was a nice enough area with loungers, towels and water provided. Warning for people afraid of heights - all the elevators in the hotel are glass. The higher floors are accessed via elevators that travel the outside of the building while others travel over the large indoor atrium. Upsides: big rooms, big beds, nice desk in room with decent office chair, english tv channels, free newspapers, good business location. Downsides: I was unable to shake the feeling that I was being ripped off everytime I opened my mouth. Not a great sightseeing location, no restaurants nearby that were not hotel (read: overpriced) restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but I expected more for a "five star hotel"”
Reviews.Author: MeInPerth
Reviews.Content: I've been to Singapore now a couple of times and tried out five different hotels so far, not only for bargain reasons, but also to be able to compare things. Location: The Pan Pacific is perfectly located to go on an extended Shopping trip as SunTech City and Marina Square are both next door. However the MRT station (City Hall) is still a good five minute walk away, if you want to go to other places. Hotel: The hotel is nice, but for a five star hotel I expected more. The friendliness of the staff has been average. I missed an explanation of the basic things, such as breakfast, Internet access, pool and so on - Nothing! Certainly I could have asked, but I guess customers would appreciate it to get a short overview. The room has been nice, but the level of cleanliness should be improved. During my whole stay the mirrors and the shower haven't been 100% clean as you would expect it from a 5 star accomodation. On my date of departure I could see why, because the room maid thought I had already left. She rushed through the room and used my old towels to clean the shower cabin. The hotel pool is quite nice. I didn't use any restaurant, so I can't review these. Checkout was efficient and correct. Returning home, I realized that I forgot two pairs of trousers in a wardrobe in the room. I used the e-mail function of the hotel's website to contact them; after one week I haven't got any response yet. In general, ok for a 3 or maybe a 4 star, but not for a 5 star. There are less expensive hotels in Singapore which provide the same or even a better service. Maybe the hotel shouldn't sell its rooms cheap on the web. A better way would certainly be to improve the quality. I'm sure customers would spread the word-of-mouth then and help the hotel to fill its rooms.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but a bit bland”
Reviews.Author: inspiteof
Reviews.Content: this is a decent business hotel, but a bit bland. rooms are clean if a little worn. great views. service can be slow, especially to the rooms. the hotel has several good restaurants, though, which is nice. overall, fine for a quick business trip, but you can do better if you're looking for a soothing holiday stay. has a kind of generic big business hotel feel...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Pan Pacific!”
Reviews.Author: motheranddaughterduo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight when travelling from Europe to Sydney and was thrilled with the choice. Lovely hotel in an excellent location - 5 star feel with a 3 star price tag. The room was a decent size with a spacious, clean bathroom and comfortable beds. Staff were friendly and helpful - made you feel like royalty. Also used the pool and gym which were excellent although i wouldn't rave about the spa facilities - staff made booking and paying a stressful experience. Had previously stayed at the Novotel on the other side of town and much preferred this location - close to all the shops Taxi from the airport was between Singapore $20 - $25 which was very reasonable. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: lostalot
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at various good hotels in Singapore on previous visits, my wife and I decided to try the Pan Pacific as a new experience on our most recent eight day trip. The hotel building itself is outstanding - huge internal atrium space reaching 30-odd storeys high, glass internal and external lifts, tasteful shops, sculptures, large pool and orchid displays were but a few of the items which greatly impressed us. However, the PPs best feature is the staff - they were always pleasant, always asked if they could be of any assistance, nothing was too much trouble for them, all aspects of the service was most efficient and they took time to converse with the guests, even if it was simply to enquire what kind of day you were having. I feel that I am reiterating views already posted by most people about this establishment but I can only reinforce that the combination of the building, people (and the Suntec City/Marina Bay shopping mall area location) makes the Pan Pacific an ideal base for an extremely pleasant stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB THROUGHOUT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Arlene&Co
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe room and upon arrival where upgraded to a Panaoramic room on floor 32 what a view!! , my wife was a bit nervous to start with as the lifts are glass and on the outside of the building no problem after a few trips though. The check in was super smooth all the staff are very polite we had buffet breakfast included in our room package and that was excellent which we booked through Trailfinders, we originally picked a dearer hotel but one of the consultants advised us to try this hotel as it was better than our 1st choice in their opinion and we are pleased we did. The room was spacious with a very large bathroom and spotless throughout we had electric curtains in the room which we found novel!, the pool area is good however we never tried the pool as we had limited time, my wife says the health spa was nice and reasonable prices. Singapore looks great fom their version of the "London Eye" its the equvalent of 42 floors high. The cost for 2 adults and 1 child is 79.65 singapore dollars so divide that by about 2.5 which gives you £31.85 the trip lasts about 30 mins we went at 1700 hours and there was no queue at all once again a superb hotel!!!!! Rod and family U.K

Reviews.Title: “Very Dishonest”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler1234
Reviews.Content: Do NOT book your stay at PanPacific.com. Their website purportedly offered a "stay 2 nights & get another one free" offer when you use your American Express card. I chose that offer and booked my stay 2 months in advance. Got the confirmation and thought all was well. When checking in, I asked to confirm that I'll be getting the extra night for free. They said... NO! Apparently, they said my booking was not made under the correct category. After demonstrating EXACTLY how I made the booking and how I EXACTLY chose the Amex offer rate, they still refused to honour it. I find such service out of line for such a hotel. Truly SUCKS!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business travel; also great for leisure stay”
Reviews.Author: QP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Pan Paicific for 6 nights on a business trip. The hotel stay is by far my best lodging experience while traveling for work! Location - right in the center of the pricy colonial district. It's great for both business/leisure. It's got indoor walkway through a shopping mall to suntec center, so you won't even be exposed to the tropical humidity. Orchard Road (for shopping, not that there's not enough shopping within walking distance of the hotel), is only a brief bus/subway/cab ride away. Room - tastefully decorated in neutral tone. Bathroom has separate shower/bath. Bath tub is generously sized, I used it every night. The room has central light control, very much like any 4+ star hotel rooms in Asia (Japan, HK, Taiwan). Nice audio/visual capabilities w/ the flat screen TV and wireless internet ready. Food - I had room service about 4 times during my stay for both breakfast and dinner. The eggs benedict is one of the best I've had. Didn't have a chance to try the restaurants, but I dare say they probably measure up to the rest of the hotel services well. Amenities - large outdoor pool, which never got busy during my stay there (I had a direct view of the pool from my room). Service - extremely efficient front desk and concierge, no compliants whatsoever! Overall, I just wish that the 5 star hotels in the US could be as nice as Pan Pacific! Tips - Singapore is such an easy country to travel to. There's great shopping and food all around town. Many travel books suggest a day trip to the Sentosa Island. I did just that. However, I don't recommend at all, unless you've kids (even then, there are better attractions on the mainland). The island is full of man made attractions. I was not impressed with anything at all. You'd be disappointed if you're a nature lover or want a taste of the south east asia.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was good!”
Reviews.Author: WD2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at one of the suites which facing the pool. Nice view from the room. When I checked in, a lady called Aki at the reception was very polite and handle my requests very well. My suite was cleaned and comes with the welcome fruits and a box of chocolate! Bravo to the management for the little thought! I went to the spa in the afternoon and couldn't locate the spa meant for hotel guests, not the spa for massage or beauty salon. An Indian public area cleaner approached me and shown me the way to the hotel spa. This is what we call "SERVICE"! I have been staying in many luxury hotels and this is my first experience in this property. The treatment that I received from this Indian gentleman definitely will make me want to return to this hotel in the future. The negative side of this hotel is the club lounge. Staffs were not friendly and practised double standards. When I arrived at the 22nd flloor where their club lounge located, I couldn't locate it. When I got out from the lift, it is their reception area. No greetings or no approach from the staffs there to offer assistance until I approach them. When I went in to the lounge, a chinese lady came and approached us to offer drinks. I do enjoyed the evening snacks served and the view from the lounge. No one cleared the plates when we have finished our snacks. Therefore, I just put it aside on my table. There were only 4 tables occupied at that time and four staffs were on duty. Then, my friend from UK came and joined me for evening cocktails. The same lady came and asked for drinks order. She then only cleared all empty plates. I just felt it is discriminating Asians. Anyway, the service rendered by your public area gentleman recovered the unpleasant experience. Hope the management will look at their club lounge staff's attitude and I shall be back and try the club facilities again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MadSci
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our holiday in November 2007, and it was the perfect way to end our honeymoon. We stayed on the Pacific Floor and enjoyed the free "pantry" all day and the free cocktails at night. We received a cake and bottle of champagne on arrival and were given a tour and explanation of all the facilities on the Pacific Floor so that we could take full advantage of them. The location was really good, with underground airconditioned shopping all the way to the MRT. We didn't sample the pool or any restaurants in the hotel as we were only there two nights, but the staff were excellent and remembered our names immediately, though it was quite embarrasing to be introduced as "the honeymooning couple". All in all, this was a fabulous stay, and I would not hesitate to stay here again and recommend it to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Really has the WOW factor!”
Reviews.Author: marmin
Reviews.Content: From the minute we walked into the reception area until we had taken in the fantastic view from our Panoramic room on the 30th floor we were amazed by the design and layout of this hotel. Check-in/out was very efficient and our room was excellent - modern and very clean. We did not sample the food here but had a great 3 night stay. This hotel would have scored a 5 from us but for the noise from the water system early in the morning that disturbed our sleep on 2 nights - not a major problem but after staying in 4 great hotels on this trip I can't give them all a 5! Overall a fairly well located top class, stylish hotel

Reviews.Title: “First Class hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: soulsease
Reviews.Content: Arriving in Singapore is a great experience; flying in over thousands of ships in the bay, and landing at what looks like a floating city is a great way to arrive! The drive to the hotel from Changi airport is a pleasant 30 minuts or so, along tree lined boulevards. The hotel is located in the business district, near the new Singapore Flyer big wheel (same size as the London Eye, but mounted on a slightly higher plinth, making it the tallest in the world...at the moment!). To get to Orchard Road and the main shopping area is a taxi ride, but the Marina Square mall adjoins the hotel, so if you need to shop, it's all close. You are also around ten minutes walk from Raffles, about 15 mins walk to the main government buildings, 15 mins from the Merlion, and a short cab ride/30 min walk from Boat Key and Clarke Key. The hotel lobby is very well presented; plenty of helpful staff and a stunning atrium bar in the middle. Rooms are large and comfortable, and there is a good selection of restaurants. Try the rooftop Chinese restaurant - food is good; views are stunning! The outdoor glass lifts are also part of the experience! There is a spa onsite, as well as the usual business facilities. The pool area is tastefully laid out, and as soon as you arrive, the staff will present you with a complimentary ice-cold bottle of water, and even better, when you've finished each one, they'll bring you another! Good sized pool as well. Not the cheapest hotel by any means, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NormanBristolUK
Reviews.Content: Well run, business and stop off hotel. Pool and public areas are kept stopless and clean. The view across singapore from the room was great, you can stroll down into town, clarkes or boat quay within 10mins. Staff were well trained and professhional, whilst still having humour and informal chats. The beds are fantastic, just what you need after a long jouney. Places to visit include the night safari, raffles hotel and lots and lots of shopping

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lyntonynottm
Reviews.Content: Booked a King Room - upgraded free to Panoramic room on 32nd floor with balcony and awesome view (expecially at night) of Singapore Harbour. Great facilities in room (toys for the boys - eg electric blinds, plasma wall mounted TV - lighting panel. Swimming Pool very attractive and clean - very attentive staff. Excellent location with easy access to air conditioned shopping malls. Cleanliness to a very high standard throughout hotel. Would definitely return. Only downside drinks in bar very expensive would recommend Boat Quay for cheaper bars.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Pan Pacific!”
Reviews.Author: ChocoboFan
Reviews.Content: Was very surprised to read comments from previous 2 reviewers about this hotel! We recently stayed there for 8 nights and had a really nice time. Staff were always friendly and pleasant and couldn't do enough for you. Our room was beautiful with a lovely view of the harbour and Singapore Flyer. I specifically picked this hotel because of all the good reviews it has received and as it was my husband's 40th birthday. I certainly wasn't disappointed by the service we received and I would definately stay here again if the opportunity arose.

Reviews.Title: “3 day business trip”
Reviews.Author: TomBamber
Reviews.Content: Hotel booked by my company. Was expecting a 4 star-ish standard, having only seen photos in Kuoni Brochure. Decided to upgrade to a club room for a couple of reasons - higher floor, moor chance of balcony, club breakfast, business centre. Handled quickly and without issue at check in, and worth the SGD80 extra per night. Room was clean, spacious and a great view, balconly had nice lounger plus ashtray. Breakfast was plentiful, fresh and staff considerate and attentive. Room service one night, Hotel Indian Restaurant the other night - excellent bothe times. Extended check out to 8pm. All in all, excellent service, attentive staff, comfy room and a great view. 5 star across the board

Reviews.Title: “2 Star Hotel with a 5 Star Facade”
Reviews.Author: HotelGuru9
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific is a hotel that looks 4 star, but provided me with 2 star quality service, at very high prices. I suggest you sort the reviews by "Lowest First" if you want an honest look at this Hotels Reviews. During check in, the man at the counter actually tries to barter with me. He begins a whole act right in front of me, telling me that I had reserved a smaller, cheaper Twin room, for the same $200 rate. I disputed this, and he tells me that I am "mistaken". He takes it a step further and lies to me, saying there are no King rooms available anyways. Then an awkward silence, conveying that his decision was final. Astonished by this, and fully aware of what he was doing, I pulled out my reservation and showed it to him. King room with a view. Visibly annoyed he mysteriously finds me my King room with a view 10 seconds later. Not to be deterred, he then tries to upsell me. "Sir, for $90 more per day, you can have free internet and breakfast". I replied "I am already paying $200 a night for this room. You basically just lied to me about my reservation so I'd take a cheaper room at the same cost. Internet should be free, and I dont eat $90 worth of breakfast every day". He continued to try and persuade me. He would not take no for an answer. It was very uncomfortable and awkward for me. I felt like I was in a flea market trying to haggle for a bead necklace with a hippie. Then something surreal happened. He actually has the audacity to inform me - like its the first time he's said it - that he is giving me a Twin room. I started laughing. Seriously? He actually was hoping I had forgotten?? Unfortunately, this theme continued throughout my stay. The light bulb was out in my bathroom. The grout along the tiles was messy, and smeared. The toilet doesn't flush unless you pump it a few times. When I turned on the sink water, the handle moaned as if it were old metal. The magnet holding the door open doesn't work, so I watched the bellhop try 5 times to make it stick, unsuccessfully. Internet is $30 per day. Absolutely ridiculous. If you go up to the Business Center they actually charge $7.50 for 15 minutes of internet use. I mentioned this to a group of Indian fellows in Little India at an internet cafe, and they responded with roaring laughter. Laundry service here is $10 per shirt. Yes, per shirt. That works out to about $200 USD for an average load of laundry. I opted for their outside laundry service, paid $45 for one load (ugh) and my clothes came back wet.
