I couldn't make this stuff up, folks... On a Sunday night, I walked outside to get a cab and get some dinner. I ended up standing there for 40 minutes. Yes.... 40 minutes ... in a line with 30 other people, and it was 97 degrees outside. Fully drenched in sweat, I went back in to the hotel to the concierge and said "Are you aware that there are 30 people standing in line for a taxi outside?" He apologized and started calling to have taxi's come by. I should point out there were six employees standing out there with us the whole time, doing absolutely nothing. The day I checked out, I had overslept and was late for my flight. I conveyed this to the concierge and meekly asked for a taxi as soon as possible. As I stood outside, I watched the hotel staff fill up 6 metered taxis with people from the Taxi line, while I stood there, without a ride. Turns out they had called the "more expensive" taxi, which I did not want or need. It costs twice as much, and took 10 minutes longer to arrive. Great idea guys! Make that money!!! To top off this already disappointing stay, the more expensive, late taxi driver dropped me off at the wrong terminal. He knew what airline I was taking, yet despite the mercedes and double-fee, he apparently didn't know his job well enough. Remember, I was late for my flight. He takes off, and I had to pay another taxi driver to take me where I needed to go. There are a lot of exceptionally shining 5 star reviews on this hotel, here on TripAdvisor. To the tune of literally hundreds. Way more than one might think is normal. Way more than the other hotels in the same area of Singapore, even right next door. Its interesting to see that the hotel's PR firm heavily involved in responding to reviews here, too. That is something I don't normally see. I can promise that this review was written by a real traveler.

Reviews.Title: “OK but no good deal”
Reviews.Author: norwayguru
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms. Garden and pool area filthy, flowing with garbage. Staff in breakfast restaurant somewhat unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Stormy85
Reviews.Content: Everything was just wonderful! Spacious room, huge bed, nice pool (room we stayed in was on the 15th floor overlooking the pool, very nice view), great service, huge flat TV. Hotel rates are more than reasonable comparing with other "luxury" hotels. There is a nice bakery on the first floor (Atrium Deli). It was Christmas time and there was this big Christmas-tree decorated with gingerbread men on the first floor. The hotel is located in the colonial district of Singapore, so you can find a lot of places of interest nearby. It is next to the City Hall MRT (underground) station and famous Singapore flyer is ten-minute walk from it. We had pleasant time staying there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular execution, but a bit boring”
Reviews.Author: Montrealais
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said, the architecture is impressive and the service is second to none. I can't imagine anything ever going *wrong* with a stay in this hotel. The only problem is that there's nothing at all to remind you that you are in Singapore, or even in Asia. Very plush, very comfortable, very impersonal. It's in the middle of the convention area, with a view of other hotels and convention buildings. Bottom line: If you need to be close to the convention centre, or thrill in the faultless execution of the hotelier's art, come here. If you want to wake up knowing you're in Singapore, go elsewhere. Cabs plentiful but taking the MRT requires a hike through the shopping centre and underground.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! factor”
Reviews.Author: Marleneann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the beautiful Pan Pacific Singapore for 6 nights. From the 20th to the 26th March. On entering the hotel I uttered "WOW" ! On going up to our room I said "WOW" ! Opening door to our room I yelled "WOW" ! First of all I must thank Su from the Pan Pacific Singapore Hotel, who helped me with our accommodation bookings. Su was easy to contact and replied immediately to my emails. This was very reassuring. The hotel was more spectacular then I imagined it to be. The inside and outside glass lifts were amazing. Orchid arrangements decorated the public areas. The beautifully kept deluxe rooms had a panoramic view of the city. I almost lost Fred in the BIG bed. The pool area was a great place to relax and read the free papers and magazines while the attendants made sure we had plenty of complimentary bottled water and fruit. So busy with sight seeing that we didn't get a chance to dine at the hotel but I did buy some delicious cakes from the bakery in the foyer. One thing I couldn't help but notice was the friendliness of all the staff at the hotel. Taxis were readily available from the front of the hotel. Management should be congratulated as they certainly do a great job at Pan Pacific Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel - superb service - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jaclak
Reviews.Content: Very efficient, staff really care, even the cleaners would ask if everything was OK. Very good facilities. At the pool bottles of water were given out with the towels and sunscreen was available for you to use. Excellent breakfast fast efficient and plentiful This is the sort of hotel that other hotel managers should visit in order to see good hotel management in action. The hotel is in a good location and is connected by air conditioned indoor shopping malls to the Esplanade at the river front, and to City Hall MRT metro station

Reviews.Title: “Big is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Serialglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: An imposing building in a city of imposing buildings. Despite being Chinese New Year with all hotels very busy, the service levels at this modern attractive hotel never faltered. The double room was clean, with a safe, tea making facilities and Internet connection. Its restaurants were able to cope well with residents; the one we used was an Italian flavours venue called Zambuca which whilst not cheap, served up some excellent food with an extensive wine list. If you like fine dining this is the one for you. The one minus point, which most hotels fall down on, is the buffet breakfast. Very few hotels are able to serve a decent cooked breakfast that is HOT! Such was the case here, but this was only a small gripe.

Reviews.Title: “Located centrally for everything,Very classy”
Reviews.Author: Louise83
Reviews.Content: Very stylish and classy.Staff are very friendly & helpful. Stayed 3 nights in a Deluxe room on 1st leg of holiday 17th floor as we requested a high room.On return we had been upgraded to a Panoramic room on the 30th floor.Both excellent but we would have preferred the 17th floor anyway just that little bit of a nicer room. Hotel is located centrally for everything and is only 20 mins from airport.Hotel has connecting area to Suntec shopping mall & others.Raffles is only 5 minute walk away. Sentosa Island easy to get to via a cable car from Mount Faber. Short distance away from Clarke Quay & Boat Quay which has excellent eateries.Didn't eat at hotel as too busy on excursion's and shopping but we did start our day with breakfast in the Global Kitchen at the hotel, this was excellent. Would stay here again as it was fantastic. Because it was the Chinese New Year it was decorated with very colourful lanterns etc and had Dragon Street shows all around Singapore, lovely to watch a bit of culture. All in all it is the best for all locations you want to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: clanchiefScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in January and February on our journey to and from Oz. I could not fault this hotel on anything. The location is great sitting on top of the Marina Square complex which is excellent for dining and shopping. A short walk and you are at the MRT and City link centre. Walk in the other direction and you are at the Suntec Centre. The staff are fantastic. Extremely polite, friendly and helpful. Stop for a moment and someone is sure to approach you and ask if they can help. Check in and out was fast and efficient. Walk outside for a taxi and one was summoned. The rooms, as was the rest of the hotel , are maintained in immaculate state. I loved the large LCD TV tastefully wall mounted and all the sports channels. Almost all the entire outside wall is glass and you can lie in bed and operate(play with) the remote which mechanically brings down the window screen and then a Roman Blind.The views from the room over the city and river were also spectacular. Worth mentioning is the pool and sun bathing area which was great. Very spacious and I spent more time here than any other hotel pool in Singapore. In the heat of the afternoon staff come around with cool towels ,fruit and free bottles of ice cool water. Free water is also provided in the room. The only thing I found missing from the hotel which could inhibit long term tourist travellers from booking was the lack of a guest laundry. Although some may find it expensive the top floor Cantonese restaurant is worth a visit for something special. Although I did not use all of the dining options other guests recommended them and there was a good price spread over these. All in all if I could put this hotel in my case I would and take it to all my destinations around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Dol123
Reviews.Content: Outstanding Service, outstanding room with a wonderful view. You can actually walk to Raffles Hotel in about 10 minutes. Easy to find the city bus tour at the Shopping Centre next door - Sun City (Tourist information point) - we did some research prior to trip. The reception staff were delightful and remembered my name all through our stay. There may be better located hotels but this hotel was absolutely superb value for money. The staff even allowed us to use a room to freshen up as we had a late flight and had checked out early( a hotel room, not a general hospitality room) I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone and would stay here again in the future - no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeSEAtrekker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Pan Pacific a tour throughout SE Asia. This is a very upmarket and classy hotel and the prices reflect this. We were lucky and got a stay 3 nights for the price of 4 deal, which helped. The rooms were very well appointed and very chic inside. The lobby and communal areas were also very good. I think the location was great, away from the very busy Orchard Road but adjoined to at least 3 other shopping malls (Suntec, Marina Sqaure and City Link). The closes MRT station (City Hall) was about a 20 minute walk, however the walk was all inside shopping malls so it was airconditioned. There were a number of excellent facilities including the large outdoor pool and spa.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer79
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a stop over for a couple of nights and had a great experience while there. Rooms were modern and clean (the hotel was recently refurbished) and we had great views out across the river/bay. Faciliaites were good and the in hotel dining was fantastic - food was excellent and good value. The hotel itself is well located being a short walk to most of the many shopping centres and restaurants in Singapore. The most overriding impression though was the service - from check in to check out everything was done superbly and nothing was too much trouble. As a stop over hotel or a base for exploring Singapore this is a fantastic place and very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: dmlis
Reviews.Content: I have booked Panoramic room at special (read - the lowest) Internet rate and... have been upgraded to Executive upon arrival. It was good start and nothing has spoiled our stay until the departure. Check-in, service at reception, restaurants and Exec Centre, cleanness, interior and equipment - everything is very good. Convenient location - just 5 min to nearest MRT. I find this hotel suitable for both business and leisure trip, do not hesitate to recommend to friends and likely will book again when in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive lobby”
Reviews.Author: dublinyogi
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night on a quick stop over; service was good, room was very nice and spacious. The lobby is pretty impressive and had the biggest and most beautiful Christmas we had ever seen! They gave us a beautiful bunch of Orchids, and a Chocolate cake to welcome us (honeymoon). The view from the room was good, particularly at night, nice pool central location. Can't go wrong really.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, modern top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: RSBUk
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific truly is a luxury hotel. First impressions are excellent and the staff make you welcome as soon as you step out of the taxi, and continue it throughout your stay. The room was modern but very comfortable with a huge, comfy bed, flat screen tv, desk, plenty of storage and superb electric roman blackout blind (i want one at home now!!). Singapore is hot and humid so everywhere seems connected underground to avoid street walking. The location is in a modern area surrounded by shopping and opposite the Mandarin Oriental. The pool area was a good size, and the gym was well equipped for a proper workout. Breakfast was plentiful if not the biggest I've ever seen, but quality was good, and service excellent. Would recommend and return in the future...

Reviews.Title: “Starting To look tired”
Reviews.Author: Exhibitionist
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the PanPac for many years now, but the rooms are starting to look tired and the interior seems to have been updated to suit the japanese tourists that flock there day and night. Still a good "big" hotel in central Singapore, but there are others that are better - Merchant Court and Marina Mandarin to name but two and so I've started staying elsewhere now despite my PanPac VIP card

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Pan Pacific Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Pynk
Reviews.Content: We delightfully stayed at the beautiful Pan Pacific hotel (Panoramic room) 4 nights for our Christmas Holiday. From the moment we entered the hotel on Xmas day, we were kindly welcomed and immediately directed to check-in desk. Check-in officer recorded passport details. Registration was completed in a kind & efficient manner (took few minutes not long at all). Our bags were brought up promptly by helpful staff to our room on time. Bubble lifts (matrix space-age looking): Clean glass with user-friendly lit buttons. The speed of lifts were appropriate to observe the atrium and amazing views of the hotel’s interior. In the lifts on our 3rd day, a staff member kindly greeted us and pronounced our surnames correctly. Very polite and accurate! Panoramic Room: Looked brilliant and felt luxurious to stay in. Clean, neat & spacious. Fitted bedding for 3. Plenty of room for 3 large suitcases and shopping bags (which grew larger with each mall visited). Room nicely furnished. Electronic blinds, shades and LCD TV were easy to use. Air-conditioner worked well to our temperature liking. Received free bottles of water each morning plus newspapers. Slippers and robes were also supplied. Mini bar was stocked with goodies (extra charges for eg bottled water from mini bar $4 SGD) and there was also room to store our chocolates in the mini bar. Room was on level 18 and we did not experience any distractions/loud noise. This room had a balcony with beautiful views of Singapore City (Esplanade, Merlion and Marina Bay). Bathroom: Immaculate, neat and polished. Fluffy towels, well-positioned mirrors and nicely accessorised with cute little bottles of shampoos, conditioners, bath gels and bath salts. Hair dryer was handy. Beds: Clean, comfortable and spotless white sheets and pillows. We all slept peacefully well. Swimming Pool: We were busy shopping and left little time to swim at the pool. Nonetheless, on our last night there, we did relax on the seats next to pool and observed the beautiful mini garden scene. Hotel: Magnificent! Check-in and check-out was completed by courteous and polite staff. Check out was prompt and there were no delays to our next destination. Before leaving the hotel room, I had postcards to send back home and staff also helped mail this out within a telephone call. Excellent customer service! Concierge staff were excellent too for taking our luggage out the entrance while we shortly waited there for our driver to pick us up. The door man kindly took a photo for us. Hotel staff are approachable and willing to help. All staff greeted and smiled at us gracefully throughout our stay. Location: Easy access (by taxi or walk) to Marina Square Mall, Suntec City and Esplanade Theatre. Taxi to Orchard Road (5 minutes around $7). Taxi to Sentosa Island around 12-15 minutes (depending on traffic flow). Buffet breakfast @ The Global Kitchen: Delicious and nicely presented food from both Western and Eastern cultures. Courteous staff. Food ranged from prawn dumplings, grilled fish, smoked salmon, stir-fried noodles, scrambled eggs, toast, has browns, mini muffins, dragon fruit, melons, yoghurt, jelly and much more ($35 SGD). Thank you note: ( we have not included our feedback comments on the hotel's online form, instead we will write it here). It was our great pleasure to stay at Pan Pacific Singapore. We are highly impressed and have already recommended this hotel to our family and friends after returning to Australia. We kindly thank all staff for working enthusiastically and kindly servicing us during our holiday period. We have left Singapore but we have not forgotten the pleasant memories of our stay there. All the best to you and we wish you more success and prosperity.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: catmouse
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the Pan Pacific in Singapore several times and have never been disappointed. The quality of service is typical for South-East Asia and puts most of the rest of the world to shame. From the moment I checked-in till I checked-out, staff were available to provide assistance, without being intrusive. The rooms are well-equipped. I took an Executive room, which as a package included breakfast and internet access and really didn't cost more than adding these items to a standard room. That put me fairly high up and with breakfast served on the executive floor, kept me away from the crowds. The situation is excellent, plenty of shopping malls and within walking distance to City Hall.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best ever”
Reviews.Author: kcl491
Reviews.Content: Absolutely one of my best hotel stays ever, anywhere in the world. I booked directly with the hotel and got an excellent package that included a deluxe room with buffet breakfast. I stayed over a weekend and, since this is clearly a business-oriented hotel, I'm sure that is why the package price was so attractive. Every staff member was top notch, the buffet breakfast extensive, the experience memorable. The bathroom was huge and the ammenities were extensive (lots of toiletries including bath salts, sewing kit, huge flat screen TV with plenty of channels). The only fault I can find at all is there was no electrical outlet in the bathroom for my hair curlers. As mentioned in previous reviews, this hotel connects via walkways with three shopping malls so there are plenty of places to eat if you want to avoid the expensive hotel restaurants. That said, the Asian themed bar on the ground floor has a Martini Happy Hour with reduced drink prices and complementary snacks - an extremely good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall hotel”
Reviews.Author: menome
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pan Pacific for 2 nights at the end of December. Got in at 6am, was really tired, however the reception noticed this and we were allowed to check in straight away. (probably because there was a room available already, but it was a very good gesture and gave a good first impression). Everything at this hotel seemed very organised, all staff knew what they were supposed to do, thus made it a very smooth trip in terms of "hotel stuff" ie. newspapers, wake up call, laundary, concierge. The rooms were very impressive, I believe they have just been through a renovation and everything was brand new. The rooms had a very classy/classic look and feel (some hotels can go overboard with the "modern" look) but I still prefer classic. Pan Pacific was like a modern classic look, if that makes sense. (had 32 inch LCD TV and electronic blinds [modern], wood finish for everything else) Bathrooms were great, with seperate bathtub and shower. Shower was large, but bathtub was the usually pint size. Location was a marina bay, right next to a few shopping plazas. Was 5 mins walk from the bay, was a nice walk and had some restaurant and hawker centres there too. Overall, this was a great and accommodating hotel, I rate it as the best place I have stayed at so far (probably in line with Mandarin Oriental, I have previously stayed at Mandarin Oriental and Swissotel Stamford)

Reviews.Title: “fantastic !!!”
Reviews.Author: Derbyshire-MrsS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific for two nights in December en-route to New Zealand. Can not fault this hotel in any way it was excellent. We were allowed to check in very early (9am) which was a bonus and we found that the staff from the check-in to the porters were exteremely friendly and helpful.The hotel is amazing with fantastic star wars style lifts and lots of marble decor everywhere ! We booked a deluxe room and it was lovely. Huge super kingsize bed and very spacious room and bathroom, We didnt eat at the hotel as there is so much choice right outside. The hotel has two shopping centres next to it infact you can access one directly from the hotel and there is a 7-11 accross the road if you fancy snacks etc for your room. Would not hesitate to recommend or return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: davo2005
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week's stay at the Pan Pacific and strongly recommend this great hotel. If you crave superior customer service as well as first class facilities this is the hotel for you. From the moment we arrived the friendliness of the staff and the quality of their service was apparent. From the door men to the personal check-in to our room the level of service exceeded all expectations. We really appreciated the friendliness and help received from all staff during our stay. The rooms have been tastefully refurbished and have a contemporary feel. The LCD tv was a nice touch and the king bed was huge and well comfy. We felt very comfortable throughout our stay. Another nice touch was the option of clearing out the bar fridge and using it to store your own beverages etc. Very helpful. We ordered room service on a few occassions and the timing was impeccable, most efficient we have experienced. The food was good too and the fact that the in room dining menu includes items from some of the hotel's in house restaurants is fantastic. The location of the hotel couldnt be better. The hotel is linked by walkways, overpasses etc to the major shopping centres (Millenia Walk, Marina Square, Suntec City) and hotels within Marina Bay. You are basically a few minutes walk to great shopping and food. If you like to walk the Esplanade is a 10 min walk and a futher 10-15 mins will take you to Boat Quay, the museums etc. If walking isnt your thing then jump in a taxi from the hotel foyer. We never waited for a taxi no matter what time of the day and normally spent between $5-10 a fare, the furthest we travelled was to Orchard Rd. Cheap in our eyes. We had an absolutely fantastic time in Singapore and the fact that the hotel is in such a great location and the facilities and staff exceeded our expectations it just made our trip that bit more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel with a major caveat”
Reviews.Author: Psycho-Badger
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the pan pacific, and the experience was identical on both occasions: lovely room and faultless service, but the standard of the food was very disappointing. We never had breakfast due to early check-outs both times. The first time (September 2006) we ate dinner in the French-style bistro upstairs- the food was cold, uninspiring and overpriced. On our second visit we arrived late so we ate from an asian tapas-style menu in the lobby bar- once again the food was luke warm (I doubt it was prepared fresh) and overpriced. Our bill came to 150 Singapore dollars for 4 glasses of beer and approximately six small tapas servings. I would be unlikely to pay these prices in Dublin, where I live, and Dublin is generallly regarded as one of the most expensive cities in the world. In summary then, the rooms and desk staff at the PP Singapore are excellent, and I have received good deals on the internet on both occasions. I would strongly advice against eating there however. Considering that the restaurant experience is important to me and that there is a competitive hotel market in Singapore, I don't feel the PP as a whole is up to scratch and therefore would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vishala
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay. We had a deluxe room with Balcony and The view from our room was worth the extra money we paid over the standard room. There was initially some disconnect as I booked for Deluxe Balcony room and my reservation was done for Panoramic room. The staff at your reception desk was very helpful. Considering there were issues with reservation, they helped me get the correct room, contacted my travel agent and personally escorted me to my correct room. I couldn't have expected a better treatment. This hotel has an Indian restaurant inside, but the timings are limited and we missed it as we were too busy shopping and roaming around. The only drawback is that it is a bit far away from the main shopping district the Orchid road.

Reviews.Title: “truely luxury”
Reviews.Author: Greek-Australian
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pan Pacific for one day on my way back to Adelaide from Greece. I used a telephone booking, because their internet site did not have flexibility for 'non-standard' check-in and check-out hours. The hotel is marvelous in all aspects, albeit at S$320 per night (excl. breakfast). The breakfast and meals however are extremely over-priced at S$40 for a continental breakfast! in fact is it ridiculously priced when you think about it.

Reviews.Title: “pan-tastic stay”
Reviews.Author: buttercup306
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed at the pan pacific from 6-8 nov 07, on our way to adelaide, we booked it on the internet check in was very quick,they gave us a room upgrade free room 3116 fantastic views of the city and merlion, can't fault the room in anyway just wish we could have stayed longer, we would like to thank all the staff and managment for making our stay a memorable one , and can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Decent value”
Reviews.Author: Dinosaw
Reviews.Content: After staying here twice during November I came away having enjoyed my stay but not as much as I might have. The main plus points for Pan Pacific are their reasonable internet rates and the superb friendly attitude of the staff who really can't do enough to help you. The hotel also features modern well proportioned rooms and a pretty good location, breakfast if included in the rate is extensive but otherwise I would opt for one of the coffee shops in the adjoining mall. The down sides were painfully slow lifts and problems during check out such as having to correct discrepencies in the room rate or having the bill presented in my home currency when I had requested it in SGD. In fairness to Pan Pacific their feedback programme is very good and they had responded to my problems within a day. In relation to other hotels I have stayed in Singapore then I found my stay at the Pan Pacific more enjoyable than both the Fullerton and the Shangri La but feel that the Mandarin Oriental is worth paying that little extra for.

Reviews.Title: “bargain luxury, great views, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: mickmcdonagh
Reviews.Content: This was the third hotel of our honeymoon trip and was probably the most "holiday like" one of all. We checked in within seconds of arrival and were presented with a bouquet of flowers. Bags were brought to our 33rd floor room and a fruit bowl and wedding cake arrived shortly afterwards! This hotel really has everything: great city views (get the upgrade room!), friendly efficient staff, super facilities, nice bar (like all hotle bars, more expensive than the local bars!) The room was spotless and bed was huge. Very central location ( walked to Raffles in 5 minutes) and offers direct access to a large shopping centre. Breakfast was expensive but tasty. Go to the shopping centre and get more for less! Good selection of restaurants but get out and see the place. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Love the Beds”
Reviews.Author: Niiki
Reviews.Content: To be honest, we don’t usually stay in Singapore long enough (or have enough spare time) to get to enjoy the hotels. We do however have 2 favourites in Singapore when travelling for either business or leisure and the Pan Pac is one of them. This is due in most part to the amazing beds. Seriously divine. The last time we went we slept in on both mornings we were there as we were sleeping so well (and the fact that our hotel booked wake up calls didn’t arrive – minor bad point). I had a drink at the bar on one evening and when I went down the next evening, the waiter recognized me and asked me if I would like the same wine. Great attention to detail In summary: - The rooms have recently been refurbished and are excellent - Service is superb - Location great – short walk to Suntec City and other shopping as well as business district - Nice (non-smoking) pool area and great bar/restaurant on the same level - Did I mention the beds?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: aarghan
Reviews.Content: Staff is cool, hotel is great, spacious rooms, great swimming pool and gym. Havent found better yet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms; be careful with booking special discounts at panpacific.com”
Reviews.Author: dougly
Reviews.Content: Pro's: Nice hotel; great room and bathroom, friendly service, location connected to malls, easy 20 minute air conditioned walk to MRT. Con's: we booked a room at the Pan Pacific website using "Singapore Airlines Boarding Pass Privileges" 15% discount offer. This offer was not honored at check-in and I did not have the energy to argue. Location: we liked the location in the convention part of town. But others may prefer staying closer to Orchard St. Amenities- all other hotels we've stayed at in Asia usually have some nice welcome fruit. Nothing here.

Reviews.Title: “Great upgrade on the property!”
Reviews.Author: UW_Alum
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised on how much I liked this hotel. In the description on different travel sites, this hotel was in the middle of an refurbishing upgrade. I decided to take advantage of the great rate and booked this hotel. The new hotel lobby and rooms were terrific. Service was excellent. Food was also terrific. A business colleague who lives in Singapore said that one of the best Indian restaurants was in the hotel. You should also take advantage of the cafe/bakery in the hotel. The location was convenient being near malls, the convention center and waterfront walkway. Friends in Singapore said that Pan Pacific usually had a bad reputation for being old and had bad service. When they visited us in the hotel, they too were impressed with the hotel including its service. Book this hotel before the price of the room rises.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: BerkshireHkc
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel with fantastic customer service. When we arrived, we were taken to our room by the customer relations manager who checked us in from our room. Our bags were taken up for us. During our stay we were also invited to a cocktail party by the management team, although we could not attend unfortunately. Each day our room was cleaned, bed made or changed, and the chamber maid checked if we wanted new towels every afternoon. Whatever our needs the hotel accommodated and gave plenty of advice. By the pool, fresh bottled water was always provided, together with cold towels to freshen up with and fruit. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to stay in a modern and beatiful building in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were on a totally different planet!”
Reviews.Author: bwie_sg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Pan Pacific, Singapore for 1 night over the weekend to get away from everyone. I made the reservation online for the 'Restful Weekends' package the hotel is offering online. We stayed at room 29-13. I wanted to change some details and hence called the hotel for help. Bad idea because they didn't know about the package I booked and kept asking if I got the right hotel. After an exasperating 15 minutes on the phone to the hotel trying to explain that I booked through the online reservation form, I managed to resolve my issue through the hotel's website online without the phone staff's help. On the day when we checked in, we were informed that our reservation was cancelled, somehow, in a rather impolite manner. My husband is English and can't speak Mandarin. The hotel check-in staff started speaking to each other in Mandarin, totally disregarding my husband. I thought it was rather inconsiderate and that staff from a 5-star hotel in a MULTI-RACIAL country would be aware of such sensitivity. That's not all! After the hotel kindly reinstate our reservation, we found that they were not aware of what our package comes with. We had to remind the hotel staff and this happened all throughout our stay there. The only good thing was they upgraded our room from a Paranomic room to a Paranomic Balacony room. The room - it was typical of a 5-stars hotel with good amenities and comfy bed. Bathroom was sparkling clean but the shower was most difficult to figure out! We spent 10 minutes trying to read the instructions given! The balcony was the most boring and ugly balcony I have seen from all hotels. The view was good; excellent view of Singapore's skyline, particularly breath-taking at night. Room service was fast and efficient. Food was nice and the serving was big enough for us. At check-out, we were billed for things that were supposedly free (and came as part of the package). When we pointed them out to the check-out staff, she counter-offered her opinion to us forcefully (this was putting it very nicely!). In the end, we were made to feel that the hotel was doing us a goodwill by waiving all the charges even though the reservation printout we had stated otherwise. Generally, the hotel delivered. The staff did not. We felt that the staff were ill-informed and impolite.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: StaffordKod
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Pan Pacific for two nights in June 2007 as part of our honeymoon. The atrium of the hotel is something to behold, it is the biggest atrium in Asia. The welcome we received at the hotel was superb, really personal service. I would definately recommend this place to honeymooners, they made us feel very special. If you want some decent panoramic photos of the Singapore sky line then take a ride in the glass elevators on the outdside of the hotel. They take you to the very top of the hotel giving you amazing views, especially at night. It is in a good location, Raffles is a 10 minutes walk away, there is a shopping centre attached to the hotel and Orchard Street and Clarkes Quay are a five minute taxi ride away. Taxi's are cheap and a good way to see the city when it is really humid. The locals are really friendly and do not try to rip you off. China town is good, probably the most civilised I have ever been to! Clarkes Quay is worth a visit too, great nightlife, loads of venues to choose from. Our only regret is that we did not stay longer. Would definately go back and stay at the Pan Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value”
Reviews.Author: FeedTheFishMayo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as the last 2 nights of a 5 night trip after moving across from the Royal Plaza on Scotts. The room at the Pan Pacific was very spacious with good views. That is the only good thing I have to say about this hotel. The furnishings were very dated, especially the bathroom. For a 5 star hotel I expect the rooms to be renovated semi regluarly not every 20 years. The cost to use the internet (if you do not have your own lap top) was very high. The bar in the lobby charged astronomical prices. If you are looking for value then I could not recommend this hotel. Of the two hotels I stayed at the Royal Plaza was far better value even if there was no view and the rooms were smaller, I would still go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific Singapore-A 6 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robbyDC
Reviews.Content: The arrival experience was so unexpected. My husband, son and I arrived tired after a long flight. Soon as we stepped down the pavement of the hotel, we were surprised at the reception line who were outside the hotel waiting. There was Ms Jennifer Wong (the Manager of Guest Care Services herself) and a Ms Ana, who was a Filipino like us... that itself was really the warmest and the best welcome I encountered in any hotel I ever have been. Before everything sinked in on us (of the royalty welcome), right away the luggages were taken from us by the very attentive hotel staff. We were escorted by Ms jennifer & Ms Ana to our room and checked us in personally. My son had truly a heyday when he saw the bubble lifts. We even had our picture taken in it, which was given to us as a souvenir. The deluxe room was wonderful. The very comfortable bed and sheets felt like heaven. We enjoyed the room immensely, so much so, we didn't want to leave it at all. The showers, bath tubs and toilet were great. So clean and water was great. We also noticed that bathroom amenities like shampoo, conditioner, lotion, etc... were replaced right away with new ones, even as much twice in a day. What more can I say. As a frequent traveller, this has been the best hotel experience ever. Have stayed in a lot of 5-star hotels, but nothing compared to this... hotel staff, experience, service, facilities and all. The level of service is truly amazing. There are so many staff on hand to help you with anything you need. No need to turn or twist your head. They all speak excellent english and are really willing and happy to help. In fact, the person who we paid for theme park trips had commented and informed us that Pan Pacific was truly the best hotel in Singapore. He says he used to work for a 4-star hotel along Orchard Road, but nothing compared to the hotel we were staying at. I am actually lost for words to describe our Pan Pacific Singapore hotel experience. I can't criticize this hotel... it's the BEST!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Prince_nz
Reviews.Content: The service this hotel provides was second to none. We had a stopover in singapore on our way to Maldives for our honeymoon and got personalised service from their staff. Not only did they faultlessly arrange for us to be picked up from the airport - check in was done in our room with only a signature and they also provided us with a honeymoon cake + teddy bears as presents for our new marriage. Gomathi arranged everything for us and we felt like we were royalty as they didnt leave any details untouched. They even took a photo of us and emailed it to me as well as sat with us in the lobby when we were awaiting for our taxi to the airport. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Yes it is pricey but you do get service to match. No probs at all with their service. Plus it is close to shopping malls / suntec city + little india and china town, about 5 singaporian dollars to and from each place.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TomYum
Reviews.Content: One of the most disappointing hotel stays we have had for years. Having read the reviews, we had high expectations of this hotel, but were sorely disappointed. Booking through hotel site – Major hassles. At some stage used the hotel’s on-line email facility. Received a reply from them only AFTER our 2nd day there! Eventually wrote to an ‘inappropriate’ email address that I found on the site and received a reply and booking. Reception – physically what we would describe as a Sixties horror – over the top and cold. (Know this is a personal like/dislike) On check in, NONE of the things that we requested on the online ‘visitors profile’ that they require you to complete when booking, seemed to have made it to reception. We were allocated a room with everything but what we requested. Granted it was sorted out, but why bother with completing this form if noboby pays any attention to it anyway. Room – When you pay US$200 plus for a STANDARD room, you would in most places in the world expect to walk in and have some ‘wow’ factor. The only wow we had was one of disappointment. The room is a reasonable size, but it is basically stock standard. As stated in other postings, the balconies do not allow for any ‘sitting outside with a drink and enjoying the view’. Apart from the high concrete balcony, there is no furniture on the balcony. It is inexusable that in a hotel of that class there is no furniture on the balcony. Bathrooms – Separate bath, shower and toilet, but small Staff – Nothing to complain about, but not what will be remembered as warm and friendly Furnishing - Beds were comfortable, pillows were not. The rest is so so for a hotel of this class. Accessability to restaurants and shopping – right next to a few big malls, else Orchard Road, Clarke Quay, etc easily accesible by taxi (at present the only viable option) Prices - we found the price of food and beverage in the hotel quite expensive. As stated in previous postings, the mini bar is not well stocked, so you either buy from a nearby supermarket or pay the room service prices with all the added charges. Business services – Considering that Singapore is such an IT centre and the price of internet elsewhere, it is ridiculous what the hotel charges. Did not use other services, so can’t comment General – They are renovating the hotel and we had the cables running past our balcony which limited our view and privacy. At the very least, these rooms should have gone at a heavily discounted rate. Know this is Singapore and hotels are expensive, but stayed in other ‘expensive’ cities where we had much, much better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but can be very overpriced”
Reviews.Author: DCA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here October 2007 on a sky-high rate: $495 (Singapore dollars) per night. Hotel prices can be outrageous in Singapore during conferences, and a big meeting at Suntec convention center (connected to hotel) meant insane rates. I had a standard room which was mostly fine. Carpet was quite shabby and stained. Breakfast in the Global Kitchen restaurant is a ripoff at US$29 or so. Selection was limited. Questionable hygiene as the spoon for scrambled eggs was stored in a bowl of water. Yuck! Location is great if you have business at Suntec convention center. It's a long 10-15 minute walk to the nearest MRT station (City Hall), but you can get there through air-conditioned corridors and shopping malls. Pool is spacious with food/beverage service from the hotel restaurant next door. Gym is rather small for such a large hotel, with limited selection of weight machines and cardio equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: dutchkiwi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for business and the wife came along for the shopping. The location is superb, in the Marina Bay area. The hotel is linked to the SUNTEC City conference centre as well as the Marina Square Shopping Mall. It is a huge mall with great quality shops. A MRT (underground) station is a stiff walk away, however, I have been told that a new station will open up soon right next to the hotel. Otherwise a Taxi is around 3 to 5 Euros to go to Orchard Road or Boat Quay. The rooms are large, with comfortable beds, LCD TV's. The bathrooms have separate shower (a must as far as I am concerned) and a larg tub (a must as far as the wife is concerned). Separate toilet. The hotel has recently been renovated. The restaurants and lobby bar are brand new. The service is outstanding. Exceptional are in the lobby Kamille and Consuela at the business centre on the 22nd floor as well as Audrey at the reception. The breakfast buffet is outstanding and again, the staff so welcoming... A great place to be. It is a great pleasure to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but a bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MollyCardiff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific en route back to the UK from Australia, having previously stayed at Raffles the Plaza on the first leg of the journey (please see my other review). Maybe my expectations were too high following our stay at Raffles the Plaza. We had paid extra for a deluxe king bed balcony room, check-in at 10.30pm on Tuesday was busy but efficient. We were given the key for a room on the 13th floor. Waited about 10 mins to get in a lift, and then found the room had twin beds. I called reception, and this was sorted out quickly and efficiently without any question and we were moved to a new room on the 15th floor. The room was nice, but a bit bland. Bathroom has a small bath, small separate shower and a partioned toilet, so good for sharing. The balcony is large, no balcony furniture (seems to be typical in Singapore), but concrete, so even if you drag chairs outside you can't sit and admire the view. The view overlooking the bay and the Oriental hotel was great. The bed was huge, but not very comfortable and the bed-linen was quite worn. Good Flat screen TV and a small mini-bar area, not very well stocked. Music from the ground-floor bar was quite loud, but did stop well before midnight. The really annoying thing was the pinging noise from the lifts that could be clearly heard from the room, even though we were the other side of the atrium from the lift shafts! Luckily we are both heavy sleepers... Maybe the rooms and the noise levels in the suites on the top floors of the hotel are better. The main lobby area of the hotel is huge, impressive to look at but a bit cold and impersonal. As expected, the hotel was full of business travellers, they hold a lot of conferences here. As tourists, we stuck out like sore thumbs in (smart) casual clothes, and didn't feel we fitted in as well as at Raffles the Plaza. The pool area and the bar next to it was gorgeous - complementary towels and water was a nice touch. Very clean, serene area with a huge beautiful pool. The spa next to it was ok, although my husband was in agony after his sports massage! I tried the room service one evening, and was very impressed - fantastic meal, excellent service and presentation, reasonable prices. The hotel is one of four hotels connected to the Marina Square mall which is huge (great food court upstairs) and next to Suntec City which is even bigger, so good for shopping, and is walking distance to the bay areas, Boat Quay, the business district etc. We popped into the other hotels to have a look, they all have the same large lobby / atrium design with similar 'bullet' lifts. The whole area just seemed a bit to similar, miles of the same thing. Overall, I loved Singapore (please see my other review for tourist tips) and this was a good hotel, but for the price I expected better, and there are more interesting areas of the city to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Services”
Reviews.Author: qsqmqa
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at this hotel. Was very pleased with services, staff and location. Breakfast had a great selection. The hotel is connected to a nice shopping mall and, more improtantly, to the Suntec Conference Centre. A very good hotel all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for everything”
Reviews.Author: mandyclan
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel tired and needing a shower after our flight from Dubai. The hotel was lovely and to make our day we received an upgrade to an executive room, which also included free breakfast and access to the free lounge where we could get free drinks and nibbles in the afternoon and evening. The room was large, bathroom brilliant, remote roller blinds on the windows and not just one but two. We had a great sleep in the comfortable bed. Quite close to all the attractions like Clarke Quay and Raffles. The glass lifts go really fast and its great seeing the city, my partner found it a bit scary but at the end he was able to look out. Bars and restaurants at the hotel are very contemporary and relaxing. Would recommend this hotel to everyone as staff and hotel are fabulous. Will go back definately.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Pinkcustard
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Pan Pacific and loved it!! It was our honeymoon so the hotel upgraded us to a suite - it was the biggest and poshest hotel room I have ever stayed in with views overlooking the pool (fantasticly clean) and compliemntary tea/coffee/snacks 24hrs a day on level 22 in the Bering Suite. The food is brilliant (although the Zanzibar restaurant gave very small portions much to my husbands dismay) and the atrium downstairs is lovely in the evenings with live music. The hotel is spotlessly clean and all staff are keen to please. I would definatley go there again in a flash!!

Reviews.Title: “Happy to stay again”
Reviews.Author: RMDJakarta
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on reviews we had seen,unfortunately our stay was affected by a problem beyond the staffs control. Front of house was helpful,courteous and a pleasure to deal with. We were hapy with location,as we didnt mind walking or taxiing around. To the unfortunate part. After retiring to our room for a well needed rest,no sooner had we fallen asleep,when a loud noise(bang) occured then a hissing noise. Immediately we awoke to an acrid smell permeating throughout our room,choking us. Our Mini bar had self destructed, leaking ammonia into our room. Once notified the Hotel staff were helpful and moved us to another room,where we were checked upon for the next hour or so,to ensure we were ok. It was also explained to us that we would not be charged for our stay and that any drinks/tea/coffee would be complimentary. We received a letter from the GM apologising and feel that the Management and staff Of The Pan Pacific were extremely helpful and genuinely concerned with our well being. Overall we felt that the Hotel was reasonable at the price without being too flash,the service though was great.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore, The Pan Pacific, company given vacation”
Reviews.Author: Aksel
Reviews.Content: This was our organizations Club Exellence award for employees that has exceeded during the fiscal year, and we got to choose from the Pan Pacific and Conrad, and after reeding the reviews here, I choose the Pan Pacific. The hotel, as most of the other major ones, are located in one place; Marina Square/Bay. They all have wonderful views of Singapore, if you stay in a higher floor. The Pan Pacific have a grandious lobby, created like a triangle, and you can see straight up the hotel and all the floors, with glass elevators going up and down, some on the inside (floors 1-22) and some on the outside (23-36, the executive floors). We were upgraded to the executive floor on the 26th floor, after some really nice and very good communications with their hotel manager. All the communication directly with the hotel through email was excellent and they responded very quick. The check-in went really smooth and fast and our luggage were sent up afterwards. We were greated in the room by a spectacular view from our executive business room, wich balcony and a lounge chair on the balcony. There were a fruit and chocolat basket as welcome, as well as one very beautiful, asian, robe, as a gift. The room was spacious with a queen bed with very nice down feather cover and pillows. Flat screen TV and a good sized desk for business. Wireless was excellent and fast. The bathroom was big, with a separate shower and bathtub and a separate toilett as well. The only minor part that was not that good, was the storage room. The closests were all spread out in the wall between the livingroom and the bathroom and were small with may compartments. Bathrobes and flippers existed, which is always nice, as well as complemantary water bottles every time the room was made up. The hotel is quite big, but far from the biggest ones. There are many restaurants in the hotel, which are supposed to be very good as I have read online and in magazines that are about Singapore that I found in the room, like Time Out Singapore. We tried the Japanese restaurant, which I don't remember the name of, and it was at least top 10 sushi I have had. We dined at Zambuca, their Italian restaurant, which was excellent. A great restaurant and the food and service was superb. Really a restaurant to recomend. If there is one thing that I actually was a little bit dissapointed at, was their breakfasts. They had three, or maybe four, breakfast restaurants to choose from, and we tried two. The one for the executive floors, are on the 22nd floor, smaller breakfast, but a bit more private and not so many guests. The other one was on the 3rd floor and had more options, but more lunch food then breakfasts food. The thing missing in all of their breakfasts, are the usualy western way of eating a sandwich/toast to breakfast; chees, ham, turkey, pastrami and these kind of things. Maybe the do not eat that in Asia? The pool area is very nice with a good size pool. Nice and comfortable sun chairs and excellent service, like free water and fruit. The gym is located here, but I did not have the time to try it. Excellent hotel! I can truelly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Berkshire_UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is faultless. From the moment we entered the hotel the excellent service started. The hotel had already emailed me for passport details etc, so registration took 2 minutes. My wife and I were escorted by a lovely young lady to our room on the Panoramic Floor (31st) where the views were excellent. The only way past the 22nd floor is via the outside glass lifts, so the views of downtown Singpore, Raffles and the pool area are stunning. The hotel is very central and is within walking distance of the Singapore tourist places. There are always taxis to take you further afield, however ensure the Mercedes taxis put you on the meter, otherwise you will pay the limo prices. The outdoor bar area is great for lunch and drink during the day. They also give a pool side service. The pool area is never crowded, but is always manned. As soon as you sit down they bring complementary water and fresh towels. I attended a conference in the hotel and once again the facilities in the ballroom area are very good. Only one problem while we were there was access to the internet service in the room at $25 SD per day. it is expensive, but in our room they could not get it working properly; neither wired nor wireless worked, so after couple of days I gave up and said I wasn't going to pay for the poor connection over the previous days. No problem, no arguement, they didn't charge me. Overall great place and if I visit Singapore again (business or pleasure), I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Club Rooms”
Reviews.Author: FirstClass59
Reviews.Content: First stay at the Pan Pacific. I was travelling alone on Business. Since there are a number of reviews on the hotel I thought I would focus on the Pan Pacific Club Floor. Simply, the Hotel and Staff were excellent. The Club floor rooms are on upper floor of the Hotel providing outstanding views of the city. Upon arriving at the hotel you go the the Pacific Club Desk and are then escorted to a private checkin area on the 33rd floor. The elevators to the checkin desk are on the exterior face of the building offering spectacular views of the city. Upon checkin you will be greeted by the most hospitable of hosts who will remember you name the entire stay. You will recieve a cool fresh fruit drink and towel while being quickly checked in. Staying on the Pacific Club floor offers a number of ammenities that make it worth the additional price. First there are lounges on the 33rd and 34th floor for Pan Pacific Club guests. The 33rd Floor Lounge is open 24 hours with complimentary coffee, tea , juice and light snacks. Complimentary is the theme while staying on these floors... Choice of breakfast is served on the 33rd floor ( American) , the Lobby Lounge ( Continental) ; Global Kitchen Restaurant ( Buffet) or in-room dining. There is afternoon tea ( 3-5PM), Cocktails and Hors d'Oeuvres ( 5:30-7 PM) and Liquor Service ( 8-10) on the 34th Floor Club. In addition there is a complimentary in-room mini-bar stocked daily with beer, Liquor, water and soda. Internet access and local calls as well as the pressing of 3 garments are also complementary. The rooms are very spacious and well appointed. Plenty of storage as there are two closets and numerous dresser draws. There is an ironing board and iron in each room. The room has a large flat panel TV and DVD player. The Bathroom is very large and luxurious. Marble everywhere. L'occitane bath products , hair dryer, shaving kits , tooth brush and paste are included. There is a seperate shower and bath. There are a number of very good restaurants in the hotel. Even with all the ammenties the outstanding service throughout the hotel is what really stood out.

Reviews.Title: “The best review in the world!”
Reviews.Author: BabyGirl84
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves nothing but the best praises, it was phenomenal in every aspect. Beginning with my arrival. Arrived at 8am (when check in is at 3pm), was greeted by the friendly staff at check in, and was immediately given a room. The hotel is very well staffed, there is someone everywhere to help or just to offer a friendly smile. Being a single traveller, that made a big difference. I stayed in the deluxe room, it was very spacious, with everything i could possibly need. The bathroom was spacious and beautiful. The Atrium area downstairs is a great place to relax, and have a drink. There is also an Atrium deli, and a great collection of restaurants to choose from within the hotel, so i mainly ate there. The pool is fantastic, i knew i couldn't leave Singapore before at least swimming there once.. Great, again very well staffed, there is a gym there and a sauna.. Up until then the hotel had met all my expectations, but they exceeded them on Saturday night. I had booked a trip to the Night Safari with a company who were going to pick me up from there, the time came and they didn't show. I asked the conciege help desk to make a phone call. It turned out they came but i was supposed to wait in the lobby, not outside, and the bus left. (of course they omitted to tell me this when i was making the booking) After the phonecall i was visibly sad, and thought my night had been ruined. The staff member noticed, and immediately said 'if you want to go, you'll go' and ordered a taxi for me at the hotel's expense to the Zoo!!! I bought a camera which had a european charger (i hated electronics shopping in Singapore), and couldn't charge until i noticed there was in fact a international plug in my room. I called an electrician at an early hour in the morning to convert the voltage so i can use it, and within seconds he was there to help. So let's see, the location is great, the price is great, the service is phenomenal, the rooms are great, the restaurants are great. I would highly recommend staying at the Pan Pacific while in Singapore. Also, if you get tired of taking taxis, there is a bus stop right outside the hotel leading to Orchard Rd, and the City Hall MRT is also easy to get to. Just ask the staff for directions.. From the beginning to the end of my stay, the staff there were like my family away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Skeoughs
Reviews.Content: We always check reviews on this site but have never written one, except it would be wrong not to say how amazing this hotel is. To be honest it was part of a 2 day stay over in Singapore on the way back from Oz so we didnt really care where Trailfinders put us, but from the moment we walked into the lobby and saw the "Blade Runner" type lifts we were enthralled. The room was extremely comfortable, we cannot have feathers in the duvet etc, which they had, but on ringing the concierge the whole bed linen was changed within 20mins. We have to mention 2 of the fantastic restaurants in this hotel. One was serving thier local food for breakfast, hot with all the sauces, I've never eaten so much (an Im usually a cereal person) but the Indian restaurant was outstanding, we have never eaten so well. Unfortunately when we were staying it was the last few days before it was being re-decorated and they were closing off the kitchens from viewing which we think will be a pity. The pool (as you can see from the pics) was an excellent size and the gym was extremely well equipped. On our last day we did some sight seeing and obviously had checked out, but we were provided with towels for showering and freshening up in their beautiful changing rooms beside the pool. This is defenitely the best hotel we have stayed in for quite some time and we would absolutely recommend it to anyone who wants and excellent hotel is a superb location within walking distance of the major malls and Raffles.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: ralphtoronto
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Pan Pacific. The staff were extremely accommodating and provided us with complimentary refreshments while we waited in the cafeteria for our room to be ready as we had arrived very early in the morning. The hotel has an excellent gym and pool and is near a few good breakfast locations. The only thing we would do differently would be to catch a regular taxi to the airport and not a hotel one as it was twice the price. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: EasyNote
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! This was our first stop over on our round the world trip and we weren't dissapointed. The rooms and other hotel ammenities were great. we were upgraded upon our arrival to a suite which was very well furbished and had fantastic views of the city sky line. Its in a good location in which to explore the rest of the city. I would definately reccomend this hotel to anybody. we'd love to go back.....maybe one day!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Steph_and_Mart
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal through expedia. We are generally used to 3 star accomodation, and therefore really appreciated this luxury. The staff were friendly but left you alone when not required. The room was beautifully styled with top spec marble bathroom. The bar and food prices were expectant of four star, but a relax in the atrium bar was worth one drink. We used the pool area everyday to escape the heat, and it wasn't busy at mid-morning time.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience marred by room reservation staff”
Reviews.Author: Hburn10
Reviews.Content: I chose the Pan Pac Singapore for a short getaway, and turned out to be better than my experience at Swissotel the Stamford. I got a Paranomic Balcony room on the 29th floor, and it was accessible by the glass elevator facing the Marina, which offered a great view everytime we went up to the room. The room was smaller than expected, but being recently reburbished, had a more classy feel and modern elements, evident in the mounted swivle plasma TV and hidden compartments in the counter which hides the mini bar, cups etc (a very nice change from the normal counter tops). Very clean, and nice, with efficient room service and house keeping. Breakfast at Global Kitchen was only so-so...I had expected a bigger spread for the price (SGD82 for 2 persons!). Also recieved a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolate cake as I had informed it was my birthday cum anniversary celebrations. The only hiccup occured during reservation. The new staff were inconsistent with their information, and they failed to inform on their webpage that all their deluxe & deluxe balcony rooms are undergoing refurbishment, which makes them unavailable from Aug - Sept. So please note this, as then the many promotions and prices listed on their website are no longer applicable for the 2 months.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Fauzia
Reviews.Content: The rooms: We stayed in Singapore for 2 nights. The hotel was quite nice. We had a look at many other hotels in the area to find what else there was, but rooms were quite pleasant here. Nicely furnished and great ambience. Conatined everything necessary! The hotel: The hotel itself is very open inside. It is hollow, exposing each floor from the very top to the bottom level. It has very spacious floors. When you leave your room and look over the balcony, you can see the lobby bar. The external view we had from our room was quite dissapointing as it was obstructed by a concrete beam. The location: The hotel is very convenienty located to many shopping malls which are all in walking distance, there are many other surrounding hotels. Service: Service is very good, staff are extremely friendly and are always willing to help. Breakfast: Huge variety for breakfast, both continental and hot which includes the usual western cuisine as well as eastern.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne8
Reviews.Content: What a hotel! Just a quick note on the place. The building is unbelieveable, the decor is top quality and really does make you feel small! Great staff, nice pool and facilities. Only slight issue I would have would be the internet connection, but please don't let that put you off.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, especially for shoppers”
Reviews.Author: rmwhitt
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific is located in Marina Square, adjacent to a shopping mall that connects to another shopping mall that connects to another shopping mall, and another...well, you get the picture. Singapore is known for its shopping opportunities and this hotel allows both the shopper and the sightseer to enjoy themselves. You can literally walk for miles underground, or surface and visit the Esplanade (river area) or Boat Quay/Clark Quay before returning to airconditioned spendor of the vast underground. I travel to Singapore every year and this is my first stay at Pan Pacific. If you like to walk, you can get around the city on foot easily from this hotel, or you can use the MRT/public transport (train) which is very user friendly. Taxis are very inexpensive but traffic can be tough. The hotel was very nice, a good 4*. I snagged it at a great rate of US$120 when other hotels (lesser or equal ones) cost $180 or more. It's comparable to Swissotel and better than the M or the Amara. The room was a good size, soothing in decor. It was typically outfitted in standard 4* comforts. Big shower stall was a pleasure to use (no tub). The outdoor pool was nice, as was the dry sauna in the pool area. I did not eat in the hotel but there are a couple of restaurants and an active lobby bar with singer/entertainment at night. Service was attentive and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrianBrown
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and rooms. Hotel is linked to Suntec which has a lot of shops, S$5 taxi ride to Orchard road, Boat and Clark Quay

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable building”
Reviews.Author: bmarshall
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the way to Australia and loved it . The hotel is expensive but if you get a high floor the view are wow!. We went for a weekend offer and of the free options went for a room upgrade. The building is awesome and internally is like an empty pyramid with the bar/music at the bottom. As in some other reviews the lower floors might get to hear the music. The hotel is well located next to a shopping centre but dont worry about getting around taxi travel here is so cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a hotel”
Reviews.Author: RNoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 2 night stay after travelling around Australia for 4 months as we fancied a bit of luxury before going home and boy did we find it. The Hotel was beautiful, we were given a free upgrade upon arrival and were on floor 33. This meant getting the outside glass lifts which are not for those afraid of heights but what a view over the city. The room was wonderful, clean, good soundproofing and lots of little extras like bath salts, slippers and bath robes. It is situated perfectly and we could walk everywhere with a little help from the staff as to what door to take...there are loads as this is one huge hotel. The breakfast was lovely, fresh and every choice you could think of. In fact the only negative I could think of would be the cost of drinks in the lounge but for a top notch hotel like this it really was to be expected and certainly wouldn't put me off of going again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SofiaReiziger
Reviews.Content: We stayed in another hotel in Singapore but were unhappy with it so we decided to move. Found a room in Pan Pacific and were very glad that we chose this hotel. The room we had was very clean, the bathroom was immaculate and the view from our balcony was fantastic. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. They let us check in early and even upgraded us to a room on a business floor. As previous reviews said, the music could be heard from the atrium in the evening but it was not loud enough to be a bother. Breakfast was very good with many different choices: American, European or Asian style. We will definitely stay there again whenever we visit Singapore

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: lb514
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Pan Pacific with my husband for 8 days (I was there for a conference). We were able to check in hours early and were upgraded for free upon arrival (9th floor w/a balcony). Everyone was extremely helpful; the staff anticipated many of our needs before we even voiced them! Much of the staff remembered our names and room number after only being there a couple of days which gave our stay a very personal feel! Our room was so clean - the hotel stores and restaurants were fantastic - the location was ideal. The only negative thing I can say (which really was not a big deal at all) was that the singing in the lounge in the evening carried up to our room. It was pleasant nonetheless and actually helped me fall asleep! I highly recommend this hotel and would go back in a flash!

Reviews.Title: “Should Be A Deluxe!”
Reviews.Author: Dan_Sin_Kween
Reviews.Content: This is classed as a First Class hotel, but I'd call it a deluxe. Let's start with the facilities. There's a fantastic pool (with a gym next door for the energetic!) where the pool staff provide bottles of drinking water as well as towels! If you're lucky enough to be on one of the higher floors you get to use the exterior lifts. Inside this 30+ storey hotel is an atrium with a cocktail bar. There's live bands playing most nights as well. The first three floors are taken up by various restaurants and shops. The staff are very helpful. They give you advice as to where to eat etc and tell the taxi driver where to take you (and write it down) The location can't be faulted either. Check out some of the views in my photos. On one side is a hawker centre, open from morning to night. The other side is attached to a large shopping mall. the nearest MRT station is within walking distance (most of it in malls) but taxis are very cheap as well. Talking of taxis, when I left my shopping behind in the cab I had a call about half an hour later from the concierge. They informed me that the taxi returned with my shopping. I'm not sure that would have happened anywhere else in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Contemporary Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mchowdhury
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel as part of our honeymoon. Got upgraded to the panaromic room, worth the extra hype. Amazing views from balcony over looking the Singapore Harbour / River. Amazing atrium, and external lifts. Great roof top pool and gym. Great reception. Rooms and service all excellent too. Cant fault the place. Location in Marina Square.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Luxury”
Reviews.Author: sixfoursixnyc
Reviews.Content: Having studied there during my college days--I had a good sense of which areas in Singapore would be best for booking a quality hotel that isn't extravagantly over-priced (ahem--Fullerton!). The Pan Pacific Singapore is an immaculate hotel tower with impressive views and a great location that is quite close to major points of interest. I traveled with my sister, who tends to be picky about things like cleanliness and strength of air conditioning and even she was thoroughly impressed!!! The Pan Pacific is convenient by taxi to any location in Singapore and just a short walk away from the Merlion and the Quays which offer scenic views and a great chance to experience the beauty of Singapore. The showers/baths are immaculate and made us not want to leave the place! The only drawback is the expensive cell phone rentals and internet.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable for a family”
Reviews.Author: Simpkeys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific on our way home from Thailand and I was pleasantly surprised by the level of service at this hotel. Everyone from the reception people to the pool staff made our stay very enjoyable. The pool is easily accessible and has a shallow end with wide stairs that was perfect for my 3 and 6 year olds. The MRT station is a pretty good hike from the hotel. It took us around 15 to 20 minutes to walk there. This wasn't a problem until we were coming home a little late one night and I had to carry our youngest child who was fast asleep. The one annoying thing for us was the lounge singer in the atrium. Because the hotel is open in the middle, the sound carries all the way up and could be heard quite clearly in our room on the 16th floor. The music ends around 11:30.

Reviews.Title: “great customer service”
Reviews.Author: RAMY1
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 2nts on our return journey back to the uk after being in Austalia for a month. Arrived early hrs of the morning so wanted a speedy check-in which we got. Hotel also upgraded our room as they had over booked, so that was a nice surprise.We had requested a cot for our little boy which wasnt in the room so we had to wait 20 min for this to arrive and it looked more like a cage,than a childs cot so didnt bother putting our little boy in it. The room was pretty standard and I was a little dissapointed, as this was meant to be a 5 star hotel. The decor was dated and in need of a a good refurb.But the bed was huge and very comy. The breakfast was fantastic- something for everybody and the service was second to none. Our little boy was also given his own plasic plate, knife & folk. So very child friendly. The pool area was clean and towels were provided along with complimentary bottles of water. The service from the staff at the pool area was again very good, nothing was to much trouble, they offered us apples and lollypops and very cold towels to freshen up.(great service). The drinks were a little overpriced, but think this is to be expected in any half decent hotel. We didnt eat in the hotel on an evening so cant comment on the other restaurants. When we checked-out our transport had not arrived and the lady from reception stayed with us at the front of the lobby and contacted the tour operator on our behalf to chase them. She didnt need to contact them as they were only 5min late but she toke this upon herself without being asked to do so. So again great customer service. to sum up our stay- even though I was dissapointed with the room & decor, due to the excellent service we recieved we will stay here again and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More than perfect!”
Reviews.Author: EuropeDuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in April for 10days and it was perfect.Refering to some reviews of other visitors it is true,that there is a karaoke singing in the late evening every day.Our room was at the 11th floor and up there we didn´t hear anything. The staff was very friendly and helpful. And as we had a late departure they offered us a hospitality room to refresh ourselves. The room was quite large and more than clean.The cleaning lady even took off her shoes before entering our room. The hotel is situated in the middle of a shopping mall and if you arrive from the airport by the MRT, get off at City Hall and just follow the signs to the Marina square shopping center. So you can get to your hotel througout an endless airconditioned mall. You don´t need to take breakfast at the hotel (expensive), there are plenty of opportunities in the Marina Square mall. Be sure to give Bread talks a try! There is also a rather big supermarket (Carefour) in the Suntec City Center. If we are going to Singapore again we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved”
Reviews.Author: candy22
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a trip to Australia stopping off at Syngapore. We stayed at the Pan Pacific for a few nights, what a lovely hotel, the staff so helpful could not do enough for you. Our flight home was late in the evening but thay let us keep our room for quite a few hours after we should have checked out. It was worth going to this hotel just for their breakfast thay were amazing. Would certainly go back again and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Yet again, the Pan Pacific did not disappoint!!”
Reviews.Author: Sammie4
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at the Pan Pacific in two months, both for business purposes. I again stayed on the Business Exec floor which houses good size rooms, large beds & ample bedding & bathroom amenities. From Reception upon arrival to Reception on your departure you are treated like the very first customer through their door. Their services are outstanding and their staff are v.polite & impressive. Their breakfast selection is overwhelming & ample a great start to a busy or relaxing day. Taxis are in abundance should your require them & the majority of these are metered providing you peice of mind. During my stay notification of refurbishment on some floors was being circulated so it will interesting to see what these refurbished rooms will look like upon completion. As previously advised this hotel is in a great location for shopping especially as it is situated minutes away from the marina & the famous Orchard Road - a shoppers paradise. I can think of nowhere better to stay when visiting Sinapore & the Pan Pacific will always be my first choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great day and night view from room”
