Reviews.Author: globetrotterboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply fantstic. It boasts an excellent location with minutes o the bustling city center and shopping close by. The room was not bad, pretty nice, nothing fancy like a W or Westin though - but very god for the price we paid. If breakfast is not included in your room rate then do ot go into the hotel restaurant to have brekkie as it is expensive at S$42 per head. Rather go to Starbucks or other nice breakfast eateries nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: terravisum
Reviews.Content: My flight comes in a bit early around 8AM and the quick cab ride to the Pan Pacific got me into the hotel lobby around 9AM. As it was early, I was notified by the front desk that my room was not ready and promptly invited me to the lobby lounge/bar for a complimentary drink while the hotel setting up my room. One cup of cappuccino later and I was invited to check out my room. The room was a good size room with a large King bed. I have a nice view to the Marina and can see the Merlion from my window. The bed was comfortable and clean. Probably one of the best hotel room that I have seen so far aside from the Singapore Grand Hyatt. The walk-in bathroom is a large size with separate shower and bathtub. The room is stocked with standard amenities of shampoo, conditioner and lotion. A complimentary shoeshine service is also available as part of the room. There are live band music every night from 7PM-11PM in the lobby and since the Pan Pacific is an atrium-type hotel, if you like to sleep early and have issues with sounds, you might want a high-floor room. There are bird-chirping sound in the atrium in the morning but I think they are just sounds playing from loudspeaker than real live birds. Turned-down service is done everyday around 6PM. The service is attentive with an accent on security. There are always several security guards manning the entrance from outside to the connecting entrance from the shopping complex nearby. The location is a bit off from Orchard road but it has good way to get on the freeway to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel, Dont Miss Out!”
Reviews.Author: OldBear
Reviews.Content: What a great Hotel. We stayed here at the end of March 07 for three nights. Having travelled from the UK with Singapore Airlines we used our 'Boarding Pass Privelage' to book an offer direct with the hotel which included breakfast. We arrived direct from the airport at 08:00 hours and asked if there was 'any likelyhood' of checking in early as check in time is 3 pm. We were given our room at 10.45am. Breakfast at the hotel is buffet style with an extensive range of foods to suit all. We were on the 19th floor and had an excellent view of the river and city district. Yes we could hear the music and singing, but it ends before midnight, so why not go down to the bar and enjoy? Alcohol in Singapore IS expensive especially wine, but then you do not see any drunkeness on the streets. The location of the 'Pan Pac' is excellent for the Marina Shopping Centre and the MRT. The MRT is an underground train system which is Very safe and cheap. The hotel rooms are spacious, clean and have very comfortable large beds. There is a business centre on a higher floor which allows you use of a computer and Internet for a small charge. There is a 'tour desk' on the 2nd floor where you can book many different trips including the Night Safari. Don't miss Swimming with the Dolphins at Sentosa Island ( Book at .'Underwaterworld' before you go for only £50 each.)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: rangus
Reviews.Content: Great place, great service, great location, great facilities, great room, great view. There was nothing at all negative about this place. I will be staying here again, loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy-Lee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights over Easter and had a pleasant stay. Got a fantastic deal through a travel agent making it very good value for money so shop around as even expedia couldn't better it. Generally I find that with hotels it is not the problems but the solutions that can make all the difference and the Pan Pacific dealt well with the issues that came up. The first room I was given had a locked connnecting door to another room through which a lot of noise from the children there could be heard. One call to reception and they quickly moved me to another room without fuss. However the air con in the 2nd room was noisy and cold - again this was repaired quickly when I reported it. The Concierge and reception were all friendly and helpful. The breakfast in the Global Kitchen restaurant was extensive and vey good quality - local expat friends joining me felt it was good value for SNG $35 I can see noise from the atium might be an issue on lower floors but only when there is a singer or musician in the lobby bar which is not late or every night. Nice rooms, spacious bathrooms and good toiletries including hair conditioner which was a plus. There is a big pool and gym area which is really nice and well serviced. It felt very safe having to use your room card to access bedroom floors. The atrium is pretty spectacular and gives the hotel a bit of a edge. The bakery/deli even had Hot cross Buns on sale. Having direct access to a huge shopping mall is a plus if you love shopping. There is a Carrefour supermarket in Suntec mall to buy fresh milk, juice or anything else you like and a good food hall next door in the other mall for a cheap lunch. Would certainly stay again if I could get a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hedge3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was better than we had hoped and we were expecting it to be good! The location is great - right near the harbour, the open top bus stop which goes all over singapore, shopping malls, etc. The rooms are clean and well laid out. The hotel is large but it is organised and friendly. We had excellent service. We had breakfast included and the food was great. All sorts to suit all tastes. Only comment would be that the bar is so expensive we never had a drink there which would have been nice to do. No hesitation in recommending or going back ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Cute glass elevators @ PanPac”
Reviews.Author: AsianGeekette
Reviews.Content: I stayed in PanPac (how locals affectionately call this hotel) from 9-11 February, 2007. I was with a work colleague and we flew from HK and arrived way past midnight. It was actually early morning of Feb. 10. Check-in was quite fast and we got into our room immediately. There were bath salts in the bath room and it was sheer bliss to just soak in a hot bath after a long day. Their toiletries are not run-of-the-mill hotel toiletry. There was separate tub and shower facilities. Bathrobes were nice and towels are soft and fluffy. We didn't have the chance to partake of the breakfast since we were in town to attend a conference in Suntec City. But me and my colleague had a nice time riding the external glass elevators (the ones which look like crystal eggs on the side of the hotel building) up and down. It was an experiment on removing some of my fear of heights. We didn't have to use our room card key to use this elevator (unlike the internal elevator which we needed to use the card key so we can get to our floor). Yes, there was a bar on the lobby and due to the open design of the building some sounds do tend to be heard when you're near the internal elevator area of the lower floors. But once you're inside your room, you won't hear the sounds anymore. The staff are very friendly (as compared to other staff members in some of the Singaporean hotels I've stayed in). It was pleasant dealing with them. It was a pleasure staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: mumisme
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pan Pacific on a 24hr stopover on my way to Australia, I was traveling alone and was apprehensive about staying in a strange city on my own. The staff at Pan Pacific made me feel very welcome and helped me to feel at ease immediately. I had a room on the Pan Pacific floor (33rd I think) the room and views were outstanding. I ate in the hotel that evening and again the staff helped to alleviate the feeling of being alone with small touches such as giving me a magazine to read as I waited for my meal. Just a small touch which makes all the difference. Breakfast was included and could be taken anywhere in the hotel, I chose to have it in the Pacific Floor Lounge and again the service and food was excellent. My flight was not leaving until early evening and I was encouraged to wait in the hotel for as long as I wished and to avail myself of all the facilities of the pacific floor, including afternoon tea. When I took a taxi to the airport I was overcharged by the taxi driver but even this negative has been changed into a positive by the wonderful staff of Pan Pacific. I had the chance to give feedback to the hotel and mentioned this to them and over the past 3 weeks since I left, they have, traced the taxi firm through CCTV, registered a complaint on my behalf, and secured a refund of the charges from the taxi company which they have since refunded to myself. I could not have asked for better service and would definately reccomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Pan Pac”
Reviews.Author: togs51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific for 4 days at the beginning of March. This was our 2nd visit to Pan Pac in 15years. The stay was wonderful. The staff excellant especially the gentleman who signed us in when we arrived. Nothing was too much trouble for them. We were celebrating our 28th Wedding Anniversary and they kindly reserved seating for us at the Fullerton Hotel for a breakfast by the sea. Which was so nice. They also made reservations for us at various restaurants e.g. No Signpost and the Jumbo. We were upgraded to a room on the 33rd floor which had views over Suntec and St Andrews. We will stay again at the Pan Pac whenever we travel through Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: californian
Reviews.Content: stayed at pan pacific from feb 27 thru march 3rd.check in was pretty smooth and they were nice enough to give me a room as my flight arrived at 7 in the morning. rooms are very nice.but the elevators are slow, very slow.once my wife had to wait for almost 30 minutes. breakfast buffet was disappointing.the plates and other containers were wet.just about every day i noticed it and so did a few others. i was supposed to get a credit of $34(singapore) if i had food at one of the hotel restaurants, which i never received.inspite of my requesting the credit. concierge service was pretty bad. there is an indian restaurant in the hotel.the dinner we had was pretty good, based on that i decided to try their lunch buffet, which turned out to be a disaster.it was 2 pm when i decided to have my lunch, most of the buffet item containers were empty.had to request several times for the bread(naan), waiter gave me two pieces of cold naan. which is a no no in any good indian restaurant. oveall the experience was disappointing.would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stopover location”
Reviews.Author: Cleo_O
Reviews.Content: After a 12 hour flight from London we needed somewhere where we could be guaranteed a good, comfortable sleep and were not disappointed. The staff were very welcoming and professional. The bedroom was immaculately clean and comfortable, featuring a large kingsize bed with a soft white duvet. The bathroom was large and complete with all unguents required for a long hot bath, ideal for winding down after a long flight, If we had any more energy we may have been tempted to a swim in the spacious outdoor pool too. The hotel is situated in Suntech next to a shopping mall and food court, perfect for nipping out for a bowl of noodles in the evening, or breakfast in the ground floor outdoor cafe next to the mall, 2 mins walk away from the hotel (the only downside of the Pan Pacific was the slightly expensive hotel breakfast). The hotel is also walking distance from Clarke Quay, home to some of the best satay in Singapore. Pan Pacific definitely hits the spot for a good night's rest and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “My Kids Loved It”
Reviews.Author: philippineeagle
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to staying at a hotel of this caliber in Singapore but were a little apprehensive if our two young children would really be welcomed there... Well, the kids loved it! We were on the 21st floor, so the glass elevator rides were thrilling. The pool area is very classy, but still kid friendly - the attendant even gave them lolly-pops after their swim. The buffet breakfast was a little less than I expected but the service was extremely friendly - they even gave our kids colorful plastic plates and utinsels. The Pan Pacific is a very elegant hotel but still fun for the little ones. The location is also fantastic. We were surrounded but shopping and entertainment. There is also easy access to the MRT through a nice underground mall.

Reviews.Title: “The Pan Pacific - Cool, Quite and Convenient and definately worth Consideration”
Reviews.Author: HinduMystic
Reviews.Content: Due to the lack of double beds at the Mandarin Oriental, we decided to stay at he Pan Pacific and it was an excellent choice. We were in Singapore to celebrate my wife's 40th birthday and our 1st Wedding Anniversary. Check-in was quick and efficient and the Hotel kindly upgraded our room as it was my wife's birthday. They sent a delicious Cake and flowers to our room on the day of her birthday which was a nice touch. The Rooms are nice and airy with a huge comfortable bed. Floor to celing window means you can see Singapore out side and the views are great. All the rooms have wireless Internet access and you can use the Business floor if you need to but this can be a bit expensive. The hotel staff are excellent and polite. We didn't have to call anyone for anything the whole time we were there. Sit out in shaded comfort and have some food at Brunch on the 4th Floor, The pool is just around the corner, They do all-day breakfast for those that missed breakfast, which we did everyday!!! The Indian restaraunt Rang Mahal was closed for refurbishement, but all the food places were execellent as well The Atruim Bar can get very busy after 5.00pm but its a cool place to have a drinks and chill out and listen to the live music The hotel is in a really good location, right next to two malls, Marina Plaza and Suntec City Mall, the later being the bigger and having a superb selection of restaurants. We would definately stay here again and would have no hesitation in recommending this to any readers out there The City Hall MRT station is a short walk away and if you cut through the City Link Mall, you can get to it in air-conditioned comfort. Buy an EZ-Link Pass if you plan to use the MRT as it will save you money and if you hand it in after you finish with it you get 3SD back plus any money still left on the card. Things to do while in Singapore: Sentosa Island - Go by Cable car and wonder around the island. Go during the week to avoid the crowds Chinatown/Little India - experience some of the culture and shopping Bukit Timah Nature Reserve Trek through the only tropical Rainforest in Singapore. Take lots of water and prepare to climb lots of steps Night Safari Fun and well organised night out to see some of the animals that you dont normally get to see. Take a cab to the Zoo...it's a lot easier and costs about 11-15 SGD. Try and get something to eat early as the restaurants at the Night Safari close abour 11-1130pm Orchard Road Shopping, shopping and more shopping SIM LIM Square For All your electronics stuff ...remember to haggle! Raffles Singapore Sling at the Long Bar- overated, but has to be done Drinks at the Axis Lounge, Mandarin Oriental Hotel Enjoy a drink in the chic, intimate atmosphere where you can listen to cool downtempo tunes while watching Singapore at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific Hotel in Sinagpore at the start of January for 3 nights and we loved it. To start of our trip we were upgraded to an executive suite. And it was gorgeous, the size of the suite is amazing and very comfortable. The location of the hotel is quite good and you can get to most places by taxi or mrt anyway. The breakfast options were good, providing continental options. The Hotel is quite pricey but its definitlely worth it if you can afford to stay here. Mr and Mrs A

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: loopylady
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific is absolutely brilliant! If you are going to Singapore, choose this hotel. We stayed there for 3 nights in November 2006 and didn't want to leave. Everything about it was superb - The staff, the rooms, the lobby, bar, etc etc The beds are SO comfortable! Best nights' sleep we've had in ages. The reception staff were so welcoming and the general atmosphere in the hotel is magical. The lobby area is quite impressive (atrium style) with glass elevators. It is located in the business district but easily accessible to shops, restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Mikeyy
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, great rooms, not overly large but very nice and comfortable. Great staff, close proximity to shopping and restaurants and really good food in the Hotel also. Free internet in some cases with a higher rate and discounts on laundry and other services if you are staying 2 weeks or more. This is my first trip to Singapore but I will definitely be staying here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Part 1”
Reviews.Author: G2WestLothian
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in Singapore for the first part of our honeymoon, for four nights. The hotel looked after us very well with flowers and a beautiful chocolate cake on arrival, as well as an upgrade to a balcony room. The room was spacious, with a large bed and exceptionally clean. There were bathrobes and slippers in the room and towels were changed twice a day. The hotel atrium is spectacular and the hotel is well situated for sightseeing, eating out and shopping. There were a number of restaurants in the hotel. We went to the Chinese one on the 37th floor on the first night and perhaps the only thing we didn't like was the way they served the food as compared with what our palate is used to. We were not long off the flight and not too hungry, so ordered soup to start and then 1/2 Crispy Peking Duck for main to share. Only the duck skin was served in the pancakes and after we finished that we got our duck meat mixed with noodles (although we felt this had been taken from a sparrow, as there was not much meat at all!). One afternoon we had food by the pool which was delicious and another evening we had room service and although we only had burgers and wedges - they were fantastic. The hotel also has pool and spa facilities. We used the pool, which has amazing underwater acoustics, but didn't use the spa facilities. Anytime we called the concierge, we found them very helpful. The hotel is also aimed at the business traveller and I found that it catered well for those on business and on leisure. All the staff were very friendly and efficient. I would definitely come to this hotel again if in Singapore and have recommended it to a friend already - who is going in February!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Indiababe
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place! From the moment we arrived we were looked after. Excellent location - ladies (and gents) right on the doorstep of 2 shopping centres Marine Square and Suntec City. Getting a taxi couldn't be easier with the doorman calling one - however return journeys can be more tricky so book in advance if possible - however the walk to the city centre is picturesque and safe at night. It takes about 20 mins. Rooms are clean and spacious. Wonderful views over the Esplanade to the Central Business District and Marina Bay with all the skyscrapers. Lifts are incredible with the indoor lift to floor 21 and the external lift to the top floor (37). Well worth getting over the vertigo to see the view! A selection of restaurants including Italian and Chinese and a great selection for breakfast from eggs, bacon, sausage, croissants, fruit, cold cuts and cheese to noodles and Teriyaki chicken. No complaints, can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chantiklook
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific on 22nd December for 1 night on our way to KL and very much wished that we had also booked it for our return home. The moment we arrived we were whisked to the front desk for check in. Despite others also checking in there was enough staff that after a couple of minutes we were attended to. The staff were lovely, i had requested deluxe smoking/interconnecting when i booked through their website, when we checked in they had no rooms of this catagory available and without fuss (and we didn't even ask) they upgraded us in order to accommodate our request. Check in was very fast and we were escorted up to our rooms by a staff member who also showed us how everything worked etc. The room didn't look dated in fact they had one of the best desk and chairs i have seen also a nice comfy armchair. The bathroom was spotless and looked brand new. We had breakfast at Global kitchen (included in rate), what a great place. Decorated and painted in light colours it has a light and airy feel - the food was wonderful, plenty of selection and service was top notch. I was at the juice bar and wanted a glass of water, i asked a nearby staff member and by the time i walked back to our table they were there with the glass of water. Talk about fast service. We were sorry to have to leave. Check out took all of 2 minutes and staff once again were friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jag1005
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a four night stopover in Singapore on our way back to UK from Perth WA. We chose the Pan Pacific at random from a website and we were not disapointed. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted in an extremely friendly way, and this continued for the whole of our stay. All of the staff were pleasant and efficient, and could not have made our stay any better. The facilites were first class. The interior was very calming, and with a huge atrium, the gentle evening musical entertainment drifted upwards from the ground floor I will certainly use this hotel if I make a return visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great End to a Memorable Trip”
Reviews.Author: Acker
Reviews.Content: This was the final hotel on our round-the-world trip, and did not disappoint. A friend recommended it, and was proved right to do so. We arrived for a 3-night stay late in the evening, and were checked-in and whisked off to our room in a trice. I had, I confess, alerted the hotel to the fact that this was a trip to celebrate our Silver Wedding anniversary, and, unbeknownst to my wife, had asked by e-mail for some flowers in our room, for which I would happily pay. The hotel staff were great, and she got her flowers at the front desk, plus a card. Once installed in a room with a balcony, and a great view of the Merlion in the inner harbour, - this was a free upgrade - we were then surprised by room service who delivered fruit, a cake, and a bottle of champagne!! This set the tone, and we continued to be impressed with the friendliness and helpful attitude of all staff. We breakfasted twice in the Global Kitchen restaurant, which, although not too cheap, and not included in the room price, was excellent. Its worth noting that the price for this is the same whether you eat a large or small breakfast. The pool was very clean, but beware having too many drinks or refreshments there if your budget is a bit slim. Once we checked out - & we asked for a late one as our flight was at 1130pm, the concierge's boys put our bags into secure storage, and we spent some time at the pool bar enjoying a beer. If you opt to have the poolside BBQ dinner, the beer is on free-flow, but - alas! our schedule precluded that meal. We had no complaints at all, and would happily go back any time.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: anilegna
Reviews.Content: unlike the hotels in the area, ie Marina Mandarin, Mandarin Oriental, Conrad & etc. the facilities are a bit old, which is fine if you're not the one paying for it (I wasn't here on holiday). the location is excellent, in between Conrad Hotel & Marina Mandarin, right next to the shopping centers, office buildings, 20 minutes from the airport the food is also very good, the Japanese restaurant here is one of the best in town, food ordered via room service is also very good and efficient what is a bit rough around the edges is the service, the attitude of the staff at the hotel is good, just not that efficient. I.E. one of the two check in exercises, it took over 5 minutes to be checked in (not counting the amount of time it took in line, but the face to face time... I actually looked at my cell phone to count the time) also during one of the check in exercises, told the girl at the front desk that I had some dry cleaning left behind on purpose while I was in a previous room, gave her the previous room #, and she thought that I wanted the same room ... basically we went around in circles & finally figured out she could not understand what I was trying to say so just told her to forget it & I'd take care of it myself when I'm checked into the room. an ok hotel, I stayed here 2 weeks in a row only because the first we had an offsite there & then a training at Conrad hotel across the street (& wanted to leave my work clothes behind while home in HK for the weekend)

Reviews.Title: “Now thats a hotel”
Reviews.Author: g'dayfromdownunder
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific Hotel in Singapore, if you ever get the chance stay there, not too expensive but the rooms (ask for the rooms overlooking the bay area) were fantastic, clean, well equipped, spacious, service was great, restaurant in the foyer of the hotel for lunches not too expensive and food fresh and tasty. Room service excellent, and nothing was too much trouble for the staff at the hotel. It is well located and will make the difference to your holiday if you stay there. I would give this hotel a five star even though it only a four star!!

Reviews.Title: “Not going to stay here anymore”
Reviews.Author: D-holidayLover
Reviews.Content: When i Check in into the hotel, i need to wait for a long Q....somemore no one offer to help with my luggages, the room is a bit old in style not modern at all, the room in others singapore hotel is much more better like: Ritz carlton, Conrad....just feel like its not worth that kind of money...somemore when i Check out i saw a terrible conversation which is a guy wearing black coat scolding the front office staff very loud, when i ask the concierge staff who is the black coat person, they mentioned is the hotel GM. Is really terrible that the GM scolding front desk staff in the public area, really spoilt the image of the hotel. I personally thinks that the hotel is very terrible, service, management and everything is not worth to be a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Happytiler
Reviews.Content: Stayed just the one night en-route back to UK. Nice hotel and cheaper than others in the area. Needs a bit of a makeover as the rooms are a bit dated and there are stains on the carpet, etc., but not really much to complain about. Plenty of TV channels. Marina Square shopping mall is on the doorstep as is Millenia Walk and the hotel is also near to Suntec City and The Esplanade so location is great - also very near to the airport, just around 20 minutes even at peak times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around”
Reviews.Author: ms9
Reviews.Content: Booked a Panoramic Balcony Room Exclusive direct on hotel website. Arrived after midnight. Check in is divided for arrivals and departures, which I thought was nice. Hotel lobby is very colorful and bar area is fun. We did not stay to have a drink though. There are 10 restraunts within the hotel, indian, italin, buffet etc. but we did not eat there. Across is a mall, and the 4th floor has a hawker center to eat. We are walkers, and hotel is within walking distance to many sites, and the city hall MRT (approx 7 blks). There is an MRT station in the mall across the way but we never used. Taxis are plentiful and cheap. Hotel room was on 30th floor (out of 36) and noise was never an issue. Room is excellent. Recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jencenny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific for 4 nights and thought it was overall, an excellent hotel. Check in was quick and we got given a room on the eighteenth floor which had a balcony with magnificent harbour views. The only down side to this was the glass elevators that went up the middle of the atrium. Its quite a height from the eighteenth floor and I wouldnt recommend it to people with vertigo! The buffet breakfast was good with a wide selection of international cuisines to choose from. The Atrium bar was on the pricey side but the service was excellent. The best thing about the hotel is it's location. Its about a ten minute walk through air conditioned shopping arcades to the nearest MRT station and even less of a walk to the Esplanade. I would highly recommend it and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An Ecellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daithi01
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay(4nights) at the Pan-Pacific Singapore and must say that it was wonderful.I would definetly stay here again if i was to return to singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: xplorer1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 times for (unfortunately) just a night each as part of the beginning and ending of our honeymoon. One would think that for such a short stay you would not be so important as a guest but you are. They are so attentive and would do anything for you. The concierge helped us out with public transport and a rental car and the staff was always there for our every wish. As part of our honeymoon we were given a free upgrade to a wonderfull suite room with views over singapore and a wedding cake! All in all it was a great experience and we will defenately come back. great location, close to airport, great restaurant on top of hotel, a bit expensive but great food!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: mdkate1657
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on our honeymoon, we stayed for 3 nights. We arrived at the hotel at 0730 hours after a flight from England. Although we were very early for check- in a room by the time we had eaten breakfast a room was ready. We were in an executive suite on one of the higher floors. We had to get a glass elevator on the outside of the building to our floor, it was a bit daunting at first but we soon got used to it. The room was excellent sized, great bathroom and view across the city. We had champagne, fruit and a chocolate truffle cake waiting for us as it was our honeymoon, this was a very nice touch in what is a predominantly business hotel. The buffet breakfast on the third floor was amazing. Location of hotel was perfect for exploring the city. We ate at the Cantonese restaurant on the top floor with 360 degree views of the city. The food was very good and not too expensive given the standard of the hotel. We had drinks and cocktails in the lobby which although expensive weren't outrageous. Although the hotel is mainly used by business people, it was perfect for tourists too. The pool area was great for cooling off after a days sightseeing. As soon as you arrived there you were handed an ice cold towel and a bottle of cold water to spray yourself with. Would definately recommend this hotel. I had been worried about the noise from the singer in the lobby which other reviews had mentioned, but could not hear it from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: solly26
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, very central, close to lots of shopping malls. Pool area excellent, although pool was on the cold side, but this was welcomed when the tempature got above 35 degrees!

Reviews.Title: “Top Stop Spot”
Reviews.Author: miss_flashpacker
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel in the heart of the shopping area. What a welcome break the pool is to break up a hard day hitting the malls. Lovely breakfast which is great value if included in the rate. The beds were very comfortable and the view from the outside lift up to the restaurant on the top floor is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, slightly retro (70s) feel, but comfortable. Good gym.”
Reviews.Author: divinzia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a major international meeting in late September. The room rate was somewhat inflated (S$450) but then the entire city held the participants hostage to higher rates. Check-in efficient and friendly. Lobby was slightly retro and jarring in style and a touch dark. Very expensive drinks at the bar and very limited food service anywhere outside the formal restaurants. The rooms were nicely modern and thoughtfully appointed with, at least in my case, a great view. If you are a towering-inferno fear of heights person, however, you won't want to get into the glass pod that zooms up and down to the 25+ floors ... you have been warned. Bathrooms were fine but nothing exceptional. The rest of the room, however, made up for it. Very well equipped gym (although some magazines and less loud-talking radio [more music] would be helpful). Nice pool. Highlight of the culinary aspect was the fantastic indian restaurant here which was one of the best indian meals I have ever had (this from a UK lass who prides herself in hunting down the best curries!). Other (discriminating) friends went to the rooftop Cantonese restaurant and were also impressed. Overall, definitely above average, particularly for the business traveler. Not sure if it would be my destination for a holiday, but perhaps, with some sensible prices.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but that's it”
Reviews.Author: Sunny123456789
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 weeks in November 2004. Lobby was under renovation so constant noise. Poolarea was also under renovation, had to go to a neighbouring hotel and use their facilities. Rooms were clean and interior ok but the beds were hard. They were very fast to come and add another mattress after I phoned and complained and then it was fine. Were upgraded to the residence floor (since we stayed for 2 weeks) where breakfast was included. A cup of coffee/tea and a pastry and cereal was pretty much what was offered. When you stayed for 2 weeks they had a complimentary limo to pick you up and drop you off at the airport. That was nice. It took us a week before we figured out that were several buses that took you for free to the underground station so we did a lot of walking for the first week. Ok hotel but with the ongoing renovations when we stayed there it definetley didn't have the WOW factor.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT panoramic view???”
Reviews.Author: London-Travella
Reviews.Content: I expressly booked a 'Panoramic' view, expecting a more than 180 degree window or something similar. What we got was a 'standard' king room with a standard window. The view !!) was ridiculous: a glimpse of the city through two massive towers blocking our view: HOW DARE THEY CALL THIS PANORAMIC VIEWS!!! The harbour view room, although requested was no longer available despite us checking in as early as 1.30 pm, VERY DISAPPOINTING and NO MENTION of this on theri website!!!. I did check with reception, thinking we were given a wrong room but was told that all rooms up to the 8th floor are standard deluxe rooms, as the view is blocked by the buildings and anything above that was 'panoramic view'. But hey: our view was ALSO blocked by buildings and we didn't even get the requested harbour view, so WHY is this called a panoramic view, sounds like a con to me, so I tried to negotiate the price down to the standard deluxe rooms (S$35 + tax cheaper) on the basis that basis THAT we didn't actually have a view either but they didn't budge, HOW CRAP IS THAT! If you would like a view and closer proximity to an MRT station at a comparable price, DO go to the Stamford which is MUCH better value. Looking at their mid week prices at around S$300+ through their own website that's absolutely ridiculous!! Just as well we only stayed a night on the Friday at their weekend rate of S$175 (+ tax); otherwise I would have been fuming to get such an average room, well below average view at a premium 5-star rate. I would class this hotel a 4 rather than a 5-star based on our rooms and would suggest that they also offer the city view panoramic rooms at their standard deluxe rate, otherwise customers like me feel well cheated!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pigsick
Reviews.Content: Great hotel & staff. Only 15 minutes from airport. Taxi's only S$15 (approx £5) & well worth it. On way to Australia, stayed Mon/Tue in a superior room on 21st floor with great city/pool view - plenty of room for 2 adults (massive/fab bed) & a child (nice Z-bed). No bar noise. Lovely pool. Food expensive so breakfast at Starbucks (5 mins walk) or Raffles Bakery/Cafe (10mins walk). A plethora of food places in the shopping malls. Saw super fireworks from hotel as it was Singapore's Independance Day when we were there. On way back to UK, stayed Sat/Sun. Got a superior room with a free upgrade-balcony on 18th floor with Quay/Merlion view. Heard hotel singer in our room - didn't cause us any problems tho'. Just something to be aware of. Bought warm crosisants from the hotel bakery & had them in our room with coffee for breakfast! 10min walk to Raffles Hotel - would recommend going there for a Singapore Sling/Tiger beer then a look round the free museum/shop on the 3rd floor. Pan Pacific is a great hotel overall. Would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Unless You Suffer from Vertigo”
Reviews.Author: StefanG
Reviews.Content: Besides the generally favorable reviews on TripAdvisor, we chose the Pan Pacific Hotel because it was across the street from the convention center where we attended a conference. We booked it on Expedia, which offered a package that included a S$40 per diem "food and beverage" credit ("Panoramic Balcony Room-Leisure Package"), which we applied towards the bar, one room service delivery, and two meals at the Japanese restaurant (excellent and authentic, by the way). By the way, you cannot apply this credit towards either the Italian Zambuca (also good) or Indian Rang Mahal restaurant because they're run by third parties, not Pan Pacific. THE AREA The hotel is fairly conveniently located, about a 15-min. (brisk) walk to the City Hall subway station (via a series of connected, air-conditioned malls) and just across the street from a major conference center. The lobby is large and features many comfortable sitting areas. The Keyaki bar had a happy hour that included some tasty, Japanese-themed hors d'oeuvres. THE ROOM Our flight from Hong Kong came in around midnight and so we informed them early on of our late arrival. We'd figured that they would hold our room until we arrived (we'd requested a king-sized bed upon booking) but it appears they did not because they gave us a room with two double beds instead. Even though the room was a no-smoking room, there was a definite, if faint, smell of cigarette smoke in the room. Could have been the ventilation, of course. This was on the 9th floor and it was OK. They said we could request a room change the next day. They did this and we ended up staying on the 20th floor, where there was no smell of cigarette smoke. (Even though we'd booked a "Panoramic Balcony Room-Leisure Package," we did not actually have a balcony. I saw balconies only on the lower two floors, in fact, so I don't know what's up with that. As it is, we wouldn't have used the balcony anyway because of the heat outdoors.) The room was good-sized and comfortable to lounge in. The desk was large and same with an office-type (fancy) Aeron chair, aside from a comfy chair in the room. The bathroom included a strong-pressure shower as well as a large, deep bathtub. The lighting was bright and there was plenty of countertop space to spread out our vanity items. The delivered our choice of newspaper each morning (the International Herald-Tribune in our case). BREAKFAST I'm surprised that a previous poster wrote, "the free breakfast offered as part of the package was continental style, which was very good but did not include cooked items like bacon, eggs and sausages for which you had to pay about $5 extra." The standard continental buffet breakfast in the Atrium (lobby) was indeed free (with our room rate at least) and included a big spread of many items, including scrambled eggs, bacon, and sausage, as well as cereal, juice, lots of fruit (watermelon, dragon fruit, pineapple), salad, croissants, rolls, jams etc., and some Asian items (tofu and other things I did not recognize). There was enough variety to satisfy us during our seven night stay. Aside from this buffet in the main lobby, there was an outside buffet area (Summer House) that cost a bit more (less than S$10) and offered more cooked options, such as eggs benedict, pancakes, waffles, sandwiches, etc. as well as the same (actually bigger) buffet spread as the one in the lobby. So the hotel pretty much had the breakfast options down pat. SPA/GYM My wife and I took advantage of the on-premise Wellness Spa to get massages. I enjoyed my basic 55-min. massage. She got a foot reflexology that was not quite what the brochure described or what she expected. She did not particularly enjoy the experience. I used the gym two or three times (AM and PM) and was pretty impressed, although I cannot compare it with other hotel gyms, as this was a first for me. They had several walking machines, riding machines, and weight machines. The staff was helpful in explaining how to use them all. I overheard some guests and it sounded like some of them are repeat visitors to the hotel and gym. Attached to the gym is a locker room and sauna/shower area, so they provide a good, useful service. Gym is open till 11 PM; the pool is open till 10 PM. I saw many families with young children using the pool. BUSINESS SERVICES We booked time on one of their computers in the 22nd-floor Executive Center so we could do some web surfing. It's quite a rip-off (S$8 for 15 min.) but when you don't have other choices, you just do it. Of course, later I found some Internet cafes charging just a couple Singapore dollars for half an hour, but they weren't anywhere near the hotel. We did see others using this center, however, so it is a useful service for some guests. We also saw some conference rooms full of business people in meetings. CUSTOMER SERVICE I asked the concierge questions throughout our stay and always encountered a friendly, helpful person -- same as the service when I called from my room. If they didn't know the answer, they called me back within 10-15 min. COMPLAINT As others have written, each night there's a lounge singer in the lobby bar whose voice travels all the way up the central atrium. The singing lasted from about 9 PM to midnight. I think a quieter jazz combo might be just as welcome to hotel guests, but this singer seems to have sole rights to entertain everyone. Even so, the noise didn't really bother us because on the 20th floor, she wasn't too obtrusive. If we'd stayed on the 9th floor for the whole week, we might feel different about things. "FEAR FACTOR" If you book one of the executive suites on an upper floor (I'd guess mid-20s+), access is exclusively from one of the external-facing elevators. This could cause some amount of anxiety if you're scared of heights because the view covers many square miles of the city. We took one of these elevators to the top-floor (37th) Hai Tien Lo restaurant (but didn't eat there) and although I found the ride to be fun, doing it several times every day might have become nerve-wracking, especially when hovering on a floor that's not your own to let others in and out. In our case, we had to use an internal-facing elevator to reach the 20th floor, which wasn't so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: beijau
Reviews.Content: Although I normally stay at the Fullerton and prefer to stay at the Four Seasons, when the money is coming out of my own pocket I have a soft spot for the Pan Pac. The rooms are fine, the beds are fine, and room service delivers promptly. I do agree that the reception staff are not to be commended for their customer service efficiency. Oh well, smile and think of the price you're paying. The same atrium design that I find so cheesy in their San Francisco property kind of works in Singapore. I haven't taken issue with the lighting, by the way; the overall design is not much of an issue unless you want to spend your time inside. With so much air conditioned real estate including untold hectares of shopping malls to be found elsewhere in the Lion City, why hang out here except maybe for champagne in the lounge? Well, let me answer my own question. The spa is competitive on features (lots of rooms, massage treatments), price, and availability. Try getting a massage booking on the weekend in Singapore without many days' advance notice. Good luck! But I like this spa so much I buy discounted block tickets and go back while staying at those other hotels. The Marina Square location is great for working at Suntec City, and a short cab to the business district. No complaints there. If you get a good deal on the room, stay here. If you have to pay up or you are on an expense account, you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Who turned out the lights?”
Reviews.Author: Reissunainen
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific is marketed as a high range business hotel with luxurious accommodation and top facilities. While the room was beautiful, as was the view, I could not get over the darkness in the lobby and other public areas. The design of the hotel is quite unique, but having the lights dimmed throughout just gives it a gloomy overall impression - as if the power went off and the back-up generator kicked in! I was also unimpressed by the efficiency of the reception staff as it took forever to check in and out. Also, I had specifically booked an exceptionally early check-in, but as I showed up the hotel was "experiencing delays" and "unexpectadly full" and I had to wait for 2 hours in the lobby for a room to be vacated. While this is understandable, I would have expected a hotel of this standard to have a Plan B for waiting visitors, ie. a lounge or something. And finally, the "Summerhouse" restaurant was being renovated during my stay, which meant non-stop drilling and banging noise from 10am to 10pm. So, even though many things at this hotel are excuisite, the experience was not all that great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mancunian Steve
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Singapore for a 3 night stay and had a great time in the Pan Pacific Hotel. I arrived off a long flight from Europe at 8am in the morning and was expecting to be told that I couldnt check into my room until the afternoon which is normal practice, was really surprised as quite the reverse happened and I was upgraded to a suite for my stay as there were no normal rooms available!!!. The hotel was slightly more expensive than I normally pay for my stays in singapore but I had the special package which included $40 a day credit with the hotels bars which made it a competiive deal, and the hotel is well worth it with an amazing atrium, great pool / Gym and an excellant choice of restuarants. My only gripe was that the free breakfast offered as part of the package was continental style, which was very good but did not include cooked items like bacon, eggs and sausages for which you had to pay about $5 extra. The Hotel is connected to the Marina Mall and is about ten mins walk to the Raffles hotel and Chijmes bar / Restaurant complex ( great place for a night out ! ) The main thing I will remember though are the staff, they are everywhere you go, incredibly helpful and really make your stay here five starred. Overall an excellant experience and as long as I can get the package deal again I will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with minor problems”
Reviews.Author: char645
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Asia and the third continent I've ever set foot on (unless if you consider Europe and Asia one continent.) I walked into the atrium, and it's the absolute most gorgeous and colorful hotel atrium I've seen! The staff was plesant and cooperative. They gave us free breakfast at the Summer House every morning, one of seven restaurants in hotel itself. The elevators are also a marvel, especially the outside ones, although they face the hotel side of the town, not downtown. When I finally got into the room, I liked the nice oversized doors and key holder, but I was slightly dissapointed at how small the room seemed. The room itself (excluding the bathroom) was also quite blank and lacking color unlike the rest of the hotel. The deluxe rooms did look a little better by judging at its photos on their website. The executive centre was a nice way to keep in touch and e-mail people at home. The other nice feature was the connecting corridor to Suntec City Mall and the fourth floor garden. As for the restaurants, they were decent. The coffee wasn't that good at the Summer House, but the tea and fruit were fabulous! We also had cocktails at the Atrium Lounge, which came with an odd assortment of snacks: dried calamari, mustard coated peas, and (sigh) mixed nuts. It may or may not be the custom, but nevertheless, it seemed strange to us. Overall, it was a satisfying hotel with minor problems.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many other Singapore hotels, I thought I'd give Pan Pacific a try as I like the Marina Bay area and also that expedia were offering very attractive rates. What an amazing hotel! From the moment you check in, you are treated with such fantastic customer service and made to feel really at home. The lobby is spectacular with fancy lighting, angles and sparkling glass lifts going up and down. My room was on the 32nd floor with the best view of downtown Singapore I have ever seen. My room itself was also beautiful - really spacious with massive bed, TV and really stunning bathroom. I was on the leisure package which includes SGD$40 per day worth of food and beverages and so I had quite a bit of room service. The food was absolutely delicious and reasonably priced. I went to the gym a couple of times and was pleasantly surprised at the good selection and excellent condition of the equipment. The pool was also great. Had a few cocktails in the Atrium bar which were very good, but a little pricey at nearly $20 per drink. The location of the hotel is great - it's right by 3 big shopping malls so you have immediate access to all the shops you want (bring a big suitcase with you). There is also very easy access to the Central Business District (5 minutes in a taxi) and it's close to the river with the Boat Quay and Clarke Quay restaurants. If you want to be near Orchard Road, chose a different hotel, but I really prefer the Marina Bay location as there is more variety of things to do. And in any case, even if you do want to go to Orchard Road it's only about 10-15 mins in a taxi. All in all, this hotel is one of the best I have ever stayed in. Real luxury and fantastic service at affordable prices.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent start to a holiday of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: CSET
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pan Pacific for 2 nights in March 2006 and we were impressed from the moment we arrived - although I would agree that the reception staff weren't overly cheery and personal. Upgraded our room (as appears to be the norm) to one on the 17th floor with a seaview and the most amazing view of Singapore. The bed was huge as was the bath, and the room a good size and clean. Loved the fact that the hotel was attached to the Marina Square Mall, and the walk to City Mall MRT took no time at all. The bar / reception area of the hotel is lovely, the glass lifts making it very attractive. We didn't eat at the hotel but we did have drinks in the bar - they were expensive, but we expected that, and the bar had a nice atmosphere and the waitresses looked stunning and they and the bar staff were very friendly. We used the pool on 3 occasions and went to the gym once. Take a bottle of water with you and don't expect it to be huge, but there were enough machines for a decent work out. The pool area is attractive with nice sunloungers and a very clean pool. In all we loved it at this hotel. It was a stopover on our way to New Zealand and we were were glad we chose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice central hotel in downtown Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Riverfrog
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 days/7 nights at the Pan Pacific Hotel in downtown Singapore in March 2006. It was our first trip to Singapore, so we did not know what to expect. Thankfully, we enjoyed our stay very much. We checked in to our hotel on the 20th floor, a non-smoking room with a king sized bed. It was nice, spacious, and very clean. The best thing about the hotel is its easy access to public transportation. To get from the hotel to the City Hall MRT (train) station, you don't even need to walk outside, just through air-conditioned malls and walkways. The MRT takes you almost everywhere you could want to go, although for some of the more far-out places (like the Zoo or Bird Park), a cab is quite cheap and is easy to get from the front of the hotel. We took a cab from the hotel to the airport in the early morning and it only cost S$14. The Pan Pacific is located in the Marina Square Mall. If you love shopping, there are two other malls all within walking distance and connected to each other (Suntec City Mall and Raffles City Mall). Make sure to visit the Fountain of Wealth in the Suntec City Mall and follow the ritual! Also, take advantage of the many money changers in the mall. Try to get small bills if you can ($5 and smaller) to use for train fare as change is limited to $4. The hotel is very centrally located to everything. It is walking distance to museums, malls, the Esplanade performing arts center, famous Merlion, Clarke Quay (pronouced "kee" for all us clueless Americans ;), riverboats, restaurants, and more. So very convenient. The hotel is beautiful, with glass elevators on both the inside and outside. Take the outside elevators all the way up to the 37th floor - the restaurant floor - for an exquisite view of the city. On the fourth floor of the hotel is a pool (which looked very nice but we did not use) with an outdoor bar and a gym (also very nice but they apparently do not have water so bring your own). Our only complaint was the loud music from the hotel bar, which was only made worse by the hotel's beautiful atrium design. The music kept going even past midnight, which surprised us because the other reviews here seemed to indicate that the bar music stopped earlier. If you are a light sleeper, or a business traveler who has to go to bed early to wake up early, you might not want to stay here. We are incredulous that management would allow music that loud to be played that late. It did not bother me as I am a pretty fast sleeper, but I woke up one day to find that my boyfriend had stuffed a towel under the door to try to minimize the sound! :( We did not find the front desk or the concierge very helpful or particularly attentive. Our room was prepaid but they tried to charge us again for some reason even though we brought the print-out receipt so be careful! As for the concierge...bring a guide book or buy one in Singapore! While maps are readily available for free at all visitors' centre, a good guide book is a must. Despite all of that, we found that our calls to their help line, ServiceOne, for wake-up calls were met with great friendliness and professionalism by Sue. Our room was impeccable, with a nice bathroom (separate shower and tub and toilet) and nice amenities. Bottles of water are provided daily, as are a free electric hotpot and instant coffee and tea packets. Very nice to start the day off with coffee and a free copy of the Straits Times! Internet access is only provided free if you upgrade to an executive floor. Otherwise, it is S$10.50 for one hour and is also offered at a lower rate for 6 hours or 24 hours. This charge seemed to me to be quite unnecessary as it was wireless anyway, and I would guess that many of their travelers are business travelers, due to its proximity to the Convention Center. Oh well. We prefer to eat outside of the hotel on trips, and so cannot rate the bar or restaurants. Finally, a word of caution. There is some construction going on somewhat near the hotel--the building of yet another train station. This construction is outside of Suntec City Mall and in my opinion is not close enough to be a noise problem. However, we felt that walking around in that area was pretty difficult, given the road closures. You can, of course, take alternate routes. We only walked around there one time, to go to visit the Raffles Hotel. All in all, the hotel is very nice. If we visit Singapore again, we would most likely try something else as there are a lot of hotel options to be had. However, the Pan Pacific is worth a first visit. We hope you have a wonderful time in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Agree with everything said”
Reviews.Author: bluwes
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews before going on our far east jaunt which included Hong Kong Phuket Bangkok and Singapore.The Pan Pacific was a first class hotel our rooms were on the 28th floor so gave great views.Liked the bar area but as previously stated was a bit pricey after tax mind you so was everywhere else we went in Singapore.The staff were very friendly, the location was great and to top it off th epool area was just what was needed afte a days sightseeing.Definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good base for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Almatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific for 4 nights in February. Overall, we were pleased with this hotel. On the plus side, the room was a good size as was the bathroom and they were well equipped. We were on the 12th floor and didn't hear the noise from the bar in the atrium that some have complained of. The breakfast buffet was excellent. The main bar was cool and relaxing for a drink or two (but we thought it was a bit pricey especially when tax etc was added!). The location is very good with direct air conditioned access to shopping malls and you can walk to Raffles, Boat Quay etc in about 10 mins. Taxis are very cheap in Singapore and they use meters so it was hassle-free. The PP has a nice pool area. There wasn't really too much of a down side to be quite honest but, in common with many chain hotels in large cities, the PP is a bit impersonal. That didn't bother us though as we just used it as a base. The main thing to note is the lifts! Do NOT stay here if you don't like heights. The lifts from reception to about the 22nd floor are inside the atrium of the hotel and are very impressive but they are glass sided and vertigo sufferers will freak out. If you are on a higher floor then you need to use similar lifts on the exterior of the hotel... you have been warned! Great views though if you like that sort of thing.

Reviews.Title: “First Clas Stopover”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Pan Pacific on a SIA Stopover and found it excellent in every respect. There was certainly no intrusion in our romm on the 8th floor from the singer in the Atrium Lobby.The staff were excellent and as a Stopover the hotel is superb value for money. A real plus is the immediate access to both the SunTec and Marina Square Malls. In the latter for any with a love of Asian food there is now a 'Loft' Food Court where it is difficult to spend more than S$5 on a dish.Adjoining there is a varied selection of conventional eateries - in particular an excellent sea food buffet.For an excellent coffee (an tempting cakes) try Mac Cafe in the same Mall. The hundreds of shops in both Malls means that you can browse in air conditioned comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, noisy at night.”
Reviews.Author: MrArthur
Reviews.Content: Good size rooms, friendly staff and well located. However, singing in the bar noise carries throughout the hotel until fairly late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Simon38
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks. As I was there for 2 weeks this meant I was upgraded to the residence floors, 27th floor. If you're scared of heights you won't like the lift up the outside of the building. Views from the room balcony were great though. The residence breakfast was terrible. The hotel reception atrium is very impressive. When you arrive you really think this is a great looking hotel. This is a little misleading. The rooms are a little dated, while the bathrooms are very nice, the TVs are quite old, the bed is not very comfortable and the decor is a bit faded. The wireless internet is also a bit unreliable. The hotel bar is a nice place to spend 30 minutes, no longer. There is a singer on at the bar every night and due to the atrium design they can be heard in your room even on a high floor. If you want to sleep before 11pm, good luck. The hotel restaurants are quite good, particularly the indian, but very expensive compared with the world outside the hotel. The pool is very good although the service is a bit lacking there. It's a hunt to find a towel and there are not many loungers. I've stayed in a lot of hotels in Asia and I don't think I would choose this hotel again, you can fiund perfection in Singapore and this isn't it.

Reviews.Title: “What luxury!”
Reviews.Author: MCFC_Steve
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel room we have ever stayed in. Stopped for 2 nights in October 2005 on Singapore Stopover, which cost an amazingly low £25 per person per night for the room. Massive double bed, courtesy slippers and robes. Bathroom all glass, mirrors and reddy brown marble with walk in shower cubicle. Our room had a desk with the comfiest chair ever. Due to the atrium design, the hotel is "hollow" so imagine the sound echoes, but we weren't affected. We were on the 17th floor with a view looking inland. Had requested a harbour view, but that was the only disappointment. The atrium is awesome, as are the glass lifts. If you are staying on or above the 23rd floor, your lift goes up the outside of the hotel !! Service absolutely superb. Location almost perfect, just a short walk from the famour Raffles Hotel. Would recommend to anyone and will stay again if we ever revisit Singapore on a stopover to Oz. One last recommendation for eating is the Newton Hawker centre. A collection of stalls serving every type of food you could want. Great food, great drink, great value, great atmosphere. It is where the locals eat. Enjoy. Steve.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: anarchyny
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two week stay at the Pan Pacific Hotel Singapore, and what else can I say but BRAVO to this hotel and its staff. In my 18 years of business travel I have not come across a more accomidating hotel. The staff and management did everything to make my experience here a positive one. A home away from home!!!!! Be sure to visit all my friends at the Atrium Bar Kenny and his staff are amongst the best in the industry... If you are are staying just a night or one month look no further than this hotel and you will realize what i mean........

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights as part of the Singapore Stopover Holiday promotion which is really a good deal. This hotel was not really our first choice but Ritz-Carlton and Shangri-la Hotels were both booked on the days we were in Singapore. No regrets because Pan-Pacific is just superb. Although we did not get the room with the queen bed (they only have a twin-bed room at check-in), we were pleased with our room. It has nice furnitures, very clean and quite spacious. The bathroom was large, modern, classy and of course very clean. The usual 5-star amenities were there (in-room safe, slippers, bathroom robes and toiletries). We were on the 7th floor and we can faintly hear the nightly music from downstairs but it did not bother us at all. The view from our room is not the best, just buildings like the Mandarin, Marina Square, etc. I guess we can't complain since we only paid $50/person/night(I'm sure I need to pay more than that to get a top-notch view). Staff were courteous and very accommodating. Breakfast was not included in our room rate. We did not try breakfast at the hotel since they were serving American buffet. We wanted to try the local food so we were mostly eating in places around the hotel. The best part is the hotel is coveniently located and so close to shopping and commercial centers. You don't have to go too far since the hotel and shopping complexes are somehow connected to each other. We LOVED the concept since one does not have to go out (it was so hot and humid outside) and you just walk inside an airconditioned complex. Overall, we had a very lovely time at the Pan-Pacific and we will definitely stay at the Pan-Pacific Singapore whenever we find ourselves in that part of Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Ryleeh
Reviews.Content: Totally agree with the previous poster. NOISY! We were on the 8th floor and from about 8pm onwards is a singer in the lobby and they have it just way too loud! For a business hotel, not good for people that have to get up and go to work early. Too many staff/security members standing around and watching all the time. I felt like I couldn't relax. Pool area looked nice, pity it was rainy and I didn't get to use it. Breakfast buffet @ S$33 was terribly overpriced and not to mention the shocking service. One day it took 40 minutes to receive 1 pancake. Yep, you read that right! What a disgrace. Rooms were OK. Would have liked a more modern TV (like the flat screens at The Orchard Hotel, Singapore), and hope they fix the TV reception ASAP! It was annoying trying to watch anything with so many white lines flickering on the screen. Overall, I owuld not stay here again. I much preferred The Orchard Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sets the standard for Far Eastern city hotels - "Great"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pan Pacific and have since recommended it agressively to anyone who will listen to me. This place has become my benchmark for all world hotels. (EG - Recently stayed at the Luxor, Las Vegas and said "Not bad, but it isnt the Pan Pacific. Recently stayed at the Waldorf Astoria, New York and said " Not bad, but it is'nt the Pan Pacific".... you get the picture) ANYWAY Upon arrival, you are greeted by hotel check-in staff (not porters) and escorted across red carpet, through its lavishly decorated entrance, through to check-in. After being further escorted to your room (we had a 25th floor room with amazing cityscape views), your luggage arrives. This service continues throughout your stay (namely, after calling the concierge for a power adaptor, one arrived at my door within 3 minutes!). When we checked in, we were treated like film stars. However, the fact we had come off a 12 hour flight, stank of free booze and were dishevelled in our combat trousers, t-shirts and trainers never altered the staffs attention. As previously described, our room had awesome views down over Raffles, Orchard Road and the city sprawl beyond. The room was huge with a 7ft wide bed and an impressive marble bathroom with modern fittings. Location wise, its great. You are within minutes of the SunTec City shopping area and can walk almost half a mile from the hotel through to an adjoining shopping mall which takes you close to Raffles towards Orchard Road and the quay areas. You need to bear in mind that this half a mile walk is within the comfort of an airconditioned mall and this benefit shouldnt be dismissed in the Malaysian heat/humidity. The pool is superb, with changing area and impeccable poolside service. The inner atrium is a sight to behold and the atrium bar a classy place to have a drink before you jump in a cycle-rickshaw on your way to dinner at Boat Quay or Clarke Quay. Bear in mind, this hotel costs around £85 a night and undercuts nearly every hotel in the world on its value for money then surpasses so many with its service. Therefore you can see why I'm recommending this as "must book" for your Singapore city stopover. Please dont consider anywhere else.... you dont know what you're missing!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: rgirn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pan Pacific for 2 nights while in Singapore. It's a beautiful hotel with great staff. The washrooms are gorgeous and the rooms are spacious. It's in a great location - walking distance to Raffles and taxi's are very accessible from the front of the hotel. Would recommend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and impersonal”
Reviews.Author: Ekel
Reviews.Content: Downside of this Hotel is that is Atrium Style so very noisy, we were on the 9th floor and could hear lots of noise from the Lobby/cafe area, including a very noisy singer who was still going at 10.00pm, very business orientated and the staff could have been good had they smiled ! Location is great for the convention centre and for shopping in Suntec but plenty of hotels in that area to choose from. Rooms and bathrooms nicely decorated but small, typical for the business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty ordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smeg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in May, 2005 as part of a Singapore Airlines Stopover Holiday. Although this is rated as 4 1/2 star, some of the rooms definitely aren't. Initially we were given a very basic room (room 905). We were told this is the standard of room given for stopovers. Eventually they did give us an upgrade to a much better room with a balcony(Room 2115). There were a few other downsides, the staff weren't particularly helpfull, the buffet breakfast was awful and the hotel is a little out of the way. While the atrium and lifts etc at this hotel are amazing this shouldn't give it more than a 3 star rating. On the way home we stayed at the Shangri La Hotel in Singapore for 4 nights (also a Singapore Stopover Holiday). The difference between the hotels is like chalk and cheese. The Shangri La is a true 5 star hotel and is the best hotel we have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: marcopolo1701
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific was first stop on a round the world trip and after a 14 hour flight from the UK was a tremendous base for our 2 nights in Singapore. Great location - and the view from our balcony couldn't have been any more perfect - the whole Singapore city skyline. Room was superb - extremely clean and comfortable with a great bathroom. Service exceptional and excellent value for money. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone who appreciates style and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: klkh2002
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pan Pacific which was at the end of an exhausting long business trip. After dreadful hotel anfter dreadful hotel in Europe, the Pan Pacific was such a pleasant surprise. The staff were fantastic - all fo them greet you with a huge smile and are so friendly. Some hotel staff overdo the formality but they find the right balance here. The rooms as excellent - very spacious and comfortable. I had a great view as well! I'm in Singapore a number of times a year and I had never bothered to stay at the Pan Pacific before. Well, in future - it will be the first choice in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “great deal on Singapore airways”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan pacific for two nights on the way back from Sydney to the UK. If you fly Singapore Airlines they do a great deal - we booked online and got a great price for a fabulous room and they included the breakfast buffet in the package as well. You have to show your boarding pass so don't lose it!! There is a lot of building work going on outside as they build a new train station - nearest one is about a 10 minute walk away through airconditioned shopping centre. This was a little confusing and also when we returned late in the evening we found ourselves locked out of the entrance we had originally used and had to make our way round the outside to the main entrance past the highway and the building works. Nevertheless we enjoyed our stay enormously - staff were couteous and efficient and even though this is a very big hotel they went out the way to treat you like individuals. Concierge was particularly helpful and personally escorted us through the hotel / shopping centre bit to show us where we needed to go. We would definately return.

HotelInfo.Name: Pan Pacific Singapore
HotelInfo.Address: 7 Raffles Boulevard | Marina Square, Singapore 039595, Singapore
